Quote: Adjusting to the passage of time, I think, is a key to success and to life: just being able to roll with the punches.
Author: Dolly Parton

Quote: If you go out to Hollywood you'll find a lot of fantastic plastic people there in the business and a lot of people in life generally. They find it so hard to be themselves that they have to be plastic.
Author: Jimmy Cliff

Quote: I try and tell all the kids that I meet that hope to be amazing one day and be a professional athlete or a doctor or a lawyer or whatever they want to be. I tell them they can do all that because Tourette's won't stop them.
Author: Tim Howard

Quote: I think Damien Hirst is hilarious. And I think he's a true artist. He's not hilarious first; I think he is a real artist, and I also think he's got an amazing sense of humor.
Author: Jemima Kirke

Quote: All good art is an indiscretion.
Author: Tennessee Williams

Quote: Behold, my friends, the spring is come; the earth has gladly received the embraces of the sun, and we shall soon see the results of their love!
Author: Sitting Bull

Quote: My songs are the door to every dream I've ever had and every success I've ever achieved.
Author: Dolly Parton

Quote: Offence is important; that's how you know you care about things. Imagine a life where you're not offended. So dull.
Author: Marcus Brigstocke

Quote: When one is giving service for the advancement of humanity, when one is working without money and without price, with no hope of earthly reward, there comes a real, genuine joy into the human heart.
Author: Heber J. Grant

Quote: We have a certain warped sense of humor in Scandinavia, and that is what comes across in the choices in a lot of our movies.
Author: Connie Nielsen

Quote: Art is the unceasing effort to compete with the beauty of flowers - and never succeeding.
Author: Gian Carlo Menotti

Quote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
Author: Anais Nin

Quote: The most successful men in the end are those whose success is the result of steady accretion.
Author: Alexander Graham Bell

Quote: God intended Earth. God intended the waters. God intended you and me. We were created in the image and the likeness of God; we are holograms, if you will. So the power, the presence, the energy is within you and me. The energy of God, as life, is within each of us.
Author: Mary Manin Morrissey

Quote: There is a lot of luck in football. Following England is like following Wycombe Wanders or Leyton Orient. You hope for the best and hope you are lucky.
Author: Alan Sugar

Quote: The guys in my band are great-we watch movies, we eat pizza, take walks, read books. Everybody has a really great sense of humor. And my boyfriend comes and visits me on the road.
Author: Lisa Loeb

Quote: We have art in order not to die of the truth.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Do what you love to do and give it your very best. Whether it's business or baseball, or the theater, or any field. If you don't love what you're doing and you can't give it your best, get out of it. Life is too short. You'll be an old man before you know it.
Author: Al Lopez

Quote: And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

Quote: I've been so fortunate in my life that my family has never been jealous of my success. They have shown true love and commitment to me by being supportive. They shared in it.
Author: Mike Krzyzewski

Quote: The half hour between waking and rising has all my life proved propitious to any task which was exercising my invention... It was always when I first opened my eyes that the desired ideas thronged upon me.
Author: Walter Scott

Quote: We are laying the foundations of a government, which we hope may outlast the Pyramids.
Author: Caleb Cushing

Quote: Cameron Crowe can write dialogue and shoot it with warmth and humor like nobody else.
Author: Emma McLaughlin

Quote: When I work, and in my art, I hold hands with God.
Author: Robert Mapplethorpe

Quote: I'm kind of a good girl - and I'm not. I'm a good girl because I really believe in love, integrity, and respect. I'm a bad girl because I like to tease. I know that I have sex appeal in my deck of cards. But I like to get people thinking. That's what the stories in my music do.
Author: Katy Perry

Quote: Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Quote: No matter how much success you're having, you can't continue working together if you can't communicate.
Author: Matt Cameron

Quote: I was born with this. It's a hereditary genetic condition. This is something you can go your whole life without really knowing that something's wrong. I had high blood pressure, and that was the first sign.
Author: Steven Cojocaru

Quote: I would like to live a day in the life of an ant and hope not to get squashed.
Author: Kiowa Gordon

Quote: But it also became the experience, or was the experience, of the writers who were attracted to this kind of humor. They're all men or women who come from the same kind of experience in their own lives.
Author: Norman Lear

Quote: The basis of art is truth, both in matter and in mode.
Author: Flannery O'Connor

Quote: All the commandments: You shall not commit adultery, you shall not kill, you shall not steal, you shall not covet, and so on, are summed up in this single command: You must love your neighbor as yourself.
Author: Jesus Christ

Quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: That should be the measure of success for everyone. It's not money, it's not fame, it's not celebrity; my index of success is happiness.
Author: Lupe Fiasco

Quote: Nothing can add more power to your life than concentrating all your energies on a limited set of targets.
Author: Nido Qubein

Quote: I hope people will say, 'Mr. Valentino, he did something for fashion, no?'
Author: Valentino Garavani

Quote: Guys usually like my sense of humor, and I am pretty down to earth. And I'm a driven person.
Author: Kreayshawn

Quote: I don't think there's any artist of any value who doesn't doubt what they're doing.
Author: Francis Ford Coppola

Quote: When you lose a person you love so much, surviving the loss is difficult.
Author: Cristiano Ronaldo

Quote: One must always be careful of books,"said Tessa, "and what is inside them, for words have the power to change us.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel

Quote: Divorce is never a pleasant experience. You look upon it as a failure. But I learned to be a different person once we broke up. Sometimes you learn more from failure than you do from success.
Author: Michael Crawford

Quote: Self-esteem comes from who you have in your life. How you were raised. What you struggled with as a child.
Author: Halle Berry

Quote: During my life I have seen, known, and lost too much to be the prey of vain dread; and, as for the hope of immortality, I am as weary of that as I am of gods and kings. For my own sake only I write this; and herein I differ from all other writers, past and to come.
Author: Mika Waltari

Quote: Some major writers have a huge impact, like Ayn Rand, who to my mind is a lousy fiction writer because her writing has no compassion and virtually no humor. She has a philosophical and economical message that she is passing off as fiction, but it really isn't fiction at all.
Author: Theodore Sturgeon

Quote: The mediator of the inexpressible is the work of art.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: The things that will destroy America are prosperity-at-any-price, peace-at-any-price, safety-first instead of duty-first, the love of soft living, and the get-rich-quick theory of life.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: There's a misconception that survival of the fittest means survival of the most aggressive. The adjective 'Darwinian' used to refer to ruthless competition; you used to read that in business journals. But that's not what Darwinian means to a biologist; it's whatever leads to reproductive success.
Author: Steven Pinker

Quote: The 'Course in Miracles' says one day you will realize that death is not the punishment but the reward. And it says that birth is not the beginning of life but a continuation. And physical death is not the end of life but a continuation.
Author: Marianne Williamson

Quote: My great hope would be that Quebec would realize itself fully as a distinct part of Canada, and stay Canadian, bringing to Canada a part of its richness.
Author: Gabrielle Roy

Quote: I'm an off-the-charts introvert. To me, being around groups of strangers is exhausting. I've had to sort of train myself to think about two tactics: finding common ground and invoking humor.
Author: Sam Yagan

Quote: The principles of true art is not to portray, but to evoke.
Author: Jerzy Kosinski

Quote: I spent a lot of years trying to outrun or outsmart vulnerability by making things certain and definite, black and white, good and bad. My inability to lean into the discomfort of vulnerability limited the fullness of those important experiences that are wrought with uncertainty: Love, belonging, trust, joy, and creativity to name a few.
Author: Brene Brown

Quote: The successful man doesn't use others, other people use the successful man, for above all the success is of service.
Author: Mark Caine

Quote: It's not true that life is one damn thing after another; it's one damn thing over and over.
Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

Quote: Death, only, renders hope futile.
Author: Edgar Rice Burroughs

Quote: I have a very dark sense of humor.
Author: Andy Dick

Quote: Painting and writing are solitary arts.
Author: Conrad Hall

Quote: Surround yourself with people who provide you with support and love and remember to give back as much as you can in return.
Author: Karen Kain

Quote: I think there are those individuals who are intimidated by really smart, talented people. But for me, surrounding yourself with great talent is the key to success.
Author: Monika Chiang

Quote: I feel 80% of my life is completely normal.
Author: J. K. Rowling

Quote: We hope we are moving toward a world where sexual orientation is not an issue, because we hate the idea of a gay ghetto. I think that it's a real shame that people become restricted by their sexuality or define their whole lives by their sexuality.
Author: Neil Tennant

Quote: My humor tends to be a little more edgy than is appropriate for 'Twilight,' although I got some in there. That was fun! There's just a tonal difference. For me, storytelling is storytelling. But, I do like writing for grown ups.
Author: Melissa Rosenberg

Quote: Art in Nature is rhythmic and has a horror of constraint.
Author: Robert Delaunay

Quote: Love one another, but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quote: Written in 1895, Alfred Nobel's will endowed prizes for scientific research in chemistry, physics, and medicine. At that time, these fields were narrowly defined, and researchers were often classically trained in only one discipline. In the late 19th century, knowledge of science was not a requisite for success in other walks of life.
Author: Peter Agre

Quote: With the price of life these days, you've got to get everything for free you can.
Author: Carl Rogers

Quote: I hope I may have succeeded in presenting to you, however imperfectly, the currents of thought due to the work of the immortal Darwin which have helped to make anthropology what it is at the present time.
Author: Franz Boas

Quote: My parents have always had a great sense of humor. And I really appreciate good humor in songs, witty lyrics that sneak up on you and then you listen again, and say: 'That's so funny.' John Prine's songs have always had this really witty tone.
Author: Kacey Musgraves

Quote: Pictures must not be too picturesque.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The best smell in the world is that man that you love.
Author: Jennifer Aniston

Quote: When I was 4 years old, my brother and sister died of hunger, so I achieved my success through confidence, self-motivation and my hard work.
Author: Chen Guangbiao

Quote: I don't ever give my opinion. Opinions I have about anything are in my personal life.
Author: Al Pacino

Quote: We hope that eventually there would be an occasion which I can personally prove that game music can in fact impress many different people and move them.
Author: Nobuo Uematsu

Quote: The 'Twilight' movies are great in their own right, but they certainly don't have any sense of humor to them.
Author: Mark Waters

Quote: Without freedom, no art; art lives only on the restraints it imposes on itself, and dies of all others.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Communism is not love. Communism is a hammer which we use to crush the enemy.
Author: Mao Zedong

Quote: Tis better to have loved and lostThan never to have loved at all.
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson,  In Memoriam

Quote: My father left Nazi Germany a year after Dr. Kissinger, and so in my household he was very much an icon. He was a kind of immigrant success story, a refugee success story.
Author: Eugene Jarecki

Quote: The joy which answers to prayer give, cannot be described; and the impetus which they afford to the spiritual life is exceedingly great.
Author: George Muller

Quote: I'm proud of my background, so I hope there will be more roles where Hispanics are being portrayed.
Author: Mario Lopez

Quote: Humor was not important only for me, humor was important for this nation for centuries, to survive, you know.
Author: Milos Forman

Quote: Personality is everything in art and poetry.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: The ultimate lesson all of us have to learn is unconditional love, which includes not only others but ourselves as well.
Author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

Quote: I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library.
Author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice

Quote: The Nationals tried hard to recover the lost ground. The final result, however, was the success of the Forest Citys by a score of 29 to 23 in a nine innings game, twice interrupted by rain.
Author: Henry Chadwick

Quote: Of any stopping place in life, it is good to ask whether it will be a good place from which to go on as well as a good place to remain.
Author: Mary Catherine Bateson

Quote: I collaborated with fellow cat lover and designer Geren Ford to create a sweater that we hope any cat parent would wear to show their kitty pride and that all animal lovers can wear in support of the ASPCA.
Author: Kellie Pickler

Quote: I liked the humor of it, I've always enjoyed a sense of humor in God and in religion and in spirituality.
Author: Amber Tamblyn

Quote: It is after all the greatest art to limit and isolate oneself.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Music is love, love is music, music is life, and I love my life. Thank you and good night.
Author: A. J. McLean

Quote: I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: Obstacles are necessary for success because in selling, as in all careers of importance, victory comes only after many struggles and countless defeats.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: My whole life was foretold to me. An old Romany gypsy read my fortune.
Author: Maureen O'Hara

Quote: To not have any hope is where things start to get really bleak. Things are possible. The impossible can be possible.
Author: Sarah Paulson

Quote: I'd like to explore the more abstract side of people's minds, as opposed to the usual sitcom stuff. I don't want to do the typical sitcom-type humor. I'd want to do stuff like go bowling with pineapples.
Author: Harland Williams

Quote: The terrifying and edible beauty of Art Nouveau architecture.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Femininity is not just lipstick, stylish hairdos, and trendy clothes. It is the divine adornment of humanity. It finds expression in your qualities of your capacity to love, your spirituality, delicacy, radiance, sensitivity, creativity, charm, graciousness, gentleness, dignity, and quiet strength.
Author: James E. Faust

Quote: Sound character provides the power with which a person may ride the emergencies of life instead of being overwhelmed by them. Failure is... the highway to success.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: Inner-life questions are the kind everyone asks, with or without benefit of God-talk: 'Does my life have meaning and purpose?' 'Do I have gifts that the world wants and needs?' 'Whom and what shall I serve?' 'Whom and what can I trust?' 'How can I rise above my fears?'
Author: Parker Palmer

Quote: I hope to God that the inner strength that will vindicate my deeds will in good time spring forth from my own people. I have done as I had to on the prompting of my inner voice.
Author: Kurt Huber

Quote: I tend to like dry humor.
Author: Dan Scanlon

Quote: Art is science made clear.
Author: Wilson Mizner

Quote: We have observed that, in society and the world in which we live, selfishness has increased more than love for others, and that men of good will must work, each with his own strengths and expertise, to ensure that love for others increases until it is equal and possibly exceeds love for oneself.
Author: Pope Francis

Quote: I wish it need not have happened in my time,"said Frodo."So do I,"said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring

Quote: Success has a simple formula: do your best, and people may like it.
Author: Sam Ewing

Quote: Hope is such a bait, it covers any hook.
Author: Oliver Goldsmith

Quote: If life had a second edition, how I would correct the proofs.
Author: John Clare

Quote: The president of General Motors was in a foul humor.
Author: Arthur Hailey

Quote: If you have only one smile in you give it to the people you love.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Gossip is the art of saying nothing in a way that leaves practically nothing unsaid.
Author: Walter Winchell

Quote: Success - keeping your mind awake and your desire asleep.
Author: Walter Scott

Quote: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
Author: Alexandre Dumas

Quote: We live in a rainbow of chaos.
Author: Paul Cezanne

Quote: People may think of Southern humor in terms of missing teeth and outhouse accidents, but the best of it is a rich vein running through the best of Southern literature.
Author: Roy Blount, Jr.

Quote: The thing I loved the most - and still love the most about teaching - is that you can connect with an individual or a group, and see that individual or group exceed their limits.
Author: Mike Krzyzewski

Quote: Photography is more than a medium for factual communication of ideas. It is a creative art.
Author: Ansel Adams

Quote: Success is sweet and sweeter if long delayed and gotten through many struggles and defeats.
Author: Amos Bronson Alcott

Quote: Hope is not the conviction that something will turn out well but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out.
Author: Vaclav Havel

Quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Sure, the comedians who swear or use scatological humor can get laughs, but they're uncomfortable laughs.
Author: John Ratzenberger

Quote: Never trust anyone completely but God. Love people, but put your full trust only in God.
Author: Lawrence Welk

Quote: Sculpture is the art of the intelligence.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it.
Author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird

Quote: Success breeds success.
Author: Mia Hamm

Quote: Expecting something for nothing is the most popular form of hope.
Author: Arnold H. Glasow

Quote: What do we live for, if not to make life less difficult for each other?
Author: George Eliot

Quote: The more women sit down and write something in a woman's voice for a woman, they more you'll see women in comedy because gender doesn't define sense of humor. Imagination and intelligence and perspective do.
Author: Kristen Schaal

Quote: Love is understood, in a historical way, as one of the great human vocations - but its counterspell has always been infidelity. This terrible, terrible betrayal that can tear apart not only another person, not only oneself, but whole families.
Author: Junot Diaz

Quote: One does not need buildings, money, power, or status to practice the Art of Peace. Heaven is right where you are standing, and that is the place to train.
Author: Morihei Ueshiba

Quote: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Success is not measured by what you accomplish, but by the opposition you have encountered, and the courage with which you have maintained the struggle against overwhelming odds.
Author: Orison Swett Marden

Quote: It is only hope which is real, and reality is a bitterness and a deceit.
Author: William Makepeace Thackeray

Quote: Life is a series of collisions with the future; it is not the sum of what we have been, but what we yearn to be.
Author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

Quote: Michael Pollan is a champion. In all ways. A man of great integrity, humor, and common sense and kindness.
Author: Maira Kalman

Quote: I really love to ride my motorcycle. When I want to just get away and be by myself and clear my head, that's what I do.
Author: Kyle Chandler

Quote: Winners have the ability to step back from the canvas of their lives like an artist gaining perspective. They make their lives a work of art - an individual masterpiece.
Author: Denis Waitley

Quote: Man needs his difficulties because they are necessary to enjoy success.
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: Chance has never yet satisfied the hope of a suffering people.
Author: Marcus Garvey

Quote: There is no wealth but life.
Author: John Ruskin

Quote: I'll let you in on a secret: I can't stand Jay Ward. I hate being compared to Rocky and Bullwinkle. It's just a different style of humor.
Author: John Kricfalusi

Quote: Everyone gets dumped and everyone gets hurt and there's karma to love in regards to what you've done to other people.
Author: Marina and the Diamonds

Quote: To array a man's will against his sickness is the supreme art of medicine.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: Most people give up just when they're about to achieve success. They quit on the one yard line. They give up at the last minute of the game one foot from a winning touchdown.
Author: Ross Perot

Quote: Little progress can be made by merely attempting to repress what is evil. Our great hope lies in developing what is good.
Author: Calvin Coolidge

Quote: The less routine the more life.
Author: Amos Bronson Alcott

Quote: I always had to genuinely like the actors I worked with and use my enthusiasm and vision to give them confidence to push their creativity and their humor.
Author: Tamra Davis

Quote: I would love for the world to be happier.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quote: And the first rude sketch that the world had seen was joy to his mighty heart, till the Devil whispered behind the leaves 'It's pretty, but is it Art?'
Author: Rudyard Kipling

Quote: The thermometer of success is merely the jealousy of the malcontents.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: The trouble with most people is that they think with their hopes or fears or wishes rather than with their minds.
Author: Will Durant

Quote: Our entire life - consists ultimately in accepting ourselves as we are.
Author: Jean Anouilh

Quote: The whole ability to look at the complexity of race and any sort of associated -ism and still find humor, that's a very interesting space.
Author: Rashid Johnson

Quote: Love the moment and the energy of that moment will spread beyond all boundaries.
Author: Corita Kent

Quote: O, thou art fairer than the evening air clad in the beauty of a thousand stars.
Author: Christopher Marlowe

Quote: Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Success is counted sweetest by those who never succeed.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: Beware how you take away hope from another human being.
Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

Quote: Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Thomas, my 15-year-old, is effectively my editor, I've always trusted his voice, more than anybody, on the strip for years. He has one of those ears that's just tuned to the rhythm of humor, so if he says something's not funny, my stomach just hurts because I know he's right, and it's already been drawn.
Author: Stephan Pastis

Quote: Love is trembling happiness.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quote: A good mother remembers to serve fruit at breakfast, is always cheerful and never yells, manages not to project her own neuroses and inadequacies onto her children, is an active and beloved community volunteer. She remembers to make play dates, her children's clothes fit, she does art projects with them and enjoys all their games.
Author: Ayelet Waldman

Quote: Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them.
Author: William Shakespeare,  Twelfth Night

Quote: A champion is afraid of losing. Everyone else is afraid of winning.
Author: Billie Jean King

Quote: Hope springs eternal in the human breast: Man never is, but always to be blest.
Author: Alexander Pope

Quote: Remember when life's path is steep to keep your mind even.
Author: Horace

Quote: With Portlandia, I don't think our intention is always to find something funny. Sometimes the humor comes from taking something really seriously. We're okay with making somebody feel uncomfortable or uneasy.
Author: Carrie Brownstein

Quote: Love is about mutual respect, apart from attraction.
Author: George Best

Quote: Patience is the art of concealing your impatience.
Author: Guy Kawasaki

Quote: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Never tell the truth to people who are not worthy of it.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Do you wish to rise? Begin by descending. You plan a tower that will pierce the clouds? Lay first the foundation of humility.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: The work goes on, the cause endures, the hope still lives and the dreams shall never die.
Author: Edward Kennedy

Quote: If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: The interesting thing about humor is that in humor, you - in logic, something is A or not A. In humor, it's both A and not A.
Author: Robert Mankoff

Quote: A person once asked me, in a provocative manner, if I approved of homosexuality. I replied with another question: 'Tell me: when God looks at a gay person, does he endorse the existence of this person with love, or reject and condemn this person?' We must always consider the person.
Author: Pope Francis

Quote: A great city, whose image dwells in the memory of man, is the type of some great idea. Rome represents conquest; Faith hovers over the towers of Jerusalem; and Athens embodies the pre-eminent quality of the antique world, Art.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Success is the child of drudgery and perseverance. It cannot be coaxed or bribed; pay the price and it is yours.
Author: Orison Swett Marden

Quote: When I was young, my ambition was to be one of the people who made a difference in this world. My hope is to leave the world a little better for having been there.
Author: Jim Henson

Quote: With the past, I have nothing to do; nor with the future. I live now.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There is humor in the darkest of moments - People who I have loved and passed away, and very high stake situations where you can't help but laugh. I think that's very human.
Author: Rose McIver

Quote: If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them. And if you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.
Author: Jesus Christ

Quote: I am not a great cook, I am not a great artist, but I love art, and I love food, so I am the perfect traveller.
Author: Michael Palin

Quote: I honestly think it is better to be a failure at something you love than to be a success at something you hate.
Author: George Burns

Quote: Never deprive someone of hope; it might be all they have.
Author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

Quote: The true object of all human life is play. Earth is a task garden; heaven is a playground.
Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

Quote: Humor starts like a wildfire, but then continues on, smoldering, smoldering for years.
Author: Robert Orben

Quote: Mother's love is peace. It need not be acquired, it need not be deserved.
Author: Erich Fromm

Quote: I don't think about art when I'm working. I try to think about life.
Author: Jean-Michel Basquiat

Quote: The toughest thing about success is that you've got to keep on being a success.
Author: Irving Berlin

Quote: Hope is the word which God has written on the brow of every man.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: Don't let life discourage you; everyone who got where he is had to begin where he was.
Author: Richard L. Evans

Quote: Humor is my default mode.
Author: John Updike

Quote: Life is difficult for everyone; everyone has bad days. Everyone has trouble in their life, because it doesn't matter how rich you are: Sickness and trouble and worry and love, these things will mess with you at every level of life.
Author: Domhnall Gleeson

Quote: Simplicity is the final achievement. After one has played a vast quantity of notes and more notes, it is simplicity that emerges as the crowning reward of art.
Author: Frederic Chopin

Quote: A person's a person, no matter how small.
Author: Dr. Seuss,  Horton Hears a Who!

Quote: Success is like reaching an important birthday and finding you're exactly the same.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: Hope is a risk that must be run.
Author: Georges Bernanos

Quote: Everything in life is luck.
Author: Donald Trump

Quote: President Ford used humor a great deal.
Author: Robert Orben

Quote: A man can be himself only so long as he is alone, and if he does not love solitude, he will not love freedom, for it is only when he is alone that he is really free.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: We can learn the art of fierce compassion - redefining strength, deconstructing isolation and renewing a sense of community, practicing letting go of rigid us-vs.-them thinking - while cultivating power and clarity in response to difficult situations.
Author: Sharon Salzberg

Quote: Once you agree upon the price you and your family must pay for success, it enables you to ignore the minor hurts, the opponent's pressure, and the temporary failures.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Hope is the only bee that makes honey without flowers.
Author: Robert Green Ingersoll

Quote: It's weird doing red carpets; it's uncomfortable. But you can have a sense of humor about it.
Author: Kirsten Dunst

Quote: There is a kind of serenity in love which is almost a paradise.
Author: Alain Badiou

Quote: Art cannot be modern. Art is primordially eternal.
Author: Egon Schiele

Quote: The measure of success is not whether you have a tough problem to deal with, but whether it is the same problem you had last year.
Author: John Foster Dulles

Quote: Hope is a good breakfast, but it is a bad supper.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quote: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity, or registering wrongs.
Author: Charlotte Bronte

Quote: I remember when humor was gentle pokes. I used to call it 'arm around the shoulder' humor. Now they go for the jugular and they take no prisoners. It's mean, mean stuff.
Author: Robert Orben

Quote: Love has its own instinct, finding the way to the heart, as the feeblest insect finds the way to its flower, with a will which nothing can dismay nor turn aside.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quote: I'm free. I just do what I want, say what I want, say how I feel, and I don't try to hurt nobody. I just try to make sure that I don't compromise my art in any kind of way, and I think people respect that.
Author: Erykah Badu

Quote: What you're supposed to do when you don't like a thing is change it. If you can't change it, change the way you think about it. Don't complain.
Author: Maya Angelou,  Wouldn't Take Nothing for My Journey Now

Quote: It's so hard to forget pain, but it's even harder to remember sweetness. We have no scar to show for happiness. We learn so little from peace.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Diary

Quote: In this world it is not what we take up, but what we give up, that makes us rich.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: All hope abandon, ye who enter here!
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quote: A chain is no stronger than its weakest link, and life is after all a chain.
Author: William James

Quote: Any attempts at humor immediately after September 11th were deemed tasteless.
Author: Allen Klein

Quote: Things are beautiful if you love them.
Author: Jean Anouilh

Quote: A compromise is the art of dividing a cake in such a way that everyone believes he has the biggest piece.
Author: Ludwig Erhard

Quote: I finally understood what true love meant...love meant that you care for another person's happiness more than your own, no matter how painful the choices you face might be.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Dear John

Quote: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Importance of Being Earnest

Quote: Success is that old ABC - ability, breaks, and courage.
Author: Charles Luckman

Quote: Hope is tomorrow's veneer over today's disappointment.
Author: Evan Esar

Quote: Life is like a trumpet - if you don't put anything into it, you don't get anything out of it.
Author: William Christopher Handy

Quote: Advertisers also know that humor can help bond us to their product.
Author: Allen Klein

Quote: I've always traveled with a picture of my daughter from 1989, her kindergarten school picture, that has 'I love you, Daddy' written on it. She's always made fun of me because I never changed that picture out. It's like my resistance to her getting older. It was the first thing she'd ever written to me and it means the world to me.
Author: Kiefer Sutherland

Quote: I'm inspired by artists and musicians. There are so many wonderful and talented people in the world. I love discovering new music, new writers, or new art.
Author: Alicia Keys

Quote: A day without laughter is a day wasted.
Author: Nicolas Chamfort

Quote: Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: Success isn't everything but it makes a man stand straight.
Author: Lillian Hellman

Quote: Man needs, for his happiness, not only the enjoyment of this or that, but hope and enterprise and change.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: I want to live my life, not record it.
Author: Jackie Kennedy

Quote: When we can find some humor in our upsets, they no longer seem as large or as important as they once did.
Author: Allen Klein

Quote: The love of what you do, combined with your belief in what you do, will not determine your success. It will determine how hard you will work and how dedicated you will be to achieving it. Success just shows up from there.
Author: Jeffrey Gitomer

Quote: The walls between art and engineering exist only in our minds.
Author: Theo Jansen

Quote: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack of will.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Hope is a talent like any other.
Author: Storm Jameson

Quote: My formula for living is quite simple. I get up in the morning and I go to bed at night. In between, I occupy myself as best I can.
Author: Cary Grant

Quote: Whether planned or not, humor takes our mind off of our troubles.
Author: Allen Klein

Quote: Anxiety is love's greatest killer. It makes others feel as you might when a drowning man holds on to you. You want to save him, but you know he will strangle you with his panic.
Author: Anais Nin

Quote: The temple of art is built in words.
Author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

Quote: The real secret of success is enthusiasm.
Author: Walter Chrysler

Quote: My great hope is to laugh as much as I cry; to get my work done and try to love somebody and have the courage to accept the love in return.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: I still find each day too short for all the thoughts I want to think, all the walks I want to take, all the books I want to read, and all the friends I want to see.
Author: John Burroughs

Quote: I'm just very amused by five-year-old humor.
Author: Kesha

Quote: Love bravely, live bravely, be courageous, there's really nothing to lose. There's no wrong you can't make right again, so be kinder to yourself, you know, have fun, take chances. There's no bounds.
Author: Jewel

Quote: The art of progress is to preserve order amid change and to preserve change amid order.
Author: Alfred North Whitehead

Quote: The ladder of success is best climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: What gives me the most hope every day is God's grace; knowing that his grace is going to give me the strength for whatever I face, knowing that nothing is a surprise to God.
Author: Rick Warren

Quote: I don't believe people are looking for the meaning of life as much as they are looking for the experience of being alive.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: I met Elton John at an Interview dinner, and we just sort of became friends. He's got such a wicked sense of humor.
Author: Moby

Quote: I really love baseball. The guys and the game, and I love the challenge of describing things. The only thing I hate - and I know you have to be realistic and pay the bills in this life - is the loneliness on the road.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: The ability to make somebody feel something: that's art. However you look at it, whether you're an author, a painter, a singer, a rapper, a spoken-word artist - art.
Author: Wale

Quote: Success is a science; if you have the conditions, you get the result.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master-gardener of his soul, the director of his life.
Author: James Allen

Quote: There is also this benefit in brag, that the speaker is unconsciously expressing his own ideal. Humor him by all means, draw it all out, and hold him to it.
Author: Miguel de Cervantes

Quote: I can honestly say I love getting older. Then again, I never put my glasses on before looking in the mirror.
Author: Cherie Lunghi

Quote: As a longtime fan of talk radio, I'm very worried about the low opinion that conservative hosts and callers have of the American artist. Art is portrayed as a scam, a rip-off and snow job pushed by snobbish elites.
Author: Camille Paglia

Quote: Defeat is not the worst of failures. Not to have tried is the true failure.
Author: George Edward Woodberry

Quote: Hope is patience with the lamp lit.
Author: Tertullian

Quote: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: Sites like Funny or Die and College Humor are great, but I'd say it's appealing to 80% men and 20% women.
Author: Zooey Deschanel

Quote: Loyalty and devotion lead to bravery. Bravery leads to the spirit of self-sacrifice. The spirit of self-sacrifice creates trust in the power of love.
Author: Morihei Ueshiba

Quote: I've constantly tried new things, even as a child, and have always been obsessed with pink. Now I'm just a little more ladylike and fearless. You should never feel afraid to become a piece of art. It's exhilarating.
Author: Nicki Minaj

Quote: The truth."Dumbledore sighed. "It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

Quote: One secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Hope in reality is the worst of all evils because it prolongs the torments of man.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
Author: Charles R. Swindoll

Quote: Edward Norton and I have known each other awhile. I just think he's the real deal, supremely talented and smart. He's got a great sense of humor.
Author: Kevin Spacey

Quote: Winners embrace hard work. They love the discipline of it, the trade-off they're making to win. Losers, on the other hand, see it as punishment. And that's the difference.
Author: Lou Holtz

Quote: In any art, you don't know in advance what you want to say - it's revealed to you as you say it. That's the difference between art and illustration.
Author: Aaron Siskind

Quote: In all our deeds, the proper value and respect for time determines success or failure.
Author: Malcolm X

Quote: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Do you realize that you can't play the game of life with sweaty palms?
Author: Phil McGraw

Quote: In looking for humor, keep in mind this guideline: Sometimes it takes a little time to see the humor in your upsets; you may not find something to laugh about immediately.
Author: Allen Klein

Quote: I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word in reality. This is why right, temporarily defeated, is stronger than evil triumphant.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: Music happens to be an art form that transcends language.
Author: Herbie Hancock

Quote: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Mother Night

Quote: Have regular hours for work and play; make each day both useful and pleasant, and prove that you understand the worth of time by employing it well. Then youth will be delightful, old age will bring few regrets, and life will become a beautiful success.
Author: Louisa May Alcott

Quote: Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness.
Author: Desmond Tutu

Quote: Books, I don't know what you see in them. I can understand a person reading them, but I can't for the life of me see why people have to write them.
Author: Peter Ustinov

Quote: Since the goal of my programs is to show audiences how humor can both help them heal as well as deal with not-so-funny stuff, I decided to discuss the events of the previous week, the pain all of us were feeling, and how humor and some laughter might be beneficial.
Author: Allen Klein

Quote: Not necessity, not desire - no, the love of power is the demon of men. Let them have everything - health, food, a place to live, entertainment - they are and remain unhappy and low-spirited: for the demon waits and waits and will be satisfied.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: In our life there is a single color, as on an artist's palette, which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.
Author: Marc Chagall

Quote: Always remember that striving and struggle precede success, even in the dictionary.
Author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

Quote: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: For me, no ideological or political conviction would justify the sacrifice of a human life. For me, the value of life is absolute, with no concessions. It's not negotiable.
Author: Edgar Ramirez

Quote: Humor and laughter - not necessarily derogatory derision - are my pet tools. This may come from my general philosophy of never taking the world too seriously - for fear of dying of boredom.
Author: Marcel Duchamp

Quote: To love yourself right now, just as you are, is to give yourself heaven. Don't wait until you die. If you wait, you die now. If you love, you live now.
Author: Alan Cohen

Quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
Author: Samuel Butler

Quote: I have no problem with the people who work hard to get success. But I think people are very jealous about success. I work very hard and they don't appreciate that.
Author: Alain Prost

Quote: Hope is like the sun, which, as we journey toward it, casts the shadow of our burden behind us.
Author: Samuel Smiles

Quote: With all of you men out there who think that having a thousand different ladies is pretty cool, I have learned in my life I've found out that having one woman a thousand different times is much more satisfying.
Author: Wilt Chamberlain

Quote: Since the very beginning, Emeril's had a sense of humor about me calling him names and poking fun at him.
Author: Anthony Bourdain

Quote: Do what you love; you'll be better at it. It sounds pretty simple, but you'd be surprised how many people don't get this one right away.
Author: LL Cool J

Quote: We are all hungry and thirsty for concrete images. Abstract art will have been good for one thing: to restore its exact virginity to figurative art.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Be careful about reading health books. Some fine day you'll die of a misprint.
Author: Markus Herz

Quote: You can be discouraged by failure, or you can learn from it. So go ahead and make mistakes, make all you can. Because, remember that's where you'll find success - on the far side of failure.
Author: Thomas J. Watson

Quote: We have always held to the hope, the belief, the conviction that there is a better life, a better world, beyond the horizon.
Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Quote: Well, my life hasn't really changed... I've been homeschooled for a long time. So that helped a lot because of shooting and stuff. But, I have had friends who I've been friends with for years and years and they are my true friends, you know?
Author: Willow Shields

Quote: From sixteen to twenty, all women, kept in humor by their hopes and by their attractions, appear to be good-natured.
Author: Samuel Richardson

Quote: Unable are the loved to die, for love is immortality.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: Life is not an exact science, it is an art.
Author: Samuel Butler

Quote: As you walk in God's divine wisdom, you will surely begin to see a greater measure of victory and good success in your life.
Author: Joseph Prince

Quote: You may not always have a comfortable life and you will not always be able to solve all of the world's problems at once but don't ever underestimate the importance you can have because history has shown us that courage can be contagious and hope can take on a life of its own.
Author: Michelle Obama

Quote: Oh, man, if in real life I was as cool and suave as Coach Taylor and had all the answers, things would be easier.
Author: Kyle Chandler

Quote: At sunrise everything is luminous but not clear. It is those we live with and love and should know who elude us. You can love completely without complete understanding.
Author: Norman Maclean

Quote: The art of a people is a true mirror to their minds.
Author: Jawaharlal Nehru

Quote: The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame.
Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray

Quote: Growing up in a group home, and with an undiagnosed learning disability to boot, the odds of success were not on my side. But when I joined the high school football team, I learned the value of discipline, focus, persistence, and teamwork - all skills that have proven vital to my career as a C.E.O. and social entrepreneur.
Author: Darell Hammond

Quote: The human heart has hidden treasures, In secret kept, in silence sealed; The thoughts, the hopes, the dreams, the pleasures, Whose charms were broken if revealed.
Author: Charlotte Bronte

Quote: We're so terrified of death in Western culture that we have to make up a myth of an afterlife. I think there's something to be said for living your life very mindful of the fact that you're going to die because I think you carry yourself differently. It doesn't have to be this big, negative bummer.
Author: Steve Earle

Quote: If I had to describe my sense of humor, I would say it's contemporary wit, you know what I'm saying?
Author: Tracy Morgan

Quote: I love fast cars... and to go too fast in them.
Author: Lara Flynn Boyle

Quote: Film will only became an art when its materials are as inexpensive as pencil and paper.
Author: Jean Cocteau

Quote: I have a tendency to sabotage relationships; I have a tendency to sabotage everything. Fear of success, fear of failure, fear of being afraid. Useless, good-for-nothing thoughts.
Author: Michael Buble

Quote: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: Being incarcerated is truly very serious, and it has changed my life to such an extent that breaking the cycle has become my sole focus. Jail is definitely not cool. Education is.
Author: Ja Rule

Quote: Things can be funny only when we are in fun. When we're 'dead earnest,' humor is the only thing that is dead.
Author: Flip Wilson

Quote: I know of only one duty, and that is to love.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: The art and science of asking questions is the source of all knowledge.
Author: Thomas Berger

Quote: Oh, I wouldn't mind, Hazel Grace. It would be a privilege to have my heart broken by you.
Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

Quote: I'd rather invest in an entrepreneur who has failed before than one who assumes success from day one.
Author: Kevin O'Leary

Quote: Hope lies in dreams, in imagination, and in the courage of those who dare to make dreams into reality.
Author: Jonas Salk

Quote: I like tricks; I like to dazzle. Dribbling and leaving your opponent on his backside is what life is for. If I achieve what I want to, then I'll mark a distinct era in football. I'm the Che Guevara of modern soccer.
Author: Sergio Aguero

Quote: I suppose I miss the British cynicism and the humor.
Author: Rod Stewart

Quote: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Raising children is a creative endeavor, an art rather than a science.
Author: Bruno Bettelheim

Quote: The hardest thing to find in life is balance - especially the more success you have, the more you look to the other side of the gate. What do I need to stay grounded, in touch, in love, connected, emotionally balanced? Look within yourself.
Author: Celine Dion

Quote: Let your hopes, not your hurts, shape your future.
Author: Robert H. Schuller

Quote: I have a lot of sympathy for young people because I realize how disturbed I was. How would I deal with life in the future? What would I do for a living?
Author: Clyde Tombaugh

Quote: There are certain things I learned when I first started learning about acting, to try and place the character physically and emotionally. And the way you place them emotionally is often with humor.
Author: David Duchovny

Quote: Love is the outreach of self toward completion.
Author: Ralph W. Sockman

Quote: You should never feel afraid to become a piece of art. It's exhilarating.
Author: Nicki Minaj

Quote: A tragic irony of life is that we so often achieve success or financial independence after the chief reason for which we sought it has passed away.
Author: Ellen Glasgow

Quote: I know that some endeavor to throw the mantle of romance over the subject and treat woman like some ideal existence, not liable to the ills of life. Let those deal in fancy who have nothing better to deal in; we have to do with sober, sad realities, with stubborn facts.
Author: Ernestine Rose

Quote: I'm very confident that Nick Hornby always gets it right as a writer. He has the vernacular and passion. He is adroit and dry, and balances humor with the humanity of life.
Author: Pierce Brosnan

Quote: Love. Fall in love and stay in love. Write only what you love, and love what you write. The key word is love. You have to get up in the morning and write something you love, something to live for.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: A work of art when placed in a gallery loses its charge, and becomes a portable object or surface disengaged from the outside world.
Author: Robert Smithson

Quote: A key to achieving success is to assemble a strong and stable management team.
Author: Vivek Wadhwa

Quote: I simply can't build my hopes on a foundation of confusion, misery and death... I think... peace and tranquillity will return again.
Author: Anne Frank

Quote: I've got an overactive brain. I enjoy work, I enjoy life, and I'm not good at relaxing. I've also never slept very much due to this overactive imagination and my brain constantly thinking.
Author: Rick Wakeman

Quote: You see, that's another thing that my parents gave me: an enormously great sense of humor.
Author: Liza Minnelli

Quote: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.
Author: Thomas Merton

Quote: What 'War and Peace' is to the novel and 'Hamlet' is to the theater, Swan Lake' is to ballet - that is, the name which to many people stands for and sums up an art form.
Author: Robert Gottlieb

Quote: If you're gonna be two-faced at least make one of them pretty.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Some might complain that nuclear disarmament is little more than a dream. But that ignores the very tangible benefits disarmament would bring for all humankind. Its success would strengthen international peace and security. It would free up vast and much-needed resources for social and economic development. It would advance the rule of law.
Author: Ban Ki-moon

Quote: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul - and sings the tunes without the words - and never stops at all.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: My success set me up for life, and it meant that I could retire from the music industry at 27 to spend time with my newborn daughter and my wife. My time away from the spotlight allowed me to rediscover my love for music, and I'm doing it for me now and no one else.
Author: Rick Astley

Quote: The woman who runs the Pennsylvania Innocence Project told me that there's a man she's been trying to get out of prison for 26 years. Every night before she goes to bed, she thinks, 'What is he doing?' She says you don't sleep. And yet, she has the greatest sense of humor and this light that comes out of her.
Author: Richard LaGravenese

Quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Quote: Pop Art looks out into the world. It doesn't look like a painting of something, it looks like the thing itself.
Author: Roy Lichtenstein

Quote: Good ideas are like Nike sports shoes. They may facilitate success for an athlete who possesses them, but on their own they are nothing but an overpriced pair of sneakers. Sports shoes don't win races. Athletes do.
Author: Felix Dennis

Quote: Hope will never be silent.
Author: Harvey Milk

Quote: Music is as integral to me as my own DNA. My life has become a continual soundtrack, with music underscoring the most powerful and even the most banal moments of my life.
Author: Danielle de Niese

Quote: In rough times, pathfinders rely on work, friends, humor and prayer. They develop a support network.
Author: Gail Sheehy

Quote: I don't think I've had love at first sight. But, I've definitely had moments where I've seen a person, and I'm like, 'Wow, there is something different about you, and I really want to get to know you.'
Author: Josh Hutcherson

Quote: The roles of art, morality, religion, political faith, science itself are not to repair organic exhaustion nor to provide sound functioning of the organs. All this supraphysical life is built and expanded not because of the demands of the cosmic environment but because of the demands of the social environment.
Author: Emile Durkheim

Quote: ... a mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge.
Author: George R.R. Martin,  A Game of Thrones

Quote: Success is the sum of details.
Author: Harvey S. Firestone

Quote: We must free ourselves of the hope that the sea will ever rest. We must learn to sail in high winds.
Author: Aristotle Onassis

Quote: One's real life is so often the life that one does not lead.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: And humor has always been a weapon. You want to get even on somebody? You want to attack somebody? Make fun of them.
Author: Alan King

Quote: If you don't love the Dodgers, there's a good chance you may not get into Heaven.
Author: Tommy Lasorda

Quote: Let's face it: professing a deep interest in movies, the absolutely dominant global art form of the last century, is at this point like professing an interest in air. Passion is nice. Erudition is admirable. But it's like that moment when good manners cross over into meaningless etiquette.
Author: David Rakoff

Quote: One press account said I was an overnight success. I thought that was the longest night I've ever spent.
Author: Sandra Cisneros

Quote: I find hope in the darkest of days, and focus in the brightest. I do not judge the universe.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: If you are lucky enough to find a way of life you love, you have to find the courage to live it.
Author: John Irving

Quote: You can't do anything to be funny. That's cringeworthy. If your humor comes out of a place of love every time, you don't make the joke bigger than you. The funniest comedians are in touch with their emotional level.
Author: John Krasinski

Quote: I love my cats more than I love most people. Probably more than is healthy.
Author: Amy Lee

Quote: I used to go and flatten my nose against that window and absorb all I could of his art. It changed my life. I saw art then as I wanted to see it.
Author: Mary Cassatt

Quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Emerson in His Journals

Quote: It's a special person - and personality - who can lead a start-up to soaring success and sustain that success for the long term. Apple co-founder Steve Jobs and Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg are star examples.
Author: Marcus Buckingham

Quote: You can make positive deposits in your own economy every day by reading and listening to powerful, positive, life-changing content and by associating with encouraging and hope-building people.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Humor has been the balm of my life, but it's been reserved for those close to me, not part of the public Lana.
Author: Lana Turner

Quote: I still haven't found the humor in getting hit by a cement truck. My knees still hurt when I think about it, so no jokes about that yet.
Author: Adam DeVine

Quote: Would not the child's heart break in despair when the first cold storm of the world sweeps over it, if the warm sunlight of love from the eyes of mother and father did not shine upon him like the soft reflection of divine light and love?
Author: Max Muller

Quote: Photographing a cake can be art.
Author: Irving Penn

Quote: Indomitable perseverance in a business, properly understood, always ensures ultimate success.
Author: Cyrus McCormick

Quote: Hope is important because it can make the present moment less difficult to bear. If we believe that tomorrow will be better, we can bear a hardship today.
Author: Thich Nhat Hanh

Quote: The goal is to live a full, productive life even with all that ambiguity. No matter what happens, whether the cancer never flares up again or whether you die, the important thing is that the days that you have had you will have lived.
Author: Gilda Radner

Quote: Life is just so much fun and so filled with humor.
Author: Foster Friess

Quote: I am a bit of a hopeless romantic. I really do have a faith and a belief in love, and when I love, I love hard.
Author: Melanie Fiona

Quote: As a child I was very into gadgets and machines and robots. The idea of experimenting with machines to create art was always something I tinkered with.
Author: Reggie Watts

Quote: Money and success don't change people; they merely amplify what is already there.
Author: Will Smith

Quote: We must rediscover the distinction between hope and expectation.
Author: Ivan Illich

Quote: It's paradoxical, that the idea of living a long life appeals to everyone, but the idea of getting old doesn't appeal to anyone.
Author: Andy Rooney

Quote: My two big date deal breakers are someone with no sense of humor and someone who chews badly. I will never be with someone who never laughs or someone who chews disgustingly, so if either of those things are detected on a date - it's a total deal breaker.
Author: Elizabeth Gillies

Quote: The Lord has been there from wanting to be a momma, to having a wonderful childhood life and dreaming of having a good motherhood as a child; always wanting to meet a good old country boy and having someone to love as much as I love my husband Roland and having a little boy that is a mixture of the both of us.
Author: Ashton Shepherd

Quote: When I travel, I draw and paint sketches which is great fun. And as long as you are fully aware that it has nothing to do with actual art, I think that's all right.
Author: Arne Jacobsen

Quote: Thomas Edison's last words were "It's very beautiful over there". I don't know where there is, but I believe it's somewhere, and I hope it's beautiful.
Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

Quote: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
Author: Paramahansa Yogananda

Quote: I am prepared for the worst, but hope for the best.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: The purpose of life is to be defeated by greater and greater things.
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: I think humor is important for all of us, and a great comedian is a great treasure.
Author: Leila Josefowicz

Quote: I'm always swimming forward like a shark. You just keep going and you don't rest. I love waking up knowing that I have a problem to solve.
Author: Nile Rodgers

Quote: It's the word 'artful'; it's such a great word, with its dark and its light side, its art and its cunning, the craft and the crafty of it - I've been preoccupied with the word 'artful' and the twin notions of 'cornucopia' and 'pickpocket' it suggests for quite some time.
Author: Ali Smith

Quote: The battle of life is, in most cases, fought uphill; and to win it without a struggle were perhaps to win it without honor. If there were no difficulties there would be no success; if there were nothing to struggle for, there would be nothing to be achieved.
Author: Samuel Smiles

Quote: Courage is like love; it must have hope for nourishment.
Author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Quote: The month of November makes me feel that life is passing more quickly. In an effort to slow it down, I try to fill the hours more meaningfully.
Author: Henry Rollins

Quote: While many of us never knew Ronald Reagan personally, we felt close to him because we shared his lighthearted sense of humor, admired his uncommon virtue, and were moved by his remarkable wisdom.
Author: Randy Forbes

Quote: My father was a man of love. He always loved me to death. He worked hard in the fields, but my father never hit me. Never. I don't ever remember a really cross, unkind word from my father.
Author: Johnny Cash

Quote: Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Any fact facing us is not as important as our attitude toward it, for that determines our success or failure. The way you think about a fact may defeat you before you ever do anything about it. You are overcome by the fact because you think you are.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Youth is easily deceived because it is quick to hope.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: As comedians, we are all laughing because life is so horrible. Life is so difficult, and I cope with it by making jokes about absolutely everything.
Author: Joan Rivers

Quote: A sense of humor is important. I'm always attracted to a girl with confidence. In terms of looks, I don't have a type. I think a lot of girls think that they have to be super-thin, to meet the Hollywood image, but I think a girl who is voluptuous is very beautiful.
Author: Corey Sevier

Quote: The story of a love is not important-what is important is that one is capable of love. It is perhaps the only glimpse we are permitted of eternity.
Author: Helen Hayes

Quote: Speak the truth, do not yield to anger; give, if thou art asked for little; by these three steps thou wilt go near the gods.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Do you remember me telling you we are practicing non-verbal spells, Potter?""Yes,"said Harry stiffly."Yes, sir.""There's no need to call me "sir"Professor."The words had escaped him before he knew what he was saying.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Success in its highest and noblest form calls for peace of mind and enjoyment and happiness which come only to the man who has found the work that he likes best.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: Hope is definitely not the same thing as optimism. It is not the conviction that something will turn out well, but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out.
Author: Vaclav Havel

Quote: I trust that when people meet, we meet for a transcendent reason, and that the challenges we face in life are always lessons that serve our soul's growth.
Author: Marianne Williamson

Quote: There's something very authentic about humor, when you think about it. Anybody can pretend to be serious. But you can't pretend to be funny.
Author: Billy Collins

Quote: To control the breathing is to control the mind. With different patterns of breathing, you can fall in love, you can hate someone, you can feel the whole spectrum of feelings just by changing your breathing.
Author: Marina Abramovic

Quote: There's no art to find the mind's construction in the face.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart.
Author: Haruki Murakami,  Kafka on the Shore

Quote: Life is a series of punches. It presents a lot of challenges. It presents a lot of hardship, but the people that are able to take those punches and able to move forward are the ones that really do have a lot of success and have a lot of joy in their life and have a lot of stories to tell, too.
Author: Josh Turner

Quote: I said to my soul, be still, and wait without hope, For hope would be hope for the wrong thing.
Author: T. S. Eliot

Quote: All of life and human relations have become so incomprehensibly complex that, when you think about it, it becomes terrifying and your heart stands still.
Author: Anton Chekhov

Quote: Humor is so important to the American scene throughout history.
Author: Bob Newhart

Quote: If you cannot inspire a woman with love of you, fill her above the brim with love of herself; all that runs over will be yours.
Author: Charles Caleb Colton

Quote: 'Crazy' is a term of art; 'Insane' is a term of law. Remember that, and you will save yourself a lot of trouble.
Author: Hunter S. Thompson

Quote: You can't live your life for other people. You've got to do what's right for you, even if it hurts some people you love.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook

Quote: The only thing I'm addicted to is winning. This bootleg cult, arrogantly referred to as Alcoholics Anonymous, reports a 5 percent success rate. My success rate is 100 percent.
Author: Charlie Sheen

Quote: The hope of a secure and livable world lies with disciplined nonconformists who are dedicated to justice, peace and brotherhood.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: That's the secret to life... replace one worry with another.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: When humor can be made to alternate with melancholy, one has a success, but when the same things are funny and melancholic at the same time, it's just wonderful.
Author: Francois Truffaut

Quote: I think in art, but especially in films, people are trying to confirm their own existences.
Author: Jim Morrison

Quote: The one you love and the one who loves you are never, ever the same person.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Invisible Monsters

Quote: A great social success is a pretty girl who plays her cards as carefully as if she were plain.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: Hope is the pillar that holds up the world. Hope is the dream of a waking man.
Author: Pliny the Elder

Quote: If you would only recognize that life is hard, things would be so much easier for you.
Author: Louis D. Brandeis

Quote: There is a lack of humor in fashion. To me, it's always been the fun, cool industry to work in, and I always wanted people to be on my side and see how much fun we really have behind the scenes.
Author: Chris Benz

Quote: I love a massage. I'd go every day if I could. I don't need to be wrapped in herbs like a salmon fillet, but I do love a massage.
Author: Jason Bateman

Quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: We have known since the 1800s that carbon dioxide traps heat in the atmosphere. The right amount keeps the climate conducive to human life.
Author: James Hansen

Quote: Humor is the oxygen of children's literature. There's a lot of competition for children's time, but even kids who hate to read want to read a funny book.
Author: Sid Fleischman

Quote: I love to sing. Mostly about love and sex.
Author: Elizabeth Berkley

Quote: Art is the stored honey of the human soul, gathered on wings of misery and travail.
Author: Theodore Dreiser

Quote: I was obliged to be industrious. Whoever is equally industrious will succeed equally well.
Author: Johann Sebastian Bach

Quote: When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me'.
Author: Erma Bombeck

Quote: Well, I think breathing life into the Endangered Species Act, taking those wolves back into Yellowstone, restoring the salmon in the rivers of the Pacific Northwest.
Author: Bruce Babbitt

Quote: In my first story, 'Mr. Mysterious & Company'... I was asked to take out some of the humor because editors were afraid reviewers would dismiss the book as a joke. Today, humor is enjoyed and no longer regarded as literary brummagem.
Author: Sid Fleischman

Quote: The new 'Joy' was needed for a number of reasons. Recent developments in nutrition and new ingredients were two of the major reasons for the revision. One of the other big reasons was America's new love for big flavors. Yay!
Author: Irma S. Rombauer

Quote: Art begins with resistance - at the point where resistance is overcome. No human masterpiece has ever been created without great labor.
Author: Andre Gide

Quote: Flaming enthusiasm, backed up by horse sense and persistence, is the quality that most frequently makes for success.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: When we meet real tragedy in life, we can react in two ways - either by losing hope and falling into self-destructive habits, or by using the challenge to find our inner strength. Thanks to the teachings of Buddha, I have been able to take this second way.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: The thing about Mumbai is you go five yards and all of human existence is revealed. It's an incredible cavalcade of life, and I love that.
Author: Julian Sands

Quote: You find out in life that people really like you funny. So what do you give 'em? Humor. And then if you show them the other side, they don't like you as much. I find, too, that I can hide behind the idiot's mask being funny, and you never see the sorrow or the pain.
Author: Terry Bradshaw

Quote: You either love or you hate. You live in the middle, you get nothing.
Author: Charlie Sheen

Quote: I hope to live all my life for my art, without abandoning my principles one iota.
Author: Gustave Courbet

Quote: It's the steady, quiet, plodding ones who win in the lifelong race.
Author: Robert W. Service

Quote: I'm here to spread a message of hope. Follow your heart. Don't follow what you've been told you're supposed to do.
Author: J. Cole

Quote: We know there is gravity because apples fall from trees. We can observe gravity in daily life. If we could throw an apple to the edge of the universe, we would observe it accelerating.
Author: Adam Riess

Quote: Humor is a social lubricant that helps us get over some of the bad spots.
Author: Steve Allen

Quote: It's possible to love a human being if you don't know them too well.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: The principle of art is to pause, not bypass.
Author: Jerzy Kosinski

Quote: A person with a new idea is a crank until the idea succeeds.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Nothing in life is so exhilarating as to be shot at without result.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: Insult is powerful. Insult begets both rage and humor and often at the same time.
Author: Suzanne Fields

Quote: Animals have never betrayed me. They are an easy prey, as I have been throughout my career. So we feel the same. I love them.
Author: Brigitte Bardot

Quote: It may be that the deep necessity of art is the examination of self-deception.
Author: Robert Motherwell

Quote: Success in almost any field depends more on energy and drive than it does on intelligence. This explains why we have so many stupid leaders.
Author: Sloan Wilson

Quote: My dream is of a place and a time where America will once again be seen as the last best hope of earth.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: The spirit of Christmas is the spirit of love and of generosity and of goodness. It illuminates the picture window of the soul, and we look out upon the world's busy life and become more interested in people than in things.
Author: Thomas S. Monson

Quote: Maybe the bar is low, but most of the strips that are 50, 60, 70 years old that are on their second or third generation of artists, the humor is pretty bland. There are others by people that were raised on 'Family Guy' or 'South Park' that are edgier. Mine's not as edgy as those, but it's edgier than 'Beetle Bailey.'
Author: Stephan Pastis

Quote: Only a struggle twists sentimentality and lust together into love.
Author: E. M. Forster

Quote: Painting is a nail to which I fasten my ideas.
Author: Georges Braque

Quote: When you win, nothing hurts.
Author: Joe Namath

Quote: Vulnerability is the essence of romance. It's the art of being uncalculated, the willingness to look foolish, the courage to say, 'This is me, and I'm interested in you enough to show you my flaws with the hope that you may embrace me for all that I am but, more important, all that I am not.'
Author: Ashton Kutcher

Quote: Never try to impress a woman, because if you do she'll expect you to keep up the standard for the rest of your life.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: The people I mixed with in Monaco didn't relate to my South African mentality or humor... Although I have met some wonderful people since I've been living in Monaco, I regard them all as acquaintances. I only have two people I consider friends here.
Author: Charlene, Princess of Monaco

Quote: I just love real characters; they're not pretentious, and every emotion is on the surface, they're regular working people. Their likes, their dislikes, their loves, their hates, their passions; they're all right there on the surface.
Author: David O. Russell

Quote: Art must take reality by surprise.
Author: Francoise Sagan

Quote: The man who has done his level best... is a success, even though the world may write him down a failure.
Author: B. C. Forbes

Quote: I hope I shall possess firmness and virtue enough to maintain what I consider the most enviable of all titles, the character of an honest man.
Author: George Washington

Quote: Early in life I had to choose between honest arrogance and hypocritical humility. I chose the former and have seen no reason to change.
Author: Frank Lloyd Wright

Quote: Along with a sense of humor, my songs have to be sincere, and they have to be sung from a position of inner conviction.
Author: Arlo Guthrie

Quote: I love dressing up and doing the red carpet every once in a while, but I am very much a jeans kinda girl, so it's all a little embarrassing for me.
Author: Kelly Clarkson

Quote: What I wanted to do was to paint sunlight on the side of a house.
Author: Edward Hopper

Quote: To be prepared is half the victory.
Author: Miguel de Cervantes

Quote: There are only two lasting bequests we can hope to give our children. One of these is roots, the other, wings.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: The happiest people in the world are those who feel absolutely terrific about themselves, and this is the natural outgrowth of accepting total responsibility for every part of their life.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: If you look back, Mozart, Haydn and Beethoven were mixing music and humor all the time.
Author: Richard Hyung-ki Joo

Quote: Brazil is where I belong, the place that feels like home. They love their family, their country and God, and are not afraid to let anybody know it.
Author: Dionne Warwick

Quote: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
Author: Thomas Merton

Quote: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: To love means loving the unlovable. To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable. Faith means believing the unbelievable. Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.
Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

Quote: Children astound me with their inquisitive minds. The world is wide and mysterious to them, and as they piece together the puzzle of life, they ask 'Why?' ceaselessly.
Author: John C. Maxwell

Quote: There is something really horrific for any human being who feels he is being consumed by other people. I'm talking about a writer's critics, who don't address what you've written, but want to probe into your existence and magnify the trivia of your life without any sense of humor, without any sense of context.
Author: Wole Soyinka

Quote: I'd love to knock an audience cold with one note, but what do you do for the rest of the evening?
Author: Eric Clapton

Quote: Pictures deface walls more often than they decorate them.
Author: William Wordsworth

Quote: Books are a uniquely portable magic.
Author: Stephen King,  On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft

Quote: Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.
Author: Ernest Hemingway,  The Garden of Eden

Quote: As kids we're not taught how to deal with success; we're taught how to deal with failure. If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. If at first you succeed, then what?
Author: Charlie Sheen

Quote: I prefer to win titles with the team ahead of individual awards or scoring more goals than anyone else. I'm more worried about being a good person than being the best football player in the world. When all this is over, what are you left with?
