Quote: It has never been, and never will be easy work! But the road that is built in hope is more pleasant to the traveler than the road built in despair, even though they both lead to the same destination.
Author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

Quote: Mother humor is such a universal theme. I wrote a show called '25 Questions for a Jewish Mother.' I had people coming up to me after the show saying, 'I'm Baptist, and my mother is just like yours.'
Author: Judy Gold

Quote: I don't think anybody should ever take their life for being bullied. But if it wasn't for my family... and my circle of friends, I could definitely see why someone would see it doesn't get any better than this, but it does. Life is so beautiful.
Author: Khloe Kardashian

Quote: I really do believe that God is love, one of deep affection and grace and forgiveness and inspiration.
Author: William P. Young

Quote: Art is the child of Nature; yes, her darling child, in whom we trace the features of the mother's face, her aspect and her attitude.
Author: Beck

Quote: In a balanced organization, working towards a common objective, there is success.
Author: Arthur Helps

Quote: Iranian filmmakers are not passive. They fight whenever they can, as creative expression means a lot to them. The restrictions and censorship in Iran are a bit like the British weather: one day it's sunny, the next day it's raining. You just have to hope you walk out into the sunshine.
Author: Asghar Farhadi

Quote: Hope for the best, survive the worst, find humor wherever you can.
Author: Claire Scovell LaZebnik

Quote: Last Wednesday, I stupidly dropped my iPhone in the bath, and my life has sort of spiraled almost out of control.
Author: Patrick Stewart

Quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
Author: Confucius

Quote: I choose a block of marble and chop off whatever I don't need.
Author: Auguste Rodin

Quote: There's nothing like deep breaths after laughing that hard. Nothing in the world like a sore stomach for the right reasons.
Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: Only the very weak-minded refuse to be influenced by literature and poetry.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel

Quote: Much effort, much prosperity.
Author: Euripides

Quote: I've realized the extraordinary power of sports to heal, unite and inspire. I believe the Olympics will serve as the ultimate platform to provide positive changes and I hope to inspire all of Japan through my strong showing there.
Author: Kohei Uchimura

Quote: We don't appreciate the value of humor sometimes.
Author: Janet Evanovich

Quote: I have a deep love for life and my fellow human beings. I try to understand everything that everybody does, even if it seems wrong to me.
Author: Steve Vai

Quote: I love you the more in that I believe you had liked me for my own sake and for nothing else.
Author: John Keats

Quote: Drawing is the honesty of the art. There is no possibility of cheating. It is either good or bad.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: I can't give you a sure-fire formula for success, but I can give you a formula for failure: try to please everybody all the time.
Author: Herbert Bayard Swope

Quote: Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement.
Author: W. Clement Stone

Quote: I write some country music. There's a song called 'I Hope You Dance.' Incredible. I was going to write that poem; somebody beat me to it.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: You can get through very serious and sometimes horrible and sometimes embarrassing and very awkward situations with humor. It gives us a way out.
Author: Janet Evanovich

Quote: When we think of the ideal, we do not add virtue to virtue, but think of Jesus Christ, so that the standard of human life is no longer a code, but a character.
Author: E. Stanley Jones

Quote: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: You're going to come across people in your life who will say all the right words at all the right times. But in the end, it's always their actions you should judge them by. It's actions, not words, that matter.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Rescue

Quote: We're all human, aren't we? Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Quote: People think that at the top there isn't much room. They tend to think of it as an Everest. My message is that there is tons of room at the top.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Reading 'Youth in Revolt' might have ruined my career because suddenly I wanted to abandon all the emotional truth of something and just go out far on a literary limb with completely implausible things that relied completely on voice and humor. And what saved me is realizing that I couldn't do that very well.
Author: Rob Thomas

Quote: People ask for this life, but they don't really understand what comes with it. People just see the outside and that looks good - big houses, cars, girls, but you never see how the person is feeling deep down inside. Me personally, being a man, I'm going to feel better displaying all of this and pouring my heart out on each record.
Author: Bow Wow

Quote: Pursue some path, however narrow and crooked, in which you can walk with love and reverence.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Painting is self-discovery. Every good artist paints what he is.
Author: Jackson Pollock

Quote: And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it.
Author: Roald Dahl

Quote: What a treacherous thing to believe that a person is more than a person.
Author: John Green,  Paper Towns

Quote: When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: If you find it in your heart to care for somebody else, you will have succeeded.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: The reason I never give up hope is because everything is so basically hopeless.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: A lot of people say, 'Hey, God doesn't have a sense of humor.' Yes, He does. God has a great sense of humor.
Author: Si Robertson

Quote: I have been insane on the subject of moneymaking all my life.
Author: Cornelius Vanderbilt

Quote: A dog is the only thing on earth that loves you more than you love yourself.
Author: Josh Billings

Quote: Art is making something out of nothing and selling it.
Author: Frank Zappa

Quote: Success or failure depends more upon attitude than upon capacity successful men act as though they have accomplished or are enjoying something. Soon it becomes a reality. Act, look, feel successful, conduct yourself accordingly, and you will be amazed at the positive results.
Author: William James

Quote: I'm not the kind of person who likes to shout out my personal issues from the rooftops, but with my bipolar becoming public, I hope fellow sufferers will know it's completely controllable. I hope I can help remove any stigma attached to it, and that those who don't have it under control will seek help with all that is available to treat it.
Author: Catherine Zeta-Jones

Quote: I don't have a disregard for my reader in humor pieces.
Author: Ian Frazier

Quote: I get very little sleep. But I try to stay constantly busy. My fear is that if I stop working I'll, like, die. So throughout my life I've always tried to remain busy, and I sort of know no other way. I think if my heart rate slowed it would affect my constitution, strangely. I've been trained to do that.
Author: Matthew Gray Gubler

Quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: Art, like morality, consists in drawing the line somewhere.
Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

Quote: I have learned that success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has had to overcome while trying to succeed.
Author: Booker T. Washington

Quote: There is no reason why challenging themes and engaging stories have to be mutually exclusive - in fact, each can fuel the other. As a filmmaker, I want to entertain people first and foremost. If out of that comes a greater awareness and understanding of a time or a circumstance, then the hope is that change can happen.
Author: Edward Zwick

Quote: The only way I could get comfortable around people was to make them laugh. I was an obedient girl, and humor was my one form of rebellion. I used comedy to deflect. Like, 'Hey, check out my zit!' - you know, making fun of yourself before someone else has a chance to.
Author: Tina Fey

Quote: Who will tell whether one happy moment of love or the joy of breathing or walking on a bright morning and smelling the fresh air, is not worth all the suffering and effort which life implies.
Author: Erich Fromm

Quote: Black as the devil, hot as hell, pure as an angel, sweet as love.
Author: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand

Quote: Life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one.
Author: Stella Adler

Quote: Maybe our favorite quotations say more about us than about the stories and people we're quoting.
Author: John Green

Quote: I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Failure is not an option. Everyone has to succeed.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: To me, one of the best faces America has ever projected is the face of a Peace Corps volunteer. That face symbolizes this country: young, curious, brimming with idealism and hope - and a real, honest compassion.
Author: Teresa Heinz

Quote: Bathroom humor, fart, and poo poo humor in movies gets a laugh. It's a pretty easy audience, and that's been around for ages.
Author: Selma Blair

Quote: Life's like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Art is the concrete representation of our most subtle feelings.
Author: Agnes Martin

Quote: We loved with a love that was more than love.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: If you wish to succeed in life, make perseverance your bosom friend, experience your wise counselor, caution your elder brother, and hope your guardian genius.
Author: Joseph Addison

Quote: Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.
Author: Joseph Conrad

Quote: He was just trying to tease me - I knew that later - but he said he'd have to leave because it wasn't fair to have anyone in the room who was going to make fun of what he had to say. He had a good sense of humor, really.
Author: Fay Wray

Quote: Life is growth. If we stop growing, technically and spiritually, we are as good as dead.
Author: Morihei Ueshiba

Quote: I do not want art for a few any more than education for a few, or freedom for a few.
Author: William Morris

Quote: For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: There is no success without hardship.
Author: Sophocles

Quote: Yesterday I was a dog. Today I'm a dog. Tomorrow I'll probably still be a dog. Sigh! There's so little hope for advancement.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: I got my sense of humor from my grandmother. You know, my grandmother was very funny.
Author: Paul Mooney

Quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we have planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
Author: E. M. Forster

Quote: Summer is a great time to visit art museums, which offer the refreshing rinse of swimming pools - only instead of cool water, you immerse yourself in art.
Author: Jerry Saltz

Quote: Man must evolve for all human conflict a method which rejects revenge, aggression and retaliation. The foundation of such a method is love.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
Author: Christopher Morley

Quote: The secret is not to give up hope. It's very hard not to because if you're really doing something worthwhile I think you will be pushed to the brink of hopelessness before you come through the other side.
Author: George Lucas

Quote: Humor, for me, is really a gate of departure. It's a way of enticing a reader into a poem so that less funny things can take place later. It really is not an end in itself, but a means to an end.
Author: Billy Collins

Quote: There is a very fine line between loving life and being greedy for it.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Without tradition, art is a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Without innovation, it is a corpse.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: A woman knows the face of the man she loves as a sailor knows the open sea.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi,  All Men are Brothers: Autobiographical Reflections

Quote: If you have no critics you'll likely have no success.
Author: Malcolm X

Quote: The essence of optimism is that it takes no account of the present, but it is a source of inspiration, of vitality and hope where others have resigned; it enables a man to hold his head high, to claim the future for himself and not to abandon it to his enemy.
Author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

Quote: I'm lucky that my real-life Mom has both a great sense of humor about herself and an amazing ability to slip into complete denial if the subject matter gets a little too close to home.
Author: Cathy Guisewite

Quote: Nearly all the best things that came to me in life have been unexpected, unplanned by me.
Author: Carl Sandburg

Quote: Affection is responsible for nine-tenths of whatever solid and durable happiness there is in our lives.
Author: C. S. Lewis

Quote: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: It takes ten times as long to put yourself back together as it does to fall apart.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay

Quote: Success is not forever and failure isn't fatal.
Author: Don Shula

Quote: People don't believe or understand that a community can lose hope. You can have a whole community where hopelessness is the norm, where folks don't have faith that things will get better because history and circumstances have proven over 30, 40, or 50 years that things don't get better.
Author: Geoffrey Canada

Quote: When people are in the midst of really heavy stuff and still have a sense of humor, I admire that.
Author: Ted Danson

Quote: I did not direct my life. I didn't design it. I never made decisions. Things always came up and made them for me. That's what life is.
Author: B. F. Skinner

Quote: Art has to move you and design does not, unless it's a good design for a bus.
Author: David Hockney

Quote: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quote: Peace begins with a smile..
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: God lets you be successful because he trusts you that you will do the right thing with it. Now, does he get disappointed often? All the time, because people get there and they forget how they got it.
Author: Steve Harvey

Quote: I totally disagree with the view that the Tibet struggle will die, and there will be no hope for Tibet, after the Dalai Lama passes away.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: You learn timing on the road. You learn structure and how to read an audience. You learn so much about the business of laughter that you can't learn on a set, because it's all on you. Sometimes you bomb, and you know not to tell that joke again... You just hope people find the humor in the awkwardness.
Author: Marlon Wayans

Quote: Life is a horizontal fall.
Author: Jean Cocteau

Quote: What art offers is space - a certain breathing room for the spirit.
Author: John Updike

Quote: Lord, grant that I might not so much seek to be loved as to love.
Author: Francis of Assisi

Quote: You are, and always have been, my dream.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook

Quote: Success is not a good teacher, failure makes you humble.
Author: Shah Rukh Khan

Quote: As people, we're generally optimistic, no matter how disabled our lives are, and we find the humor in the darkest situations.
Author: John Wells

Quote: Any idiot can face a crisis - it's day to day living that wears you out.
Author: Anton Chekhov

Quote: All art is autobiographical. The pearl is the oyster's autobiography.
Author: Federico Fellini

Quote: At the center of non-violence stands the principle of love.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: The five essential entrepreneurial skills for success: Concentration, Discrimination, Organization, Innovation and Communication.
Author: Harold S. Geneen

Quote: If a man like Malcolm X could change and repudiate racism, if I myself and other former Muslims can change, if young whites can change, then there is hope for America.
Author: Eldridge Cleaver

Quote: One of my pet peeves is that sometimes the talents of my band get overlooked because, and it was the same problem that Frank Zappa had, with a lot of groups that use humor, people don't realize there's a lot of craft behind the comedy.
Author: Al Yankovic

Quote: I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day.
Author: E. B. White

Quote: Art requires philosophy, just as philosophy requires art. Otherwise, what would become of beauty?
Author: Paul Gauguin

Quote: Love has no age, no limit; and no death.
Author: John Galsworthy

Quote: I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring

Quote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: Winning isn't everything, but it beats anything in second place.
Author: William C. Bryant

Quote: Hope is necessary in every condition. The miseries of poverty, sickness and captivity would, without this comfort, be insupportable.
Author: William Samuel Johnson

Quote: People, I guess, generally come to see me do stand-up with a working knowledge of my broad sense of humor on 'The Daily Show'... I don't think anyone would mistake me as an actual anchor.
Author: John Oliver

Quote: Maybe all one can do is hope to end up with the right regrets.
Author: Arthur Miller

Quote: Without art, the crudeness of reality would make the world unbearable.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: A part of kindness consists in loving people more than they deserve.
Author: Joseph Joubert

Quote: If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: I hope that I inspire women to believe in themselves, no matter where they come from; no matter what education they have; what particular background they originate from.
Author: Madonna Ciccone

Quote: We get the worrywart, the hypochondriac, the money-grubbing miser, the intractable negotiator... Some would say certain of these refer to the stereotypical, or 'stage' Jew. But objectively speaking, the only crime in humor is an unfunny joke.
Author: Alan King

Quote: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: Love is the joy of the good, the wonder of the wise, the amazement of the Gods.
Author: Plato

Quote: You are my best friend as well as my lover, and I do not know which side of you I enjoy the most. I treasure each side, just as I have treasured our life together.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook

Quote: We love the things we love for what they are.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: The secret of my success is a two word answer: Know people.
Author: Harvey S. Firestone

Quote: It's true that General Musharraf opposes my return, seeing me as a symbol of democracy in the country. He is comfortable with dictatorship. I hope better sense prevails.
Author: Benazir Bhutto

Quote: I'm actually a perpetual 13-year-old. I've never advanced beyond 13. Every day, tomorrow is my 14th birthday. That's my kind of humor.
Author: Terry Crews

Quote: Not life, but good life, is to be chiefly valued.
Author: Socrates

Quote: I don't want to be interesting. I want to be good.
Author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

Quote: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
Author: Emily Bronte

Quote: Let me tell you this: if you meet a loner, no matter what they tell you, it's not because they enjoy solitude. It's because they have tried to blend into the world before, and people continue to disappoint them.
Author: Jodi Picoult,  My Sister's Keeper

Quote: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

Quote: There is little success where there is little laughter.
Author: Andrew Carnegie

Quote: The sparrow that is twittering on the edge of my balcony is calling up to me this moment a world of memories that reach over half my lifetime, and a world of hope that stretches farther than any flight of sparrows.
Author: Donald G. Mitchell

Quote: I like very dry humor. I don't like things that are over the top. I like subtlety. I like things that are nonchalant. I like characters that are sort of monotone and based in dark comedy.
Author: Emily Rios

Quote: The greatest pleasure of life is love.
Author: Euripides

Quote: It is not in life, but in art that self-fulfillment is to be found.
Author: Wilson Mizner

Quote: As the Father has loved me, so have I loved you.
Author: Jesus Christ

Quote: Success comes to a writer as a rule, so gradually that it is always something of a shock to him to look back and realize the heights to which he has climbed.
Author: P. G. Wodehouse

Quote: God gives me hope that there is something greater than us, something better and bigger than the here and now, that can help us live.
Author: Mattie Stepanek

Quote: I love Sell Out, I think it's great. I love the jingles. The whole thing as an album is a wonderful piece of work. The cover. Everything about it. It's got humor, great songs, irony.
Author: Roger Daltrey

Quote: Let life happen to you. Believe me: life is in the right, always.
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: Love has no errors, for all errors are the want for love.
Author: William Law

Quote: I think of art, at its most significant, as a DEW line, a Distant Early Warning system that can always be relied on to tell the old culture what is beginning to happen to it.
Author: Marshall McLuhan

Quote: Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love.
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Letters to a Young Poet

Quote: Imagining the future is a kind of nostalgia. (...) You spend your whole life stuck in the labyrinth, thinking about how you'll escape it one day, and how awesome it will be, and imagining that future keeps you going, but you never do it. You just use the future to escape the present.
Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

Quote: I don't measure my success anymore by the Grammys. I can't because I'll just end up crushed.
Author: Drake

Quote: Hope and Change has become Divide and Conquer.
Author: Marco Rubio

Quote: Stephen King has inspired me with his humor and honesty, and his admonition that the author's job is to tell the truth.
Author: Barry Eisler

Quote: For the happiest life, days should be rigorously planned, nights left open to chance.
Author: Mignon McLaughlin

Quote: Be of love a little more careful than of anything.
Author: e. e. cummings

Quote: If you go back to the Greeks and Romans, they talk about all three - wine, food, and art - as a way of enhancing life.
Author: Robert Mondavi

Quote: Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

Quote: Apple Computer would not have reached its current peak of success if it had feared to roll the dice and launch products that didn't always hit the mark. In the mid-1990s, the company was considered washed up, Steve Jobs had departed, and a string of lackluster product launches unrelated to the company's core business.
Author: Naveen Jain

Quote: There is a part of me that still wants to go out and grab a backpack and unplug - not take a cellphone or even a camera and just get out there and experience the world and travel. I have yet to do that, but someday I hope.
Author: Emilio Estevez

Quote: Our ability to find humor in the world, to make connections between previously unconnected notions, to create new ideas, to share in a common culture: All these essentially human acts depend on memory.
Author: Joshua Foer

Quote: The art of war is of vital importance to the state. It is a matter of life and death, a road either to safety or to ruin. Hence it is a subject of inquiry which can on no account be neglected.
Author: Sun Tzu

Quote: Work/life benefits allow companies meaningful ways for responding to their employees' needs; they can be a powerful tool for transforming a workforce and driving a business' success.
Author: Anne M. Mulcahy

Quote: I think you grow wherever God plants you. I hope I'm growing as a person of faith, as a Christian. That should be our number one objective this journey of life. That all starts with a personal intimate relationship with Christ and then being in prayer every single day about all of those things - being tenacious about it.
Author: J. C. Watts

Quote: Next to power without honor, the most dangerous thing in the world is power without humor.
Author: Eric Sevareid

Quote: Life is a lively process of becoming.
Author: Douglas MacArthur

Quote: Love is always bestowed as a gift - freely, willingly and without expectation. We don't love to be loved; we love to love.
Author: Leo Buscaglia

Quote: There is no philosophy without the art of ignoring objections.
Author: Joseph de Maistre

Quote: Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness. Armour yourself in it, and it will never be used to hurt you.
Author: George R.R. Martin,  A Game of Thrones

Quote: Our safety at home and the cause of freedom abroad is largely contingent upon our success in Iraq.
Author: Ron Lewis

Quote: The great hope of society is in individual character.
Author: William Ellery Channing

Quote: If golf wasn't enjoyable and there wasn't a lot of humor and enjoyment, even though the game is so frustrating, you would wonder why you put yourself through it.
Author: Ray Romano

Quote: Love is a game that two can play and both win.
Author: Eva Gabor

Quote: Geometry is moribund. I want a lilt and joy to art.
Author: Ellsworth Kelly

Quote: Men judge us by the success of our efforts. God looks at the efforts themselves.
Author: Charlotte Bronte

Quote: I hope that by modeling feminism in my own life, work and relationships that it will haut become an organic part of my daughter's life. But I'm also fully prepared for her to become a Republican as a way to rebel as a teenager - that would be just my luck!
Author: Jessica Valenti

Quote: Everybody in my family had a real sick, twisted sense of humor. Most of the jokes we make in our house, we would just never even dream of making anywhere else. Just sick, horrible stuff. That wasn't anything new to college.
Author: Seth MacFarlane

Quote: Life is made up of marble and mud.
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

Quote: True love cannot be found where it does not exist, nor can it be denied where it does.
Author: Torquato Tasso

Quote: The recognition of the art that informs all pure science need not mean the abandonment for it of all present art, rather it will mean the completion of the transformation of art that has already begun.
Author: John Desmond Bernal

Quote: Death ends a life, not a relationship.
Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie

Quote: I would die for you. But I won't live for you.
Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: There's a lot of blood, sweat, and guts between dreams and success.
Author: Paul Bryant

Quote: I hope that I'm always struggling, really. You develop when you're struggling. When you're struggling, you get stronger.
Author: Andrew Garfield

Quote: Whether it's viewers of the show or readers of my columns and books, I'm consistently impressed with their wit, humor and insight. That goes for about 95 percent of the audience. The other five percent are why the 'Delete' option and restraining orders were invented.
Author: Richard Roeper

Quote: Every man dies. Not every man really lives.
Author: William Wallace

Quote: As soon go kindle fire with snow, as seek to quench the fire of love with words.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: I dug up some old John Buscema 'Conan' comics. Man, when Alfredo Alcala was inking, that was some of the most beautiful black and white comic art ever published. The stories are good, too, though early '70s comics based on Conan is a festival of sexist, racist stereotypes.
Author: Ted Naifeh

Quote: In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you.
Author: Jane Austen,  Pride And Prejudice

Quote: Success is different for everyone; everybody defines it in their own way, and that's part of what we do in 'Close Up', finding what it was each person wanted to achieve and what their willingness to sacrifice for that was.
Author: William Shatner

Quote: I do feel strongly that string theory is our best hope for making progress at unifying gravity and quantum mechanics.
Author: Brian Greene

Quote: I think sometimes my humor is extremely dry, and a lot of times I would say things that I thought were very funny but... I have a reputation of - people think of me as a very fundamentalist, humorless fellow.
Author: Ian MacKaye

Quote: I decided, very early on, just to accept life unconditionally; I never expected it to do anything special for me, yet I seemed to accomplish far more than I had ever hoped. Most of the time it just happened to me without my ever seeking it.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: Love is the greatest gift that God has given us. It's free.
Author: Taraji P. Henson

Quote: I think art is the only thing that's spiritual in the world. And I refuse to forced to believe in other people's interpretations of God. I don't think anybody should be. No one person can own the copyright to what God means.
Author: Marilyn Manson

Quote: Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Sandman, Vol. 6: Fables and Reflections

Quote: I believe success is preparation, because opportunity is going to knock on your door sooner or later but are you prepared to answer that?
Author: Omar Epps

Quote: Religion kept some of my relatives alive, because it was all they had. If they hadn't had some hope of heaven, some companionship in Jesus, they probably would have committed suicide, their lives were so hellish.
Author: Octavia Butler

Quote: I'm a pretty tenacious person; I get that from my mom. So sometimes, I use dark humor. I can't take myself too seriously.
Author: Art Alexakis

Quote: When I hear somebody sigh, 'Life is hard,' I am always tempted to ask, 'Compared to what?'
Author: Sydney J. Harris

Quote: A kiss is a rosy dot over the 'i' of loving.
Author: Cyrano de Bergerac

Quote: For thousands of years, human beings have been obsessed with beauty, truth, love, honor, altruism, courage, social relationships, art, and God. They all go together as subjective experiences, and it's a straw man to set God up as the delusion. If he is, then so is truth itself or beauty itself.
Author: Deepak Chopra

Quote: When it comes down to it, I let them think what they want. If they care enough to bother with what I do, then I'm already better than them.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Happy Hunger Games! And may the odds be ever in your favor.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  The Hunger Games

Quote: As an outside; don't worry about failure, because failure will take care of itself. Focus on success.
Author: Henry Cavill

Quote: Together we will build an America where hope is a new job with a paycheck, not a faded word on an old bumper sticker.
Author: Mitt Romney

Quote: A farce, or slapstick humor, does well universally.
Author: John Ratzenberger

Quote: Life becomes harder for us when we live for others, but it also becomes richer and happier.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
Author: James A. Baldwin

Quote: When we look back at the Mayans or ancient Egypt, we look at their art.
Author: Robert Wilson

Quote: Don't think or judge, just listen.
Author: Sarah Dessen,  Just Listen

Quote: Promise me you'll always remember: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: Past performance speaks a tremendous amount about one's ability and likelihood for success.
Author: Mark Spitz

Quote: Like all of us in this storm between birth and death, I can wreak no great changes on the world, only small changes for the better, I hope, in the lives of those I love.
Author: Dean Koontz

Quote: The humor is essentially dark for a cartoon and sophisticated. But at the same time, being a cartoon gives the writers more freedom than in a normal sitcom. It always pushes the line that, despite human failings, the Simpsons are really decent people.
Author: Dan Castellaneta

Quote: As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well spent brings happy death.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: Love is a hole in the heart.
Author: Ben Hecht

Quote: Serious art has been the work of individual artists whose art has had nothing to do with style because they were not in the least connected with the style or the needs of the masses. Their work arose rather in defiance of their times.
Author: Franz Marc

Quote: Wit beyond measure is a man's greatest treasure.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Quote: We came to see Jace. Is he alright?""I don't know,"Magnus said. "Does he normally just lie on the floor like that without moving?
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

Quote: I passionately believe that's it's not just what you say that counts, it's also how you say it - that the success of your argument critically depends on your manner of presenting it.
Author: Alain de Botton

Quote: We must not lose hope. Hope is an anchor to the souls of men. Satan would have us cast away that anchor.
Author: Ezra Taft Benson

Quote: I have this idyllic love life, but my mind just won't accept that. I would like to bring a new guy home every night. I try to make humor out of that situation.
Author: Jen Kirkman

Quote: Why should we think upon things that are lovely? Because thinking determines life. It is a common habit to blame life upon the environment. Environment modifies life but does not govern life. The soul is stronger than its surroundings.
Author: William James

Quote: I don't know that love changes. People change. Circumstances change.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: To so enter into it in nature and art that the enjoyed meanings of life may become a part of living is the attitude of aesthetic appreciation.
Author: George Herbert Mead

Quote: An investment said to have an 80% chance of success sounds far more attractive than one with a 20% chance of failure. The mind can't easily recognize that they are the same.
Author: Daniel Kahneman

Quote: We need international support so that our people live a life of normality, of dignity, of liberty and freedom. I hope that our cry for freedom may be heard.
Author: Mahmoud Abbas

Quote: I think in life, the sense of humor and comedy always exists.
Author: Mike Epps

Quote: Your ordinary acts of love and hope point to the extraordinary promise that every human life is of inestimable value.
Author: Desmond Tutu

Quote: I am happier when I love than when I am loved. I adore my husband, my son, my grandchildren, my mother, my dog, and frankly, I don't know if they even like me. But who cares? Loving them is my joy.
Author: Isabel Allende

Quote: Modesty: the gentle art of enhancing your charm by pretending not to be aware of it.
Author: Oliver Herford

Quote: With great power... comes great need to take a nap. Wake me up later.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Last Olympian

Quote: Maintaining spirituality and humanism are the keys to success. It's a balance.
Author: Bikram Choudhury

Quote: A lot of presidential memoirs, they say, are dull and self-serving. I hope mine is interesting and self-serving.
Author: William J. Clinton

Quote: It's great to be able to connect parents with children both emotionally and through humor. I look forward to exploring family entertainment once again and examining the specifics of our day-to-day lives against the backdrop of an extraordinary adventure.
Author: Jon Favreau

Quote: There is no short cut to achievement. Life requires thorough preparation - veneer isn't worth anything.
Author: George Washington Carver

Quote: I think music is the greatest art form that exists, and I think people listen to music for different reasons, and it serves different purposes. Some of it is background music, and some of it is things that might affect a person's day, if not their life, or change an attitude. The best songs are the ones that make you feel something.
Author: Eddie Vedder

Quote: Nowadays love is a matter of chance, matrimony a matter of money and divorce a matter of course.
Author: Helen Rowland

Quote: You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: Success is always something completely different to people. I feel like I've succeeded, if I'm doing something that makes me happy and I'm not lying to anybody.
Author: Kristen Stewart

Quote: Without hope we are lost.
Author: Mahmoud Darwish

Quote: The real important things are kindness and a sense of humor. I've been fortunate to have dated and could have easily married women who have those qualities, and time and circumstances didn't work out. Timing plays a big part.
Author: Hill Harper

Quote: Reading is a basic tool in the living of a good life.
Author: Joseph Addison

Quote: Listen to your inner-voice: Surround yourself with loving, nurturing people. Fall in love with your art and find yourself. Music is the great communicator.
Author: Glenn Hughes

Quote: My life path has been a blessing and a great learning experience. Skateboarding is my passion and I don't see that changing. When I'm not skating, I love to surf. I'm open to the new experiences and opportunities.
Author: Ryan Sheckler

Quote: May your coming year be filled with magic and dreams and good madness. I hope you read some fine books and kiss someone who thinks you're wonderful, and don't forget to make some art -- write or draw or build or sing or live as only you can. And I hope, somewhere in the next year, you surprise yourself.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: I love you. I am who I am because of you. You are every reason, every hope, and every dream I've ever had, and no matter what happens to us in the future, everyday we are together is the greatest day of my life. I will always be yours.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook

Quote: Success is measured by your discipline and inner peace.
Author: Mike Ditka

Quote: What thoughts are to the individual, art is to the community as a whole. That's where you reflect on who you are, who you hope to be, what you've gone through, and where you hope to go.
Author: Wendell Pierce

Quote: That is the saving grace of humor, if you fail no one is laughing at you.
Author: A. Whitney Brown

Quote: When one realizes that his life is worthless he either commits suicide or travels.
Author: Edward Dahlberg

Quote: I'm a people person, very approachable. I go out every night, tons of functions. I love all facets of this industry... Music, film, TV, books, art. I love being around creative people.
Author: Guy Oseary

Quote: The one thing I don't consume during 'Today' - which surprises many people - is coffee. I find that a lot of water helps wake me up, without the buzz. I love coffee, but usually reserve a double espresso as an afternoon pick-me-up before settling in to do the weekend 'Nightly News.'
Author: Lester Holt

Quote: Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: When you're around enormously successful people you realise their success isn't an accident - it's about work.
Author: Ryan Tedder

Quote: I hope somebody falls in love with me - other than my fiancee. But that's what you want. As a player you want a team that really wants you; head coach, GM, owner, everybody that really wants you in their place and the players believe in you. I'm looking forward to making somebody fall in love with me.
Author: Robert Griffin III

Quote: I really hate sitcoms on television with canned laughter and stuff. What really makes me laugh is the real-life stuff. I've got a dry sense of humor.
Author: Katie Price

Quote: Life is like a landscape. You live in the midst of it but can describe it only from the vantage point of distance.
Author: Charles Lindbergh

Quote: The art of life is to live in the present moment, and to make that moment as perfect as we can by the realization that we are the instruments and expression of God Himself.
Author: Emmet Fox

Quote: I love a vintage look that's also a bit rock n' roll.
Author: Cara Delevingne

Quote: He can run faster than Severus Snape confronted with shampoo.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: It takes 20 years to make an overnight success.
Author: Eddie Cantor

Quote: Even in the hardest circumstances, dreams can give you the courage to live, and I hope I can share that message with children in need.
Author: Kim Yuna

Quote: When I was young, my favorite picture book was 'Fletcher and Zenobia,' written by Edward Gorey and illustrated by Victoria Chess. It's long out of print now, but its mix of macabre humor and 1960s psychedelia made it a perfect children's book for the times.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Never die easy. Why run out of bounds and die easy? Make that linebacker pay. It carries into all facets of your life. It's okay to lose, to die, but don't die without trying, without giving it your best.
Author: Walter Payton

Quote: Even in modern art, artists have used methods based on calculation, inasmuch as these elements, alongside those of a more personal and emotional nature, give balance and harmony to any work of art.
Author: Max Bill

Quote: Wine comes in at the mouth And love comes in at the eye; That's all we shall know for truth Before we grow old and die.
Author: William Butler Yeats

Quote: If ever there is tomorrow when we're not together... there is something you must always remember. You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think. But the most important thing is, even if we're apart... I'll always be with you.
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: The line between failure and success is so fine that we scarcely know when we pass it: so fine that we are often on the line and do not know it.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: Friends from the press, China needs to learn more about the world, and the world also needs to learn more about China. I hope you will continue to make more efforts and contributions to deepening the mutual understanding between China and the countries of the world.
Author: Xi Jinping

Quote: My wife has a good sense of humor, and instead of calling me psychic with my novels, she simply refers to me as being 'psycho.' That's because multiple things in my books have come true.
Author: Brad Thor

Quote: Life has evolved to thrive in environments that are extreme only by our limited human standards: in the boiling battery acid of Yellowstone hot springs, in the cracks of permanent ice sheets, in the cooling waters of nuclear reactors, miles beneath the Earth's crust, in pure salt crystals, and inside the rocks of the dry valleys of Antarctica.
Author: Jill Tarter

Quote: Great art speaks a language which every intelligent person can understand. The people who call themselves modernists today speak a different language.
Author: Marshall McLuhan

Quote: If a person loves only one other person and is indifferent to all others, his love is not love but a symbiotic attachment, or an enlarged egotism.
Author: Erich Fromm

Quote: Grief does not change you, Hazel. It reveals you.
Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

Quote: Don't touch any of my weapons without my permission.""Well, there goes my plan for selling them all on eBay,"Clary muttered."Selling them on what?"Clary smiled blandly at him. "A mythical place of great magical power.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

Quote: The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: If you carefully consider what you want to be said of you in the funeral experience, you will find your definition of success.
Author: Stephen Covey

Quote: Hope lies in having more faith in the power of God to heal us than in the power of anything to hurt or destroy us. In realizing that as children of God we are bigger than our problems, we have the power at last to confront them.
Author: Marianne Williamson

Quote: I'll do humor about myself, I'll poke fun and everything, but that's me and I can do it to me. I think it's cruel to do it to somebody else.
Author: Delta Burke

Quote: There is something terribly morbid in the modern sympathy with pain. One should sympathise with the colour, the beauty, the joy of life. The less said about life's sores the better.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: The momentous thing in human life is the art of winning the soul to good or evil.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quote: I think relationships are work, but love is a gift.
Author: Anne Hathaway

Quote: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Quote: I remember one day sitting at the pool and suddenly the tears were streaming down my cheeks. Why was I so unhappy? I had success. I had security. But it wasn't enough. I was exploding inside.
Author: Ingrid Bergman

Quote: I'm going to sit back, light up, and hope I don't chew the cigarette to pieces.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: I've never met a person who has more integrity than my husband. I respect that. There's his humor and intelligence, too, and he's really cute, all those things - but if you don't respect your partner, you'll get sick of him.
Author: Michelle Pfeiffer

Quote: I remember a specific moment, watching my grandmother hang the clothes on the line, and her saying to me, 'you are going to have to learn to do this,' and me being in that space of awareness and knowing that my life would not be the same as my grandmother's life.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: Through art, you create your own world.
Author: Daphne Guinness

Quote: Lot's wife, of course, was told not to look back where all those people and their homes had been. But she did look back, and I love her for that, because it was so human.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: When we love, we always strive to become better than we are. When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better too.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

Quote: You may lose your wife, you may lose your dog, your mother may hate you. None of those things matter. What matters is that you achieve success and become free. Then you can do whatever you like.
Author: Kevin O'Leary

Quote: Our hope in life beyond death is a hope made possible, not by some general sentimental belief in life after death, but by our participation in the life of Christ.
Author: Stanley Hauerwas

Quote: There's something about Southern women that is so unique yet so universal. Strong southern women are allowed to be soft and feminine and have a sense of humor. But what I love about Southern women in particular is their universality.
Author: Connie Britton

Quote: In education, technology can be a life-changer, a game changer, for kids who are both in school and out of school. Technology can bring textbooks to life. The Internet can connect students to their peers in other parts of the world. It can bridge the quality gaps.
Author: Queen Rania of Jordan

Quote: Every mind which has given itself to self-expression in art is aware of a directing agency outside its conscious control which it has agreed to label 'inspiration'.
Author: Norman Lindsay

Quote: It is in the thirties that we want friends. In the forties we know they won't save us any more than love did.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: You cannot find peace by avoiding life.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Perhaps one did not want to be loved so much as to be understood.
Author: George Orwell,  1984

Quote: Taxation is the price we pay for failing to build a civilized society. The higher the tax level, the greater the failure. A centrally planned totalitarian state represents a complete defeat for the civilized world, while a totally voluntary society represents its ultimate success.
Author: Mark Skousen

Quote: Hope, the best comfort of our imperfect condition.
Author: Edward Gibbon

Quote: My stories are very somber, so I think I need the comic ingredient. Besides, life has so much humor.
Author: Manuel Puig

Quote: Being a survivor doesn't mean being strong - it's telling people when you need a meal or a ride, company, whatever. It's paying attention to heart wisdom, feelings, not living a role, but having a unique, authentic life, having something to contribute, finding time to love and laugh. All these things are qualities of survivors.
Author: Bernie Siegel

Quote: There is a lot that horses and art share in common. I have found that most horse people are art lovers, and vice versa.
Author: Alice Walton

Quote: I honestly, sincerely love what I do.
Author: Mary Hart

Quote: I've been surrounded by a lot of people who felt that external success would result in them feeling good about themselves. But it just seems extremely unfulfilling to me.
Author: Alanis Morissette

Quote: My hope is that we continue to nurture the places that we love, but that we also look outside our immediate worlds.
Author: Annie Leibovitz

Quote: Tony and I had a good on and off screen relationship, we are two very different people, but we did share a sense of humor, we now live in different parts of the world but when we find ourselves in the same place it is more or less as if there had been no years in between.
Author: Roger Moore

Quote: I'm just a regular person who believes life is simple, and I like a simple life.
Author: Manny Pacquiao

Quote: Art is not necessary at all. All that is necessary to make this world a better place to live in is to love - to love as Christ loved, as Buddha loved.
Author: Isadora Duncan

Quote: They are always saying God loves us. If that's love I'd rather have a bit of kindness.
Author: Graham Greene

Quote: When you're in jail, a good friend will be trying to bail you out. A best friend will be in the cell next to you saying, 'Damn, that was fun'.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: Chance is perhaps the pseudonym of God when he does not want to sign.
Author: Théophile Gautier

Quote: There's a fine line between genius and insanity. I have erased this line.
Author: Oscar Levant

Quote: When I look in the mirror, I see someone who's happy with how he looks, because I was never one of the handsome Hollywood people. And I've had success as I've gotten older, because I'm able to play characters. I no longer get the girl, but I get the part.
Author: Michael Caine

Quote: Why do people play the lottery, or why do people gamble, period? You know, it's with the hope of winning something more.
Author: Derek Kilmer

Quote: The thing about For Better or Worse is the only thing that made me an okay director for that is that I have a sense of humor, and it was supposed to be funny.
Author: Jason Alexander

Quote: It's in literature that true life can be found. It's under the mask of fiction that you can tell the truth.
Author: Gao Xingjian

Quote: When you think about Dada and the great moments in Modern Art, it's always the sense of when you're not sure that art is most likely to be occurring.
Author: Richard Phillips

Quote: Sometimes you're afraid to fall in love with a chick, but she sucks you in anyway.
Author: Sammy Hagar

Quote: So, I guess we are who we are for alot of reasons. And maybe we'll never know most of them. But even if we don't have the power to choose where we come from, we can still choose where we go from there. We can still do things. And we can try to feel okay about them.
Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: I had come to the point when I realized it was unlikely that my film career was going to move beyond a certain level of role. And I was - because I had graphic instances of it - handicapped by the success of Star Trek. A director would say, 'I don't want Jean-Luc Picard in my movie' - and this was compounded by X-Men as well.
Author: Patrick Stewart

Quote: Over the years, I had nurtured the hope to be able to fly; to handle a machine as it rose higher and higher in the stratosphere was my dearest dream.
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: I have a dark sense of humor.
Author: Olivia Munn

Quote: Everyone has their own different life experiences which make them who they are. No two people's life experiences are the same. And mine are just unique to me.
Author: Keshia Knight Pulliam

Quote: When art dresses in worn-out material it is most easily recognized as art.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: I went to a psychoanalyst. He explained things about my love life that I found very impressive... almost scary.
Author: Britney Spears

Quote: There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

Quote: I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end. Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it, without knowing what's going to happen next.Delicious Ambiguity.
Author: Gilda Radner

Quote: Two wrongs don't make a right, but they make a good excuse.
Author: Thomas Szasz

Quote: We all learn lessons in life. Some stick, some don't. I have always learned more from rejection and failure than from acceptance and success.
Author: Henry Rollins

Quote: Man's only true happiness is to live in hope of something to be won by him. Reverence something to be worshipped by him, and love something to be cherished by him, forever.
Author: John Ruskin

Quote: I read the script and decide if a particular character looks fun to play. I look for complexity and a sense of humor. Those are crucial, real things to life.
Author: Steve Buscemi

Quote: No one really wants to admit they are lonely, and it is never really addressed very much between friends and family. But I have felt lonely many times in my life.
Author: Bill Murray

Quote: People like to think of you as a certain person, or a certain type of person, and they do love to give you a label. We like luggage labels, and we like people labels.
Author: Clare Balding

Quote: Art is always and everywhere the secret confession, and at the same time the immortal movement of its time.
Author: Karl Marx

Quote: Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind.
Author: Virginia Woolf,  A Room of One's Own

Quote: Creativity is the key to success in the future, and primary education is where teachers can bring creativity in children at that level.
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: Few people know so clearly what they want. Most people can't even think what to hope for when they throw a penny in a fountain.
Author: Barbara Kingsolver

Quote: The comics that are just conversing with you up there and drawing on their own life, yeah, I guess so. I guess some do political humor, some do topical humor, but the ones that I like, the ones that are appealing to me, were guys who were just talking to you about their life.
Author: Ray Romano

Quote: I still have a Gypsy sense of adventure. I don't think I have slept in the same bed for more than three or four months my whole life. I am always planting vegetables that I never get to eat and flowers that I never see flower. I have always moved around the world.
Author: Helen Mirren

Quote: Love is not altogether a delirium, yet it has many points in common therewith.
Author: Thomas Carlyle

Quote: Parents are usually more careful to bestow knowledge on their children rather than virtue, the art of speaking well rather than doing well; but their manners should be of the greatest concern.
Author: R. Buckminster Fuller

Quote: You can't force love, I realized. It's there or it isn't. If it's not there, you've got to be able to admit it. If it is there, you've got to do whatever it takes to protect the ones you love.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Frostbite

Quote: Fear cannot be without hope nor hope without fear.
Author: Baruch Spinoza

Quote: To this day, I've found that it doesn't matter what a guy looks like if he's really funny. His sense of humor makes him attractive. On the other hand, you don't hear men saying, 'No she's not pretty, but is she ever funny!'
Author: Catherine O'Hara

Quote: I believe that a simple and unassuming manner of life is best for everyone, best both for the body and the mind.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I love going to the movie theatre, seeing live comedy, and going to amusement parks.
Author: Jennette McCurdy

Quote: Mathematics is the art of giving the same name to different things.
Author: Henri Poincare

Quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.
Author: Margaret Mead

Quote: Socialism has no moral justification whatsoever; poor people are not morally superior to rich people, nor are they owed anything by rich people simply because of their lack of success. Charity is not a socialist concept - it is a religious one, an acknowledgment of God's sovereignty over property, a sovereignty the Left utterly rejects.
Author: Ben Shapiro

Quote: I sincerely hope I can contribute to the progress there has been in relations between Jews and Catholics since the Second Vatican Council in a spirit of renewed collaboration.
Author: Pope Francis

Quote: I don't think my sense of humor has changed at all; I was born with this, for better or for worse.
Author: Ivan Reitman

Quote: The real test of friendship is: can you literally do nothing with the other person? Can you enjoy those moments of life that are utterly simple?
Author: Eugene Kennedy

Quote: I love mankind; it's people I can't stand.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: Art is accusation, expression, passion. Art is a fight to the finish between black charcoal and white paper.
Author: Gunter Grass

Quote: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will.
Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre

Quote: When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. That's relativity.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Every soldier must know, before he goes into battle, how the little battle he is to fight fits into the larger picture, and how the success of his fighting will influence the battle as a whole.
Author: Bernard Law Montgomery

Quote: Of the big horror movies of the '70s, you have 'The Omen,' 'The Sentinel,' 'Rosemary's Baby,' 'The Stepford Wives,' 'Burnt Offerings' - these are all romantic fatalist movies where there's a sort of glimmer of hope... but darkness wins.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Part of my humor is the fact that I love coming out of left field. I don't want people to expect what is going to happen next.
Author: Howie Mandel

Quote: Your outlook upon life, your estimate of yourself, your estimate of your value are largely colored by your environment. Your whole career will be modified, shaped, molded by your surroundings, by the character of the people with whom you come in contact every day.
Author: Orison Swett Marden

Quote: To put yourself in another's place requires real imagination, but by doing so each Girl Scout will be able to love among others happily.
Author: Juliette Gordon Low

Quote: It is a myth that art has to be sold. It is not like stocking a grocery store where people fill a pushcart. Art is a product that has no apparent need. The salesperson builds the need in the mind of the buyer.
Author: Jack White

Quote: The only thing worse than a boy who hates you: a boy that loves you.
Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

Quote: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  The Great Gatsby

Quote: Focused, hard work is the real key to success. Keep your eyes on the goal, and just keep taking the next step towards completing it. If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.
Author: John Carmack

Quote: I really feel like life will dictate itself. You should allow it to unfold as naturally as possible. Just go with the flow. When you're really desperate, you say a few prayers and hope for the best. That's the way I've always lived my life.
Author: Shania Twain

Quote: You probably found 'How to Survive a Robot Uprising' in the humor section. Let's just hope that is where it belongs.
Author: Daniel H. Wilson

Quote: When push comes to shove, it ain't the science that's going to lift you up - it's the belief, the spiritual side of life, that's going to lift you up, no matter what religion you are.
Author: Kirstie Alley

Quote: The elusive nature of love... it can be such a fleeting thing. You see it there and it's just fluttering and it's gone.
Author: Mick Jagger

Quote: There are so many awful things in this world, but I wanted readers to share with me the small, beautiful, enjoyable things. Things like cute clothes, beautiful art and pretty flowers; items that are overflowing with beauty. If you just become obsessed with your own problems, you miss these things. When you discover them, you become happy.
Author: Novala Takemoto

Quote: Failures, repeated failures, are finger posts on the road to achievement. One fails forward toward success.
Author: C. S. Lewis

Quote: All parents hope and pray that their children will make wise decisions. Children who are obedient and responsible bring to their parents unending pride and satisfaction.
Author: James E. Faust

Quote: Daddy was hilarious. He could take the most mundane event and tell it so that we all on the floor laughing. He trained me in the joys of humor.
Author: Karen DeCrow

Quote: Bitterness imprisons life; love releases it.
Author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

Quote: I like the idea of being warm and secure. That's what home should be. That you have a sense of warmth, security, love, and you love the things around you and surround yourself with beauty.
Author: Andre Leon Talley

Quote: Writing stopped being fun when I discovered the difference between good writing and bad and, even more terrifying, the difference between it and true art. And after that, the whip came down.
Author: Truman Capote

Quote: Well, don't expect us to be too impressed. We just saw Finnick Odair in his underwear.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay

Quote: Whatever you are, be a good one.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Success is a journey, not a destination. The doing is often more important than the outcome.
Author: Arthur Ashe

Quote: I had to stop going to auditions thinking, 'Oh, I hope they like me.' I had to go in thinking I was the answer to their problem.
Author: George Clooney

Quote: Cathy was the first widely syndicated humor strip created by a woman. The strip was pretty revolutionary at the time not only because it starred a female, but also because it was so emotionally honest about all the conflicting feelings many women had in 1976.
Author: Cathy Guisewite

Quote: I'm a big believer than a great bit is a great bit - if I go and see someone I love, like Robert Klein. I want to hear some classics and some new stuff. But a great stand-up bit takes a long time to really polish and perfect, and they're beautiful things when they're done.
Author: Jerry Seinfeld

Quote: Medicine is a science of uncertainty and an art of probability.
Author: William Osler

Quote: Everything you need for better future and success has already been written. And guess what? All you have to do is go to the library.
Author: Henri Frederic Amiel

Quote: I hope all you young girls see yourself up there... we were just like you.
Author: Mia Hamm

Quote: Humor can be an incredible lacerating and effective weapon. And that is the way I use it.
Author: Carl Hiaasen

Quote: No man is worth his salt who is not ready at all times to risk his well-being, to risk his body, to risk his life, in a great cause.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: I love Thanksgiving because it's a holiday that is centered around food and family, two things that are of utmost importance to me.
Author: Marcus Samuelsson

Quote: What other people may find in poetry or art museums, I find in the flight of a good drive.
Author: Arnold Palmer

Quote: Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Thief of Time

Quote: In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Success and failure are both part of life. Both are not permanent.
Author: Shah Rukh Khan

Quote: When you put something out there into the world, there's all these words you don't want to hear, that you hope people don't say. I don't like anything that starts with 're' - like retro, reinvent, recreate - I hate that. It's always like living in the past - copying, emulating.
Author: Jack White

Quote: Life itself is a quotation.
Author: Jorge Luis Borges

Quote: Loving someone liberates the lover as well as the beloved. And that kind of love comes with age.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: I did study the art of being a barber because I wanted to figure out what my routine would be. Do you start in the front or back? Top or bottom? Swivel the chair or walk around? What I did discover is there's no such thing as the perfect haircut!
Author: Sean Patrick Thomas

Quote: So, I love you because the entire universe conspired to help me find you.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

Quote: Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: I know of no single formula for success. But over the years I have observed that some attributes of leadership are universal and are often about finding ways of encouraging people to combine their efforts, their talents, their insights, their enthusiasm and their inspiration to work together.
Author: Queen Elizabeth II

Quote: I hope people remember me as a guy who brought magic to the people. You know, pushed the boundaries of wonder.
Author: David Blaine

Quote: If you can understand the humor in the drawing part you'll probably get the humor in the audio part.
Author: Eric San

Quote: In life, there is always that special person who shapes who you are, who helps to determine the person you become.
Author: Molly Ringwald

Quote: Americans, who make more of marrying for love than any other people, also break up more of their marriages, but the figure reflects not so much the failure of love as the determination of people not to live without it.
Author: Morton Hunt

Quote: Washington, D.C., has everything that Rome, Paris and London have in the way of great architecture - great power bases. Washington has obelisks and pyramids and underground tunnels and great art and a whole shadow world that we really don't see.
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: No student ever attains very eminent success by simply doing what is required of him: it is the amount and excellence of what is over and above the required, that determines the greatness of ultimate distinction.
Author: Charles Kendall Adams

Quote: I get asked to read new works a lot, in the hope that I will give a quotation and I will only give a 'puff' for a book I truly love.
Author: Peter James

Quote: I'm not an expert on the Malaysian sense of humor.
Author: Ben Stiller

Quote: My identity was a big issue when I was a teenager, and I had a lot of questions, like: 'Who am I?' 'Who do I belong to?' But when I was still quite young, I decided that belonging is a tough process in life, and I'd better say I belonged to myself and the world rather than belonging to one nationality or another.
Author: Hiam Abbass

Quote: I love Christopher Bailey and Burberry, Mulberry for bags, and Hudson for jeans.
Author: Cara Delevingne

Quote: Music is God's gift to man, the only art of Heaven given to earth, the only art of earth we take to Heaven.
Author: Walter Savage Landor

Quote: Success is often achieved by those who don't know that failure is inevitable.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quote: When we have lost everything, including hope, life becomes a disgrace, and death a duty.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I think what is important for things to be funny is if you the listener, or the reader, get a chance to supply the humor of it yourself.
Author: Ian Frazier

Quote: The hardest thing in life to learn is which bridge to cross and which to burn.
Author: David Russell

Quote: As far as love is concerned, possession, power, fusion and disenchantment are the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse.
Author: Zygmunt Bauman

Quote: He who would do good to another must do it in Minute Particulars: general Good is the plea of the scoundrel, hypocrite, and flatterer, for Art and Science cannot exist but in minutely organized Particulars.
Author: William Blake

Quote: We are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Quote: Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness.
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: The road to success is always under construction.
Author: Lily Tomlin

Quote: It's a good place when all you have is hope and not expectations.
Author: Danny Boyle

Quote: However, frat-boy humor is funny and it always will be.
Author: Craig Kilborn

Quote: I love sleep. My life has the tendency to fall apart when I'm awake, you know?
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: If you were to destroy the belief in immortality in mankind, not only love but every living force on which the continuation of all life in the world depended, would dry up at once.
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

Quote: Dying is an art, like everything else. I do it exceptionally well. I do it so it feels like hell. I do it so it feels real. I guess you could say I've a call.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: True leaders don't invest in buildings. Jesus never built a building. They invest in people. Why? Because success without a successor is failure. So your legacy should not be in buildings, programs, or projects; your legacy must be in people.
Author: Myles Munroe

Quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.
Author: Epicurus

Quote: But if you don't watch me, I will try and sneak in some humor. I see humor everywhere in life around me.
Author: Marion Ross

Quote: There are three ingredients in the good life: learning, earning and yearning.
Author: Christopher Morley

Quote: One mustn't ask apple trees for oranges, France for sun, women for love, life for happiness.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: A secondhand wardrobe hand clothes doesn't make one an artist. Neither do a hair-trigger temper, melancholic nature, propensity for tears, hating your parents, or HIV. I hate to say it - none of these make one an artist. They can help, but just as being gay doesn't make one witty... the only thing that makes one an artist is making art.
Author: David Rakoff

Quote: Death's got an Invisibility Cloak?"Harry interrupted again."So he can sneak up on people,"said Ron. "Sometimes he gets bored of running at them, flapping his arms and shrieking...
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Quote: I like the night. Without the dark, we'd never see the stars.
Author: Stephenie Meyer,  Twilight

Quote: Success in management requires learning as fast as the world is changing.
Author: Warren Bennis

Quote: One lives in the hope of becoming a memory.
Author: Antonio Porchia

Quote: If somebody is not on the same page with me humor wise, I can't give them that.
Author: Stephan Pastis

Quote: It's the game of life. Do I win or do I lose? One day they're gonna shut the game down. I gotta have as much fun and go around the board as many times as I can before it's my turn to leave.
Author: Tupac Shakur

Quote: If you don't like it, learn to love it!
Author: Ric Flair

Quote: It is the spectator, and not life, that art really mirrors.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: The first step toward success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself.
Author: Mark Caine

Quote: There is hope in dreams, imagination, and in the courage of those who wish to make those dreams a reality.
Author: Jonas Salk

Quote: In sitcoms, the women are so beautiful, understanding and well-bred. They have humor, but sort of display it with a twinkle of the eye and not a guffaw. But there's no juice in that for me.
Author: Bea Arthur

Quote: Life is too short to not have fun; we are only here for a short time compared to the sun and the moon and all that.
Author: Coolio

Quote: I have never denied my background or my culture. I have taught my child to embrace her Mexican heritage, to love my first language, Spanish, to learn about Mexican history, music, folk art, food, and even the Mexican candy I grew up with.
Author: Salma Hayek

Quote: It is the function of art to renew our perception. What we are familiar with we cease to see. The writer shakes up the familiar scene, and, as if by magic, we see a new meaning in it.
Author: Anais Nin

Quote: Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood.
Author: Oscar Wilde,  Lord Arthur Savile's Crime and Other Stories

Quote: You know the world is going crazy when the best rapper is a white guy, the best golfer is a black guy, the tallest guy in the NBA is Chinese, the Swiss hold the America's Cup, France is accusing the U.S. of arrogance, Germany doesn't want to go to war, and the three most powerful men in America are named "Bush", "Dick", and "Colin."Need I say more?
Author: Chris Rock

Quote: Finding good partners is the key to success in anything: in business, in marriage and, especially, in investing.
Author: Robert Kiyosaki

Quote: The capacity for hope is the most significant fact of life. It provides human beings with a sense of destination and the energy to get started.
Author: Norman Cousins

Quote: Athletes tend to have less of a sense of humor than most people. They are heroes to so many. That might be part of it.
Author: Jeff Ross

Quote: For the past 33 years, I have looked in the mirror every morning and asked myself: 'If today were the last day of my life, would I want to do what I am about to do today?' And whenever the answer has been 'No' for too many days in a row, I know I need to change something.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: God tells me that I need to provide for my family, discipline and teach my children, and love my wife as Christ loves the church. If I don't do that, I'm being unfaithful and sinful.
Author: Kevin DeYoung

Quote: In France, cooking is a serious art form and a national sport.
Author: Julia Child

Quote: Never memorize something that you can look up.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring

Quote: Make treating yourself a priority and always remember your life is happening now. Don't put off all your dreams and pleasures to another day. In any balanced personal definition of success there has to be a powerful element of living life in the present.
Author: Mireille Guiliano

Quote: Extreme hopes are born from extreme misery.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: It's odd how violence and humor so often go together, isn't it?
Author: Dan Simmons

Quote: Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.
Author: Ashley Smith

Quote: I still believe that love is the most powerful force in the world, even though I am yet to experience it fully.
Author: Rufus Wainwright

Quote: I believe the target of anything in life should be to do it so well that it becomes an art.
Author: Arsene Wenger

Quote: We all die. The goal isn't to live forever, the goal is to create something that will.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Diary

Quote: Success on any major scale requires you to accept responsibility... in the final analysis, the one quality that all successful people have... is the ability to take on responsibility.
Author: Michael Korda

Quote: A whole stack of memories never equal one little hope.
Author: Charles M. Schulz
