Quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
Author: John Muir

Quote: When you trip over love, it is easy to get up. But when you fall in love, it is impossible to stand again.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The only truth is music.
Author: Jack Kerouac

Quote: If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us.
Author: Hermann Hesse,  Demian: Die Geschichte von Emil Sinclairs Jugend

Quote: She discovered with great delight that one does not love one's children just because they are one's children but because of the friendship formed while raising them.
Author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

Quote: Even when we make mistakes, we hope others will love us in spite of our shortcomings - even if we don't deserve it.
Author: Joseph B. Wirthlin

Quote: Humor is the first of the gifts to perish in a foreign tongue.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Life is complex. You don't have any person who is nice from the beginning until the end. You don't always have the notion of redemption. The bad people don't always pay.
Author: Marjane Satrapi

Quote: Love is the best thing in the world, and the thing that lives the longest.
Author: Henry Van Dyke

Quote: I have nothing to hide in art. The initial force alone can bring anyone to the end he must attain.
Author: Paul Cezanne

Quote: I think you should be a child for as long as you can. I have been successful for 74 years being able to do that.
Author: Bob Newhart

Quote: Let the first act of every morning be to make the following resolve for the day:- I shall not fear anyone on Earth. - I shall fear only God. - I shall not bear ill will toward anyone. - I shall not submit to injustice from anyone. - I shall conquer untruth by truth. And in resisting untruth, I shall put up with all suffering.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: We need to talk. All of us About what we're going to do now.""I was going to watch Project Runway.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

Quote: It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere.
Author: Lois Lowry

Quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view.
Author: Edward Abbey

Quote: What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains.
Author: Tennessee Williams,  A Streetcar Named Desire

Quote: Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: the free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.
Author: Charles Bukowski,  Tales of Ordinary Madness

Quote: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: These violent delights have violent endsAnd in their triump die, like fire and powderWhich, as they kiss, consume
Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet

Quote: Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: Let everything happen to youBeauty and terrorJust keep goingNo feeling is final
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: True success, true happiness lies in freedom and fulfillment.
Author: Dada Vaswani

Quote: Sympathy constitutes friendship; but in love there is a sort of antipathy, or opposing passion. Each strives to be the other, and both together make up one whole.
Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Quote: For many people, myself included, the end of the world is happening all the time! It is a form of criticality that paradoxically gives us hope for change and improvement.
Author: Douglas Coupland

Quote: There is a Japanese proverb that literally goes 'Raise the sail with your stronger hand', meaning you must go after the opportunities that arise in life that you are best equipped to do.
Author: Soichiro Honda

Quote: The history of modern art is also the history of the progressive loss of art's audience. Art has increasingly become the concern of the artist and the bafflement of the public.
Author: Paul Gauguin

Quote: Is there no way out of the mind?
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: The only lies for which we are truly punished are those we tell ourselves.
Author: V.S. Naipaul,  In a Free State

Quote: Compassion is the basis of morality.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: A trap is only a trap if you don't know about it. If you know about it, it's a challenge.
Author: China Miéville,  King Rat

Quote: No one has ever become poor by giving.
Author: Anne Frank,  diary of Anne Frank: the play

Quote: The mouth is made for communication, and nothing is more articulate than a kiss.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  It Occurred to Me

Quote: There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  The Great Gatsby

Quote: those who escape hellhowevernever talk aboutitand nothing muchbothers themafterthat.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.
Author: Veronica Roth,  Divergent

Quote: I lived in books more than I lived anywhere else.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Ocean at the End of the Lane

Quote: Whatever obstacle comes your way, you gotta be prepared to jump over it! And I think that's what separates the legends from the regular artists. It's all in how you manage that success, and how you deal with the controversy when it actually comes.
Author: Akon

Quote: There is no friendship in trade.
Author: Cornelius Vanderbilt

Quote: Just as a mother finds pleasure in taking her little child on her lap, there to feed and caress him, in like manner our loving God shows His fondness for His beloved souls who have given themselves entirely to Him and have placed all their hope in His goodness.
Author: Alphonsus Liguori

Quote: I think being funny is not anyone's first choice.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: Every musician, their goal in life is to play music that people love, and I've accomplished my goal. I was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and left that chapter of my life and those people in the past. Good and bad, I've loved and am thankful for that chapter.
Author: Steven Adler

Quote: Fortune and love favor the brave.
Author: Ovid

Quote: A painting that is well composed is half finished.
Author: Pierre Bonnard

Quote: Well, she's not responding to my advances,"he observed more brightly than he felt, "so she must be dead.""Or she's a woman of good taste and sense.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel

Quote: I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: I could die for you. But I couldn't, and wouldn't, live for you.
Author: Ayn Rand,  The Fountainhead

Quote: The future depends on what you do today.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I pray because I can't help myself. I pray because I'm helpless. I pray because the need flows out of me all the time- waking and sleeping. It doesn't change God- it changes me.
Author: William Nicholson,  Shadowlands

Quote: Come sleep with me: We won't make Love,Love will make us.
Author: Julio Cortázar

Quote: If you liked being a teenager, there's something really wrong with you.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Why do people say "grow some balls"? Balls are weak and sensitive. If you wanna be tough, grow a vagina. Those things can take a pounding.
Author: Sheng Wang

Quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
Author: Walt Disney Company

Quote: Will rolled up his sleeves. "We'll probably have to knock down the door--""Or,"said Jem, reaching out and giving the knob a twist, "not."The door swung open onto a rectangle of darkness. "Now, that's simply laziness,"said Will.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel

Quote: I figured all your classes were stuff like Slaughter 101 and Beheading for Beginners."Jace flipped a page. "Very funny, Fray.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

Quote: There are much worse games to play.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay

Quote: The most important thing is being passionate about what you're doing and always give it your all. That is the key to success.
Author: Charlie White

Quote: So far as it depends on the course of this government, our relations of good will and friendship will be sedulously cultivated with all nations.
Author: John Tyler

Quote: Don't fall in love with your wit. Your cleverly turned phrase may not, as you hope, show off how much gray matter you have, especially if the phrase is at someone else's expense.
Author: Harvey Mackay

Quote: Impropriety is the soul of wit.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: I grew up when one of America's greatest black playwrights, August Wilson, was writing about life in Pittsburgh, but I never saw myself in any of his straight-male plays. And then I see 'Angels,' which was so honest and painful, and it had this black drag queen in it, Belize, with a big heart. I finally had a character to relate to.
Author: Billy Porter

Quote: The truth is that there is only one terminal dignity - love. And the story of a love is not important - what is important is that one is capable of love. It is perhaps the only glimpse we are permitted of eternity.
Author: Helen Hayes

Quote: The highest art is always the most religious, and the greatest artist is always a devout person.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: I wonder if the snow loves the trees and fields, that it kisses them so gently? And then it covers them up snug, you know, with a white quilt; and perhaps it says "Go to sleep, darlings, till the summer comes again.
Author: Lewis Carroll,  Alice's Adventures in Wonderland & Through the Looking-Glass

Quote: The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
Author: George Washington Burnap,  The Sphere and Duties of Woman: A Course of Lectures

Quote: For me, literacy means freedom. For the individual and for society.
Author: LeVar Burton

Quote: Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

Quote: The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.
Author: Rachel Carson

Quote: I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Return of the King

Quote: This is how you do it: you sit down at the keyboard and you put one word after another until its done. It's that easy, and that hard.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: Dreams come true. Without that possibility, nature would not incite us to have them.
Author: John Updike

Quote: I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; I lift my eyes and all is born again.
Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Bell Jar

Quote: Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, "It might have been.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking.
Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Anna Karenina

Quote: All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: So many people walk around with a meaningless life. They seem half-asleep, even when they're busy doing things they think are important. This is because they're chasing the wrong things. The way you get meaning into your life is to devote yourself to loving others, devote yourself to your community around you, and devote yourself to creating something that gives you purpose and meaning.
Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie

Quote: I am always saying "Glad to've met you"to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though.
Author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye

Quote: Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic.
Author: Laini Taylor,  Daughter of Smoke & Bone

Quote: We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Do no harm and leave the world a better place than you found it.
Author: Patricia Cornwell

Quote: I hope you're pleased with yourselves. We could all have been killed - or worse, expelled. Now if you don't mind, I'm going to bed.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

Quote: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.
Author: Judy Garland

Quote: It is easy to forget how full the world is of people, full to bursting, and each of them imaginable and consistently misimagined.
Author: John Green,  Paper Towns

Quote: So light a fire!"Harry choked. "Yes...of course...but there's no wood!"... "HAVE YOU GONE MAD!"Ron bellowed. "ARE YOU A WITCH OR NOT!
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

Quote: A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I'm not going to get somewhere and say, 'OK, I'm done.' Success is never final; I'll just keep on going. The same way as failure never being fatal. Just keep going. I'm going to the stars and then past them.
Author: Conor McGregor

Quote: People instantly assume you can't have a platonic friendship with someone of the opposite sex. I think this may be specific to L.A. - or America.
Author: Isabel Lucas

Quote: Hope is the struggle of the soul, breaking loose from what is perishable, and attesting her eternity.
Author: Herman Melville

Quote: Humor is by far the most significant activity of the human brain.
Author: Edward de Bono

Quote: People fear death even more than pain. It's strange that they fear death. Life hurts a lot more than death. At the point of death, the pain is over. Yeah, I guess it is a friend.
Author: Jim Morrison

Quote: Love is a mutual self-giving which ends in self-recovery.
Author: Fulton J. Sheen

Quote: Art is like a border of flowers along the course of civilization.
Author: Lincoln Steffens

Quote: I am going to take this bucket of water and pour it on the flames of hell, and then I am going to use this torch to burn down the gates of paradise so that people will not love God for want of heaven or fear of hell, but because He is God.
Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

Quote: We do not believe in ourselves until someone reveals that deep inside us something is valuable, worth listening to, worthy of our trust, sacred to our touch. Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight or any experience that reveals the human spirit.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: there are two types of people in the world: those who prefer to be sad among others, and those who prefer to be sad alone.
Author: Nicole Krauss,  The History of Love

Quote: To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.
Author: T.S. Eliot,  The Use of Poetry and the Use of Criticism

Quote: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quote: To survive, you must tell stories.
Author: Umberto Eco,  The Island of the Day Before

Quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Quote: Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war
Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

Quote: Our finger prints don't fade from the lives we touch.
Author: Judy Blume

Quote: When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.
Author: John Green,  Will Grayson, Will Grayson

Quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
Author: Edmund Burke

Quote: The single most important key to success is to be a good listener.
Author: Kelly Wearstler

Quote: To be capable of steady friendship or lasting love, are the two greatest proofs, not only of goodness of heart, but of strength of mind.
Author: William Hazlitt

Quote: We hope that, when the insects take over the world, they will remember with gratitude how we took them along on all our picnics.
Author: Bill Vaughan

Quote: The more I live, the more I think that humor is the saving sense.
Author: Jacob Riis

Quote: Despite my firm convictions, I have always been a man who tries to face facts, and to accept the reality of life as new experience and new knowledge unfolds. I have always kept an open mind, a flexibility that must go hand in hand with every form of the intelligent search for truth.
Author: Malcolm X

Quote: Love's greatest gift is its ability to make everything it touches sacred.
Author: Barbara de Angelis

Quote: Art distills sensations and embodies it with enhanced meaning.
Author: Miguel de Unamuno

Quote: I wonder how many people don't get the one they want, but end up with the one they're supposed to be with.
Author: Fannie Flagg,  Fried Green Tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe

Quote: Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: In life, finding a voice is speaking and living the truth. Each of you is an original. Each of you has a distinctive voice. When you find it, your story will be told. You will be heard.
Author: John Grisham

Quote: When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better.
Author: Mae West

Quote: You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Either you deal with what is the reality, or you can be sure that the reality is going to deal with you.
Author: Alex Haley

Quote: Don't give in to your fears. If you do, you won't be able to talk to your heart.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

Quote: I clench his hands to the point of pain. "Stay with me."His pupils contract to pinpoints, dialate again rapidly, and then return to something resembling normalcy. "Always,"he murmurs.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay

Quote: The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.
Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Essays, Letters and Miscellanies

Quote: Clary felt suddenly annoyed. "When the self-congratulatory part of the evening is over, maybe we could get back to saving my best friend from being exsanguinated to death?""Exsanguinated,"said Jace, impressed. "That's a big word.""And you're a big-""Tsk tsk,"he interupted. "No swearing in church.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

Quote: You always have a choice. It's just that some people make the wrong one.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Guardian

Quote: Love is like a tree: it grows by itself, roots itself deeply in our being and continues to flourish over a heart in ruin. The inexplicable fact is that the blinder it is, the more tenacious it is. It is never stronger than when it is completely unreasonable.
Author: Victor Hugo,  The Hunchback of Notre-Dame

Quote: The past is always tense, the future perfect.
Author: Zadie Smith

Quote: The problem with doing nothing is not knowing when you are finished.
Author: Nelson DeMille

Quote: I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,  Dance with the Devil

Quote: Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element.
Author: Audrey Niffenegger,  The Time Traveler's Wife

Quote: There is a deep sadness to American poverty, greater than the sadness of any other kind. It's because America has such an ideology of success.
Author: Will Self

Quote: If we would build on a sure foundation in friendship, we must love friends for their sake rather than for our own.
Author: Charlotte Bronte

Quote: We are biological creatures. We are born, we live, we die. There is no transcendent purpose to existence. At best we are creatures of reason, and by using reason we can cure ourselves of emotional excess. Purged of both hope and fear, we find courage in the face of helplessness, insignificance and uncertainty.
Author: Jonathan Sacks

Quote: I'm not funny. What I am is brave.
Author: Lucille Ball

Quote: This is love: to fly toward a secret sky, to cause a hundred veils to fall each moment. First to let go of life. Finally, to take a step without feet.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Love is stronger than justice.
Author: Sting

Quote: Of all lies, art is the least untrue.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: The bird, the pin, the song, the berries, the watch, the cracker, the dress that burst into flames. I am the mockingjay. The one that survived despite the Capitol's plans. The symbol of the rebellion.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  Catching Fire

Quote: There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.But they are there for a reason. Only when we have overcome them will we understand why they were there.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Fifth Mountain

Quote: ...you know that a good, long session of weeping can often make you feel better, even if your circumstances have not changed one bit.
Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Bad Beginning

Quote: Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: A bit of trash now and then is good for the severest reader. It provides the necessary roughage in the literary diet.
Author: Phyllis McGinley

Quote: While I sleep, I dream of you, and when I wake, I long to hold you in my arms. If anything, our time apart has only made me more certain that I want to spend my nights by your side, and my days with your heart.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Nights in Rodanthe

Quote: I am too fond of reading books to care to write them.
Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray

Quote: People, generally, suck.
Author: Christopher Moore,  The Stupidest Angel: A Heartwarming Tale of Christmas Terror

Quote: Second star to the right and straight on 'til morning.
Author: J.M. Barrie,  Peter Pan

Quote: Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are god. Whereas owners of cats are compelled to realize that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they draw the conclusion that they are gods.
Author: Christopher Hitchens,  The Portable Atheist: Essential Readings for the Nonbeliever

Quote: Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.
Author: Daphne du Maurier

Quote: Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace.
Author: Robert J. Sawyer,  Calculating God

Quote: Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.
Author: Anaïs Nin,  Incest: From a Journal of Love

Quote: Ah, music,"he said, wiping his eyes. "A magic beyond all we do here!
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

Quote: You are not special. You're not a beautiful and unique snowflake. You're the same decaying organic matter as everything else. We're all part of the same compost heap. We're all singing, all dancing crap of the world.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Fight Club

Quote: Every life has death and every light has shadow. Be content to stand in the light and let the shadow fall where it will.
Author: Mary Stewart,  The Hollow Hills

Quote: Learn the rules, break the rules, make up new rules, break the new rules.
Author: Marvin Bell

Quote: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.
Author: Anne Frank

Quote: I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own.
Author: Chaim Potok,  The Chosen

Quote: Humor is reason gone mad.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.
Author: Dean Koontz,  Fear Nothing

Quote: In times of grief and sorrow I will hold you and rock you and take your grief and make it my own. When you cry I cry and when you hurt I hurt. And together we will try to hold back the floods to tears and despair and make it through the potholed street of life
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook

Quote: In the first six to twelve months of a war with the United States and Great Britain I will run wild and win victory upon victory. But then, if the war continues after that, I have no expectation of success.
Author: Isoroku Yamamoto

Quote: One hopes, of course, that a relationship grows and becomes a deep and wonderful marriage and friendship that lasts forever. But that's not always the case.
Author: Alana Stewart

Quote: I hope that one day when I'll go back to Pakistan, I will build a university like Harvard.
Author: Malala Yousafzai

Quote: The quality of life is more important than life itself.
Author: Alexis Carrel

Quote: Selfishness is one of the qualities apt to inspire love.
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

Quote: In art, the hand can never execute anything higher than the heart can imagine.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: What is right is not always popular and what is popular is not always right.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I decided as long as I'm going to hell, I might as well do it thoroughly.
Author: Stephenie Meyer,  Twilight

Quote: Freedom lies in being bold.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death.
Author: Rumi

Quote: The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Hello, Harry"said George, beaming at him. "We thought we heard your dulcet tones.""You don't want to bottle up your anger like that, Harry, let it all out,"said Fred, also beaming. "There might be a couple of people fifty miles away who didn't hear you.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Quote: The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances.
Author: Agatha Christie,  Murder on the Orient Express

Quote: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.
Author: Oscar Wilde,  A Woman of No Importance

Quote: You will hear thunder and remember me,and think: she wanted storms...
Author: Anna Akhmatova

Quote: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.
Author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Teh Ching

Quote: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: We shouldn't be looking for heroes, we should be looking for good ideas.
Author: Noam Chomsky

Quote: Success is not in never failing, but rising everytime you fall!
Author: Jonathan Taylor Thomas

Quote: The first two lessons, which we learned early in our efforts to be good member missionaries, have made sharing the Gospel much easier: We simply can't predict who will or won't be interested in the Gospel, and building a friendship is not a prerequisite to inviting people to learn about the Gospel.
Author: Clayton Christensen

Quote: We have been given God in our souls and Christ in our flesh. We have the power to believe where others deny, to hope where others despair, to love where others hurt.
Author: Brennan Manning

Quote: In conversation, humor is worth more than wit and easiness more than knowledge.
Author: George Herbert

Quote: I have had a happy life and thank the Lord. Goodbye and may God bless all!
Author: Christopher McCandless

Quote: The love of our private friends is the only preparatory exercise for the love of all men.
Author: John Henry Newman

Quote: Lesser artists borrow, great artists steal.
Author: Igor Stravinsky

Quote: It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince

Quote: One must live as if it would be forever, and as if one might die each moment. Always both at once.
Author: Mary Renault,  The Persian Boy

Quote: My only love sprung from my only hate!Too early seen unknown, and known too late!Prodigious birth of love it is to me,That I must love a loathed enemy.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Ghosts don't haunt us. That's not how it works. They're present among us because we won't let go of them.
Author: Sue Grafton,  M is for Malice

Quote: He died not for men, but for each man. If each man had been the only man made, He would have done no less.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: The success of the suffrage movement would injure women spiritually and intellectually, for they would be assuming a burden though they knew themselves unable to bear it. It is the sediment, not the wave, of a sex. It is the antithesis of that highest and sweetest mystery - conviction by submission, and conquest by sacrifice.
Author: John Boyle O'Reilly

Quote: Israelis can be proud of the vibrant democracy that they have created, and I know that many Rhode Islanders share my deep appreciation for the close friendship between our two nations.
Author: Lincoln Chafee

Quote: Pity the selfishness of lovers: it is brief, a forlorn hope; it is impossible.
Author: Elizabeth Bowen

Quote: Humor is richly rewarding to the person who employs it. It has some value in gaining and holding attention, but it has no persuasive value at all.
Author: John Kenneth Galbraith

Quote: Motherhood has most definitely changed me and my life. It's so crazy how drastic even the small details change - in such an amazing way. Even silly things, like the fact that all of my pictures on my cell phone used to be of me at photo shoots - conceited, I know! - but now every single picture on my phone is of Mason.
Author: Kourtney Kardashian

Quote: To good and true love fear is forever affixed.
Author: Francois Rabelais

Quote: To be an artist includes much; one must possess many gifts - absolute gifts - which have not been acquired by one's own effort. And, moreover, to succeed, the artist much possess the courageous soul.
Author: Kate Chopin

Quote: Whenever my environment had failed to support or nourish me, I had clutched at books...
Author: Richard Wright,  Black Boy

Quote: Every book, every volume you see here, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it and of those who read it and lived and dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down its pages, its spirit grows and strengthens.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind

Quote: As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Life is too short to waste any amount of time on wondering what other people think about you. In the first place, if they had better things going on in their lives, they wouldn't have the time to sit around and talk about you. What's important to me is not others' opinions of me, but what's important to me is my opinion of myself.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: One more time? For the audience?"he says. His voice isn't angry. It's hollow, which is worse. Already the boy with the bread is slipping away from me.I take his hand, holding on tightly, preparing for the cameras, and dreading the moment when I will finally have to let go.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  The Hunger Games

Quote: The things you used to own, now they own you.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Fight Club

Quote: I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

Quote: The mind I love must have wild places.
Author: Katherine Mansfield

Quote: A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?""Well, sweetheart,"I tell her, "yes, but it hurts a lot more to keep living.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Survivor

Quote: Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they don't realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world.
Author: Bill Watterson,  The Calvin And Hobbes: Tenth Anniversary Book

Quote: Ally."Peeta says the words slowly, tasting it. "Friend. Lover. Victor. Enemy. Fiancee. Target. Mutt. Neighbor. Hunter. Tribute. Ally. I'll add it to the list of words I use to try to figure you out. The problem is, I can't tell what's real anymore, and what's made up.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay

Quote: What are men to rocks and mountains?
Author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice

Quote: silence is the language of god, all else is poor translation.
Author: Rumi

Quote: A love like that was a serious illness, an illness from which you never entirely recover.
Author: Charles Bukowski,  The People Look Like Flowers at Last

Quote: But until a person can say deeply and honestly, "I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday,"that person cannot say, "I choose otherwise.
Author: Stephen R. Covey,  The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change

Quote: Books: a beautifully browsable invention that needs no electricity and exists in a readable form no matter what happens.
Author: Nicholson Baker

Quote: To be fully seen by somebody, then, and be loved anyhow - this is a human offering that can border on miraculous.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Committed: A Skeptic Makes Peace with Marriage

Quote: Light thinks it travels faster than anything but it is wrong. No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness has always got there first, and is waiting for it.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Reaper Man

Quote: A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other.
Author: Charles Dickens,  A Tale of Two Cities

Quote: Post-operatively the transplanted kidney functioned immediately with a dramatic improvement in the patient's renal and cardiopulmonary status. This spectacular success was a clear demonstration that organ transplantation could be life-saving.
Author: Joseph Murray

Quote: What gay culture is before it is anything else, before it is a culture of desire or a culture of subversion or a culture of pain, is a culture of friendship.
Author: Andrew Sullivan

Quote: I hope I go to Heaven, and when I do, I'm going to do what every San Franciscan does when he gets there. He looks around and says, 'It ain't bad, but it ain't San Francisco.'
Author: Herb Caen

Quote: I don't think it's possible to have a sense of tragedy without having a sense of humor.
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: After you have wept and grieved for your physical losses, cherish the functions and the life you have left.
Author: Morrie Schwartz

Quote: Every human is an artist. The dream of your life is to make beautiful art.
Author: Don Miguel Ruiz

Quote: Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.
Author: Betty Smith,  A Tree Grows in Brooklyn

Quote: She wanted something to happen - something, anything: she did not know what.
Author: Kate Chopin

Quote: Silence is so freaking loud
Author: Sarah Dessen,  Just Listen

Quote: Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands, but let it go, and you learn at once how big and precious it is.
Author: Maxim Gorky,  The Lower Depths and Other Plays

Quote: There's nothing worse than waiting and not knowing what'll happen to you. Your own imagination can be crueler than any captor.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Frostbite

Quote: I suspect the most we can hope for, and it's no small hope, is that we never give up, that we never stop giving ourselves permission to try to love and receive love.
Author: Elizabeth Strout,  Abide with Me

Quote: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: Imagination does not become great until human beings, given the courage and the strength, use it to create.
Author: Maria Montessori

Quote: I think; therefore I am.
Author: René Descartes

Quote: Holding Eleanor's hand was like holding a butterfly. Or a heartbeat. Like holding something complete, and completely alive.
Author: Rainbow Rowell,  Eleanor & Park

Quote: In the summerI stretch out on the shoreAnd think of you. Had I told the seaWhat I felt for you,It would have left its shores,Its shells,Its fish,And followed me.
Author: Nizar Qabbani

Quote: Katniss, the girl who was on fire!
Author: Suzanne Collins,  The Hunger Games

Quote: The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  Veronika Decides to Die

Quote: Nothing behind me, everything ahead of me, as is ever so on the road.
Author: Jack Kerouac,  On the Road

Quote: Do you think that I count the days? There is only one day left, always starting over: it is given to us at dawn and taken away from us at dusk.
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life.
Author: Fernando Pessoa,  The Book of Disquiet

Quote: In order to succeed, your desire for success should be greater than your fear of failure.
Author: Bill Cosby

Quote: But it all comes down to friendship, treating people right.
Author: Ernie Banks

Quote: Our only hope is to control the vote.
Author: Medgar Evers

Quote: Start every day off with a smile and get it over with.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: I've grown up a lot, I'm on my own, and I've learned some valuable life lessons.
Author: Zac Efron

Quote: Love means to commit yourself without guarantee.
Author: Anne Campbell

Quote: The writer, when he is also an artist, is someone who admits what others don't dare reveal.
Author: Elia Kazan

Quote: You know it's never fifty-fifty in a marriage. It's always seventy-thirty, or sixty-forty. Someone falls in love first. Someone puts someone else up on a pedestal. Someone works very hard to keep things rolling smoothly; someone else sails along for the ride.
Author: Jodi Picoult,  Mercy

Quote: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.
Author: Pablo Picasso,  Pablo Picasso: Metamorphoses of the Human Form : Graphic Works, 1895-1972

Quote: Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it.Boldness has genius, power and magic in it!
Author: John Anster,  The First Part of Goethe's Faust

Quote: Your thorns are the best part of you.
Author: Marianne Moore

Quote: No good deed goes unpunished.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
Author: Nelson Mandela

Quote: This is the way the world endsNot with a bang but a whimper.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: They're certainly entitled to think that, and they're entitled to full respect for their opinions... but before I can live with other folks I've got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.
Author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird

Quote: Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: Education: the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: It's the mortal cup Jace, not the mortal toilet bowl.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balancedlife.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love: One Woman's Search for Everything Across Italy, India and Indonesia

Quote: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?
Author: Gautama Buddha

Quote: I figured something out. The future is unpredictable.
Author: John Green,  An Abundance of Katherines

Quote: The secret to success is to offend the greatest number of people.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Suspicion is the cancer of friendship.
Author: Petrarch

Quote: Until women themselves reject stigma and refuse to feel shame for the way others treat them, they have no hope of achieving full human stature.
Author: Germaine Greer

Quote: There is a thin line that separates laughter and pain, comedy and tragedy, humor and hurt.
Author: Erma Bombeck

Quote: We continue to shape our personality all our life. If we knew ourselves perfectly, we should die.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: My wife, my family, my friends - they've all taught me things about love and what that emotion really means. In a nutshell, loving someone is about giving, not receiving.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: The artist one day falls through a hole in the brambles, and from that moment he is following the dark rapids of an underground river which may sometimes flow so near to the surface that the laughing picnic parties are heard above.
Author: Cyril Connolly

Quote: If there's one thing I've learned, it's this: We all want everything to be okay. We don't even wish so much for fantastic or marvelous or outstanding. We will happily settle for okay, because most of the time, okay is enough.
Author: David Levithan,  Every Day

Quote: It is often in the darkest skies that we see the brightest stars.
Author: Richard Evans

Quote: Only the dead have seen the end of war.
Author: Plato

Quote: That was one of the virtues of being a pessimist: nothing was ever as bad as you thought it would be.
Author: James Jones,  From Here to Eternity

Quote: What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Can you be a girl for a few seconds?""I'm always a girl"I frown."You know what I mean. Like a silly, annoying girl"I twirl my hair around my finger. "Kay.
Author: Veronica Roth,  Divergent

Quote: Your silence will not protect you.
Author: Audre Lorde,  Sister Outsider: Essays and Speeches

Quote: I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.
Author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo

Quote: I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains.
Author: Anne Frank,  The Diary of a Young Girl

Quote: A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on.
Author: William S. Burroughs

Quote: Everyone has secrets. It's just a matter of finding out what they are.
Author: Stieg Larsson,  The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

Quote: He stepped back and threw his arms out."I'm always crazy around you Rose. Here, I'm going to write an impromptu poem for you."He tipped his head back and shouted to the sky:"Rose is in redBut never in blueSharp as a thornFights like one too.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Shadow Kiss

Quote: Watch out for intellect,because it knows so much it knows nothingand leaves you hanging upside down,mouthing knowledge as your heartfalls out of your mouth.
Author: Anne Sexton,  The Complete Poems

Quote: Success is the progressive realization of a worthy goal or ideal.
Author: Earl Nightingale

Quote: Friendship is two-sided. It isn't a friend just because someone's doing something nice for you. That's a nice person. There's friendship when you do for each other. It's like marriage - it's two-sided.
Author: John Wooden

Quote: It is practically impossible to teach good programming to students that have had a prior exposure to BASIC: as potential programmers they are mentally mutilated beyond hope of regeneration.
Author: Edsger Dijkstra

Quote: If you would be loved, love, and be loveable.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: If anybody wanted to photograph my life, they'd get bored in a day.
Author: Matt Damon

Quote: I have a really dry sense of humor. I don't think it's funny when people wink at the camera. That's more of an actor thing, just committing to whatever the thing is.
Author: Topher Grace

Quote: Advertising is the greatest art form of the 20th century.
Author: Marshall McLuhan

Quote: You only live twice:Once when you are bornAnd once when you look death in the face
Author: Ian Fleming,  You Only Live Twice

Quote: Sometimes, when I have to do something I don't want to do, I pretend I'm a character from a book. It's easier to know what they would do.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel

Quote: what's your name?"what?"i asked, squinting at the light.your name."I reconized Dr. Olendzki peering over me.you know my name."I want you to tell me."Rose. Rose Hathaway."Do you know your birthday?"Of course I do. Why are you asking me such stupid things? Did you lose my records?"Dr. Olendzki gave an exasperated sigh and walked off, taking the annoying light with her. "I think she's fine,
Author: Richelle Mead,  Frostbite

Quote: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.
Author: Ben Okri

Quote: Love: It will kill you and save you, both
Author: Lauren Oliver,  Delirium

Quote: You don't love a girl because of beauty. You love her because she sings a song only you can understand.
Author: L.J. Smith,  Secret Vampire

Quote: If I am not good to myself, how can I expect anyone else to be good to me?
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: I know of a cure for everything: salt water...in one way or the other. Sweat, or tears, or the salt sea.
Author: Karen Blixen

Quote: Nothing, Everything, Anything, Something: If you have nothing, then you have everything, because you have the freedom to do anything, without the fear of losing something.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This is the story my great-grandfather told my father, who then told my grandfather, who then told me about how The Mythical Mr. Boo, Charles Manseur Fizzlebush Grissham III, better known as Mr. Fizzlebush, and Orafoura are all in fact me...

Quote: Please believe that one single positive dream is more important than a thousand negative realities.
Author: Adeline Yen Mah,  Chinese Cinderella: The True Story of an Unwanted Daughter

Quote: How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Slaughterhouse-Five

Quote: Every day is a new day. It is better to be lucky. But I would rather be exact. Then when luck comes you are ready.
Author: Ernest Hemingway,  The Old Man and the Sea

Quote: Laugh and the world laughs with you, snore and you sleep alone.
Author: Anthony Burgess

Quote: In a lot of ways, success is much harder than I thought it would be. I figured that you'd get here and then everything would be happily ever after. But, it's hard work, almost harder once you're successful because you've got to maintain it.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: Before the flowers of friendship faded friendship faded.
Author: Gertrude Stein

Quote: Compromise is but the sacrifice of one right or good in the hope of retaining another - too often ending in the loss of both.
Author: Tryon Edwards

Quote: One of the things I've started doing lately is tracking my dreams. I feel like there's a lot of information there and you can really bring those emotions to the situations that may feel mundane or familiar. That gives them new life and gives you a new relationship with it - if that makes any sort of sense.
Author: Jennifer Carpenter

Quote: As I write, I control my anxiety and anguish thanks to the invaluable aid of irony and humor. But every night I am subdued by an anxiety that knows no irony, and I must wait until the next day to rediscover the blend of anguish and humor that characterizes my writing and that generates my style.
Author: Enrique Vila-Matas

Quote: The business of art is to reveal the relation between man and his environment.
Author: D. H. Lawrence

Quote: That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: Now that she had nothing to lose, she was free.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  Eleven Minutes

Quote: After all, Ginger Rogers did everything that Fred Astaire did. She just did it backwards and in high heels.
Author: Ann Richards

Quote: Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: That's the thing about depression: A human being can survive almost anything, as long as she sees the end in sight. But depression is so insidious, and it compounds daily, that it's impossible to ever see the end.
Author: Elizabeth Wurtzel,  Prozac Nation

Quote: Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.
Author: Henry Thomas Buckle

Quote: See, the problem is that God gives men a brain and a penis, and only enough blood to run one at a time.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: If you love something set it free, but don't be surprised if it comes back with herpes.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: The power of a glance has been so much abused in love stories, that it has come to be disbelieved in. Few people dare now to say that two beings have fallen in love because they have looked at each other. Yet it is in this way that love begins, and in this way only.
Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables

Quote: Can you understand? Someone, somewhere, can you understand me a little, love me a little? For all my despair, for all my ideals, for all that - I love life. But it is hard, and I have so much - so very much to learn.
Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Journals of Sylvia Plath

Quote: Ultimately, leadership is not about glorious crowning acts. It's about keeping your team focused on a goal and motivated to do their best to achieve it, especially when the stakes are high and the consequences really matter. It is about laying the groundwork for others' success, and then standing back and letting them shine.
Author: Chris Hadfield

Quote: My first experiences of academic friendship made me smile in after years when I looked back on them. But my circle of acquaintances had gradually grown so large that it was only natural new friendships should grow out of it.
Author: Georg Brandes

Quote: There are a lot of times that we feel like our hands are tied - 'I have no control over if I'm going to lose my job.' 'I have no control over if I'm going to be able to pay my bills.' You've got to realize that that's where your trust comes in. You have to trust God, and keep your hope, because your hope is what produces your faith.
Author: Victoria Osteen

Quote: To deprive a man of his natural liberty and to deny to him the ordinary amenities of life is worse then starving the body; it is starvation of the soul, the dweller in the body.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Heaven grant us patience with a man in love.
Author: Rudyard Kipling

Quote: I like girls who are funny with a warped sense of humor.
Author: Robert Buckley

Quote: It is a mistake for a sculptor or a painter to speak or write very often about his job. It releases tension needed for his work.
Author: Henry Moore

Quote: Laugh all you want and cry all you want and whistle at pretty men in the street and to hell with anybody who thinks you're a damned fool!
Author: Armistead Maupin,  More Tales of the City

Quote: I will take the sun in my mouthand leap into the ripe air Alive with closed eyesto dash against darkness
Author: E.E. Cummings,  Poems, 1923-1954

Quote: The voice of the sea speaks to the soul.
Author: Kate Chopin,  The Awakening

Quote: I sought to hear the voice of God and climbed the topmost steeple, but God declared: "Go down again - I dwell among the people.
Author: John Henry Newman

Quote: Books are easily destroyed. But words will live as long as people can remember them.
Author: Tahereh Mafi,  Unravel Me

Quote: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard, are sweeter
Author: John Keats,  Ode on a Grecian Urn and Other Poems

Quote: You alone are enough. You have nothing to prove to anybody.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Accio Brain!
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Quote: When I say it's you I like, I'm talking about that part of you that knows that life is far more than anything you can ever see or hear or touch. That deep part of you that allows you to stand for those things without which humankind cannot survive. Love that conquers hate, peace that rises triumphant over war, and justice that proves more powerful than greed.
Author: Fred Rogers

Quote: I always worried someone would notice me, and then when no one did, I felt lonely.
Author: Curtis Sittenfeld,  Prep

Quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: It matters not how strait the gate, How charged with punishments the scroll, I am the master of my fate: I am the captain of my soul.
Author: William Ernest Henley,  Echoes of Life and Death;

Quote: I was born with an enormous need for affection, and a terrible need to give it.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: Um...is that thing tame?"Frank said.The horse whinnied angrily."I don't think so,"Percy guessed. "He just said, 'I will trample you to death, silly Chinese Canadian baby man'.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Son of Neptune

Quote: Only someone who is well prepared has the opportunity to improvise.
Author: Ingmar Bergman

Quote: Never underestimate the power of stupid people in large groups.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Charm is the ability to make someone else think that both of you are pretty wonderful.
Author: Kathleen Winsor

Quote: Dress shabbily and they remember the dress; dress impeccably and they remember the woman.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quote: DON'T THINK OF IT AS DYING, said Death. JUST THINK OF IT AS LEAVING EARLY TO AVOID THE RUSH.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Good Omens: The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch

Quote: Think little goals and expect little achievements. Think big goals and win big success.
Author: David Joseph Schwartz

Quote: If the chemistry is right between star and photographer and the geometry of the pictures pleases the star, often the two people end up with a long-term professional friendship during which they continue to work together and to produce highly personal images.
Author: Eve Arnold

Quote: I've seen the ticket, and I still can't believe it. When I see the money, I hope I don't hit the floor.
Author: Judy Garland

Quote: We are constituted so that simple acts of kindness, such as giving to charity or expressing gratitude, have a positive effect on our long-term moods. The key to the happy life, it seems, is the good life: a life with sustained relationships, challenging work, and connections to community.
Author: Paul Bloom

Quote: My number one goal is to love, support and be there for my son.
Author: Farrah Fawcett

Quote: While it is true that Frank had a great sense of humor, he was also very serious about composing music. In reality there are only a handful of skilled players who can play his most complex pieces. It takes a lot of patience to learn and requires a fantastic memory.
Author: Dweezil Zappa

Quote: The worst state of affairs is when science begins to concern itself with art.
Author: Paul Klee

Quote: You know, some people think Shadowhunters are just myths. Like mummies and genies."Kyle grinned at Jace. "Can you grant wishes?""That depends,"he said. "Do you wish to be punched in the face?
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Fallen Angels

Quote: It's so strange how life works: You want something and you wait and wait and feel like it's taking forever to come. Then it happens and it's over and all you want to do is curl back up in that moment before things changed.
Author: Lauren Oliver,  Delirium

Quote: Well-read people are less likely to be evil.
Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Slippery Slope

Quote: The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones.
Author: Joseph Joubert

Quote: That was enterprising,"Will sounded nearly impressed.Nate smiled. Tess shot him a furious look. "Don't look pleased with yourself. When Will says 'enterprising' he means 'morally deficient.'""No, I mean enterprising,"said Will. "When I mean morally deficient, I say, 'Now, that's something I would have done'.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel

Quote: There's no need to clarify my finger snap,"said Magnus. "The implication was clear in the snap itself.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

Quote: If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library.
Author: Frank Zappa

Quote: Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.
Author: Toni Morrison,  Beloved

Quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
Author: Oliver Goldsmith,  The Citizen of the World, Or, Letters from a Chinese Philosopher, Residing in London, to His Friends in the Country, by Dr. Goldsmith

Quote: When we are young, the words are scattered all around us. As they are assembled by experience, so also are we, sentence by sentence, until the story takes shape.
Author: Louise Erdrich,  The Plague of Doves

Quote: Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.
Author: Margaret Atwood,  Cat's Eye

Quote: Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I've done a lot of albums and I kinda know when I'm onto something that was inspirational for me to record and create, and this was one of those projects where I really enjoyed making the album.
Author: Lee Ritenour

Quote: Think of success as a game of chance in which you have control over the odds. As you begin to master concepts in personal achievement, you are increasing your odds of achieving success.
Author: Bo Bennett

Quote: One of the greatest delusions in the world is the hope that the evils in this world are to be cured by legislation.
Author: Thomas Reed

Quote: Fiction is like a spider's web, attached ever so slightly perhaps, but still attached to life at all four corners. Often the attachment is scarcely perceptible.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Doubt thou the stars are fire, Doubt that the sun doth move. Doubt truth to be a liar, But never doubt I love.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Prior to Wordsworth, humor was an essential part of poetry. I mean, they don't call them Shakespeare comedies for nothing.
Author: William Collins

Quote: Art is a step from what is obvious and well-known toward what is arcane and concealed.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quote: The present changes the past. Looking back you do not find what you left behind.
Author: Kiran Desai,  The Inheritance of Loss

Quote: But I didn't understand then. That I could hurt somebody so badly she would never recover. That a person can, just by living, damage another human being beyond repair.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: Laughter is wine for the soul - laughter soft, or loud and deep, tinged through with seriousness - the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living.
Author: Seán O'Casey

Quote: You can't lie to your soul.
Author: Irvine Welsh,  Porno

Quote: Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Be awesome! Be a book nut!
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Lightning Thief

Quote: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.
Author: Steve Maraboli

Quote: Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.
Author: Ken Kesey,  One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Quote: Child, child, do you not see? For each of us comes a time when we must be more than what we are.
Author: Lloyd Alexander,  The Black Cauldron

Quote: This is just rap. I'm not trying to make people think I'm some sort of scientific wizard or inspirational poet.
Author: Action Bronson

Quote: To have long term success as a coach or in any position of leadership, you have to be obsessed in some way.
Author: Pat Riley

Quote: Friendship is an arrangement by which we undertake to exchange small favors for big ones.
Author: Charles de Montesquieu

Quote: Life goes on, and I'm moving on to the next thing, but I hope the soaps that are still running will thrive. They have millions of loyal viewers.
Author: Susan Lucci

Quote: I have led a pretty colorful life.
Author: Corey Feldman

Quote: Being Irish, I always had this love of words.
Author: Kenneth Branagh

Quote: Humor helps people open up.
Author: Roger von Oech

Quote: Every creator painfully experiences the chasm between his inner vision and its ultimate expression.
Author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

Quote: I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.
Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. "I'm okay"we say. "I'm alright". But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.
Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

Quote: if you love two people at the same time, choose the second. Because if you really loved the first one, you wouldn't have fallen for the second.
Author: Johnny Depp

Quote: Books are no more threatened by Kindle than stairs by elevators.
Author: Stephen Fry

Quote: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard,  The Concept of Anxiety: A Simple Psychologically Orienting Deliberation on the Dogmatic Issue of Hereditary Sin

Quote: When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: My wish is that you may be loved to the point of madness.
Author: André Breton,  What is Surrealism?: Selected Writings

Quote: When the enemy has no face, society will invent one.
Author: Susan Faludi

Quote: Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong."Or "She's going to hurt me."Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ."Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: Ordinary life is pretty complex stuff.
Author: Harvey Pekar

Quote: What a kid I got, I told him about the birds and the bees and he told me about the butcher and my wife.
Author: Rodney Dangerfield

Quote: The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: Inspirational leaders need to have a winning mentality in order to inspire respect. It is hard to trust in the leadership of someone who is half-hearted about their purpose, or only sporadic in focus or enthusiasm.
Author: Sebastian Coe

Quote: Just remember: to be grateful and thank the people who are there and support you along the way is a great start to success.
Author: Meryl Davis

Quote: When David Fincher called me up a few years ago and said, 'Hey, I'd like you to score this film 'The Social Network,' I said, 'I'm flattered, but I really don't have any real experience scoring films, and I'd rather not screw it up on a high-profile project. And I like you and I don't want to compromise our friendship.'
Author: Trent Reznor

Quote: Well I certainly have learned and I hope I'm moving on and certainly two years of prison was a terrible punishment.
Author: Jeffrey Archer

Quote: I think a big test we all face in life on a regular basis is that discouragement test. Life's not always fair, but I believe if you keep doing the right thing, God will get you to where you are.
Author: Joel Osteen

Quote: It is cruel, you know, that music should be so beautiful. It has the beauty of loneliness of pain: of strength and freedom. The beauty of disappointment and never-satisfied love. The cruel beauty of nature and everlasting beauty of monotony.
Author: Benjamin Britten

Quote: Those who knew Lincoln described him as an extraordinarily funny man. Humor was an essential aspect of his temperament. He laughed, he explained, so he did not weep.
Author: Doris Kearns Goodwin

Quote: What I wish to show when I paint is the way I see things with my eyes and in my heart.
Author: Raoul Dufy

Quote: I am not interested in being original. I am interested in being true.
Author: Agostinho da Silva

Quote: Every couple needs to argue now and then. Just to prove that the relationship is strong enough to survive. Long-term relationships, the ones that matter, are all about weathering the peaks and the valleys.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Safe Haven

Quote: What I've come to learn is that the world is never saved in grand messianic gestures, but in the simple accumulation of gentle, soft, almost invisible acts of compassion.
Author: Chris Abani

Quote: Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it. Those who do not do it, think of it as a cousin of stamp collecting, a sister of the trophy cabinet, bastard of a sound bank account and a weak mind.
Author: Jeanette Winterson

Quote: Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.
Author: Dan Brown,  The Da Vinci Code

Quote: You're beautiful and sad,"I said finally, not looking at him when I did. "Just like your eyes. You're like a song that I heard when I was a little kid but forgot I knew until I heard it again."For a long moment there was only the whirring sound of the tires on the road, and then Sam said softly, "Thank you.
Author: Maggie Stiefvater,  Shiver

Quote: The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.
Author: David Foster Wallace,  Infinite Jest

Quote: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Kind people have a way of working their way inside me and rooting there.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  The Hunger Games

Quote: God alert!"Blackjack yelled. "It's the wine dude!Mr. D sighed in exasperation. "The next person, or horse, who calls me the 'wine dude' will end up in a bottle of Merlot!
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Titan's Curse

Quote: It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Lord of the Rings

Quote: The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: If my doctor told me I had only six minutes to live, I wouldn't brood. I'd type a little faster.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.
Author: Amelia Earhart

Quote: Laugh loudly, laugh often, and most important, laugh at yourself.
Author: Chelsea Handler,  Lies That Chelsea Handler Told Me

Quote: Curiouser and curiouser!
Author: Lewis Carroll,  Alice in Wonderland

Quote: Stay is a charming word in a friend's vocabulary.
Author: Amos Bronson Alcott,  Concord Days

Quote: 'Star Wars' is fun, its exciting, its inspirational, and people respond to that. It's what they want.
Author: George Lucas

Quote: Success is a sort of metaphysical experience. I live exactly as I did before - only on a slightly bigger scale. Naturally, I won't be corrupted. I'll sit there in my Rolls, uncorrupted, and tell my chauffeur, uncorruptedly, where to go.
Author: Tom Stoppard

Quote: Primarily, 'Black Girl/White Girl' is the story of two very different, yet somehow 'fated' girls; for Genna, her 'friendship' with Minette is the most haunting of her life, though it is one-sided and ends in tragedy.
Author: Joyce Carol Oates

Quote: I hope we're all kind of influencing each other now to keep the quality up on those things. They seem to be getting better and better and better as there's not only sort of a film geek audience, there's also a general interest in the overall film consuming population.
Author: Jay Roach

Quote: A successful life is one that is lived through understanding and pursuing one's own path, not chasing after the dreams of others.
Author: Chin-Ning Chu

Quote: Unconditional love really exists in each of us. It is part of our deep inner being. It is not so much an active emotion as a state of being. It's not 'I love you' for this or that reason, not 'I love you if you love me.' It's love for no reason, love without an object.
Author: Ram Dass

Quote: I like guys who have a plan or a dream. A good sense of humor is also a must. I can be weird with my humor and say things that are random. You need to understand that I'm really goofy and go with it.
Author: Edy Ganem

Quote: My painting does not come from the easel.
Author: Jackson Pollock

Quote: Wounds turn into scars and scars make you tough.
Author: Aisha Tyler

Quote: It's hard to enjoy practical jokes when your whole life feels like one.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Last Olympian

Quote: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.
Author: Omar Khayyám,  The Rubáiyát of Omar Khayyám

Quote: Life is like a prism. What you see depends on how you turn the glass.
Author: Jonathan Kellerman

Quote: Love can make even nice people do awful things.
Author: Jude Deveraux

Quote: The most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or touched, they are felt with the heart.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince

Quote: If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: You can go through life and make new friends every year - every month practically - but there was never any substitute for those friendships of childhood that survive into adult years. Those are the ones in which we are bound to one another with hoops of steel.
Author: Alexander McCall Smith,  The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency

Quote: Always be a poet, even in prose.
Author: Charles Baudelaire

Quote: We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: There's something ugly about the flawless.
Author: Dennis Lehane,  Sacred

Quote: Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy
Author: Ludwig van Beethoven

Quote: Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: Is there some particular reason that you're here?"..."Not this again.""Not what again?"said Clary."Every time I annoy him, he retreats into his No Mundanes Allowed tree house."Simon pointed at Jace.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

Quote: Dimitri: "Why did you come here?"Rose: "Because you hit me on the head and dragged me here.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Blood Promise

Quote: Your lucky enough to be different, never change
Author: Taylor Swift,  Taylor Swift

Quote: He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.She was the book thief without the words.Trust me, though, the words were on their way, and when they arrived, Liesel would hold them in her hands like the clouds, and she would wring them out like rain.
Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

Quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: When I was working at the Sprint store, I got laid off. I was bummed out, but I stayed positive. I used the money I had earned while working there to make my first album. Without that job, maybe 'Corazon Sin Cara' would never had been made. It's a very inspirational story.
Author: Prince Royce

Quote: People of mediocre ability sometimes achieve outstanding success because they don't know when to quit. Most men succeed because they are determined to.
Author: George Allen, Sr.

Quote: Often the magical elements in my books are standing in for elements of the real world, the small and magical-in-their-own-right sorts of things that we take for granted and no longer pay attention to, like the bonds of friendship that entwine our own lives with those of other people and places.
Author: Charles de Lint

Quote: Creativity comes from trust. Trust your instincts. And never hope more than you work.
Author: Rita Mae Brown

Quote: Be happy with being you. Love your flaws. Own your quirks. And know that you are just as perfect as anyone else, exactly as you are.
Author: Ariana Grande

Quote: He has such a patronizing tone and manner, and such a sarcastic sense of humor. I found him rather brutal, a kind of elegant brutality which appealed. No, I think he came pretty much off the page.
Author: Jeremy Northam

Quote: Time extracts various values from a painter's work. When these values are exhausted the pictures are forgotten, and the more a picture has to give, the greater it is.
Author: Henri Matisse

Quote: The bond forged between us was not one that could be broken by absence, distance, or time. And no matter how much more special or beautiful or brilliant or perfect than me he might be, he was as irreversibly altered as I was. As I would always belong to him, so would he always be mine.
Author: Stephenie Meyer,  New Moon

Quote: Ideas are easy. It's the execution of ideas that really separates the sheep from the goats.
Author: Sue Grafton

Quote: A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.
Author: Roald Dahl

Quote: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: We never know the quality of someone else's life, though we seldom resist the temptation to assume and pass judgement.
Author: Tami Hoag,  Dark Horse

Quote: If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: Strength is the capacity to break a Hershey bar into four pieces with your bare hands - and then eat just one of the pieces.
Author: Judith Viorst,  Love & Guilt & The Meaning Of Life, Etc

Quote: If you were music, I would listen to you ceaselessly, and my low spirits would brighten up.
Author: Anna Akhmatova,  The Complete Poems of Anna Akhmatova

Quote: I found myself thinking about President William McKinley, the third American president to be assassinated. He lived for several days after he was shot, and towards the end, his wife started crying and screaming, "I want to go too! I want to go too!"And with his last measure of strength, McKinley turned to her and spoke his last words: "We are all going.
Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

Quote: That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth.
Author: Tim O'Brien

Quote: I don't hate you.. I just don't like that you exist
Author: Gena Showalter,  Seduce the Darkness

Quote: Today is the sort of day where the sun only comes up to humiliate you.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Fight Club

Quote: If the person you are talking to doesn't appear to be listening, be patient. It may simply be that he has a small piece of fluff in his ear.
Author: A.A. Milne,  Winnie-the-Pooh

Quote: It is always sad when someone leaves home, unless they are simply going around the corner and will return in a few minutes with ice-cream sandwiches.
Author: Lemony Snicket,  Horseradish

Quote: The farther you go...the harder it is to return. The world has many edges and it's easy to fall off.
Author: Anderson Cooper,  Dispatches from the Edge: A Memoir of War, Disasters, and Survival

Quote: I forgot that's what gets you all hot and bothered, Jace, girls killing things.""I like anyone killing things, especially me."he said with a smile.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

Quote: Just as you wouldn't leave the house without taking a shower, you shouldn't start the day without at least 10 minutes of sacred practice: prayer, meditation, inspirational reading.
Author: Marianne Williamson

Quote: Survival was my only hope, success my only revenge.
Author: Patricia Cornwell

Quote: I have enjoyed most particularly reading the correspondence between Gustav Mahler and Richard Strauss. The genuine friendship, competitiveness and support that thread through their communications are life lessons for us all.
Author: Jessye Norman
