Quote: [A] quotation is a handy thing to have about, saving one the trouble of thinking for oneself, always a laborious business."(The Record Lie)
Author: A.A. Milne,  If I May

Quote: The first and final thing you have to do in this world is to last it and not be smashed by it.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: I think the big mistake in schools is trying to teach children anything, and by using fear as the basic motivation. Fear of getting failing grades, fear of not staying with your class, etc. Interest can produce learning on a scale compared to fear as a nuclear explosion to a firecracker.
Author: Stanley Kubrick

Quote: Let us sacrifice our today so that our children can have a better tomorrow.
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: Don't be afraid of failure; be afraid of petty success.
Author: Maude Adams

Quote: Ah, Hope! what would life be, stripped of thy encouraging smiles, that teach us to look behind the dark clouds of today, for the golden beams that are to gild the morrow.
Author: Susanna Moodie

Quote: The little trouble in the world that is not due to love is due to friendship.
Author: E. W. Howe

Quote: Life is either a great adventure or nothing.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: I want my wardrobe to be full of good clothes, so that when I'm deciding what to wear, I don't run out of options. I love shopping!
Author: Virat Kohli

Quote: Writing is not for me. I completely lose my sense of humor when I write. I become extremely pathetic, very sensational. Images give me possibilities that I don't have with words.
Author: Marjane Satrapi

Quote: I never had the exposure to techniques and so forth that children have today with art workshops, but I always had crayons and pencils and still have work going right back to when I was five or six years old.
Author: Robert Indiana

Quote: Nobody wants to be here and nobody wants to leave.
Author: Cormac McCarthy,  The Road

Quote: The more I live, the more I learn. The more I learn, the more I realize, the less I know.
Author: Michel Legrand

Quote: Would you destroy Something perfect in order to make it beautiful?
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: life's not a paragraphAnd death i think is no parenthesis
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: Put your ear down close to your soul and listen hard.
Author: Anne Sexton

Quote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding... And could you keep your heart in wonder at the daily miracles of your life, your pain would not seem less wondrous than your joy
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: Hide not your talents, they for use were made,What's a sundial in the shade?
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: some moments are nice, some arenicer, some are even worthwritingabout.
Author: Charles Bukowski,  War All the Time

Quote: Even when I'm dead, I'll swim through the Earth,like a mermaid of the soil, just to be next to your bones.
Author: Jeffrey McDaniel

Quote: This book was written using 100% recycled words.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Wyrd Sisters

Quote: I think the warning labels on alcoholic beverages are too bland. They should be more vivid. Here is one I would suggest: "Alcohol will turn you into the same asshole your father was.
Author: George Carlin,  When Will Jesus Bring the Pork Chops?

Quote: Yeah, sometimes life really sucks,"she says. "But you know what I'm holding on for?"I raise my eyebrows.She raises hers, too, mimicking me."The moments that don't suck,"she says. "The trick is to notice them when they come around.
Author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant

Quote: Everybody finished the song at different times. At last, only the Weasley twins were left singing along to a very slow funeral march.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

Quote: We could visit him,"suggests Will. "But what would we say? 'I didn't know you that well, but I'm sorry you got stabbed in the eye'?
Author: Veronica Roth,  Divergent

Quote: Scoot over, man. I don't like you that much.""Dick. That's not what you said last night.""Bite me.
Author: Rachel Caine,  Glass Houses

Quote: But if everything was always smooth and perfect, you'd get too used to that, you know? You have to have a little bit of disorganization now and then. Otherwise, you'll never really enjoy it when things go right.
Author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever

Quote: I don't think we get a choice in who we fall for,"Ian whispers. "I think we just do.
Author: Jodi Picoult,  Keeping Faith

Quote: Student: Dr. Einstein, Aren't these the same questions as last year's [physics] final exam?Dr. Einstein: Yes; But this year the answers are different.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: You're only a man! You've not our gifts! I can tell you! Why, a woman can think of a hundred different things at once, all them contradictory!
Author: Georgette Heyer,  Powder And Patch

Quote: A bear, however hard he tries, grows tubby without exercise.
Author: A.A. Milne,  Winnie-the-Pooh

Quote: The individual who says it is not possible should move out of the way of those doing it.
Author: Tricia Cunningham

Quote: You cannot open a book without learning something.
Author: Confucius

Quote: God is a circle whose center is everywhere and circumference nowhere.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Success produces confidence; confidence relaxes industry, and negligence ruins the reputation which accuracy had raised.
Author: Ben Jonson

Quote: Journalists say a thing that they know isn't true, in the hope that if they keep on saying it long enough it will be true.
Author: Arnold Bennett

Quote: Came but for friendship, and took away love.
Author: Thomas Moore

Quote: Our greatest happiness does not depend on the condition of life in which chance has placed us, but is always the result of a good conscience, good health, occupation, and freedom in all just pursuits.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: What do I geek out about? What am I? Hmmm. I love movies. I watch movies. I like big, sweeping epics, like Ed Zwick stuff: 'The Last Samurai,' 'Legends of the Fall,' 'Blood Diamond,' 'Glory.'
Author: Chris Evans

Quote: If you get a diagnosis, get on a therapy, keep a good attitude and keep your sense of humor.
Author: Teri Garr

Quote: I profoundly feel that the art of living is the art of giving. You're fulfilled in the moment of giving, of doing something beyond yourself.
Author: Laurance Rockefeller

Quote: The way you walk, way you talk, way you say my name; it's beautiful, wonderful, don't you ever change.
Author: Taylor Swift,  Taylor Swift

Quote: Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!
Author: Mark A. Cooper,  Edelweiss Pirates ‘Operation Einstein'

Quote: With me poetry has not been a purpose, but a passion.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: Always learn poems by heart. They have to become the marrow in your bones. Like fluoride in the water, they'll make your soul impervious to the world's soft decay.
Author: Janet Fitch,  White Oleander

Quote: Sometimes it takes a heartbreak to shake us awake & help us see we are worth so much more than we're settling for.
Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass

Quote: That which God said to the rose, and caused it to laugh in full-blown beauty, He said to my heart, and made it a hundred times more beautiful.
Author: Rumi

Quote: The strength of a woman is not measured by the impact that all her hardships in life have had on her; but the strength of a woman is measured by the extent of her refusal to allow those hardships to dictate her and who she becomes.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: It takes a very long time to become young.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: This life is yours. Take the power to choose what you want to do and do it well. Take the power to love what you want in life and love it honestly. Take the power to walk in the forest and be a part of nature. Take the power to control your own life. No one else can do it for you. Take the power to make your life happy.
Author: Susan Polis Schutz

Quote: Too many people spend money they haven't earned, to buy things they don't want, to impress people that they don't like.
Author: Will Rogers

Quote: Those people who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: At the end of the day it's about how much you can bear, how much you can endure. Being together, we harm nobody; being apart, we extinguish ourselves.
Author: Tabitha Suzuma,  Forbidden

Quote: You can live your whole life not realizing that what you're looking for is right in front of you.
Author: David Nicholls,  One Day

Quote: The saddest thing about love, Joe, is that not only the love cannot last forever, but even the heartbreak is soon forgotten.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: No one should ever ask themselves that: why am I unhappy? The question carries within it the virus that will destroy everything. If we ask that question, it means we want to find out what makes us happy. If what makes us happy is different from what we have now, then we must either change once and for all or stay as we are, feeling even more unhappy.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Zahir

Quote: Looking at him now-even if she hadn't been in love with him, that part of her that was her mother's daugher, that loved every beautiful thing for its beauty alone, would still have wanted him.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Glass

Quote: Delaying death is one of my favorite hobbies
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Mark of Athena

Quote: I felt the unfairness of it, the inarguable injustice of loving someone who might have loved you back but can't due to deadness.
Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

Quote: It was good to walk into a library again; it smelled like home.
Author: Elizabeth Kostova,  The Historian

Quote: Listen to God with a broken heart. He is not only the doctor who mends it, but also the father who wipes away the tears.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: We can come to look upon the deaths of our enemies with as much regret as we feel for those of our friends, namely, when we miss their existence as witnesses to our success.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: The difficulty of IVF or of any fertility issues is the hope and the shattered hope, the dream that it might happen this time and then it doesn't happen.
Author: Brooke Shields

Quote: The firmest friendship is based on an identity of likes and dislikes.
Author: Sallust

Quote: Your living is determined not so much by what life brings to you as by the attitude you bring to life; not so much by what happens to you as by the way your mind looks at what happens.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quote: I'm a huge classics fan. I love Ernest Hemingway and J.D. Salinger. I'm that guy who rereads a book before I read newer stuff, which is probably not all that progressive, and it's not really going to make me a better reader. I'm like, 'Oh, my God, you should read To Kill a Mockingbird.'
Author: John Krasinski

Quote: I don't know how many sacred cows there are today. I think there's a little confusion between humor and gross passing for humor. That's kind of regrettable.
Author: Bob Newhart

Quote: I was an anorexic, beer drinking, class cutting, doodling, shoplifting, skater chick that was into nature, art class, and the beach.
Author: Rebecca Miller

Quote: Every woman wants a man who'll fall in love with her soul as well as her body.
Author: Rainbow Rowell,  Attachments

Quote: I just hope I remember to tell my kids that they are as happy as I look in my old photographs. And I hope that they believe me.
Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: Teach the ignorant as much as you can; society is culpable in not providing a free education for all and it must answer for the night which it produces. If the soul is left in darkness sins will be committed. The guilty one is not he who commits the sin, but he who causes the darkness.
Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables

Quote: You who suffer because you love, love still more. To die of love, is to live by it.
Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables

Quote: Without leaps of imagination or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all is a form of planning.
Author: Gloria Steinem

Quote: Independence is my happiness, and I view things as they are, without regard to place or person; my country is the world, and my religion is to do good.
Author: Thomas Paine,  Rights of Man

Quote: A Woman in harmony with her spirit is like a river flowing.She goes where she will without pretense and arrives at her destination prepared to be herself and only herself
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: I have been driven many times upon my knees by the overwhelming conviction that I had no where else to go. My own wisdom and that of all about me seemed insufficient for that day.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Some things have to be believed to be seen.
Author: Madeleine L'Engle

Quote: I wish you to know that you have been the last dream of my soul.
Author: Charles Dickens,  A Tale of Two Cities

Quote: I thought we were a real love relationship. I did. I was very invested in love, but it was just this long long sex thing that could end at any moment because after all, it's just about getting off. Almost all the time, you tell yourself you're loving somebody when you're just using them. This only looks like love.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Invisible Monsters

Quote: I'm the Super-sized McShizzle, man!"Leo said. "I'm Leo Valdez, bad boy supreme. And the ladies love a bad boy.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Mark of Athena

Quote: Faith is walking face-first and full-speed into the dark. If we truly knew all the answers in advance as to the meaning of life and the nature of God and the destiny of our souls, our belief would not be a leap of faith and it would not be a courageous act of humanity; it would just be... a prudent insurance policy.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: Though nothing can bring back the hourOf splendor in the grass, of glory in the flower;We will grieve not, rather findStrength in what remains behind;In the primal sympathyWhich having been must ever be...
Author: William Wordsworth

Quote: Each affects the other, and the other affects the next, and the world is full of stories, but the stories are all one.
Author: Mitch Albom,  The Five People You Meet in Heaven

Quote: The stupid neither forgive nor forget; the naive forgive and forget; the wise forgive but do not forget.
Author: Thomas Szasz

Quote: I like to imagine that the world is one big machine. You know, machines never have any extra parts. They have the exact number and type of parts they need. So I figure if the entire world is a big machine, I have to be here for some reason. And that means you have to be here for some reason, too.
Author: Brian Selznick,  The Invention of Hugo Cabret

Quote: Now, Max, I think we both know your parents aren't missionaries."I opened my eyes wide. "No? Well, for God's sake, don't tell them. They'd be crushed. Thinking they're doing the Lord's work and all.
Author: James Patterson,  School's Out—Forever

Quote: It can hardly be a coincidence that no language on earth has ever produced the expression, 'As pretty as an airport.
Author: Douglas Adams,  The Long Dark Tea-Time of the Soul

Quote: A person is a fool to become a writer. His only compensation is absolute freedom. He has no master except his own soul, and that, I am sure, is why he does it
Author: Roald Dahl

Quote: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: You're mind is working at its best when you're being paranoid.You explore every avenue and possibility of your situationat high speed with total clarity.
Author: Banksy,  Banging Your Head Against a Brick Wall

Quote: Dripping water hollows out stone, not through force but through persistence.
Author: Ovid

Quote: I couldn't believe I'd come this far, lost Tyson, suffered through so much, only to fail - stopped by a big stupid monster in a baby-blue tuxedo kilt. Nobody was going to swat down my friends like that! I mean...nobody, not Nobody. Ah, you know what I mean.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Sea of Monsters

Quote: I wore black because I liked it. I still do, and wearing it still means something to me. It's still my symbol of rebellion -- against a stagnant status quo, against our hypocritical houses of God, against people whose minds are closed to others' ideas.
Author: Johnny Cash

Quote: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: Failure is a part of success.
Author: Hank Aaron

Quote: As great scientists have said and as all children know, it is above all by the imagination that we achieve perception, and compassion, and hope.
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin

Quote: I'm quite obsessed with the idea of nailing the girl friendship. It's such an art, so delicate.
Author: Alanis Morissette

Quote: I love people who dress how they feel and change it depending on the day.
Author: Becky G

Quote: I find intelligence sexy. I find a sense of humor sexy. I find sensitivity sexy.
Author: Nicole Appleton

Quote: Before I was a cosplayer, I was a fan artist. I would draw my favorite characters and sell the pieces at art auctions. But once I discovered cosplay, it was like, 'I don't have to draw my favorite characters, I can become my favorite characters.'
Author: Yaya Han

Quote: Living with him is like being told a perpetual story: his mind is the biggest, most imaginative I have ever met. I could live in its growing countries forever.
Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

Quote: Life isn't as serious as the mind makes it out to be.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Fools have a habit of believing that everything written by a famous author is admirable. For my part I read only to please myself and like only what suits my taste.
Author: Voltaire,  Candide

Quote: Don't ever think I fell for you, or fell over you. I didn't fall in love, I rose in it.
Author: Toni Morrison,  Jazz

Quote: There is more in you of good than you know, child of the kindly West. Some courage and some wisdom, blended in measure. If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Hobbit

Quote: He died that day because his body had served its purpose. His soul had done what it came to do, learned what it came to learn, and then was free to leave.
Author: Garth Stein,  The Art of Racing in the Rain

Quote: He was the toast to her butter.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Lucky One

Quote: Even if things don't unfold the way you expected, don't be disheartened or give up. One who continues to advance will win in the end.
Author: Daisaku Ikeda

Quote: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: No man is poor who has a Godly mother.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Well done is better than well said.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: There is more to life than simply increasing its speed.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: As I am sure you know, when people say 'It's my pleasure,' they usually mean something along the lines of, 'There's nothing on Earth I would rather do less.' [...]
Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Penultimate Peril

Quote: Anyone who says he can see through women is missing a lot.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: Cram your head with characters and stories. Abuse your library privileges. Never stop looking at the world, and never stop reading to find out what sense other people have made of it. If people give you a hard time and tell you to get your nose out of a book, tell them you're working. Tell them it's research. Tell them to pipe down and leave you alone.
Author: Jennifer Weiner

Quote: This is the real secret of life -- to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.
Author: Alan W. Watts

Quote: A great nose may be an indexOf a great soul
Author: Edmond Rostand,  Cyrano de Bergerac

Quote: Terrific. A bisexual dominant vampire with kidnapping expertise.
Author: J.R. Ward,  Lover Unbound

Quote: Practice makes perfect, but nobody's perfect, so why practice?
Author: Kurt Cobain

Quote: When we die, we will turn into songs, and we will hear each other and remember each other.
Author: Rob Sheffield,  Love Is a Mix Tape

Quote: you can take this mouththis wound you wantbut you can't kissand make itbetter.
Author: Daphne Gottlieb,  Why Things Burn

Quote: The first step - especially for young people with energy and drive and talent, but not money - the first step to controlling your world is to control your culture. To model and demonstrate the kind of world you demand to live in. To write the books. Make the music. Shoot the films. Paint the art.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: If you believe in yourself and have dedication and pride - and never quit, you'll be a winner. The price of victory is high but so are the rewards.
Author: Paul Bryant

Quote: Personal satisfaction is the most important ingredient of success.
Author: Denis Waitley

Quote: I doubt I'll be singing forever, because at some point people aren't going to want to hear my music, and I hope that I'll still get the opportunity to write songs.
Author: Adele

Quote: I want to use my connections with coaches, players, celebrities, whomever, and if I can take that friendship and use it to help someone else, I'm going to take advantage of that. I'm not going to apologize for that.
Author: Tim Tebow

Quote: I really believe that all of us have a lot of darkness in our souls. Anger, rage, fear, sadness. I don't think that's only reserved for people who have horrible upbringings. I think it really exists and is part of the human condition. I think in the course of your life you figure out ways to deal with that.
Author: Kevin Bacon

Quote: I rise to taste the dawn, and find that love alone will shine today.
Author: Ken Wilber

Quote: I compare Stephen Sondheim with humor, because humor is unanalyzable. You can't analyze humor. You just have to get through it.
Author: Elaine Stritch

Quote: My argument would be that I don't think there is much that's genuinely political art that is good art.
Author: Thom Yorke

Quote: Before you were born, your parents weren't as boring as they are now. They got that way from paying your bills, cleaning your clothes and listening to you talk about how cool you thought you were. So before you save the rain forest from the parasites of your parent's generation, try delousing the closet in your own room.
Author: Bill Gates

Quote: And yet,to say the truth, reason and love keep little company together nowadays.
Author: William Shakespeare,  A Midsummer Night's Dream

Quote: To educate a person in the mind but not in morals is to educate a menace to society.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: You may choose to look the other way but you can never say again that you did not know.
Author: William Wilberforce

Quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
Author: Seneca

Quote: Erre es korakas, Blinky!"Dionysus cursed. "I will have your soul!
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Last Olympian

Quote: Do you want me to tell you something really subversive? Love is everything it's cracked up to be. That's why people are so cynical about it. It really is worth fighting for, being brave for, risking everything for. And the trouble is, if you don't risk anything, you risk even more.
Author: Erica Jong,  Fear of Flying

Quote: Until one has loved an animal, a part of one's soul remains unawakened.
Author: Anatole France

Quote: If there was anything that depressed him more than his own cynicism, it was that quite often it still wasn't as cynical as real life.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Guards! Guards!

Quote: You must find the place inside yourself where nothing is impossible.
Author: Deepak Chopra

Quote: Always be wary of any helpful item that weighs less than its operating manual.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Jingo

Quote: It's not about how to achieve your dreams, it's about how to lead your life, ... If you lead your life the right way, the karma will take care of itself, the dreams will come to you.
Author: Randy Pausch,  The Last Lecture

Quote: The place to improve the world is first in one's own heart and head and hands, and then work outward from there.
Author: Robert M. Pirsig,  Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry Into Values

Quote: Love is not a maybe thing, you know when you love someone.
Author: Lauren Conrad

Quote: Things do not change; we change.
Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden

Quote: If you start by promising what you don't even have yet, you'll lose your desire to work towards getting it.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

Quote: I never made a mistake in my life; at least, never one that I couldn't explain away afterwards.
Author: Rudyard Kipling,  Under The Deodars

Quote: That was the funniest thing I'd heard in days.You're kidding, right? PLEASE tell me you have a stronger motive for me than 'fair is fair.' Life isn't FAIR, Dean....Nothing is fair, EVER. That's the stupidest thing I've ever heard. I need to help you because FAIR IS FAIR? Try, 'I need you to help me so I won't rip out your spine and beat you with it.' I MIGHT respond to that. MAYBE.
Author: James Patterson,  School's Out—Forever

Quote: I will follow you to the ends of the world.
Author: Khaled Hosseini,  A Thousand Splendid Suns

Quote: Neither love nor evil conquers all, but evil cheats more.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  Cerulean Sins

Quote: I love to sleep. Do you? Isn't it great? It really is the best of both worlds. You get to be alive and unconscious.
Author: Rita Rudner

Quote: The two most common elements in the universe are Hydrogen and stupidity.
Author: Harlan Ellison

Quote: I can tell you from experience that God's help and presence in our lives is vital. He is the Author of all true success and everything that is good-without Him, we can do nothing of true value.
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: I hope the two wings of the Democratic Party may flap together.
Author: William Jennings Bryan

Quote: We come into relationships often very much identified with our needs. I need this, I need security, I need refuge, I need friendship. And all of relationships are symbiotic in that sense. We come together because we fulfill each others' needs at some level or other.
Author: Ram Dass

Quote: I believe that a trusting attitude and a patient attitude go hand in hand. You see, when you let go and learn to trust God, it releases joy in your life. And when you trust God, you're able to be more patient. Patience is not just about waiting for something... it's about how you wait, or your attitude while waiting.
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: I need a woman to have a quirky sense of humor. There's a bunch of jokes I use, and if she doesn't get them, she's probably not for me.
Author: Matthew Perry

Quote: That's the great thing about art. Anybody can do it if you just believe. With practice, you can make great paintings.
Author: Damien Hirst

Quote: I love you"I say."I love you, too"he says. "I'll see you soon.
Author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant

Quote: Do not swear by the moon, for she changes constantly. then your love would also change.
Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet

Quote: Once I had a rose named after me and I was very flattered. But I was not pleased to read the description in the catalogue: "No good in a bed, but fine up against a wall.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: I don't want to hurt you or anybody so please forget about me. Just try. Find yourself a better friend.
Author: Nina LaCour,  Hold Still

Quote: People were always getting ready for tomorrow. I didn't believe in that. Tomorrow wasn't getting ready for them. It didn't even know they were there.
Author: Cormac McCarthy,  The Road

Quote: Sex without love is a meaningless experience, but as far as meaningless experiences go its pretty damn good.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: You're alive, Bod. That means you have infinite potential. You can do anything, make anything, dream anything. If you can change the world, the world will change. Potential. Once you're dead, it's gone. Over. You've made what you've made, dreamed your dream, written your name. You may be buried here, you may even walk. But that potential is finished.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Graveyard Book

Quote: If our Founding Fathers wanted us to care about the rest of the world, they wouldn't have declared their independence from it.
Author: Stephen Colbert

Quote: When I write, I feel like an armless, legless man with a crayon in his mouth.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: What the superior man seeks is in himself; what the small man seeks is in others.
Author: Confucius

Quote: It wasn't until I started reading and found books they wouldn't let us read in school that I discovered you could be insane and happy and have a good life without being like everybody else.
Author: John Waters

Quote: Wasn't that the point of the book? For women to realize, We are just two people. Not that much separates us. Not nearly as much as I'd thought.
Author: Kathryn Stockett,  The Help

Quote: I quote others only in order the better to express myself.
Author: Michel de Montaigne,  The Complete Essays

Quote: They're book addicts.
Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Miserable Mill

Quote: Brevity is the soul of lingerie.
Author: Dorothy Parker,  While Rome Burns

Quote: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.
Author: Jeanne d'Arc

Quote: Surround yourself only with people who are going to take you higher.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: Mythologically speaking, if there's anything I hate worse than trios of old ladies, it's bulls. Last summer, I fought the Minotaur on top of Half-Blood Hill. This time what I saw up there was even worse: two bulls. And not just regular bulls - bronze ones the size of elephants. And even that wasn't bad enough. Naturally they had to breathe fire, too.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Sea of Monsters

Quote: what a luxury it was for people to hold their loved ones whenever they wanted
Author: Cecelia Ahern,  P.S. I Love You

Quote: Life gives us choices. You either grab on with both hands and just go for it, or you sit on the sidelines.
Author: Christine Feehan,  Night Game

Quote: I want to live my life in such a way that when I get out of bed in the morning, the devil says, "aw shit, he's up!
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

Quote: It's a good idea to have your own books with you in a strange place
Author: Cornelia Funke,  Inkheart

Quote: What if you find your soul mate... at the wrong time?
Author: Lauren Kate,  Passion

Quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
Author: Anne Frank

Quote: Life affords no higher pleasure than that of surmounting difficulties, passing from one step of success to another, forming new wishes and seeing them gratified.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: I'm so thankful for the active obedience of Christ. No hope without it.
Author: John Gresham Machen

Quote: Conjugal love, or the friendship of spouses, can persist even after sexual desires have weakened, withered, and disappeared.
Author: Mortimer Adler

Quote: I like to be lazy. I do like to be busy and really active, but when that's done, you can be sure I will be a lazy boy. I like to take time and relax and enjoy life.
Author: Olivier Theyskens

Quote: I'm a huge NASCAR fan, but I'm not a gearhead. I've never been into fixing cars. It's not because I don't like it. I would love to know more. It's just my dad never taught me that stuff because my dad wasn't a mechanic.
Author: Larry the Cable Guy

Quote: I'm a huge Muppets fan. Gigantic. I think they're genius. I think they're some of the best work out there and completely underrated, just because of how genius they are. I love that kind of humor. It's so innocent but brilliant.
Author: Andie MacDowell

Quote: Even though you can't expect to defeat the absurdity of the world, you must make the attempt. That's morality, that's religion, that's art, that's life.
Author: Phil Ochs

Quote: How terribly sad it was that people are made in such a way that they get used to something as extraordinary as living.
Author: Jostein Gaarder,  The Solitaire Mystery

Quote: One should always be in love. That's the reason one should never marry.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: This is Leo. I'm the... What's my title? Am I like, admiral, or captain, or...""Repair boy.""Very funny, Piper.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Son of Neptune

Quote: I love books, by the way, way more than movies. Movies tell you what to think. A good book lets you choose a few thoughts for yourself.
Author: Karen Marie Moning,  Darkfever

Quote: Missing someone, they say, is self-centered.I self-center you more than ever.
Author: Saša Stanišić,  How the Soldier Repairs the Gramophone

Quote: See, as much as you want to hold on to the bitter sore memory that someone has left this world, you are still in it
Author: Jodi Picoult,  My Sister's Keeper

Quote: ...inside every old person is a young person wondering what happened.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Moving Pictures

Quote: I'm tired of this back-slappin' "isn't humanity neat"bullshit. We're a virus with shoes.
Author: Bill Hicks

Quote: Sometimes it's not enough to know what things mean, sometimes you have to know what things don't mean.
Author: Bob Dylan

Quote: It was at that agethat poetry came in search of me.
Author: Pablo Neruda,  Twenty Love Poems and a Song of Despair

Quote: I've got the key to my castle in the air, but whether I can unlock the door remains to be seen.
Author: Louisa May Alcott,  Little Women

Quote: Sometimes we love with nothing more than hope. Sometimes we cry with everything except tears.
Author: Gregory David Roberts,  Shantaram

Quote: Even if there is only one possible unified theory, it is just a set of rules and equations. What is it that breathes fire into the equations and makes a universe for them to describe? The usual approach of science of constructing a mathematical model cannot answer the questions of why there should be a universe for the model to describe. Why does the universe go to all the bother of existing?
Author: Stephen Hawking,  A Brief History of Time

Quote: Yes, the long war on Christianity. I pray that one day we may live in an America where Christians can worship freely! In broad daylight! Openly wearing the symbols of their religion... perhaps around their necks? And maybe -- dare I dream it? -- maybe one day there can be an openly Christian President. Or, perhaps, 43 of them. Consecutively.
Author: Jon Stewart

Quote: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV,  The Art of Happiness

Quote: The hard part about writing a novel is finishing it.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: To fall in love with God is the greatest romance; to seek him the greatest adventure; to find him, the greatest human achievement.
Author: Augustine of Hippo

Quote: He loved her, of course, but better than that, he chose her, day after day. Choice: that was the thing.
Author: Sherman Alexie,  The Toughest Indian in the World

Quote: We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: I would never die for my beliefs because I might be wrong.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: Although I was able to maintain a pleasant expression, I was mentally throwing up in her face.
Author: Augusten Burroughs

Quote: I want to lose weight by eating nothing but moon pies, which have significantly less gravity than earthier foods such as fruits and vegetables.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want

Quote: When you see a good person, think of becoming like her/him. When you see someone not so good, reflect on your own weak points.
Author: Confucius

Quote: His hands are holding my cheeks, and he pulls back just to look me in the eye and his chest is heaving and he says, "I think,"he says, "my heart is going to explode,"and I wish, more than ever, that I knew how to capture moments like these and revisit them forever. Because this.This is everything.
Author: Tahereh Mafi,  Ignite Me

Quote: Nothing is real.
Author: John Lennon,  Beatles Lyrics

Quote: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.
Author: William James

Quote: If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quote: Success is never final, but failure can be.
Author: Bill Parcells

Quote: I try to make my life about service, and hope that one day we can all 'see' a little better because God is with everyone and everywhere.
Author: Russell Simmons

Quote: Aristotle uses a mother's love for her child as the prime example of love or friendship.
Author: Mortimer Adler

Quote: I feel I am lucky. I am grateful for this life that God has given me. I am happy, as I am getting to do work that I want to do and enjoy doing it.
Author: Sonam Kapoor

Quote: When I was a kid, I loved 'The Curse of Frankenstein,' 'The Creeping Unknown,' 'X: The Unknown.' I love 'Forbidden Planet,' 'The Thing from Another World.' They were science fiction/horror movies, generally.
Author: John Carpenter

Quote: Sometimes Americans don't quite get my sense of humor. My good ol' British sarcasm seems to go over their heads.
Author: Lee Westwood

Quote: I think the key to great art and great artists is to just fully be yourself and not be scared of that, and be the extremes of your personality. Show the extremes of your personality and embrace the imperfections. Embrace the things about yourself that you might not like.
Author: King Tuff

Quote: Z: "You know, this was a hell of a lot easier when you were out cold in the back of that truck."Phury: "That was you?"Z:"You think it was Santa Claus or some shit?
Author: J.R. Ward,  Lover Awakened

Quote: I carry death in my left pocket. Sometimes I take it out and talk to it: "Hello, baby, how you doing? When you coming for me? I'll be ready.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: I wanted to explain that I am constantly overestimating and underestimating the human race - that rarely do I even simply estimate it. I wanted to ask her how the same thing could be so ugly and so glorious, and its words and stories so damning and brilliant...I AM HAUNTED BY HUMANS.
Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

Quote: The poetry of the earth is never dead.
Author: John Keats

Quote: He knew one of the women well, and had shared his universe with her. They had seen the same mountains, and the same trees, although each of them had seem them differently. She knew his weaknesses, his moments of hatred, of despair. Yet she was there at his side. They shared the same universe.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Valkyries

Quote: I've been saying it so long to you, you just wouldn't listen. Every time you said 'Farm Boy do this' you thought I was answering 'As you wish' but that's only because you were hearing wrong. 'I love you' was what it was, but you never heard.
Author: William Goldman,  The Princess Bride

Quote: If we ever forget that we're one nation under God, then we will be one nation gone under.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: Haven't you ever heard that modesty is an attractive trait?""Only from ugly people,"Jace confided. "The meek may inherit the earth, but at the moment it belongs to the conceited. Like me."He winked at the girls, who giggled and hid behind their hair.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

Quote: Being a detective isn't all about torture and murder and monsters. Sometimes it gets truly unpleasant...The fate of the world may depend on whether or not you can bring yourself to visit your relatives.
Author: Derek Landy

Quote: I go to school, but I never learn what I want to know.
Author: Bill Watterson,  The Authoritative Calvin And Hobbes

Quote: If we're going to the Silent City, you might want to get dressed. I mean, I appreciate the bra-and-panties look, but I don't know if the Silent Brothers will. There are only a few of the left, and I don't want them to die of excitement.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Fallen Angels

Quote: Close your eyes and I'll kiss you, Tomorrow I'll miss you.
Author: Paul McCartney

Quote: Any happiness, no matter how brief, seemed better than the long, simmering torture of waking up day after day, knowing I could never have him.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,  Crescendo

Quote: Life is made of so many moments that mean nothing. Then one day, a single moment comes along to define every second that comes after. Such moments are tests of courage, of strength.
Author: Sabaa Tahir,  An Ember in the Ashes

Quote: It's time to start living the life you've imagined.
Author: Henry James

Quote: Your mail could've waited."Daemon followed me into the kitchen. "What is it? Just books?"Grabbing the OJ from the fridge, I sighed. People who didn't heart books didn't understand.
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,  Onyx

Quote: Be the one who nurtures and builds. Be the one who has an understanding and a forgiving heart one who looks for the best in people. Leave people better than you found them.
Author: Marvin J. Ashton

Quote: I had rather hear my dog bark at a crow, than a man swear he loves me.
Author: William Shakespeare,  Much Ado About Nothing

Quote: We all live with the objective of being happy; our lives are all different and yet the same.
Author: Anne Frank

Quote: Perhaps I know best why it is man alone who laughs; he alone suffers so deeply that he had to invent laughter.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: So I placed my heart under lock and key To take some time, and take care of me But I turn around and you're standing here
Author: Deborah Cox

Quote: When a man cannot choose, he ceases to be a man.
Author: Anthony Burgess,  A Clockwork Orange

Quote: When the sun is shining I can do anything; no mountain is too high, no trouble too difficult to overcome.
Author: Wilma Rudolph

Quote: Positivity is such a high predicator of success rates.
Author: Shawn Achor

Quote: It's sad when you can't make everyone happy, though. It's impossible but, at the same time, you still hope. You think, 'Maybe I can do it,' but you know you can't. But gosh, if I had to rely on giving people what they wanted, I would have had to write 40 billion different books and even then, I wouldn't get it right.
Author: Stephenie Meyer

Quote: You've got to reach a hand of friendship across the aisle and across philosophies in this country.
Author: Joe Biden

Quote: I think people should have fun. And don't get so down on yourself. Enjoy life and be the best person you can be.
Author: Keke Palmer

Quote: I love Amsterdam. The city is vibrant and alive. It's fresh and so open. It's definitely one of my favorite places.
Author: Stefon Harris

Quote: Working on newspapers, you're writing to a certain length, often very brief pieces; you tend to look for easy forms of humor - women can't drive, things like that. That's about the level of a lot of newspaper humor. It becomes a form of laziness.
Author: Tom Wolfe

Quote: All I know is movies; I went to school, but movies are my reference point for everything. I figured I'd have to P.A. or intern in the art department. Because the filmmaking process is so many people creating to make one piece of magic, so I've always wanted to be involved. With the acting, I doubted it.
Author: Jordan Ladd

Quote: Being happy doesn't mean that everything is perfect. It means that you've decided to look beyond the imperfections.
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: To be brave is to love someone unconditionally, without expecting anything in return. To just give. That takes courage, because we don't want to fall on our faces or leave ourselves open to hurt.
Author: Madonna

Quote: The problem with people is they forget that most of the time it's the small things that count.
Author: Jennifer Niven,  All the Bright Places

Quote: Taking pictures is savoring life intensely, every hundredth of a second.
Author: Marc Riboud

Quote: If our destiny stems from our name, then I weep for the flower named Wilt.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  It Occurred to Me

Quote: And if there were a God, I think it very unlikely that He would have such an uneasy vanity as to be offended by those who doubt His existence
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: Grand. There's a word I really hate. It's a phony. I could puke every time I hear it.
Author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye

Quote: I want to go to sleep in my time machine and wake up eight hours in the future.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: A friend of mine once defined love as finding someone you can talk to late into the night
Author: James Patterson

Quote: I was always an unusual girl.My mother told me I had a chameleon soul, no moral compass pointing due north, no fixed personality; just an inner indecisiveness that was as wide and as wavering as the ocean.
Author: Lana Del Rey

Quote: Darling, when things go wrong in life, you lift your chin, put on a ravishing smile, mix yourself a little cocktail...
Author: Sophie Kinsella

Quote: Adam is crying and somewhere inside of me I am crying, too, because I'm feeling things at last. I'm feeling not just the physical pain, but all that I have lost, and it is profound and catastrophic and will leave a crater in me that nothing will ever fill.
Author: Gayle Forman,  If I Stay

Quote: Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: What should young people do with their lives today? Many things, obviously. But the most daring thing is to create stable communities in which the terrible disease of loneliness can be cured.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Palm Sunday: An Autobiographical Collage

Quote: She cast her fragrance and her radiance over me. I ought never to have run away from her... I ought to have guessed all the affection that lay behind her poor little stratagems. Flowers are so inconsistent! But I was too young to know how to love her...
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince

Quote: It's one thing to fall in love. It's another to feel someone else fall in love with you, and to feel a responsibility toward that love.
Author: David Levithan,  Every Day

Quote: I wanted to tell her everything, maybe if I'd been able to, we could have lived differently, maybe I'd be there with you now instead of here. Maybe... if I'd said, 'I'm so afraid of losing something I love that I refuse to love anything,' maybe that would have made the impossible possible. Maybe, but I couldn't do it, I had buried too much too deeply inside me. And here I am, instead of there.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

Quote: But you can't make people listen. They have to come round in their own time, wondering what happened and why the world blew up around them. It can't last.
Author: Ray Bradbury,  Fahrenheit 451

Quote: Statistically speaking, there is a 65 percent chance that the love of your life is having an affair. Be very suspicious.
Author: Scott Dikkers,  You Are Worthless: Depressing Nuggets of Wisdom Sure to Ruin Your Day

Quote: the time is always right to do the right thing
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: A woman, especially if she have the misfortune of knowing anything, should conceal it as well as she can.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: CALVIN:This whole Santa Claus thing just doesn't make sense. Why all the secrecy? Why all the mystery?If the guy exists why doesn't he ever show himself and prove it?And if he doesn't exist what's the meaning of all this?HOBBES:I dunno. Isn't this a religious holiday? CALVIN:Yeah, but actually, I've got the same questions about God.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: Six hundred and forty fish later, the only thing I know is everything you love will die. The first time you meet someone special, you can count on them one day being dead and in the ground.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Survivor

Quote: Rich people have small TVs and big libraries, and poor people have small libraries and big TVs.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: I've said for a long time, clearly the - a, a critical key to success in the region is going to be Pakistan and our relationship with Pakistan, which was one that was broken in the late '80s and which we've worked hard to restore.
Author: Michael Mullen

Quote: The hope of a new politics does not lie in formulating a left-wing reply to the right-it lies in rejecting conventional political categories.
Author: Christopher Lasch

Quote: To some it may be a thrill to be known, to me it's a thrill to start a friendship even up.
Author: Christopher Knight

Quote: I have lived pain, and my life can tell: I only deepen the wound of the world when I neglect to give thanks the heavy perfume of wild roses in early July and the song of crickets on summer humid nights and the rivers that run and the stars that rise and the rain that falls and all the good things that a good God gives.
Author: Ann Voskamp

Quote: Christmas, my child, is love in action. Every time we love, every time we give, it's Christmas.
Author: Dale Evans

Quote: When I look at a lot of older stuff that I've written, I think one sign of amateur humor writing is when you see people trying too hard.
Author: David Sedaris

Quote: That's something I learned in art school. I studied graphic design in Germany, and my professor emphasized the responsibility that designers and illustrators have towards the people they create things for.
Author: Eric Carle

Quote: The Simple PathSilence is PrayerPrayer is FaithFaith is LoveLove is ServiceThe Fruit of Service is Peace
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: So much of the language of love was like that: you devoured someone with your eyes, you drank in the sight of him, you swallowed him whole. Love was substance, broken down and beating through your bloodstream.
Author: Jodi Picoult,  Nineteen Minutes

Quote: Heaven can be found in the most unlikely corners.
Author: Mitch Albom,  The Five People You Meet in Heaven - Meniti Bianglala

Quote: I challenge anyone to understand Islam, its spirit, and not to love it. It is a beautiful religion of brotherhood and devotion.
Author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi

Quote: Read not to contradict and confute; nor to believe and take for granted; nor to find talk and discourse; but to weigh and consider. Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested: that is, some books are to be read only in parts, others to be read, but not curiously, and some few to be read wholly, and with diligence and attention.
Author: Francis Bacon,  The Essays

Quote: It doesn't have to be on Valentine's Day. It doesn't have to be by the time you turn eighteen or thirty-three or fifty-nine. It doesn't have to conform to whatever is usual. It doesn't have to be kismet at once, or rhapsody by the third date.It just has to be. In time. In place. In spirit.It just has to be.
Author: David Levithan

Quote: I celebrated Thanksgiving in an old-fashioned way. I invited everyone in my neighborhood to my house, we had an enormous feast, and then I killed them and took their land.
Author: Jon Stewart

Quote: Don't join the book burners. Don't think you're going to conceal faults by concealing evidence that they ever existed. Don't be afraid to go in your library and read every book...
Author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

Quote: And you can't love, not fully, unless you are loved in return.
Author: Lauren Oliver,  Requiem

Quote: I didn't know that idiocy caused people to just start spontaneously bleeding from the nose.
Author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant

Quote: She was right about something else too,"Dimitri said after a long pause. My back was to him, but there was a strange quality to his voice that made me turn around."What's that?"I asked."That I do still love you."With that one sentence, everything in the universe changed.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Last Sacrifice

Quote: A good night sleep, or a ten minute bawl, or a pint of chocolate ice cream, or all three together, is good medicine.
Author: Ray Bradbury,  Dandelion Wine

Quote: Boys. I'd turn gay if they weren't so sexy.
Author: Rachel Caine,  The Dead Girls' Dance

Quote: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door
Author: Milton Berle

Quote: Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say yes.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: My happiness is not the means to any end. It is the end. It is its own goal. It is its own purpose.
Author: Ayn Rand,  Anthem

Quote: I don't want to be a tree; I want to be its meaning.
Author: Orhan Pamuk,  My Name is Red

Quote: All who joy would winMust share it -- Happiness was born a twin.
Author: George Gordon Byron,  Don Juan

Quote: Seeking what is true is not seeking what is desirable.
Author: Albert Camus,  The Myth of Sisyphus and Other Essays

Quote: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
Author: Baltasar Gracián,  The Art of Worldly Wisdom

Quote: When asked, "How do you write?"I invariably answer, "One word at a time,"and the answer is invariably dismissed. But that is all it is. It sounds too simple to be true, but consider the Great Wall of China, if you will: one stone at a time, man. That's all. One stone at a time. But I've read you can see that motherfucker from space without a telescope.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Fresh is better. But you've never drunk fresh blood. Have you?"Simon raised his eyebrow in response."Well, aside from mine of course,"Jace said. "And I'm pretty sure my blood is fan-tastic.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Glass

Quote: The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts.
Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations

Quote: Game shows are designed to make us feel better about the random, useless facts that are all we have left of our education.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Invisible Monsters

Quote: I never could have achieved the success that I have without setting physical activity and health goals.
Author: Bonnie Blair

Quote: I don't want to tell your story because you're a insensitive, self-centered moron. I've told a lot of stories about young people, and I always feel there's hope.
Author: Joel Schumacher

Quote: I've learned that friendship does not equate business, business does not equate friendship.
Author: Jill Scott

Quote: Going by my past journey, I am not certain where life will take me, what turns and twists will happen; nobody knows where they will end up. As life changes direction, I'll flow with it.
Author: Katrina Kaif

Quote: I love the diversity of America. I love the plain, normal sense of humor Americans have. It is not wicked, like in some countries. And I also love how new America is.
Author: Antonio Banderas

Quote: Art doesn't interest me. Only artists interest me.
Author: Marcel Duchamp

Quote: When you love you wish to do things for. You wish to sacrifice for. You wish to serve.
Author: Ernest Hemingway,  A Farewell to Arms

Quote: Such short little lives our pets have to spend with us, and they spend most of it waiting for us to come home each day. It is amazing how much love and laughter they bring into our lives and even how much closer we become with each other because of them.
Author: John Grogan,  Marley and Me: Life and Love With the World's Worst Dog

Quote: God's Final Message to His Creation:'We apologize for the inconvenience.
Author: Douglas Adams,  So Long, and Thanks for All the Fish

Quote: On the whole human beings want to be good, but not too good, and not quite all the time.
Author: George Orwell,  All Art is Propaganda: Critical Essays

Quote: We may ignore, but we can nowhere evade the presence of God. The world is crowded with Him. He walks everywhere incognito.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Stay with me.Always.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay

Quote: Oh Jake,"Brett said, "We could have had such a damned good time together."Ahead was a mounted policeman in khaki directing traffic. He raised his baton. The car slowed suddenly, pressing Brett against me.Yes,"I said. "Isn't it pretty to think so?
Author: Ernest Hemingway,  The Sun Also Rises

Quote: Down on the lake rosy reflections of celestial vapor appeared, and I said, "God, I love you"and looked to the sky and really meant it. "I have fallen in love with you, God. Take care of us all, one way or the other."To the children and the innocent it's all the same.
Author: Jack Kerouac,  The Dharma Bums

Quote: I know because I read...Your mind is not a cage. It's a garden. And it requires cultivating.
Author: Libba Bray

Quote: You can only be in a bad mood for so long before you have to face up to the fact that it isn't a bad mood at all; it's just your sucky personality.
Author: Megan McCafferty,  Sloppy Firsts

Quote: Happiness. It was the place where passion, with all its dazzle and drumbeat, met something softer: homecoming and safety and pure sunbeam comfort. It was all those things, intertwined with the heat and the thrill, and it was as bright within her as a swallowed star.
Author: Laini Taylor,  Daughter of Smoke & Bone

Quote: Failed relationships can be described as so much wasted make-up.
Author: Marian Keyes,  Watermelon

Quote: If you aren't cute, you may as well be clever.
Author: David Sedaris,  Me Talk Pretty One Day

Quote: It is the possibility that keeps me going, and though you may call me a dreamer or a fool or any other thing, I believe that anything is possible.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: But maybe you never really had someone, she thought now. Maybe, no matter how much you loved them, they could slip through your fingers like water, and there was nothing you could do about it.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Fallen Angels

Quote: Be believing, be happy, don't get discouraged. Things will work out.
Author: Gordon B. Hinckley

Quote: Deliver me from writers who say the way they live doesn't matter. I'm not sure a bad person can write a good book. If art doesn't make us better, then what on earth is it for.
Author: Alice Walker

Quote: Ah, how good it is to be among people who are reading.
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  The Notebooks of Malte Laurids Brigge

Quote: When you look for a man- what you want to look for is a man with the heart of a poor boy and the mind of a conqueror.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: How hurtful it can be to deny one's true self and live a life of lies just to appease others.
Author: June Ahern

Quote: When you love someone, you don't have a choice. Love takes your choices away.- Clary Fray
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

Quote: The worst memories stick with us, while the nice ones always seem to slip through our fingers.
Author: Rachel Vincent,  My Soul to Save

Quote: Bermimpilah, karena Tuhan akan memeluk mimpi-mimpi itu.
Author: Andrea Hirata,  Sang Pemimpi

Quote: Whenever you're successful you owe that success to the people in the community, because they are the ones buying your product.
Author: Carl Karcher

Quote: I hope that through my example, such as my role on 'The West Wing,' I can help change attitudes on deafness and prove we can really do everything... except hear.
Author: Marlee Matlin

Quote: I really think that technology has the greatest potential to accelerate happiness of most things in the world. The companies that will ultimately do well are the companies that chase happiness. If you find a way to help people find love, or health or friendship, the dollar will chase that.
Author: Ashton Kutcher

Quote: Freedom means you are unobstructed in living your life as you choose. Anything less is a form of slavery.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: Love can do much, but duty more.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: I don't think arrested-adolescent humor will fade. Maybe the form will change, but I guarantee its replacement will still be based in immature behavior from mature figures.
Author: Adam McKay

Quote: I think the art fair is very much a form of urbanism. I think something really happens to the cities when such a fair happens. The city becomes an exhibition; it's amazing.
Author: Hans-Ulrich Obrist

Quote: The three great essentials to achieve anything worthwhile are, first, hard work; second, stick-to-itiveness; third, common sense.
Author: Thomas A. Edison

Quote: I've been lucky. Opportunities don't often come along. So, when they do, you have to grab them.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: I want my time to be taken up by chores, errands, appointments, and arguments. In other words, I want to get married.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want

Quote: The truth is not for all men but only for those who seek it.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: I was waiting for the longest time, she said. I thought you forgot.It is hard to forget, I said, when there is such an empty space when you are gone.
Author: Brian Andreas,  Story People: Selected Stories & Drawings of Brian Andreas

Quote: He sighed and then focused his eyes right on me. It was like drowning, drowning in seas of green. There was nothing in the world except for those eyes."I want to kiss you, Rose,"he said softly. "And I want you to want me too.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Shadow Kiss

Quote: Goodbyes, they often come in waves.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  $3.33

Quote: A kind gesture can reach a wound that only compassion can heal.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

Quote: I'll find you. There is no place in this world you can hide from me. I'm watching.Love, Dimitri
Author: Richelle Mead,  Spirit Bound

Quote: Hello, Minister!"bellowed Percy, sending a neat jinx straight at Thicknesse, who dropped his wand and clawed at the front of his robes, apparently in awful discomfort. "Did I mention I'm resigning?
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Quote: The scientist is not a person who gives the right answers, he's one who asks the right questions.
Author: Claude Lévi-Strauss

Quote: Being rich is not about how much money you have or how many homes you own; it's the freedom to buy any book you want without looking at the price and wondering if you can afford it.
Author: John Waters,  Role Models

Quote: To answer your question, you want me because I'm made of awesome.
Author: Gena Showalter,  Heart of Darkness

Quote: It seems to me that if you or I must choose between two courses of thought or action, we should remember our dying and try so to live that our death brings no pleasure to the world.
Author: John Steinbeck,  East of Eden

Quote: She's my kitten, and no one else's.
Author: Jeaniene Frost,  One Foot in the Grave

Quote: The tears of the world are a constant quantity. For each one who begins to weep somewhere else another stops. The same is true of the laugh.
Author: Samuel Beckett,  Waiting for Godot

Quote: FEAR stands for fuck everything and run.
Author: Stephen King,  Doctor Sleep

Quote: Don't limit yourself. Many people limit themselves to what they think they can do. You can go as far as your mind lets you. What you believe, remember, you can achieve.
Author: Mary Kay Ash

Quote: It is true that the aristocracies seem to have abused their monopoly of legal knowledge; and at all events their exclusive possession of the law was a formidable impediment to the success of those popular movements which began to be universal in the western world.
Author: Henry James Sumner Maine

Quote: I did this book 'Harvest for Hope,' and I learned so much about food. And one thing I learned is that we have the guts not of a carnivore, but of an herbivore. Herbivore guts are very long because they have to get the last bit of nutrition out of leaves and things.
Author: Jane Goodall

Quote: All who consult on doubtful matters, should be void of hatred, friendship, anger, and pity.
Author: Sallust

Quote: Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.
Author: George Eliot

Quote: Putting a little time aside for clean fun and good humor is very necessary to relieve the tensions of our time.
Author: Hattie McDaniel

Quote: And that's what art is, a form in which people can reflect on who we are as human beings and come to some understanding of this journey we are on.
Author: Wendell Pierce

Quote: This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV,  The Dalai Lama: A Policy of Kindness: An Anthology of Writings By and About the Dalai Lama

Quote: I don't like it when I outweigh my men.
Author: Patricia Briggs,  Moon Called

Quote: That's when I finally got it. I finally understood. It wasn't the thought that counted. It was the actual execution that mattered, the showing up for somebody. The intent behind it wasn't enough. Not for me. Not anymore. It wasn't enough to know that deep down, he loved me. You had to actually say it to somebody, show them you cared. And he just didn't. Not enough.
Author: Jenny Han,  It's Not Summer Without You

Quote: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
Author: Harriet Tubman

Quote: It doesn't matter if they hate you, or embarrass you, or simply don't appreciate your genius for inventing the internet-""You invented the internet?"It was my idea, Martha said.Rats are delicious, George said."It was my idea!"Hermes said. "I mean the internet, not the rats. But that's not the point.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Sea of Monsters

Quote: Knowing can be a curse on a person's life. I'd traded in a pack of lies for a pack of truth, and I didn't know which one was heavier. Which one took the most strength to carry around? It was a ridiculous question, though, because once you know the truth, you can't ever go back and pick up your suitcase of lies. Heavier or not, the truth is yours now.
Author: Sue Monk Kidd,  The Secret Life of Bees:

Quote: If you cannot read all your books...fondle them---peer into them, let them fall open where they will, read from the first sentence that arrests the eye, set them back on the shelves with your own hands, arrange them on your own plan so that you at least know where they are. Let them be your friends; let them, at any rate, be your acquaintances.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: Love is always open arms. If you close your arms about love you will find that you are left holding only yourself.
Author: Leo Buscaglia

Quote: You show me a capitalist, and I'll show you a bloodsucker
Author: Malcolm X

Quote: The Reality of The Other Person Lies Not In What He Reveals To You, But What He Cannot Reveal To You.Therefore, If You Would Understand Him, Listen Not To What He Says, But Rather To What He Does Not Say.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: Everybody going to be dead one day, just give them time.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  Anansi Boys

Quote: When you get to the end of all the light you know and it's time to step into the darkness of the unknown, faith is knowing that one of two things shall happen: either you will be given something solid to stand on, or you will be taught how to fly.
Author: Edward Teller

Quote: And then the line was quite but not dead. I almost felt like he was there in my room with me, but in a way it was better, like I was not in my room and he was not in his, but instead we were together in some invisible and tenuous third space that could only be visited on the phone.
Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

Quote: If you can't do anything about it, laugh like hell.
Author: David Cook

Quote: We are all connected; To each other, biologically. To the earth, chemically. To the rest of the universe atomically.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: The great object of life is sensation- to feel that we exist, even though in pain.
Author: George Gordon Byron

Quote: I want everything with you, America. I want the holidays and the birthdays, the busy season and lazy weekends. I want peanut butter fingertips on my desk. I want inside jokes and fights and everything. I want a life with you.
Author: Kiera Cass,  The One

Quote: It takes three to make love, not two: you, your spouse, and God. Without God people only succeed in bringing out the worst in one another. Lovers who have nothing else to do but love each other soon find there is nothing else. Without a central loyalty life is unfinished.
Author: Fulton J. Sheen,  Seven Words of Jesus and Mary: Lessons from Cana and Calvary

Quote: Crap, are you thinking what I'm thinking?""I'm thinking we have about fifteen vampires and no blood,"Claire said. "Is that it?""No, I was thinking we're out of chips. Of course that's what I was thinking.
Author: Rachel Caine,  Feast of Fools

Quote: But magic is neither good nor evil. It is a tool, like a knife. Is a knife evil? Only if the wielder is evil.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The House of Hades

Quote: In the end, it wasn't death that surprised her but the stubbornness of life.
Author: Jeffrey Eugenides,  The Virgin Suicides

Quote: Love Jo all your days, if you choose, but don't let it spoil you, for it's wicked to throw away so many good gifts because you can't have the one you want.
Author: Louisa May Alcott,  Little Women

Quote: Love wins, love always wins.
Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie

Quote: There are so many things that demand to be said. Where did you go? Do you ever think about me? You've ruined me. Are you okay? But of course, I can't say any of that.
Author: Gayle Forman,  Where She Went

Quote: I love her, and that's the beginning and end of everything.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  Dear Scott, Dearest Zelda: The Love Letters of F. Scott and Zelda Fitzgerald

Quote: misgivings, n.Last night, I got up the courage to ask you if you regretted us. "There are things I miss,"you said. "But if I didn't have you, I'd miss more.
Author: David Levithan,  The Lover's Dictionary

Quote: Some people talk in their sleep. Lecturers talk while other people sleep
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: There is no happiness like that of being loved by your fellow creatures, and feeling that your presence is an addition to their comfort.
Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre

Quote: Friendship with oneself is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: How do I know you'll keep your word?"asked Coraline."I swear it,"said the other mother. "I swear it on my own mother's grave.""Does she have a grave?"asked Coraline."Oh yes,"said the other mother. "I put her in there myself. And when I found her trying to crawl out, I put her back.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  Coraline

Quote: In time, in time they tell me, I'll not feel so bad. I don't want time to heal me. There's a reason I'm like this.I want time to set me ugly and knotted with loss of you, marking me. I won't smooth you away.I can't say goodbye.
Author: China Miéville,  The Scar

Quote: In many cases when a reader puts a story aside because it 'got boring,' the boredom arose because the writer grew enchanted with his powers of description and lost sight of his priority, which is to keep the ball rolling.
Author: Stephen King,  On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft

Quote: Love doesn't mean anything if you're not willing to make a commitment, and you have to think not only about what you want, but about what he wants. Not just now, but in the future.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Safe Haven

Quote: Oh, love isn't there to make us happy. I believe it exists to show us how much we can endure.
Author: Hermann Hesse,  Wer lieben kann, ist glücklich. Über die Liebe

Quote: Definition of rock journalism: People who can't write, doing interviews with people who can't think, in order to prepare articles for people who can't read.
Author: Frank Zappa,  The Real Frank Zappa Book

Quote: Let us remember: One book, one pen, one child, and one teacher can change the world.
Author: Malala Yousafzai

Quote: The secret to success is good leadership, and good leadership is all about making the lives of your team members or workers better.
Author: Tony Dungy

Quote: Occupy Wall Street is meant more as a way of life that spreads through contagion, creates as many questions as it answers, aims to force a reconsideration of the way the nation does business and offers hope to those of us who previously felt alone in our belief that the current economic system is broken.
Author: Douglas Rushkoff

Quote: Like any friendship or marriage, familiarity breeds more contempt, and love, and everything.
Author: Martin Freeman

Quote: God had brought me to my knees and made me acknowledge my own nothingness, and out of that knowledge I had been reborn. I was no longer the centre of my life and therefore I could see God in everything.
Author: Bede Griffiths

Quote: One does not kill oneself for love of a woman, but because love - any love - reveals us in our nakedness, our misery, our vulnerability, our nothingness.
Author: Cesare Pavese

Quote: My favorite kind of humor is basically, if it was happening to you, it wouldn't be funny, but to observe it, it's hilarious.
Author: Bill Burr

Quote: The hours I spend with you I look upon as sort of a perfumed garden, a dim twilight, and a fountain singing to it. You and you alone make me feel that I am alive. Other men it is said have seen angels, but I have seen thee and thou art enough.
Author: George Edward Moore

Quote: i carry your heart with me(i carry it in my heart)
Author: E.E. Cummings,  Selected Poems

Quote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead. The consciousness of loving and being loved brings a warmth and a richness to life that nothing else can bring.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: You had to know a person well to make them laugh like that.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Prince

Quote: An appeaser is one who feeds a crocodile, hoping it will eat him last.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: Think, Believe, Dream, and Dare.
Author: Walt Disney Company

Quote: We are saved by faith alone, but the faith that saves is never alone.
Author: Martin Luther

Quote: Better to write for yourself and have no public, than to write for the public and have no self."[The New Statesman, February 25, 1933]
Author: Cyril Connolly

Quote: Be happy, but never satisfied.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: I think hiccup cures were really invented for the amusement of the patient's friends.
Author: Bill Watterson,  The Complete Calvin and Hobbes

Quote: Start by doing what is necessary, then what is possible, and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
Author: Francis of Assisi

Quote: wisdom comes to us when it can no longer do any good.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez,  Love in the Time of Cholera

Quote: A man who wants to die feels angry and full of life and desperate and bored and exhausted, all at the same time; he wants to fight everyone, and he wants to curl up in a ball and hide in a cupboard somewhere. He wants to say sorry to everyone, and he wants everyone to know just how badly they've all let him down.
Author: Nick Hornby,  A Long Way Down

Quote: Life, unfortunately, doesn't seem to care what we want.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Last Sacrifice

Quote: He looked so lost, so soulful, so lonely. I wanted him to kiss me now. I wanted to let him know I was his for all eternity.
Author: Ellen Schreiber,  Vampire Kisses

Quote: Words can never fully say what we want them to say, for they fumble, stammer, and break the best porcelain. The best one can hope for is to find along the way someone to share the path, content to walk in silence, for the heart communes best when it does not try to speak.
Author: Margaret Weis,  Dragons of a Lost Star

Quote: Life's great happiness is to be convinced we are loved.
Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables

Quote: If I shot an arrow and thought about an ass, would it surprise you if it hit Erik?
Author: P.C. Cast,  Tempted

Quote: I wasn't fooled. He was avoiding looking at me. "There's nothing to talk about.""I knew you'd say that. Actually, it was a toss-up between that and 'I don't know what you're talking about.'"Dimitri sighed.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Last Sacrifice

Quote: A woman needs a man like a fish needs a bicycle.
Author: Irina Dunn

Quote: You're supposed to say, 'All I want is your happiness. I'll do whatever it takes, even if it means being without you.'""Sorry,"Noah said. "I'm just not that big of a person.
Author: Michelle Hodkin,  The Unbecoming of Mara Dyer

Quote: I wish my stove came with a Save As button like Word has. That way I could experiment with my cooking and not fear ruining my dinner.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Who Moved My Choose?: An Amazing Way to Deal With Change by Deciding to Let Indecision Into Your Life

Quote: I'm the girl nobody knows until she commits suicide. Then suddenly everyone had a class with her.
Author: Tom Leveen,  Party

Quote: You cannot control what happens to you, but you can control your attitude toward what happens to you, and in that, you will be mastering change rather than allowing it to master you.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: If we can just let go and trust that things will work out they way they're supposed to, without trying to control the outcome, then we can begin to enjoy the moment more fully. The joy of the freedom it brings becomes more pleasurable than the experience itself.
Author: Goldie Hawn

Quote: There are things known and there are things unknownand in between are the doors.
Author: Jim Morrison,  Letters from Joe

Quote: Autumn is the hardest season. The leaves are all falling, and they're falling likethey're falling in love with the ground.
Author: Andrea Gibson

Quote: Whoa, who peed in your Cheerios?
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,  Crescendo

Quote: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I have no time for those who say there is no way Scotland could go it alone. I know first-hand the contribution Scotland and Scots make to Britain's success - so for me there's no question about whether Scotland could be an independent nation.
Author: David Cameron

Quote: If I can have the opportunity to go into an editing room, it's like the golden ticket for me. All I want is to learn about everything else in the filmmaking process. I just directed a music video which just came out and that'd sort of be the area of the field that I'm going to move into, I hope.
Author: Nikki Reed

Quote: One measure of friendship consists not in the number of things friends can discuss, but in the number of things they need no longer mention.
Author: Clifton Fadiman

Quote: It's a funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: I live and love in God's peculiar light.
Author: Michelangelo

Quote: I've got a great sense of humor, and if I'm able to say or do something in a movie that people feel like they want to repeat, that's hugely flattering.
Author: Matthew McConaughey

Quote: I wash my hands of those who imagine chattering to be knowledge, silence to be ignorance, and affection to be art.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quote: Can officially confirm that the way to a man's heart these days is not through beauty, food, sex, or alluringness of character, but merely the ability to seem not very interested in him.
Author: Helen Fielding,  Bridget Jones's Diary
