Quote: When you struggle with your partner, you are struggling with yourself. Every fault you see in them touches a denied weakness in yourself.
Author: Deepak Chopra

Quote: Do not go gentle.
Author: Ally Condie,  Matched

Quote: I wouldn't say I'm superficial, just averagely ficial.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  It Occurred to Me

Quote: It is sometimes easier to be happy if you don't know everything.
Author: Alexander McCall Smith,  Morality for Beautiful Girls

Quote: There is no greatness where there is not simplicity, goodness, and truth.
Author: Leo Tolstoy,  War and Peace

Quote: The best lies were always mixed with truth.
Author: Sarah J. Maas,  Crown of Midnight

Quote: Perhaps I can stay by the fire and mend your socks and scream if I hear any strange noises.
Author: Kristin Cashore,  Graceling

Quote: I cannot imagine a God who rewards and punishes the objects of his creation, whose purposes are modeled after our own -- a God, in short, who is but a reflection of human frailty. Neither can I believe that the individual survives the death of his body, although feeble souls harbor such thoughts through fear or ridiculous egotisms.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The creation of a thousand forests is in one acorn
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: My books are water; those of the great geniuses is wine. Everybody drinks water.
Author: Mark Twain,  Notebook

Quote: Ash is going to kick your ass, Daemon."Daemon's grin went up a notch. "Nah, she likes my ass too much for that.
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,  Obsidian

Quote: Souls cross ages like clouds cross skies, an' tho' a cloud's shape nor hue nor size don't stay the same, it's still a cloud an' so is a soul. Who can say where the cloud's blowed from or who the soul'll be 'morrow? Only Sonmi the east an' the west an' the compass an' the atlas, yay, only the atlas o' clouds.
Author: David Mitchell,  Cloud Atlas

Quote: Tonight was... well, it was perfect for me too. You've turned my world upside down. I've fallen in love with you, chica, and it scares the fuckin' shit outta me. I've been shakin' all night, because I knew it.I've tried to deny it, to make you think I wanted you as a fake girlfriend, but that was a lie.
Author: Simone Elkeles,  Rules of Attraction

Quote: You asked why I couldn't forgive you,"Nick said, very quietly, and I jumped a little. "It was because you were the love of my life, Harper. And you didn't want to be. That's hard to let go.
Author: Kristan Higgins,  My One and Only

Quote: You come of the Lord Adam and the Lady Eve,"said Aslan. "And that is both honour enough to erect the head of the poorest beggar, and shame enough to bow the shoulders of the greatest emperor on earth. Be content.
Author: C.S. Lewis,  Prince Caspian

Quote: We are all worms, But I do believe that I am a glow worm.
Author: Winston S. Churchill,  Never Give In!: The Best of Winston Churchill's Speeches

Quote: Nothing will work unless you do.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Any fool can make a ruleAnd any fool will mind it.
Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Journal #14

Quote: Think with your whole body.
Author: Taisen Deshimaru

Quote: I'm not bothered about what people say behind my back. I don't need to know about it. I believe in living my life and doing my work. God will give you success. And even if He doesn't, there's a lesson to be learnt.
Author: Rani Mukerji

Quote: When the Islamic revolution began in 1979 under the leadership of Ayatollah Khomeini, it aroused considerable admiration in the Arab street. It presented a model of organised popular action that deposed one of the region's most tyrannical regimes. The people of the region discerned in this revolution new hope for freedom and change.
Author: Wadah Khanfar

Quote: The value of life is not in its duration, but in its donation. You are not important because of how long you live, you are important because of how effective you live.
Author: Myles Munroe

Quote: Gestures, in love, are incomparably more attractive, effective and valuable than words.
Author: Francois Rabelais

Quote: If a dog doesn't put you first where are you both? In what relation? A dog needs God. It lives by your glances, your wishes. It even shares your humor. This happens about the fifth year. If it doesn't happen you are only keeping an animal.
Author: Enid Bagnold

Quote: It's clever, but is it Art?
Author: Rudyard Kipling

Quote: We cannot be sure of having something to live for unless we are willing to die for it.
Author: Ernesto Che Guevara

Quote: Why, man, he doth bestride the narrow worldLike a Colossus; and we petty menWalk under his huge legs, and peep aboutTo find ourselves dishonourable graves.
Author: William Shakespeare,  Julius Caesar

Quote: Better to sleep with a sober cannibal than a drunk Christian.
Author: Herman Melville,  Moby-Dick; or, The Whale

Quote: Now it was just the three of us: the leader, the warrior, and the kid about to wet his pants. Guess who I was.
Author: D.J. MacHale

Quote: You can't be brave if you've only had wonderful things happen to you.
Author: Mary Tyler Moore

Quote: The only obsession everyone wants: 'love.' People think that in falling in love they make themselves whole? The Platonic union of souls? I think otherwise. I think you're whole before you begin. And the love fractures you. You're whole, and then you're cracked open.
Author: Philip Roth,  The Dying Animal

Quote: I love the ground under his feet, and the air over his head, and everything he touches and every word he says. I love all his looks, and all his actions and him entirely and all together.
Author: Emily Brontë

Quote: No matter where it is in the sky... No matter where you are in the world... the moon is never bigger than your thumb. -John
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Dear John

Quote: Before, I wanted to say: "I found love!"But now, I want to say: "I found a person. And he belongs to me and I belong to him.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: I began to realize how important it was to be an enthusiast in life. He taught me that if you are interested in something, no matter what it is, go at it at full speed ahead. Embrace it with both arms, hug it, love it and above all become passionate about it. Lukewarm is no good. Hot is no good either. White hot and passionate is the only thing to be.
Author: Roald Dahl,  My Uncle Oswald

Quote: Do not do that again,"he said stiffly."Don't kiss me back then,"I retorted.He stared at me for what seemed like forever. "I don't give 'Zen lessons' to hear myself talk. I don't give them because you're another student. I'm doing this to teach you control.""You're doing a great job,"I said bitterly.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Frostbite

Quote: Perhaps the logical conclusion of everyone looking the same is everyone thinking the same.
Author: Scott Westerfeld,  Uglies

Quote: And yet another moral occurs to me now: Make love when you can. It's good for you.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Mother Night

Quote: When you feel someone else's pain and joy as powerfully as if it were your own, then you know you really loved them.
Author: Ann Brashares,  Girls In Pants: The Third Summer of the Sisterhood

Quote: I was in the biggest breakdown of my life when I stopped crying long enough to let the words of my epiphany really sink in. That whore, karma, had finally made her way around, and had just bitch-slapped me right across the face. The realization only made me cry harder.
Author: Jennifer Salaiz

Quote: If you send out goodness from yourself, or if you share that which is happy or good within you, it will all come back to you multiplied ten thousand times. In the kingdom of love there is no competition; there is no possessiveness or control. The more love you give away, the more love you will have.
Author: John O'Donohue,  Anam Cara: A Book of Celtic Wisdom

Quote: As for literary criticism in general: I have long felt that any reviewer who expresses rage and loathing for a novel or a play or a poem is preposterous. He or she is like a person who has put on full armor and attacked a hot fudge sundae or a banana split.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Palm Sunday: An Autobiographical Collage

Quote: The beautiful journey of today can only begin when we learn to let go of yesterday.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

Quote: This is part of what a family is about, not just love. It's knowing that your family will be there watching out for you. Nothing else will give you that. Not money. Not fame. Not work.
Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie

Quote: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: Things die. But they don't always stay dead. Believe me, I know.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Frostbite

Quote: Be careful, though.""Aren't I always?""No, I think the word for how you usually are is 'reckless.
Author: Veronica Roth,  Insurgent

Quote: Love! Love until the night collapses!
Author: Pablo Neruda,  Machu Picchu

Quote: You know someone's right for you when the things they don't have to say are even more important than the things they do.
Author: Jodi Picoult,  Sing You Home

Quote: The heart can think of no devotionGreater than being shore to the ocean-Holding the curve of one position,Counting an endless repetition.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: Maktub"(It is written.)
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

Quote: You get in life what you have the courage to ask for.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: Sometimes your light shines so bright that it blinds people from seeing who you really are.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: The cost of a thing is the amount of what I will call life which is required to be exchanged for it, immediately or in the long run.
Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden

Quote: I desire to be with you. I miss you. I feel lonely when I can't see you. I am obsessed with you, fascinated by you, infatuated with you. I hunger for your taste, your smell, the feel of your soul touching mine.
Author: Jack Llawayllynn,  Indulgence

Quote: ...Who could refrain, That had a heart to love, and in that heart Courage to make love known?
Author: William Shakespeare,  Macbeth

Quote: Believe there is a great power silently working all things for good, behave yourself and never mind the rest.
Author: Beatrix Potter

Quote: The problems of the world cannot possibly be solved by skeptics or cynics whose horizons are limited by the obvious realities. We need men who can dream of things that never were.
Author: John Keats

Quote: Just give me a comfortable couch, a dog, a good book, and a woman. Then if you can get the dog to go somewhere and read the book, I might have a little fun.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: Sam laughed, a funny, self-deprecating laugh. "You did read a lot. And spent too much time just inside the kitchen window, where I couldn't see you very well.""And not enough time mostly naked in front of my bedroom window?"I teased. Sam turned bright red. "That,"he said, "is so not the point of this conversation.
Author: Maggie Stiefvater,  Shiver

Quote: She read books as one would breathe air, to fill up and live.
Author: Annie Dillard,  The Living

Quote: There is nothing you can see that is not a Bashoflower; there is nothing you can think that is not the moon.
Author: Matsuo Basho

Quote: I'm a forgiver. I might not forget, but I forgive. My mother, father and older brother always told me: 'Don't hold grudges. If you do that, you don't lower yourself down to your adversary. Just treat people the way you want to be treated.' I honestly think that's why I was able to survive and have some success.
Author: Monte Irvin

Quote: Oftentimes when you see adaptations of books you like, you're let down. As an author, you assume that they are going to suck. A little bit of hope is dangerous.
Author: Gayle Forman

Quote: I am a great admirer of mystery and magic. Look at this life - all mystery and magic.
Author: Harry Houdini

Quote: Don't walk in front of me, I may not follow. Don't walk behind me, I may not lead. There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved.
Author: George Sand

Quote: I'm not really big on slapstick humor. I like gentle humor.
Author: Anjelica Huston

Quote: The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: In the darkness, two shadows, reaching through the hopeless, heavy dusk. Their hands meet, and light spills in a flood like a hundred golden urns pouring out of the sun.
Author: Madeline Miller,  The Song of Achilles

Quote: But even when I stop crying, even when we fall asleep and I'm nestled in his arms, this will leave another scar. No one will see it. No one will know. But it will be there. And eventually all of the scars will have scars, and that's all I'll be--one big scar of a love gone wrong.
Author: Amanda Grace,  But I Love Him

Quote: Reality is wrong. Dreams are for the real.
Author: Tupac Shakur

Quote: It's all in the mind.
Author: George Harrison

Quote: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.
Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations

Quote: Unrequited love is the infinite curse of a lonely heart.
Author: Christina Westover

Quote: You are someone who is different, but who wants to be the same as everyone else. And that in my view is a serious illness. God chose you to be different. Why are you disappointing God with this kind of attitude?
Author: Paulo Coelho,  Veronika Decides to Die

Quote: Know thyself.
Author: Socrates

Quote: You fuck - you ate my cat!
Author: Kendare Blake,  Anna Dressed in Blood

Quote: Success is getting what you want..Happiness is wanting what you get.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: Relationships take up energy; letting go of them, psychiatrists theorize, entails mental work. When you lose someone you were close to, you have to reassess your picture of the world and your place in it. The more your identity was wrapped up with the deceased, the more difficult the loss.
Author: Meghan O'Rourke

Quote: The soul should always stand ajar, ready to welcome the ecstatic experience.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: There are moments, Jeeves, when one asks oneself, 'Do trousers matter?'""The mood will pass, sir.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse,  The Code of the Woosters

Quote: Sometimes you break your heart in the right way, if you know what I mean.
Author: Gregory David Roberts,  Shantaram

Quote: We all take different paths in life, but no matter where we go, we take a little of each other everyhwere.
Author: Tim McGraw

Quote: Be what you would seem to be - or, if you'd like it put more simply - never imagine yourself not to be otherwise than what it might appear to others that what you were or might have been was not otherwise than what you had been would have appeared to them to be otherwise.
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: You were the missing piece of my soul, the breath in my lungs, and the blood in my veins.
Author: J.A. Redmerski,  The Edge of Never

Quote: If you enter this world knowing you are loved and you leave this world knowing the same, then everything that happens in between can be dealt with.
Author: Michael Jackson

Quote: Then he made one last effort to search in his heart for the place where his affection had rotted away, and he could not find it.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez,  One Hundred Years of Solitude

Quote: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to walk and run and climb and dance; one cannot fly into flying.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: I want to write the Boston Marathon of run-on sentences. And since it'll be so long, I'll replace all the commas with the word Gatorade, to help push people through it.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want

Quote: We're not retreating, we're advancing in reverse.' --Skulduggery Pleasant
Author: Derek Landy,  Playing with Fire

Quote: We don't get to chose what is true. We only get to choose what we do about it.
Author: Kami Garcia,  Beautiful Darkness

Quote: If all printers were determined not to print anything till they were sure it would offend nobody, there would be very little printed.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: Ultimately, it is the desire, not the desired, that we love.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: They say sarcasm is the lowest form of wit,"Valkyrie said. China glanced at her. "They've obviously never met me.
Author: Derek Landy,  Mortal Coil

Quote: I don't fit into any stereotypes. And I like myself that way.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: Interviewer: 'So Frank, you have long hair. Does that make you a woman?'Frank Zappa: 'You have a wooden leg. Does that make you a table?
Author: Frank Zappa

Quote: People always say that, when you love someone, nothing in the world matters. But that's not true, is it? You know, and I know, that when you love someone, everything in the world matters a little bit more.
Author: Jodi Picoult,  Handle with Care

Quote: The hardest thing about the road not taken is that you never know where it might have led.
Author: Lisa Wingate,  A Month of Summer

Quote: Our battered suitcases were piled on the sidewalk again; we had longer ways to go. But no matter, the road is life
Author: Jack Kerouac,  On the Road

Quote: I can't give you the white picket fence, and if I did, you'd set it on fire.
Author: Ilona Andrews,  Magic Bleeds

Quote: The most important reason for going from one place to another is to see what's in between, and they took great pleasure in doing just that.
Author: Norton Juster,  The Phantom Tollbooth

Quote: If something is going to happen to me, I want to be there.
Author: Albert Camus,  The Stranger

Quote: I have been stabbed, shot, burned, bitten, beaten unconscious too many times to count, and even staked. None of those held a candle to the pain I felt at seeing his mouth on hers.
Author: Jeaniene Frost,  One Foot in the Grave

Quote: Woman is not made to be the admiration of all, but the happiness of one.
Author: Edmund Burke

Quote: I wanted all thingsTo seem to make some sense,So we could all be happy, yes,Instead of tense.And I made up liesSo that they all fit nice,And I made this sad worldA par-a-dise.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  A Man Without a Country

Quote: Societies in decline have no use for visionaries.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: You cannot expect victory and plan for defeat.
Author: Joel Osteen

Quote: Write about the emotions you fear the most.
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson

Quote: The ideal life is in our blood and never will be still.
Author: Phillips Brooks

Quote: Super-ambitious goals tend to be unifying and energizing to people; but only if they believe there's a chance of success.
Author: Peter Diamandis

Quote: I think the notion of retirement is just a dreadful, dreadful idea and I hope I never have to do that.
Author: Michael Moritz

Quote: Learn to enjoy every minute of your life. Be happy now. Don't wait for something outside of yourself to make you happy in the future. Think how really precious is the time you have to spend, whether it's at work or with your family. Every minute should be enjoyed and savored.
Author: Earl Nightingale

Quote: To love abundantly is to live abundantly, and to love forever is to live forever.
Author: Henry Drummond

Quote: I don't have a very quick sense of humor.
Author: Florenz Ziegfeld

Quote: Color is my day-long obsession, joy and torment.
Author: Claude Monet

Quote: What I cannot love, I overlook.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: Hearing voices no one else can hear isn't a good sign, even in the wizarding world.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Quote: The president of the United States has claimed, on more than one occasion, to be in dialogue with God. If he said that he was talking to God through his hairdryer, this would precipitate a national emergency. I fail to see how the addition of a hairdryer makes the claim more ridiculous or offensive.
Author: Sam Harris,  Letter to a Christian Nation

Quote: Everyone must dream. We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, that's like saying you can never change your fate. Isn't that true?
Author: Amy Tan,  The Hundred Secret Senses

Quote: Daemon pressed his forehead against mine. "Oh, I still want to strangle you. But I'm insane. You're crazy. Maybe that's why. We just make crazy together.
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,  Onyx

Quote: No matter what dimension you're in, there's a big-headed male trying to take over the world.
Author: Eoin Colfer,  The Lost Colony

Quote: Sometimes you can see things happen right in front of your eyes and still jump to the wrong conclusions.
Author: Jodi Picoult,  Keeping Faith

Quote: Fred, you next,"the plump woman said. "I'm not Fred, I'm George,"said the boy. "Honestly, woman, you call yourself our mother? Can't you tell I'm George?""Sorry, George, dear.""Only joking, I am Fred,"said the boy and off he went.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

Quote: At what point do you give up - decide enough is enough? There is only one answer really. Never.
Author: Tabitha Suzuma,  Forbidden

Quote: You will face your greatest opposition when you are closest to your biggest miracle.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: My opinions may have changed, but not the fact that I'm right.
Author: Ashleigh Brilliant

Quote: A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.
Author: Joseph Stalin

Quote: There ain't no such thing as a free lunch.
Author: Robert A. Heinlein,  The Moon is a Harsh Mistress

Quote: A Word is DeadA word is deadWhen it is said,Some say.I say it justBegins to liveThat day.
Author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems

Quote: The best stories don't come from "good vs. bad"but "good vs. good.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: A rock pile ceases to be a rock pile the moment a single man contemplates it, bearing within him the image of a cathedral.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince

Quote: We have to be back in three hours,"Ronan said. "I just fed Chainsaw but she'll need it again.""This,"Gansey replied "is precisely why I didn't want to have a baby with you.
Author: Maggie Stiefvater,  The Raven Boys

Quote: The morning always has a way of creeping up on me and peeking in my bedroom windows. The sunrise is such a pervert.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Who Moved My Choose?: An Amazing Way to Deal With Change by Deciding to Let Indecision Into Your Life

Quote: An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.
Author: Benjamin Franklin,  The Way to Wealth: Ben Franklin on Money and Success

Quote: You gotta be careful: don't say a word to nobody about nothing anytime ever.
Author: Johnny Depp

Quote: Curious that we spend more time congratulating people who have succeeded than encouraging people who have not.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: Where they have burned books, they will end in burning human beings.
Author: Heinrich Heine

Quote: Not on one strand are all life's jewels strung.
Author: William Morris

Quote: I'm a very competitive person, but competitive with myself. I want to be the best that I can be, and if that means that I'm eventually better than everyone else, then so be it. But I don't go around comparing and contrasting myself with other actors if I can help it. It's also, I think, the key to my success.
Author: Wentworth Miller

Quote: I love the song 'I Hope You Dance' by Lee Ann Womack. I was going to write that song, but someone beat me to it.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: I feel that the simplicity of life is just being yourself.
Author: Bobby Brown

Quote: The way to know life is to love many things.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: 'Northern Exposure.' I loved that show; I loved the way it was able to have episodes where somebody finds a woolly mammoth, he calls the museum in New York, they send a guy out, and the mammoth's gone because someone ate it. To me, that was everything I ever wanted to do. That show mixed emotion, humor and the surreal all at once.
Author: Edward Kitsis

Quote: There is nothing worse than a sharp image of a fuzzy concept.
Author: Ansel Adams

Quote: I won't telephone him. I'll never telephone him again as long as I live. He'll rot in hell, before I'll call him up. You don't have to give me strength, God; I have it myself. If he wanted me, he could get me. He knows where I am. He knows I'm waiting here. He's so sure of me, so sure. I wonder why they hate you, as soon as they are sure of you.
Author: Dorothy Parker,  The Portable Dorothy Parker

Quote: Sometimes I just think depression's one way of coping with the world. Like, some people get drunk, some people do drugs, some people get depressed. Because there's so much stuff out there that you have to do something to deal with it.
Author: Ned Vizzini,  It's Kind of a Funny Story

Quote: I knew I loved you before I met youI think I dreamed you into lifeI knew I loved you before I met youI have been waiting all my life
Author: Savage Garden

Quote: The universe may not always play fair, but at least it's got a hell of a sense of humor.
Author: Candace Bushnell,  Sex and the City

Quote: So long as we love we serve; so long as we are loved by others, I would almost say that we are indispensable; and no man is useless while he has a friend.
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson,  Lay Morals

Quote: Let me never fall into the vulgar mistake of dreaming that I am persecuted whenever I am contradicted.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Emerson in His Journals

Quote: I'm going to paraphrase Thoreau here... rather than love, than money, than faith, than fame, than fairness... give me truth.
Author: Jon Krakauer,  Into the Wild

Quote: It's now very common to hear people say, 'I'm rather offended by that.' As if that gives them certain rights. It's actually nothing more... than a whine. 'I find that offensive.' It has no meaning; it has no purpose; it has no reason to be respected as a phrase. 'I am offended by that.' Well, so fucking what."[I saw hate in a graveyard -- Stephen Fry, The Guardian, 5 June 2005]
Author: Stephen Fry

Quote: Real life's nasty. It's cruel. It doesn't care about heroes and happy endings and the way things should be. In real life, bad things happen. People die. Fights are lost. Evil often wins.
Author: Darren Shan

Quote: Would you mind repeating that? I'm afraid I might have lost my wits altogether and just hallucinated what I've longed to hear.
Author: Jeaniene Frost,  Halfway to the Grave

Quote: When I saw you, I saw love. When I saw you naked, I saw lust. When I saw you with my clone in a dream, I saw the future.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: And then there are the rare ones who know love, who understand it. Who freely give of themselves, demanding only a return of that love,that trust.
Author: Kim Harrison,  Every Which Way But Dead

Quote: The mistakes I've made are dead to me. But I can't take back the things I never did.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

Quote: The most important thing in communication is hearing what isn't being said. The art of reading between the lines is a life long quest of the wise.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: Your kids require you most of all to love them for who they are, not to spend your whole time trying to correct them.
Author: Bill Ayers

Quote: ..."better to have loved and lost"bullshit. Don't show me paradise and then burn it down.
Author: Harlan Coben

Quote: If you cannot inspire a woman with love of you, fill her above the brim with love of herself ~ all that runs over will be yours.
Author: Charles Caleb Colton

Quote: Wisdom is having things right in your lifeand knowing why.
Author: William Stafford

Quote: Love is not a habit, a commitment, or a debt. It isn't what romantic songs tell us it is - love simply is.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: This time when we kiss, I feel it in the pit of my stomach, I feel it in my heart. And I realize love isn't about sex. It's about connection.
Author: Ellen Hopkins

Quote: I believe in intuitions and inspirations...I sometimes FEEL that I am right. I do not KNOW that I am.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Yes We Can!
Author: Barack Obama

Quote: The tree which moves some to tears of joy is in the eyes of others only a green thing that stands in the way. Some see nature all ridicule and deformity... and some scarce see nature at all. But to the eyes of the man of imagination, nature is imagination itself.
Author: William Blake

Quote: For it would seem - her case proved it - that we write, not with the fingers, but with the whole person. The nerve which controls the pen winds itself about every fibre of our being, threads the heart, pierces the liver.
Author: Virginia Woolf,  Orlando

Quote: If you don't live a life in service of a greater good, you've gotta at least die a death in service of a greater good, you know? And I fear that I won't get either a life or a death that means anything.
Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

Quote: The world changes, we do not, therein lies the irony that kills us.
Author: Anne Rice,  Interview with the Vampire

Quote: It does not matter how long you are spending on the earth, how much money you have gathered or how much attention you have received. It is the amount of positive vibration you have radiated in life that matters,
Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations

Quote: Time will make it worse! You're...the other half of his soul. He's never going to get over you. And no matter how much you hope that you will... you'll never get over him. You're going to wake up one day and realize what you've done, and you're going to regret the time you wasted apart from him for the rest of your life.
Author: Jamie McGuire,  Providence

Quote: Stupid men are the only ones worth knowing after all.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: In life you'll meet a lot of jerks. If they hurt you, tell yourself that it's because they're stupid. That will help keep you from reacting to their cruelty. Because there is nothing worse than bitterness and vengeance... Always keep your dignity and be true to yourself.
Author: Marjane Satrapi,  Persepolis: The Story of a Childhood

Quote: We have now left Reason and Sanity Junction. Next stop, Looneyville.
Author: Jim Butcher,  Grave Peril

Quote: Never forget that God is your friend. And like all friends, He longs to hear what's been happening in your life. Good or bad, whether it's been full of sorrow or anger, or even when you're questioning why terrible things have to happen.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Last Song

Quote: After a moment, Wrath turned to John. "This is Lassiter, the fallen angel. One of the last times he was here on earth, there was a plague in central Europe-""Okay, that was so not my fault-""-which wiped out two-thirds of the human population.""I'd like to remind you that you don't like humans.""They smell bad when they're dead.""All you mortal types do.
Author: J.R. Ward,  Lover Enshrined

Quote: You and I have a love so secret that not even you know about it. But first, let me introduce myself.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: Boy, those French! They have a different word for everything.
Author: Steve Martin

Quote: It was better to know the worst than to wonder.
Author: Margaret Mitchell,  Gone with the Wind

Quote: Poetry heals the wounds inflicted by reason.
Author: Novalis

Quote: It's no good trying to get rid of your own aloneness. You've got to stick to it all your life. Only at times, at times, the gap will be filled in. At times! But you have to wait for the times. Accept your own aloneness and stick to it, all your life. And then accept the times when the gap is filled in, when they come. But they've got to come. You can't force them.
Author: D.H. Lawrence,  Lady Chatterley's Lover

Quote: They've got no idea what happiness is, they don't know that without this love there is no happiness or unhappiness for us--there is no life.
Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Anna Karenina

Quote: It's not hard to decide what you want your life to be about. What's hard, she said, is figuring out what you're willing to give up in order to do the things you really care about.
Author: Shauna Niequist,  Bittersweet: Thoughts on Change, Grace, and Learning the Hard Way

Quote: She lacks confidence, she craves admiration insatiably. She lives on the reflections of herself in the eyes of others. She does not dare to be herself.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: It's none of their business that you have to learn how to write. Let them think you were born that way.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: A concerted effort to preserve our heritage is a vital link to our cultural, educational, aesthetic, inspirational, and economic legacies - all of the things that quite literally make us who we are.
Author: Steve Berry

Quote: Success has always been easy to measure. It is the distance between one's origins and one's final achievement.
Author: Michael Korda

Quote: War is just when it is necessary; arms are permissible when there is no hope except in arms.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quote: How absurd and delicious it is to be in love with somebody younger than yourself. Everybody should try it.
Author: Barbara Pym

Quote: I genuinely liked all of the cast members very much. Steve had a wicked sense of humor. I remember Russell coming to my rescue, once. I watched Eric evolve before everyone's eyes. Maurice loved what he did, so. He treated his character with respect, down to the costuming.
Author: Madeleine Stowe

Quote: You can't do sketches enough. Sketch everything and keep your curiosity fresh.
Author: John Singer Sargent

Quote: Hard is trying to rebuild yourself, piece by piece, with no instruction book, and no clue as to where all the important bits are supposed to go.
Author: Nick Hornby,  A Long Way Down

Quote: We are unusual and tragic and alive.
Author: Dave Eggers

Quote: Adventures are never fun while you're having them.
Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Voyage of the Dawn Treader

Quote: Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting some on yourself.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Never forget that anticipation is an important part of life. Work's important, family's important, but without excitement, you have nothing. You're cheating yourself if you refuse to enjoy what's coming.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Three Weeks With My Brother

Quote: It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.
Author: Harry S. Truman

Quote: I do not know what I may appear to the world, but to myself I seem to have been only like a boy playing on the sea-shore, and diverting myself in now and then finding a smoother pebble or a prettier shell than ordinary, whilst the great ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quote: Those who will not reason, are bigots, those who cannot, are fools, and those who dare not, are slaves.
Author: George Gordon Byron

Quote: Don't own so much clutter that you will be relieved to see your house catch fire.
Author: Wendell Berry,  Farming: a hand book

Quote: Did you mean it... that if Victor did tell...that you'd..."I couldn't finish. I couldn't bring myself to say the words have him killed."I don't have much influence in the upper levels of Moroi royalty, but I have plenty among the guardians who handle the dirty work in our world.""You didn't answer the question. If you'd really do it.""I'd do a lot of things to protect you, Roza.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Shadow Kiss

Quote: CONJUGATE THIS:I cut class, you cut class, he, she, it cuts class. We cut class, they cut class. We all cut class. I cannot say this in Spanish because I did not go to Spanish today. Gracias a dios. Hasta luego.
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson,  Speak

Quote: Why is it that all cars are women?"he asked. "Because they're fussy and demanding,"answered Zee. "Because if they were men, they'd sit around and complain instead of getting the job done,"I told him.
Author: Patricia Briggs,  Silver Borne

Quote: You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you odd.
Author: Flannery O'Connor,  Collected Works: Wise Blood / A Good Man is Hard to Find / The Violent Bear it Away / Everything that Rises Must Converge / Essays and Letters

Quote: Writing is a form of therapy; sometimes I wonder how all those who do not write, compose, or paint can manage to escape the madness, melancholia, the panic and fear which is inherent in a human situation.
Author: Graham Greene,  Ways Of Escape

Quote: If you truly want to be respected by people you love, you must prove to them that you can survive without them.
Author: Michael Bassey Johnson,  The Infinity Sign

Quote: Time weighs down on you like an old, ambiguous dream. You keep on moving, trying to sleep through it. But even if you go to the ends of the earth, you won't be able to escape it. Still, you have to go there- to the edge of the world. There's something you can't do unless you get there.
Author: Haruki Murakami,  Kafka on the Shore

Quote: 25 And the Lord spake unto the Angel that guarded the eastern gate, saying 'Where is the flaming sword that was given unto thee?'26 And the Angel said, 'I had it here only a moment ago, I must have put it down some where, forget my own head next.'27 And the Lord did not ask him again.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  Good Omens: The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch

Quote: The forceps of our minds are clumsy forceps, and crush the truth a little in taking hold of it.
Author: H.G. Wells

Quote: Reading a book is like re-writing it for yourself. You bring to a novel, anything you read, all your experience of the world. You bring your history and you read it in your own terms.
Author: Angela Carter

Quote: I love you more than I hate everything else.
Author: Rainbow Rowell,  Landline

Quote: There are a lot of things I wish I would have done, instead of just sitting around and complaining about having a boring life.
Author: Kurt Cobain

Quote: I have only made this letter longer because I have not had the time to make it shorter."(Letter 16, 1657)
Author: Blaise Pascal,  The Provincial Letters

Quote: I am not a glutton - I am an explorer of food
Author: Erma Bombeck

Quote: I told him I believed in hell, and that certain people, like me, had to live in hell before they died, to make up for missing out on it after death, since they didn't believe in life after death, and what each person believed happened to him when he died.
Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Bell Jar

Quote: And therein lies the whole of man's plight. Human time does not turn in a circle; it runs ahead in a straight line. That is why man cannot be happy: happiness is the longing for repetition.
Author: Milan Kundera,  The Unbearable Lightness of Being

Quote: Those who really love you don't mean to hurt you and if they do, you can't see it in their eyes but it hurts them too.
Author: Holly Black

Quote: You know that when I hate you, it is because I love you to a point of passion that unhinges my soul.
Author: Julie de Lespinasse

Quote: For women, the best aphrodisiacs are words. The G-spot is in the ears. He who looks for it below there is wasting his time.
Author: Isabel Allende,  Of Love and Shadows

Quote: I am convinced that most people do not grow up...We marry and dare to have children and call that growing up. I think what we do is mostly grow old. We carry accumulation of years in our bodies, and on our faces, but generally our real selves, the children inside, are innocent and shy as magnolias.
Author: Maya Angelou,  Letter to My Daughter

Quote: The way you're singing in your sleepThe way you look before you leapThe strange illusions that you keepYou don't knowBut I'm noticingThe way your touch turns into arcsThe way you slide into the darkThe beating of my open heartYou don't knowBut I'm noticing
Author: David Levithan,  Nick & Norah's Infinite Playlist

Quote: Just give me a second. Attempting to give a fuck...Attempting harder to give a fuck...Sorry, there was an error; fuck not given.
Author: Suzanne Wright,  Feral Sins

Quote: I guess sometimes you have to lie to find the truth.
Author: Scott Westerfeld,  Extras

Quote: In fact, the mere act of opening the box will determine the state of thecat, although in this case there were three determinate states the catcould be in: these being Alive, Dead, and Bloody Furious.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Lords and Ladies

Quote: When you cut pieces out of the truth to avoid looking like a fool you end up looking like a moron instead.
Author: Robin Hobb,  Assassin's Apprentice

Quote: I am stuffing your mouth with yourpromises and watching you vomit them out upon my face.
Author: Anne Sexton,  The Complete Poems

Quote: Half a century ago, the amazing courage of Rosa Parks, the visionary leadership of Martin Luther King, and the inspirational actions of the civil rights movement led politicians to write equality into the law and make real the promise of America for all her citizens.
Author: David Cameron

Quote: I thought doing reality TV would be the greatest success of my life or the biggest mistake.
Author: Bethenny Frankel

Quote: If I had to choose between betraying my country and betraying my friend, I hope I should have the guts to betray my country.
Author: E. M. Forster

Quote: Be brave enough to live life creatively. The creative place where no one else has ever been.
Author: Alan Alda

Quote: Love conquers all.
Author: Virgil

Quote: But it was this tough little character part that I was playing, a very funny little guy that I invented over a weekend, because I realized I was not contributing to the humor of this thing. And I had to do something.
Author: Dabney Coleman

Quote: Photograph: a picture painted by the sun without instruction in art.
Author: Ambrose Bierce

Quote: Berterimakasihlah pada segala yang memberi kehidupan.
Author: Pramoedya Ananta Toer,  Bumi Manusia

Quote: Love cannot be forced, love cannot be coaxed and teased. It comes out of heaven, unasked and unsought.
Author: Pearl S. Buck

Quote: When I turn around, he cups my face in his hands and he kisses me so deeply that I don't know who is breathing for who, but his mouth and tongue taste like warm honey. I don't know how long it lasts, but when I let go of him, I miss it already.
Author: Melina Marchetta,  On the Jellicoe Road

Quote: Let me give you a tip on a clue to men's characters: the man who damns money has obtained it dishonorably; the man who respects it has earned it.
Author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged

Quote: I've had a lot of worries in my life, most of which never happened.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Thankfully, persistence is a great substitute for talent.
Author: Steve Martin,  Born Standing Up: A Comic's Life

Quote: It is strange how often a heart must be broken Before the years can make it wise.
Author: Sara Teasdale,  The Collected Poems

Quote: You are never too old to become younger!
Author: Mae West

Quote: Love's about finding the one person who makes your heart complete. Who makes you a better person than you ever dreamed you could be. Its about looking in the eyes of your wife and knowing all the way to your bones that she's simply the best person you've ever known.
Author: Julia Quinn,  The Viscount Who Loved Me

Quote: Love is too precious to be ashamed of.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  A Stroke of Midnight

Quote: I don't think you can define love.
Author: Harry Styles

Quote: Stop feeling sorry for yourself and you will be happy.
Author: Stephen Fry

Quote: Love. Fall in love and stay in love. Write only what you love, and love what you write. The word is love. You have to get up in the morning and write something you love, something to live for.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: I wish I had a boyfriend. I wish he lived in the wardrobe on a coat hanger. Whenever I wanted, I could get him out and he'd look at me the way boys do in films, as if I'm beautiful.
Author: Jenny Downham,  Before I Die

Quote: When its gone, you'll know what a gift love was. you'll suffer like this. So go back and fight to keep it.
Author: Ian McEwan,  Enduring Love

Quote: If you love someone, you must be prepared to set them free.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Winner Stands Alone

Quote: Life is hard. After all, it kills you.
Author: Katharine Hepburn,  Me: Stories of My Life

Quote: Plant seeds of happiness, hope, success, and love; it will all come back to you in abundance. This is the law of nature.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

Quote: It's a strange thing to discover and to believe that you are loved when you know that there is nothing in you for anybody but a parent or a God to love.
Author: Graham Greene,  The End of the Affair

Quote: He who hesitates is a damned fool.
Author: Mae West

Quote: If you had to identify, in one word, the reason why the human race has not achieved, and never will achieve, its full potential, that word would be 'meetings.
Author: Dave Barry

Quote: Truth is like the sun. You can shut it out for a time, but it ain't going away.
Author: Elvis Presley

Quote: Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror.But you are eternity and you are the mirror.
Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet

Quote: Trust is the fruit of a relationship in which you know you are loved.
Author: Wm. Paul Young

Quote: The boldness of his mind was sheathed in a scabbard of politeness.
Author: Dumas Malone,  Jefferson the Virginian

Quote: My past has not defined me, destroyed me, deterred me, or defeated me; it has only strengthened me.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

Quote: Never bend your head. Hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.
Author: Lyndon B. Johnson

Quote: Accidental sex. He made it sound like I fell down, and there just happened to be an erection in the way.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  Incubus Dreams

Quote: Romance takes place in the middle distance. Romance is looking in at yourself through a window clouded with dew. Romance means leaving things out: where life grunts and shuffles, romance only sighs.
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quote: How can something so wrong feel so right?
Author: Tabitha Suzuma,  Forbidden

Quote: Never, ever, let anyone tell you what you can and can't do. Prove the cynics wrong. Pity them for they have no imagination. The sky's the limit. Your sky. Your limit. Now. Let's dance.
Author: Tom Hiddleston

Quote: If you expect to succeed as a writer, rudeness should be the second-to-least of your concerns. The least of all should be polite society and what it expects. If you intend to write as truthfully as you can, your days as a member of polite society are numbered, anyway.
Author: Stephen King,  On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft

Quote: I want to protect innocent people from sin by locking them in cages, where the evil can't get to them.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  There are Two Typos of People in This World: Those Who Can Edit and Those Who Can't

Quote: How easy to be amiable in the midst of happiness and success.
Author: William Ellery Channing

Quote: Intuition is the wisdom formed by feeling and instinct - a gift of knowing without reasoning... Belief is ignited by hope and supported by facts and evidence - it builds alignment and creates confidence. Belief is what sets energy in motion and creates the success that breeds more success.
Author: Angela Ahrendts

Quote: Love is the only gold.
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

Quote: Sense of humor is important in life, not just in clothing. How boring to live a life in beige.
Author: Jean Pigozzi

Quote: Ads are the cave art of the twentieth century.
Author: Marshall McLuhan

Quote: I don't know why we are here, but I'm pretty sure that it is not in order to enjoy ourselves.
Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

Quote: When love has fused and mingled two beings in a sacred and angelic unity, the secret of life has been discovered so far as they are concerned; they are no longer anything more than the two boundaries of the same destiny; they are no longer anything but the two wings of the same spirit. Love, soar.
Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables

Quote: I remembered the fox. One runs the risk of crying a bit if one allows oneself to be tamed.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince

Quote: As my father always used to tell me, 'You see, son, there's always someone in the world worse off than you.' And I always used to think, 'So?
Author: Bill Bryson,  The Lost Continent: Travels in Small Town America

Quote: I have the feeling we just made a deal with the devil, and he's going to come back and want our first-born child or something."Daemon waggled his brows. "You want kids? Because you know, practice makes--""Shut up."I shook my head and started walking.
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,  Opal

Quote: You can laugh! But people used to believe there were no such things as the Blibbering Humdinger or the Crumple-Horned Snorkack!
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Quote: I want to do it too!"(sitting motionless)Nudge: "Nope, you stand out like a fart in a church."Max: (muttering) "Appropriately enough."Iggy: "What about me?"(stands still)Max: "No, you're visible."Iggy: "Am not!"Max: (throws a pinecone at him) "Could I do that if I wouldn't see you?
Author: James Patterson,  The Final Warning

Quote: Meaning what? We're going to pretend nothing's going on? That's stupid. The only way to deal with any of this is to get it out in the open."Have you been watching Oprah again?
Author: James Patterson,  Saving the World and Other Extreme Sports

Quote: We keep on being told that religion, whatever its imperfections, at least instills morality. On every side, there is conclusive evidence that the contrary is the case and that faith causes people to be more mean, more selfish, and perhaps above all, more stupid.
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: Music is my higher power
Author: Oliver James

Quote: It didn't make you noble to step away from something that wasn't working, even if you thought you were the reason for the malfunction. Especially then. It just made you a quitter. Because if you were the problem, chances were you could also be the solution. The only way to find out was to take another shot.
Author: Sarah Dessen,  Along for the Ride

Quote: It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: The only way love can last a lifetime is if it's unconditional. The truth is this: love is not determined by the one being loved but rather by the one choosing to love.
Author: Stephen Kendrick,  The Love Dare

Quote: In the land of Gibberish, the man who makes sense, the man who speaks clearly, clearly speaks nonsense.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: If you love deeply, you're going to get hurt badly. But it's still worth it.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: My doctor says that I have a malformed public-duty gland and a natural deficiency in moral fibre and that I am therefore excused from saving universes.
Author: Douglas Adams,  Life, the Universe and Everything

Quote: A bruise is a lesson... and each lesson makes us better.
Author: George R.R. Martin,  A Game of Thrones

Quote: A story is a letter that the author writes to himself, to tell himself things that he would be unable to discover otherwise.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind

Quote: I'm bad and I'm going to hell, and I don't care. I'd rather be in hell than anywhere where you are.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: I learned very early the difference between knowing the name of something and knowing something.
Author: Richard Feynman

Quote: I just...I just miss him. And I hate being so alone.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  The Hunger Games

Quote: Just remember that the things you put into your head are there forever, he said. You might want to think about that.You forget some things, dont you?Yes. You forget what you want to remember and you remember what you want to forget.
Author: Cormac McCarthy,  The Road

Quote: Life is filled with unanswered questions, but it is the courage to seek those answers that continues to give meaning to life. You can spend your life wallowing in despair, wondering why you were the one who was led towards the road strewn with pain, or you can be grateful that you are strong enough to survive it.
Author: J.D. Stroube,  Caged by Damnation

Quote: I realized how truly hard it was, really, to see someone you love change right before your eyes. Not only is it scary, it throws your balance off as well.
Author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever

Quote: You are willing to die, you coward, but not to live.
Author: Hermann Hesse,  Steppenwolf

Quote: Luckily, I always travel with a book, just in case I have to wait on line for Santa, or some such inconvenience.
Author: David Levithan,  Dash & Lily's Book of Dares

Quote: But we can't go back. We can only go forward.
Author: Libba Bray

Quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
Author: Robertson Davies,  Tempest-Tost

Quote: I don't put up with being messed around, and I don't suffer fools gladly. The short version of that is that I'm a bitch. Trust me, I can provide character references.
Author: Robin McKinley,  Sunshine

Quote: As a well spent day brings happy sleep, so life well used brings happy death.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: I went down to the river,I set down on the bank.I tried to think but couldn't,So I jumped in and sank.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: There's no one particular road that will lead you to success. I think everybody will find it differently.
Author: Marina and the Diamonds

Quote: Hope is like a road in the country; there was never a road, but when many people walk on it, the road comes into existence.
Author: Lin Yutang

Quote: A woman may very well form a friendship with a man, but for this to endure, it must be assisted by a little physical antipathy.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Let the refining and improving of your own life keep you so busy that you have little time to criticize others.
Author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

Quote: I believe in the compelling power of love. I do not understand it. I believe it to be the most fragrant blossom of all this thorny existence.
Author: Theodore Dreiser

Quote: I think you have to have a sense of humor about every movie that you're doing. Your character needs to be relatable in a way that, even when you're doing the most bizarre things, sometimes a bit of tongue in cheek is necessary to keep up the believability of it.
Author: Katharine Isabelle

Quote: Art is a harmony parallel with nature.
Author: Paul Cezanne

Quote: She had loved him for such a long time, she thought. How was it that she did now know him at all?
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Prince

Quote: When someone blushes, doesn't that mean 'yes'?
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince

Quote: Some feelings sink so deep into the heart that only loneliness can help you find them again. Some truths are so painful that only shame can help you live with them. Some things are so sad that only your soul can do the crying for them.
Author: Gregory David Roberts,  Shantaram

Quote: The eye through which I see God is the same eye through which God sees me; my eye and God's eye are one eye, one seeing, one knowing, one love.
Author: Meister Eckhart,  Sermons of Meister Eckhart

Quote: LAW 4 Always Say Less Than Necessary When you are trying to impress people with words, the more you say, the more common you appear, and the less in control. Even if you are saying something banal, it will seem original if you make it vague, open-ended, and sphinxlike. Powerful people impress and intimidate by saying less. The more you say, the more likely you are to say something foolish.
Author: Robert Greene,  The 48 Laws of Power

Quote: It's a reflex. Hear a bell, get food. See an undead, throw a knife. Same thing, really.
Author: Ilona Andrews,  Magic Bites

Quote: The world must be all fucked up,"he said then, "when men travel first class and literature goes as freight.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

Quote: Absence makes the heart grow fonder, but it sure makes the rest of you lonely.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: Do you believe a man can truly love a woman and constantly betray her?Never mind physically but betray her in his mind,in the very "poetry of his soul".Well,it's not easy but men do it all the time.
Author: Mario Puzo,  Fools Die

Quote: It can only take a moment to waste the rest of your life.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Snuff

Quote: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations

Quote: ...Next time you're faced with a choice, do the right thing. It hurts everyone less in the long run.
Author: Wendelin Van Draanen,  Flipped

Quote: Whereas story is processed in the mind in a straightforward manner, poetry bypasses rational thought and goes straight to the limbic system and lights it up like a brushfire. It's the crack cocaine of the literary world.
Author: Jasper Fforde,  First Among Sequels

Quote: That's one of the remarkable things about life. It's never so bad that it can't get worse.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: Dev-"Come in peace or leave in pieces
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,  Bad Moon Rising

Quote: In a room wherepeople unanimously maintaina conspiracy of silence,one word of truthsounds like a pistol shot.
Author: Czesław Miłosz

Quote: ... you don't have to wait for someone to treat you bad repeatedly. All it takes is once, and if they get away with it that once, if they know they can treat you like that, then it sets the pattern for the future.
Author: Jane Green,  Bookends

Quote: There is an ancient tribal proverb I once heard in India. It says that before we can see properly we must first shed our tears to clear the way.
Author: Libba Bray,  The Sweet Far Thing

Quote: With or without religion, you would have good people doing good things and evil people doing evil things. But for good people to do evil things, that takes religion.
Author: Steven Weinberg

Quote: Only the ship is made of books, its sails thousands of overlapping pages, and the sea it floats upon is dark black ink.
Author: Erin Morgenstern,  The Night Circus

Quote: Cinema is the ultimate pervert art. It doesn't give you what you desire - it tells you how to desire.
Author: Slavoj Žižek

Quote: To sell your soul is the easiest thing in the world. That's what everybody does every hour of his life. If I asked you to keep your soul - would you understand why that's much harder?
Author: Ayn Rand,  The Fountainhead

Quote: Each time you happen to me all over again.
Author: Edith Wharton,  The Age of Innocence

Quote: There is a wisdom of the head, and... there is a wisdom of the heart.
Author: Charles Dickens,  Hard Times

Quote: How happy is the little stoneThat rambles in the road alone,And doesn't care about careers,And exigencies never fears;Whose coat of elemental brownA passing universe put on;And independent as the sun,Associates or glows alone,Fulfilling absolute decreeIn casual simplicity.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: By seeking and blundering we learn.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: You are the only one who has understood even a whisper of me, and I will tell you that I am the only person who has understood even a whisper of you.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Everything Is Illuminated

Quote: Between hello and goodbye is I love you.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  99 Cents For Some Nonsense

Quote: She is tolerable, but not handsome enough to tempt me, and I am in no humor at present to give consequence to young ladies who are slighted by other men.
Author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice

Quote: The trouble is that we have a bad habit, encouraged by pedants and sophisticates, of considering happiness as something rather stupid. Only pain is intellectual, only evil interesting. This is the treason of the artist; a refusal to admit the banality of evil and the terrible boredom of pain.
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Ones Who Walk Away from Omelas

Quote: I wish to weepbut sorrow isstupid.I wish to believebut belief is agraveyard.
Author: Charles Bukowski,  What Matters Most is How Well You Walk Through the Fire

Quote: She was like a drowning person, flailing, reaching for anything that might save her. Her life was an urgent, desperate struggle to justify her life.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Everything Is Illuminated

Quote: In school we learn that mistakes are bad, and we are punished for making them. Yet, if you look at the way humans are designed to learn, we learn by making mistakes. We learn to walk by falling down. If we never fell down, we would never walk.
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki,  Rich Dad, Poor Dad

Quote: I don't know what good it is to know so much and be smart as whips and all if it doesn't make you happy.
Author: J.D. Salinger,  Franny and Zooey

Quote: Trust starts with truth and ends with truth.
Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday

Quote: You are the master of your destiny. You can influence, direct and control your own environment. You can make your life what you want it to be.
Author: Napoleon Hill,  Think and Grow Rich

Quote: No two persons ever read the same book.
Author: Edmund Wilson

Quote: I wish the Peace Corps and its volunteers continued success and perseverance. We are grateful for their contributions to society and dedication to providing assistance where it is needed. May the Peace Corps continue its legacy of service, both at home and abroad.
Author: Kenny Marchant

Quote: As I prepare for my second term as Secretary-General, I am thinking hard about how we can meet the expectations of the millions of people who see the U.N.'s blue flag as a banner of hope. We have to continue our life-saving work in peacekeeping, human rights, development and humanitarian relief.
Author: Ban Ki-moon

Quote: Have the courage to say no. Have the courage to face the truth. Do the right thing because it is right. These are the magic keys to living your life with integrity.
Author: W. Clement Stone

Quote: Love is energy of life.
Author: Robert Browning

Quote: My humor isn't meant to be mean or hurt anyone. But it's to make them uncomfortable and laugh. I like making people feel a different range of emotions. I like to make people a bit confused.
Author: Charlyne Yi

Quote: With color one obtains an energy that seems to stem from witchcraft.
Author: Henri Matisse

Quote: Want to keep Christ in Christmas? Feed the hungry, clothe the naked, forgive the guilty, welcome the unwanted, care for the ill, love your enemies, and do unto others as you would have done unto you.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

Quote: Life is more or less a lie, but then again, that's exactly the way we want it to be.
Author: Bob Dylan

Quote: I am the broth of love. Make soup to me.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: Do you really think anyone in this world, compares to you in my eyes?
Author: S.C. Stephens,  Thoughtless

Quote: Hope is important because it can make the present moment less difficult to bear. If we believe that tomorrow will be better, we can bear a hardship today.
Author: Hanh Nhat Thich,  Peace Is Every Step: The Path of Mindfulness in Everyday Life

Quote: Fault always lies in the same place: with him weak enough to lay blame.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: When what you hear and what you see don't match, trust your eyes.
Author: Dale Renton

Quote: A scrupulous writer, in every sentence that he writes, will ask himself at least four questions, thus: 1. What am I trying to say? 2. What words will express it? 3. What image or idiom will make it clearer? 4. Is this image fresh enough to have an effect?
Author: George Orwell,  Politics and the English Language

Quote: How do I know what I think until I see what I say?
Author: E.M. Forster

Quote: I mean, it's not surprising, really. Once you love something, you always love it in some way. You have to. It's, like, part of you for good.
Author: Sarah Dessen,  What Happened to Goodbye

Quote: Life is a blank canvas, and you need to throw all the paint on it you can.
Author: Danny Kaye

Quote: I will not wait to love as best as I can. We thought we were young and that there would be time to love well sometime in the future. This is a terrible way to think. It is no way to live, to wait to love.
Author: Dave Eggers,  What is the What

Quote: The cost of oblivious daydreaming was always this moment of return, the realignment with what had been before and now seemed a little worse.
Author: Ian McEwan,  Atonement

Quote: People who lack the clarity, courage, or determination to follow their own dreams will often find ways to discourage yours. When you change for the better, the people around you will be inspired to change also....but only after doing their best to make you stop. Live your truth and don't EVER stop.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

Quote: We should forgive our enemies, but not before they are hanged
Author: Heinrich Heine

Quote: Each person deserves a day away in which no problems are confronted, no solutions searched for.
Author: Maya Angelou,  Wouldn't Take Nothing for My Journey Now

Quote: You are an aperture through which the universe is looking at and exploring itself.
Author: Alan W. Watts

Quote: The high-minded man must care more for the truth than for what people think.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Half of the American people have never read a newspaper. Half never voted for President. One hopes it is the same half.
Author: Gore Vidal,  Screening History

Quote: In case you never get a second chance: don't be afraid!""And what if you do get a second chance?""You take it!
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: This above all: to thine own self be true.
Author: William Shakespeare,  Hamlet

Quote: A book is a suicide postponed.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quote: Your soul knows the geography of your destiny. Your soul alone has the map of your future, therefore you can trust this indirect, oblique side of yourself. If you do, it will take you where you need to go, but more important it will teach you a kindness of rhythm in your journey.
Author: John O'Donohue,  Anam Cara: A Book of Celtic Wisdom

Quote: Science, my lad, is made up of mistakes, but they are mistakes which it is useful to make, because they lead little by little to the truth.
Author: Jules Verne,  A Journey to the Center of the Earth

Quote: Everybody is a main character to someone...
Author: Amy Harmon,  Making Faces

Quote: It was the nicest thing she could imagine. It made her want to have his babies and give him both of her kidneys.
Author: Rainbow Rowell,  Eleanor & Park

Quote: I think you're still the only person sharp enough to sharpen someone like me.
Author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant

Quote: We are afraid of losing what we have, whether it's our life or our possessions and property. But this fear evaporates when we understand that our life stories and the history of the world were written by the same hand.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: He had a new girl, and I told him she looked like Marilyn Monroe. He smiled because he thought I meant she was beautiful, and I smiled because I meant she looked like a corpse.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Titanic would never have sunk if it were made out of a sink.

Quote: Remember He is the artist and you are only the picture. You can't see it. So quietly submit to be painted---i.e., keep fulfilling all the obvious duties of your station (you really know quite well enough what they are!), asking forgiveness for each failure and then leaving it alone.You are in the right way. Walk---don't keep on looking at it.
Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Collected Letters of C. S. Lewis, Volume lll: Narnia, Cambridge, and Joy 1950-1963

Quote: Would you like me to [kill you] now?"asked Snape, his voice heavy with irony. "Or would you like a few moments to compose an epitaph?
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Quote: But that was the problem with having the answers. It was only after you gave them that you realized they sometimes weren't what people wanted to hear.
Author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever

Quote: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The problem with marriage is that it ends every night after making love, and it must be rebuilt every morning before breakfast.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

Quote: As a single footstep will not make a path on the earth, so a single thought will not make a pathway in the mind. To make a deep physical path, we walk again and again. To make a deep mental path, we must think over and over the kind of thoughts we wish to dominate our lives.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Writer's block is a fancy term made up by whiners so they can have an excuse to drink alcohol.
Author: Steve Martin

Quote: Okay,"I said. "Just a normal afternoon and two normal people."She nodded. "And so...hypothetically, if these to people likes each other, what would it take to get the stupid guy to kiss the girl, huh?""Oh..."I felt like one of Apollo's sacred cows-slow, dumb, and bright red. "Um...
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Last Olympian

Quote: The good news is that the moment you decide that what you know is more important than what you have been taught to believe, you will have shifted gears in your quest for abundance. Success comes from within, not from without.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The flaw in, say, austerity, is that its success is predicated on the relative exactitude of math rather than the shifting, liquid imperfection of people's lives.
Author: Steven Weber

Quote: Art is longing. You never arrive, but you keep going in the hope that you will.
Author: Anselm Kiefer

Quote: The spring of love becomes hidden and soon filled up.
Author: Max Muller

Quote: But if you read Jane Austen, you know that she had a wicked sense of humor. Not only was she funny, but her early writing was very dark and had a gothic tone to it.
Author: Seth Grahame-Smith

Quote: There is nothing new in art except talent.
Author: Anton Chekhov

Quote: And I didn't choose it, Kat. I chose you.
Author: Ally Carter,  Heist Society

Quote: Be still, sad heart! and cease repining;Behind the clouds is the sun still shining;Thy fate is the common fate of all,Into each life some rain must fall
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow,  Ballads and Other Poems

Quote: To Do Today, 1/17/081. Sit and think2. Reach enlightenment3. Feed the cats
Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Should Have Renamed This

Quote: I can't believe he didn't have the dignity and presence of mind just to get drunk and pass out in some gutter,"said Jace. "I must say, I'm disappointed in the little fellow.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

Quote: My religion consists of a humble admiration of the illimitable superior spirit who reveals himself in the slight details we are able to perceive with our frail and feeble mind.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: There is darkness in light, there is pain in joy, and there are thorns on the rose.
Author: Cate Tiernan

Quote: It is an absolute human certainty that no one can know his own beauty or perceive a sense of his own worth until it has been reflected back to him in the mirror of another loving, caring human being.
Author: John Joseph Powell,  The Secret of Staying in Love

Quote: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. Your really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
Author: Lucille Ball

Quote: Faith is universal. Our specific methods for understanding it are arbitrary. Some of us pray to Jesus, some of us go to Mecca, some of us study subatomic particles. In the end we are all just searching for truth, that which is greater than ourselves.
Author: Dan Brown,  Angels & Demons

Quote: Life is full of misery, loneliness, and suffering - and it's all over much too soon.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: The best way to predict your future is to create it
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: A mighty pain to love it is,And 't is a pain that pain to miss;But of all pains, the greatest painIt is to love, but love in vain.
Author: Abraham Cowley,  The Poems of Abraham Cowley

Quote: Sometimes I ask myself, "Do I have the courage to do the right thing when it matters most?"And that answer, I'm afraid, is silence.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: Just because you are happy it does not mean that the day is perfect but that you have looked beyond its imperfections
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: I would love to saythat youmake meweak in the kneesbutto be quite upfrontand completelytruthfulyoumake my bodyforgetit has kneesat all.
Author: Tyler Knott Gregson,  Love Language

Quote: It is not the failure of others to appreciate your abilities that should trouble you, but rather your failure to appreciate theirs.
Author: Confucius

Quote: He moved like a dancer, which is not surprising; a horse is a beautiful animal, but it is perhaps most remarkable because it moves as if it always hears music.
Author: Mark Helprin,  Winter's Tale

Quote: Honest is how I want to look. The truth doesn't glitter and shine.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Survivor

Quote: What is it you most dislike? Stupidity, especially in its nastiest forms of racism and superstition.
Author: Christopher Hitchens,  Hitch-22: A Memoir

Quote: And perhaps it is the greater grief, after all, to be left on earth when another is gone.
Author: Madeline Miller,  The Song of Achilles

Quote: Writing a novel is a terrible experience, during which the hair often falls out and the teeth decay. I'm always irritated by people who imply that writing fiction is an escape from reality. It is a plunge into reality and it's very shocking to the system.
Author: Flannery O'Connor,  Mystery and Manners: Occasional Prose

Quote: Look at me, chica."When she does, I repeat, "Eres hermosa.""What does it mean?""You're beautiful.
Author: Simone Elkeles,  Rules of Attraction

Quote: The more boys I meet the more I love my dog.
Author: Carrie Underwood

Quote: If you love someone but rarely make yourself available to him or her, that is not true love.
Author: Hanh Nhat Thich,  Living Buddha, Living Christ

Quote: Ah, love, let us be true To one another! for the world, which seems To lie before us like a land of dreams, So various, so beautiful, so new, Hath really neither joy, nor love, nor light, Nor certitude, nor peace, nor help for pain; And we are here as on a darkling plain Swept with confused alarms of struggle and flight, Where ignorant armies clash by night.
Author: Matthew Arnold,  Dover Beach and Other Poems

Quote: When you like someone, you like them in spite of their faults. When you love someone, you love them with their faults.
Author: Hermann Hesse,  Wer lieben kann, ist glücklich. Über die Liebe

Quote: We ate well and cheaply and drank well and cheaply and slept well and warm together and loved each other.
Author: Ernest Hemingway,  A Moveable Feast

Quote: Be yourself; no base imitator of another, but your best self. There is something which you can do better than another. Listen to the inward voice and bravely obey that. Do the things at which you are great, not what you were never made for.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Self-Reliance and Other Essays

Quote: Life begins on the other side of despair.
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: You'd be surprised how many people in the modern age no longer fear zombies as much as teletubies.
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,  Dream Warrior

Quote: You're such a pain in the ass. (Butch) Said the SIG to the Glock. (V)
Author: J.R. Ward,  Lover Revealed

Quote: Let us dance in the sun, wearing wild flowers in our hair...
Author: Susan Polis Schutz

Quote: The man of wisdom is never of two minds;the man of benevolence never worries;the man of courage is never afraid.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Men trust God by risking rejection. Women trust God by waiting.
Author: Carolyn McCulley

Quote: Love blurs your vision; but after it recedes, you can see more clearly than ever. It's like the tide going out, revealing whatever's been thrown away and sunk: broken bottles, old gloves, rusting pop cans, nibbled fishbodies, bones. This is the kind of thing you see if you sit in the darkness with open eyes, not knowing the future. The ruin you've made.
Author: Margaret Atwood,  Cat's Eye

Quote: It is a well-documented fact that guys will not ask for directions. This is a biological thing. This is why it takes several million sperm cells... to locate a female egg, despite the fact that the egg is, relative to them, the size of Wisconsin.
Author: Dave Barry

Quote: Life is like a box of chocolates.
Author: Winston Groom,  Gump and Co.

Quote: The female mind is certainly a devious one, my lord."Vetinari looked at his secretary in surprise. "Well, of course it is. It has to deal with the male one.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Unseen Academicals

Quote: We sing inspirational songs, songs of praise and worship, and about how good and how big God is. We are magnifying the Lord.
Author: Fred Hammond

Quote: Success is the maximum utilization of the ability that you have.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: You know, it shouldn't just be about women as heroic figures overcoming things, it just needs to be about women in general getting the opportunity to play a multitude of roles, telling a multitude of stories - just to express human experience from a woman's perspective. I hope, someday, we can get to that point. I'm all about representation.
Author: Diablo Cody

Quote: Friendship is a strong and habitual inclination in two persons to promote the good and happiness of one another.
Author: Eustace Budgell

Quote: I have wandered all my life, and I have also traveled; the difference between the two being this, that we wander for distraction, but we travel for fulfillment.
Author: Hilaire Belloc

Quote: When you're in love you never really know whether your elation comes from the qualities of the one you love, or if it attributes them to her; whether the light which surrounds her like a halo comes from you, from her, or from the meeting of your sparks.
Author: Natalie Clifford Barney

Quote: To my mind, a well-developed sense of humor is the surest indication of a person's humanity, no matter how black and bitter that humor may be.
Author: Thomas Ligotti

Quote: A great artist is always before his time or behind it.
Author: George Edward Moore

Quote: He had the look of one who had drunk the cup of life and found a dead beetle at the bottom.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse

Quote: younot wanting mewasthe beginning of mewanting myselfthank you
Author: Nayyirah Waheed

Quote: I hunger for your sleek laugh and your hands the color of a furious harvest. I want to eat the sunbeams flaring in your beauty.
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: There is no God and we are his prophets.
Author: Cormac McCarthy,  The Road

Quote: Freely we serveBecause we freely love, as in our willTo love or not; in this we stand or fall.
Author: John Milton

Quote: All the world's a stage and most of us are desperately unrehearsed.
Author: Seán O'Casey

Quote: To love is to suffer and there can be no love otherwise.
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  Notes from Underground
