Quote: Pointing to another world will never stop vice among us; shedding light over this world can alone help us.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Telling an introvert to go to a party is like telling a saint to go to Hell.
Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

Quote: Sometimes two people have to fall apart, to realize how much they need to fall back together.
Author: Colleen Hoover

Quote: I do not believe anyone can be perfectly well, who has a brain and a heart
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Quote: Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books. Books make sense of life. The only problem is that the lives they make sense of are other people's lives, never your own.
Author: Julian Barnes,  Flaubert's Parrot

Quote: It's easy to cry when you realize that everyone you love will reject you or die.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Too many people seem to believe that silence was a void that needed to be filled, even if nothing important was said.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Nights in Rodanthe

Quote: I've learned that you shouldn't go through life with a catcher's mitt on both hands; you need to be able to throw some things back.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: If at first the idea is not absurd, then there is no hope for it.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: When dealing with people, remember you are not dealing with creatures of logic, but with creatures bristling with prejudice and motivated by pride and vanity.
Author: Dale Carnegie,  How to Win Friends and Influence People

Quote: nothing can save you except writing. it keeps the walls from failing.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: You were put on this earth to achieve your greatest self, to live out your purpose, and to do it courageously.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

Quote: Mistakes are, after all, the foundations of truth, and if a man does not know what a thing is, it is at least an increase in knowledge if he knows what it is not.
Author: C.G. Jung

Quote: Falling in love is very real, but I used to shake my head when people talked about soul mates, poor deluded individuals grasping at some supernatural ideal not intended for mortals but sounded pretty in a poetry book. Then, we met, and everything changed, the cynic has become the converted, the sceptic, an ardent zealot.
Author: E.A. Bucchianeri,  Brushstrokes of a Gadfly

Quote: The play was a great success, but audience was a dismal failure.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: People can do great things. However, there are some things they just CAN'T do. I, for instance, have not been able to transform myself into a Popsicle, despite years of effort.
Author: Brandon Sanderson,  Alcatraz Versus the Evil Librarians

Quote: The house smelled musty and damp, and a little sweet, as if it were haunted by the ghosts of long-dead cookies.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  American Gods

Quote: We are the hollow menWe are the stuffed menLeaning togetherHeadpiece filled with straw. Alas!Our dried voices, whenWe whisper togetherAre quiet and meaninglessAs wind in dry grassOr rats' feet over broken glassIn our dry cellarShape without form, shade without colour,Paralysed force, gesture without motion;- The Hollow Men
Author: T.S. Eliot,  Poems: 1909-1925

Quote: As long as Man continues to be the ruthless destroyer of lower living beings, he will never know health or peace. For as long as men massacre animals, they will kill each other. Indeed, he who sows the seed of murder and pain cannot reap joy and love.
Author: Pythagoras

Quote: Love must not entreat,' she added, 'or demand. Love must have the strength to become certain within itself. Then it ceases merely to be attracted and begins to attract.
Author: Hermann Hesse,  Demian: Die Geschichte von Emil Sinclairs Jugend

Quote: To move, to breathe, to fly, to float,To gain all while you give,To roam the roads of lands remote,To travel is to live.
Author: Hans Christian Andersen,  The Fairy Tale of My Life: An Autobiography

Quote: And that's when I understand that I have been stained. Whether I'm still in love with him, whether he was ever in love with me, and no matter who he's in love with now, Willem changed my life. He showed me how to get lost, and then I showed myself how to get found.
Author: Gayle Forman,  Just One Day

Quote: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.
Author: Wayne W. Dyer

Quote: Man invented language to satisfy his deep need to complain.
Author: Lily Tomlin

Quote: Feathers filled the small room. Our laughter kept the feathers in the air. I thought about birds. Could they fly is there wasn't someone, somewhere, laughing?
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

Quote: A cult is a religion with no political power.
Author: Tom Wolfe

Quote: Risk anything! Care no more for the opinion of others ... Do the hardest thing on earth for you. Act for yourself. Face the truth."(Journal entry, 14 October 1922)
Author: Katherine Mansfield,  Journal of Katherine Mansfield

Quote: Space is an inspirational concept that allows you to dream big.
Author: Peter Diamandis

Quote: An artist must never be a prisoner. Prisoner? An artist should never be a prisoner of himself, prisoner of style, prisoner of reputation, prisoner of success, etc.
Author: Henri Matisse

Quote: I'm a big believer in pairing classics with contemporary literature, so students have the opportunity to see that literature is not a cold, dead thing that happened once but instead a vibrant mode of storytelling that's been with us a long time - and will be with us, I hope, for a long time to come.
Author: John Green

Quote: How can sincerity be a condition of friendship? A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Even with all our technology and the inventions that make modern life so much easier than it once was, it takes just one big natural disaster to wipe all that away and remind us that, here on Earth, we're still at the mercy of nature.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: Love is the ultimate expression of the will to live.
Author: Tom Wolfe

Quote: Humor is imperative, more important than food. You have a choice when someone dies. You can lie down or get back into life. Do something for someone else.
Author: Doris Roberts

Quote: A work of art has no importance whatever to society. It is only important to the individual.
Author: Vladimir Nabokov

Quote: When defeat comes, accept it as a signal that your plans are not sound, rebuild those plans, and set sail once more toward your coveted goal.
Author: Napoleon Hill,  Think and Grow Rich

Quote: Your naked body should only belong to those who fall in love with your naked soul.
Author: Charlie Chaplin

Quote: Just believe everything I tell you, and it will all be very, very simple.'Ah, well, I'm not sure I believe that.
Author: Douglas Adams,  Life, the Universe and Everything

Quote: I've been in love with you since the very beginning. You asked why there isn't anyone else in my life, and the reason... is you.
Author: Julie James,  Practice Makes Perfect

Quote: One of the world's most tiresome questions is what object one would bring to a desert island,because people always answer "a deck of cards"or "Anna Karenina"when the obvious answer is "a well equipped boat and a crew to sail me off the island and back home where I can play all the card games and read all the Russian novels I want.
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.
Author: René Descartes

Quote: The phoenix must burn to emerge.
Author: Janet Fitch,  White Oleander

Quote: A poet is, before anything else, a person who is passionately in love with language.
Author: W.H. Auden,  The Complete Works of W.H. Auden: Prose, Volume II: 1939-1948

Quote: When I am attacked by gloomy thoughts, nothing helps me so much as running to my books. They quickly absorb me and banish the clouds from my mind.
Author: Michel de Montaigne,  Les Essais

Quote: Every life has one true love snapshot.
Author: Mitch Albom,  The Five People You Meet in Heaven

Quote: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
Author: Annie Dillard,  The Writing Life

Quote: I'll never know, and neither will you, of the life you don't choose. We'll only know that whatever that sister life was, it was important and beautiful and not ours. It was the ghost ship that didn't carry us. There's nothing to do but salute it from the shore.
Author: Cheryl Strayed,  Tiny Beautiful Things: Advice on Love and Life from Dear Sugar

Quote: Try again. Fail again. Fail better.
Author: Samuel Beckett

Quote: Arthur: If I asked you where the hell we were, would I regret it?Ford: We're safe.Arthur: Oh good.Ford: We're in a small galley cabin in one of the spaceships of the Vogon Constructor Fleet.Arthur: Ah, this is obviously some strange use of the word safe that I wasn't previously aware of.
Author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

Quote: Don't mistake activity with achievement.
Author: John Wooden

Quote: There's no need to wait for the bad things and bullshit to be over. Change now. Love now. Live now. Don't wait for people to give you permission to live, because they won't.
Author: Kris Carr,  Crazy Sexy Diet: Eat Your Veggies, Ignite Your Spark, and Live Like You Mean It!

Quote: I thought perhaps that when you told me you did not love me that my own feelings would fall away and atrophy, but they have not. They have grown every day. I love you now more desperately, this moment, than I have ever loved you before, and in an hour I will love you more than that
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Princess

Quote: There aren't any syringes."Red Sox came over and held a sterile pack out. When she tried to take it from him, he kept a grip on the thing. "I know you'll use this wisely.""Wisely?"She snapped the syringe out of his hand. "No, I'm going to poke him in the eye with it. Because that's what they trained me to do in medical school.
Author: J.R. Ward,  Lover Unbound

Quote: There will be no yelling at people who are bleeding themselves to unconsciousness.
Author: Kristin Cashore,  Fire

Quote: So dawn goes down today... Nothing gold can stay.-- Robert Frost
Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

Quote: Nothing is more creative... nor destructive... than a brilliant mind with a purpose.
Author: Dan Brown,  Inferno

Quote: I'm backing down now. I really do love you. That's why I'm doing this.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Last Sacrifice

Quote: It doesn't matter if a million people tell you what you can't do, or if ten million tell you no. If you get one yes from God that's all you need.
Author: Tyler Perry

Quote: You're Hell's Angels, then? What chapter are you from?''REVELATIONS. CHAPTER SIX.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  Good Omens: The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch

Quote: THINGS YOU NEVER HEAR: 'Please stop sucking my dick or I'll call the police.
Author: George Carlin,  Brain Droppings

Quote: This is how the entire course of a life can be changed: by doing nothing.
Author: Ian McEwan,  On Chesil Beach

Quote: Feet, what do I need them forIf I have wings to fly.
Author: Frida Kahlo

Quote: If my mind can conceive it, and my heart can believe it - then I can achieve it.
Author: Muhammad Ali,  The Soul of a Butterfly: Reflections on Life's Journey

Quote: You fit into melike a hook into an eyea fish hookan open eye
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quote: I want to be an inspirational model. I want people to look at me and say, 'Wow, she looks healthy.'
Author: Ireland Baldwin

Quote: I'm either going to go completely mental, completely bankrupt, or have the best success of my life.
Author: Katy Perry

Quote: I always try to put a seed of hope into people's hearts. I'm not there to teach them doctrine necessarily, but to let them know that God is a good God, and has a plan for their lives. Hopefully, that will restore their faith, or draw them into faith.
Author: Joel Osteen

Quote: Friendship with ones self is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: A library is the delivery room for the birth of ideas, a place where history comes to life.
Author: Norman Cousins

Quote: For above all things Love means sweetness, and truth, and measure; yea, loyalty to the loved one and to your word. And because of this I dare not meddle with so high a matter.
Author: Marie de France

Quote: The great thing about university is that they incline you to get up and do it, from the Classics to modern plays, to the humor that Monty Pythons made popular.
Author: Michael York

Quote: Rationalism is the enemy of art, though necessary as a basis for architecture.
Author: Arthur Erickson

Quote: Every time I think I'm missing a piece of me, you give it back.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Heavenly Fire

Quote: Every normal man must be tempted, at times, to spit on his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin slitting throats.
Author: H.L. Mencken,  Prejudices: First Series

Quote: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy to a friend.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: If love be rough with you, be rough with love. Prick love for pricking and you beat love down.
Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet

Quote: When you have exhausted all possibilities, remember this - you haven't.
Author: Thomas A. Edison

Quote: Freedom in capitalist society always remains about the same as it was in ancient Greek republics: Freedom for slave owners.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: Faith consists in believing what reason cannot.
Author: Voltaire,  The Works: Voltaire

Quote: Hearts may break, but hearts are the toughest of muscles, able to pump for a lifetime, seventy times a minute, and scarcely falter along the way. Even dreams, the most delicate and intangible of things, can prove remarkably difficult to kill.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  Fragile Things: Short Fictions and Wonders

Quote: There is creative reading as well as creative writing.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I was feeling the height of bitchiness.
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,  Obsidian

Quote: O teach me how I should forget to think (1.1.224)
Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet

Quote: Walking the stacks in a library, dragging your fingers across the spines -- it's hard not to feel the presence of sleeping spirits.
Author: Robin Sloan,  Mr. Penumbra's 24-Hour Bookstore

Quote: You're never alone when you're reading a book.
Author: Susan Wiggs

Quote: When you're missing a peice of yourself, aching, gut wrenching emptiness begins to take over. Until you find the link that completes your very soul, the feeling will never go away. Most people find a way to fill this void, material possessions, a string of relationships, affairs, food...I bear my soul, with words, for all to see.
Author: Jennifer Salaiz

Quote: Love never dies.
Author: Lauren Kate,  Torment

Quote: Life's like a movie, write your own ending. Keep believing, keep pretending.
Author: Jim Henson

Quote: If you have to dry the dishes (Such an awful boring chore)If you have to dry the dishes('Stead of going to the store)If you have to dry the dishesAnd you drop one on the floorMaybe they won't let youDry the dishes anymore
Author: Shel Silverstein,  A Light in the Attic

Quote: Just because something is traditional is no reason to do it, of course. Piracy, for example, is a tradition that has been carried on for hundreds of years, but that doesn't mean we should all attack ships and steal their gold.
Author: Lemony Snicket,  Horseradish

Quote: The way out is through the door. Why is it that no one will use this method?
Author: Confucius

Quote: in this land some of us fuck more than we die but most of us die better than we fuck
Author: Charles Bukowski,  Love is a Dog from Hell

Quote: I know nothing in the world that has as much power as a word. Sometimes I write one, and I look at it, until it begins to shine.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: It is better to lose your pride with someone you love rather than to lose that someone you love with your useless pride.
Author: John Ruskin

Quote: Nothing's perfect, the world's not perfect. But it's there for us, trying the best it can; that's what makes it so damn beautiful.
Author: Hiromu Arakawa,  Fullmetal Alchemist, Vol. 1

Quote: Piece of Heaven?""No, that other place I'm going to go to for thinking what I'm thinking.
Author: Richelle Mead,  The Indigo Spell

Quote: Bea says that the art of reading is slowly dying, that it's an intimate ritual, that a book is a mirror that offers us only what we already carry inside us, that when we read, we do it with all our heart and mind, and great readers are becoming more scarce by the day.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind

Quote: Tears are words the heart can't express
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: Chocolate says "I'm sorry"so much better than words.
Author: Rachel Vincent,  My Soul to Save

Quote: Power does not corrupt. Fear corrupts... perhaps the fear of a loss of power.
Author: John Steinbeck

Quote: Dogs are not our whole life, but they make our lives whole.
Author: Roger A. Caras

Quote: The greatest ideas are the simplest.
Author: William Golding,  Lord of the Flies

Quote: It only takes a split second to smile and forget, yet to someone that needed it, it can last a lifetime.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

Quote: Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.
Author: Vince Lombardi Jr.

Quote: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quote: My desire and wish is that the things I start with should be so obvious that you wonder why I spend my time stating them. This is what I aim at because the point of philosophy is to start with something so simple as not to seem worth stating, and to end with something so paradoxical that no one will believe it.
Author: Bertrand Russell,  The Philosophy of Logical Atomism

Quote: Far better it is to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs, even though checkered by failure, than to take rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy much nor suffer much, because they live in the gray twilight that knows neither victory nor defeat.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt,  Strenuous Life

Quote: I believe that life is a game, that life is a cruel joke, and that life is what happens when you're alive and that you might as well lie back and enjoy it.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  American Gods

Quote: We come to love not by finding a perfect person, but by learning to see an imperfect person perfectly.
Author: Sam Keen,  To Love and Be Loved

Quote: Wanting him to come back before anyone notices part of the world has not moved since he left.
Author: Brian Andreas

Quote: If the path before you is clear, you're probably on someone else's.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: Lover? I don't know. I don't know if she loves me. I don't know if I love her. All I can say is, she's the one I think about. All the time. She's the voice I want to hear. She's the face I hope to see.
Author: Sophie Kinsella,  I've Got Your Number

Quote: You cannot teach a man anything, you can only help him find it within himself.
Author: Galileo Galilei

Quote: Concentrate on what you want to say to yourself and your friends. Follow your inner moonlight; don't hide the madness. You say what you want to say when you don't care who's listening.
Author: Allen Ginsberg

Quote: I have learned that success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome while trying to succeed.
Author: Booker T. Washington,  Up From Slavery: An Autobiography

Quote: The keys to brand success are self-definition, transparency, authenticity and accountability.
Author: Simon Mainwaring

Quote: When people talk of the freedom of writing, speaking or thinking I cannot choose but laugh. No such thing ever existed. No such thing now exists; but I hope it will exist. But it must be hundreds of years after you and I shall write and speak no more.
Author: John Adams

Quote: You've got to know what you want. This is central to acting on your intentions. When you know what you want, you realize that all there is left then is time management. You'll manage your time to achieve your goals because you clearly know what you're trying to achieve in your life.
Author: Patch Adams

Quote: Love, having no geography, knows no boundaries.
Author: Truman Capote

Quote: I think I've learned that if you want to be successful, you have to tell your story honestly and from your heart - and I think a healthy sense of humor doesn't hurt either.
Author: Dorothea Benton Frank

Quote: Only through art can we emerge from ourselves and know what another person sees.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quote: So much working, reading, thinking, living to do! A lifetime is not long enough.
Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

Quote: Fight for the only thing she knew was good enough, noble enough, powerful enough to be worth risking everything... Love.
Author: Lauren Kate

Quote: Sweets to the sweet.
Author: William Shakespeare,  Hamlet

Quote: I don't remember who said this, but there really are places in the heart you don't even know exist until you love a child.
Author: Anne Lamott,  Operating Instructions: A Journal of My Son's First Year

Quote: She had never imagined she had the power to make someone else so happy. And not a magical power, either--a purely human one.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Prince

Quote: I want to say something so embarrassing about September that even the leaves start blushing and turning red.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want Two apply for a job at our country's largest funeral home, and then wear a suit and noose to the job interview.

Quote: I suppose that since most of our hurts come through relationships so will our healing, and I know that grace rarely makes sense for those looking in from the outside.
Author: Wm. Paul Young,  The Shack

Quote: Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs.
Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet

Quote: Once in a golden hour I cast to earth a seed. Up there came a flower, The people said, a weed.
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson,  The Complete Works of Alfred Tennyson

Quote: I love you when you bow in your mosque, kneel in your temple, pray in your church. For you and I are sons of one religion, and it is the spirit.
Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet

Quote: Our great democracies still tend to think that a stupid man is more likely to be honest than a clever man, and our politicians take advantage of this prejudice by pretending to be even more stupid than nature made them.
Author: Bertrand Russell,  New Hopes for a Changing World

Quote: Love simply is.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Witch Of Portobello

Quote: ...and when one of them meets the other half, the actual half of himself, whether he be a lover of youth or a lover of another sort, the pair are lost in an amazement of love and friendship and intimacy and one will not be out of the other's sight, as I may say, even for a moment...
Author: Plato,  The Symposium

Quote: You have wakened not out of sleep, but into a prior dream, and that dream lies within another, and so on, to infinity, which is the number of grains of sand. The path that you are to take is endless, and you will die before you have truly awakened.
Author: Jorge Luis Borges

Quote: Life happens. Shit happens. And it happens a lot. To a lot of people.
Author: Colleen Hoover,  Slammed

Quote: Let me love you, but don't love me back. Do love me and let me hate you for a while. Let me feel like I have some control, because I know I never do.
Author: Ann Brashares

Quote: Stay hungry. Stay foolish.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: Beauty is about being comfortable in your own skin. It's about knowing and accepting who you are.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres,  Seriously... I'm Kidding

Quote: Attraction is not an option.
Author: Neil Strauss

Quote: The best time for planning a book is while you're doing the dishes.
Author: Agatha Christie

Quote: If you truly love a book, you should sleep with it, write in it, read aloud from it, and fill its pages with muffin crumbs.
Author: Anne Fadiman

Quote: There are many, many types of books in the world, which makes good sense, because there are many, many types of people, and everybody wants to read something different.
Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Bad Beginning

Quote: If you love me as you say you do,' she whispered, 'make it so that I am at peace.
Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Anna Karenina

Quote: I know it's not easy for you, living this life, but try to remember, always try to remember, you're not the only one with troubles.
Author: Laini Taylor,  Daughter of Smoke & Bone

Quote: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: Everything will turn out right, the world is built on that.
Author: Mikhail Bulgakov,  The Master and Margarita

Quote: But death was her curse and her gift, and death had been her good friend these long, long years.
Author: Sarah J. Maas,  Crown of Midnight

Quote: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
Author: Alan W. Watts

Quote: Relationships are all about trust and equality. If one person shares, then the other person should share, too.
Author: Sophie Kinsella,  Can You Keep a Secret?

Quote: When you do something noble and beautiful and nobody noticed, do not be sad. For the sun every morning is a beautiful spectacle and yet most of the audience still sleeps.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: Sometimes I feel like we're a knot, too tangled to be taken apart.
Author: Kiera Cass,  The Elite

Quote: Most men claim to desire driven, independent and confident women. Yet when confronted with such a creature reverence often evolves into resent. For just like women, men need to be needed.
Author: Tiffany Madison

Quote: Never respond to an angry person with a fiery comeback, even if he deserves it...Don't allow his anger to become your anger.
Author: Bohdi Sanders,  Warrior Wisdom: Ageless Wisdom for the Modern Warrior

Quote: We all have two lives. The second one starts when we realize that we only have one.
Author: Tom Hiddleston

Quote: I think it's kinda nice.' And I did. my mom isn't famous for her pies. No, she's famous for defusing a nuclear device in Brussels with only a pair of cuticle scissors and a ponytail holder. Somehow, at the moment, pies seemed cooler.
Author: Ally Carter,  I'd Tell You I Love You, But Then I'd Have to Kill You

Quote: We buy things we don't need with money we don't have to impress people we don't like.
Author: Dave Ramsey,  The Total Money Makeover: A Proven Plan for Financial Fitness

Quote: The truth is like a nipple: the more you twist it, the more somebody is going to get hurt.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: I will not tell you our love story, because-like all real love stories-it will die with us,as it should.
Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

Quote: Don't fuck with an English major. They keep lots of useless crap trapped in their heads. Once in a while they let some of it out and it bites you square on the ass.
Author: P.C. Cast,  Divine By Mistake

Quote: Only the united beat of sex and heart together can create ecstasy.
Author: Anaïs Nin,  Delta of Venus

Quote: The menu is not the meal.
Author: Alan W. Watts

Quote: If you can't run, you crawl. If you can't crawl-- you find someone to carry you.
Author: Joss Whedon

Quote: To truly laugh, you must be able to take your pain, and play with it.
Author: Charlie Chaplin

Quote: Success is determined not by whether or not you face obstacles, but by your reaction to them. And if you look at these obstacles as a containing fence, they become your excuse for failure. If you look at them as a hurdle, each one strengthens you for the next.
Author: Ben Carson,  Gifted Hands: The Ben Carson Story

Quote: Memory is the happiness of being alone.
Author: Lois Lowry,  Anastasia Krupnik

Quote: Art should comfort the disturbed and disturb the comfortable.
Author: Banksy

Quote: Time for you and time for me, And time yet for a hundred indecisions, And for a hundred visions and revisions, Before the taking of a toast and tea.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: You're insane!"she shouted."Pretty cool, huh?""No!"Tally yelled. "Why didn't you tell me it was broken?"Shay shrugged. "More fun that way?""More fun?"Her heart beating fast,her vision strangely clear. She was full of anger and relief and...joy."Well, kind of. But you suck!
Author: Scott Westerfeld,  Uglies

Quote: We all obviously need others to look up to, and be inspirational to us. Ford did a great job as far as putting the presidency back where it belonged, getting the trust back after Nixon. And President Reagan has been one of the most influential presidents.
Author: Steve Garvey

Quote: When I finish a picture I don't show it to anyone if I feel it's not good enough yet. I've learnt to listen to my partners and my friends. For me it's the biggest success if they like it.
Author: Marilyn Manson

Quote: Marriage is the death of hope.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: From an early age I didn't buy into the value systems of working hard in a nine-to-five job. I thought creativity, friendship and loyalty and pushing the boundaries of what was acceptable was much more interesting.
Author: Adam Clayton

Quote: The clearest way to show what the rule of law means to us in everyday life is to recall what has happened when there is no rule of law.
Author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

Quote: A loving heart is the beginning of all knowledge.
Author: Thomas Carlyle

Quote: I hang out with the 'nerdy' people - they have a different sense of humor than most kids.
Author: Liam Aiken

Quote: Painting seems like some kind of peculiar miracle that I need to have again and again.
Author: Philip Guston

Quote: As far as we can discern, the sole purpose of human existence is to kindle a light of meaning in the darkness of mere being.
Author: C.G. Jung

Quote: The most enjoyable book in the world is the phone book, because think of all the sex that went into creating the content.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  99 Cents For Some Nonsense

Quote: What do I care how 'e looks? I am good-looking enough for both of us, I theenk! All these scars show is zat my husband is brave!
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: Remake the world, a little at a time, each in your own corner of the world.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Pegang tanganku, tapi jangan terlalu erat, karena aku ingin seiring dan bukan digiring.(Spasi)
Author: Dee Lestari,  Filosofi Kopi: Kumpulan Cerita dan Prosa Satu Dekade

Quote: You can drag my body to school but my spirit refuses to go.
Author: Bill Watterson,  The Essential Calvin and Hobbes

Quote: Falling in love you remain a child; rising in love you mature. By and by love becomes not a relationship, it becomes a state of your being. Not that you are in love - now you are love.
Author: Osho

Quote: I think you can only be truly mad at someone you really love.
Author: E.L. James,  Fifty Shades Freed

Quote: Love is so unpredictable. That's what makes it so great.
Author: Sarah Dessen,  This Lullaby

Quote: Civilized men are more discourteous than savages because they know they can be impolite without having their skulls split, as a general thing.
Author: Robert E. Howard

Quote: Hobbes: Do you think there's a God?Calvin: Well, somebody's out to get me!
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: I'm not dumb. I just have a command of thoroughly useless information.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: Perhaps not one religion contains all of the truth of the world. Perhaps every religion contains fragments of the truth, and it is our responsibility to identify those fragments and piece them together.
Author: Christopher Paolini,  Brisingr

Quote: Really, these wizards! You'd think no one had ever had a cold before! Well, what is it?"she asked, hobbling through the bedroom door onto the filthy carpet."I'm dying of boredom,"Howl said pathetically. "Or maybe just dying.
Author: Diana Wynne Jones,  Howl's Moving Castle

Quote: I could tell by their audible gasps that the people on the beach were jealous of me when I found five shark's teeth. Locating them wasn't really the problem, but pulling them out of my leg was.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  It Occurred to Me

Quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: They tell us that Suicide is the greatest piece of Cowardice... That Suicide is wrong; when it is quite obvious that there is nothing in this world to which every man has a more unassailable title than to his own life and person.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: Love who you love while you have them. That's all you can do. Let them go when you must. If you know how to love, you'll never run out.
Author: Ann Brashares,  My Name Is Memory

Quote: Two words. Three vowels. Four constenants. Seven letters. It can either cut you open to the core and leave you in ungodly pain or it can free your soul and lift a tremendous weight off you shoulders. The phrase is: It's over.
Author: Maggi Richard

Quote: God, grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
Author: Reinhold Niebuhr

Quote: Max, if you survive your final test, can you steal me one of those magic outfits for me?"I'll try to get one for each of us. Hey! 'If'?
Author: James Patterson,  Saving the World and Other Extreme Sports

Quote: TV and the Internet are good because they keep stupid people from spending too much time out in public.
Author: Douglas Coupland,  JPod

Quote: My bullshit meter is reading that as 'false'.
Author: Charlaine Harris,  Dead as a Doornail

Quote: Education either functions as an instrument which is used to facilitate integration of the younger generation into the logic of the present system and bring about conformity or it becomes the practice of freedom, the means by which men and women deal critically and creatively with reality and discover how to participate in the transformation of their world.
Author: Richard Shaull,  Pedagogy of the Oppressed

Quote: My arms are killing me. I didn't know words could be so heavy.
Author: Markus Zusak,  I Am the Messenger

Quote: Only the development of compassion and understanding for others can bring us the tranquility and happiness we all seek.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: Whatever in creation exists without my knowledge exists without my consent.
Author: Cormac McCarthy,  Blood Meridian, or the Evening Redness in the West

Quote: Never let go of a good thing without a fight. Especially if that good thing is a pair of boxing gloves.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: One half of the world cannot understand the pleasures of the other.
Author: Jane Austen,  Emma

Quote: This life is for loving, sharing, learning, smiling, caring, forgiving, laughing, hugging, helping, dancing, wondering, healing, and even more loving. I choose to live life this way. I want to live my life in such a way that when I get out of bed in the morning, the devil says, 'aw shit, he's up!
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

Quote: A true gentleman is one that apologizes anyways, even though he has not offended a lady intentionally. He is in a class all of his own because he knows the value of a woman's heart.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: When a stargirl cries, she sheds not tears but light.
Author: Jerry Spinelli,  Stargirl

Quote: Just move to the Internet, its great here. We get to live inside where the weather is always awesome.
Author: John Green

Quote: I tried to believe that there is a God, who created each of us in His own image and likeness, loves us very much, and keeps a close eye on things. I really tried to believe that, but I gotta tell you, the longer you live, the more you look around, the more you realize, something is fucked up.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I really think that it's disgusting that Paris is the only place where it is illegal for paps to follow you around. It actually took someone losing their life - Diana, an inspirational woman - and then it changed, but they still won't change it in London! It's horrible!
Author: Cara Delevingne

Quote: Middle class families are struggling to send their sons and daughters to school. For many Americans, a college education is essential to future success.
Author: Albio Sires

Quote: Religion. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
Author: Ambrose Bierce

Quote: True happiness arises, in the first place, from the enjoyment of one's self, and in the next, from the friendship and conversation of a few select companions.
Author: Joseph Addison

Quote: There's a period of life when we swallow a knowledge of ourselves and it becomes either good or sour inside.
Author: Pearl Bailey

Quote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own... Jealousy is a disease, love is a healthy condition. The immature mind often mistakes one for the other, or assumes that the greater the love, the greater the jealousy.
Author: Robert A. Heinlein

Quote: Comedy is still alive, and there are still funny people. Jews are still overrepresented in comedy and psychiatry and underrepresented in the priesthood. That immigrant Jewish humor is still with us.
Author: Robert Klein

Quote: The works must be conceived with fire in the soul but executed with clinical coolness.
Author: Joan Miro

Quote: I make love like the 13th floor is the 14th floor of a hotel. I give it that little extra that takes it to a whole new level.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion'.
Author: Muhammad Ali

Quote: All men want, not something to do with, but something to do, or rather something to be.
Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden

Quote: That proves you are unusual,"returned the Scarecrow; "and I am convinced that the only people worthy of consideration in this world are the unusual ones. For the common folks are like the leaves of a tree, and live and die unnoticed.
Author: L. Frank Baum

Quote: I am a wizard, not a baboon brandishing a stick.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: The truth knocks on the door and you say, "Go away, I'm looking for the truth,"and so it goes away. Puzzling.
Author: Robert M. Pirsig,  Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry Into Values

Quote: I don't want to live in the kind of world where we don't look out for each other. Not just the people that are close to us, but anybody who needs a helping hand. I cant change the way anybody else thinks, or what they choose to do, but I can do my bit.
Author: Charles de Lint

Quote: My reading list grows exponentially. Every time I read a book, it'll mention three other books I feel I have to read. It's like a particularly relentless series of pop-up ads.
Author: A.J. Jacobs,  The Year of Living Biblically: One Man's Humble Quest to Follow the Bible as Literally as Possible

Quote: You're the queen, and it's the queen's house, and whatever Brigan may accomplish, he's highly unlikely ever to be queen.
Author: Kristin Cashore,  Fire

Quote: After writing a story I was always empty and both sad and happy, as though I had made love, and I was sure this was a very good story although I would not know truly how good until I read it over the next day.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: When I was a child, when I was an adolescent, books saved me from despair: that convinced me that culture was the highest of values[...].
Author: Simone de Beauvoir,  The Woman Destroyed

Quote: What I'm not sure about, is if our lives have been so different from the lives of the people we save. We all complete. Maybe none of us really understand what we've lived through, or feel we've had enough time.
Author: Kazuo Ishiguro,  Never Let Me Go

Quote: He was contemplation and enthusiasm. Ambition and strong coffee. I could have looked at him forever.
Author: E. Lockhart,  We Were Liars

Quote: True beauty is something that attacks, overpowers, robs, and finally destroys.
Author: Yukio Mishima

Quote: Sit in a room and read--and read and read. And read the right books by the right people. Your mind is brought onto that level, and you have a nice, mild, slow-burning rapture all the time.
Author: Joseph Campbell,  The Power of Myth

Quote: I never hated a man enough to give him his diamonds back.
Author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

Quote: What is now proved was once only imagined.
Author: William Blake

Quote: I was a little excited but mostly blorft. "Blorft"is an adjective I just made up that means 'Completely overwhelmed but proceeding as if everything is fine and reacting to the stress with the torpor of a possum.' I have been blorft every day for the past seven years.
Author: Tina Fey,  Bossypants

Quote: I have left orders to be awakened at any time during national emergency, even if I'm in a cabinet meeting.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: As for monkeys, I would have five, and they would be named: See No Evil, Hear No Evil, Speak No Evil, Do Pretty Much Whatever The Hell You Want, and Expensive Attorney.
Author: Tad Williams

Quote: Ever heard of the rule of three? he shouts as we run.No!If you save somebody's life three times, their life belongs to you. You saved my life today, that makes once. Save it twice more an I'm all yers.
Author: Moira Young,  Blood Red Road

Quote: What do you most value in your friends?Their continued existence.
Author: Christopher Hitchens,  Hitch-22: A Memoir

Quote: A truth should exist,it should not be usedlike this. If I love youis that a fact or a weapon?
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quote: It may be important to great thinkers to examine the world, to explain and despise it. But I think it is only important to love the world, not to despise it, not for us to hate each other, but to be able to regard the world and ourselves and all beings with love, admiration and respect.
Author: Hermann Hesse,  Siddhartha

Quote: If others tell us something we make assumptions, and if they don't tell us something we make assumptions to fulfill our need to know and to replace the need to communicate. Even if we hear something and we don't understand we make assumptions about what it means and then believe the assumptions. We make all sorts of assumptions because we don't have the courage to ask questions.
Author: Miguel Ruiz,  The Four Agreements: A Practical Guide to Personal Freedom

Quote: Know that love is truly timeless.
Author: Mary M. Ricksen

Quote: The caterpillar does all the work, but the butterfly gets all the publicity.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: What the hell is instant? Nothing is instant. Instant rice takes five minutes, instant pudding an hour. I doubt that an instant of blinding pain feels particularly instantaneous.
Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

Quote: Serenity is when you get above all this, when it doesn't matter what they think, say or want, but when you do as you are, and see God and Devil as one.
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: I write entirely to find out what I'm thinking, what I'm looking at, what I see and what it means. What I want and what I fear.
Author: Joan Didion

Quote: The tragedy of life is what dies inside a man while he lives.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Nothing ever really goes away--it just changes into something else. Something beautiful.
Author: Sarah Ockler,  Twenty Boy Summer

Quote: Yeah, but the lost diadem,"said Michael Corner, rolling his eyes, "is lost, Luna. That's sort of the point.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Quote: Now what happens?"asked the man in black. "We face each other as God intended,"Fezzik said. "No tricks, no weapons, skill against skill alone.""You mean you'll put down your rock and I'll put down my sword and we'll try to kill each other like civilized people, is that it?
Author: William Goldman,  The Princess Bride

Quote: People talk too much. Humans aren't descended from monkeys. They come from parrots.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind

Quote: One thing I have learned in a long life: that all our science, measured against reality, is primitive and childlike -- and yet it is the most precious thing we have.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Sometimes I get real lonely sleeping with you.
Author: Haruki Murakami,  A Wild Sheep Chase

Quote: Art is unquestionably one of the purest and highest elements in human happiness. It trains the mind through the eye, and the eye through the mind. As the sun colors flowers, so does art color life.
Author: John Lubbock,  The Pleasures of Life

Quote: He not busy being born is busy dying.
Author: Bob Dylan

Quote: The only time you fail is when you fall down and stay down.
Author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering: You can be successful

Quote: Cherish those who seek the truth but beware of those who find it.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Don't assume, ask. Be kind. Tell the truth. Don't say anything you can't stand behind fully. Have integrity. Tell people how you feel.
Author: Warsan Shire

Quote: Oh, you know. Jace reminds me of an old boyfriend. Some guys look at you like they want sex. Jace looks at you like you've already had sex, it was great, and now you're just friends--even though you want more. Drives girls crazy. You know what I mean?"Yes, Clary thought. "No,"she said.pg. 280
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

Quote: I define connection as the energy that exists between people when they feel seen, heard, and valued; when they can give and receive without judgment; and when they derive sustenance and strength from the relationship.
Author: Brené Brown

Quote: One of the great things about books is sometimes there are some fantastic pictures.
Author: George W. Bush

Quote: All my music is inspirational. You just gotta listen to the words and get what you can get out of it.
Author: Young Jeezy

Quote: Earl Nightingale has inspired more people toward success and fortune than any other motivational speaker on the planet.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: The mind is never satisfied with the objects immediately before it, but is always breaking away from the present moment, and losing itself in schemes of future felicity... The natural flights of the human mind are not from pleasure to pleasure, but from hope to hope.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: True friendship is a plant of slow growth, and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity, before it is entitled to the appellation.
Author: George Washington

Quote: The moment you have in your heart this extraordinary thing called love and feel the depth, the delight, the ecstasy of it, you will discover that for you the world is transformed.
Author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

Quote: I find any sort of acting that doesn't have any humor in it is mind-numbingly boring. 'Serious acting' is the kind of acting that I don't ever respond to.
Author: Andrew Scott

Quote: Rules and models destroy genius and art.
Author: William Hazlitt

Quote: I definitely learned a lesson this time. I know that I can be broken. I am not as tough as I thought. I see it now. At this point, it's the only thing good that came out of all of this. I know myself better now and know what I have to do.
Author: Henry Rollins,  The Portable Henry Rollins

Quote: I'm in love with you, and I'm not in the business of denying myself the simple pleasure of saying true things.
Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

Quote: Hope is not about proving anything. It's about choosing to believe this one thing, that love is bigger than any grim, bleak shit anyone can throw at us.
Author: Anne Lamott,  Plan B: Further Thoughts on Faith

Quote: Are you on our side...and want to be different, or are you on that side and want to throw a football at my head!?
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: I am seeking, I am striving, I am in it with all my heart.
Author: Vincent van Gogh

Quote: We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  By the River Piedra I Sat Down and Wept

Quote: I am ready for whatever's coming. I expect nothing but to be let down or turned away. I am alone. Goddamn. The shit hurts sometimes, but I realize what I am, what I have become.
Author: Henry Rollins

Quote: Submission is not about authority and it is not obedience; it is all about relationships of love and respect.
Author: Wm. Paul Young,  The Shack

Quote: I reserve the right to love many different people at once, and to change my prince often.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: Whether we fall by ambition, blood, or lustLike diamonds we are cut with our own dust
Author: John Webster

Quote: Life belongs to the living, and he who lives must be prepared for changes.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Blood may be thicker than water, but it's certainly not as thick as ketchup. Nor does it go as well with French fries.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: There's only one rule you need to remember: laugh at everything and foget everybody else! It sound egotistical, but it's actually the only cure for those suffering from self-pity.
Author: Anne Frank,  The Diary of Anne Frank

Quote: Fair means everyone gets what they need. And the only way to get what you need is to make it happen yourself.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Red Pyramid

Quote: Stairs,"Valkyrie said, disappointed."Not just ordinary stairs,"Skulduggery told her as he led the way down. "Magic stairs.""Really?""Oh, yes."She followed him into the darkness. "How are they magic?""They just are.""In what way?""In a magicky way."She glared at the back of his head. "They aren't magic at all, are they?""Not really.
Author: Derek Landy,  Mortal Coil

Quote: Destiny is a name often given in retrospect to choices that had dramatic consequences.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: If you want to change the world, pick up your pen and write.
Author: Martin Luther

Quote: A writer - and, I believe, generally all persons - must think that whatever happens to him or her is a resource. All things have been given to us for a purpose, and an artist must feel this more intensely. All that happens to us, including our humiliations, our misfortunes, our embarrassments, all is given to us as raw material, as clay, so that we may shape our art.
Author: Jorge Luis Borges,  Twenty-Four Conversations with Borges: Interviews by Roberto Alifano 1981-1983

Quote: As always, one of her books was next to her.
Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

Quote: Love is like breathing, you take it in and let it out.
Author: Wally Lamb,  She's Come Undone

Quote: Confession is not betrayal. What you say or do doesn't matter; only feelings matter. If they could make me stop loving you-that would be the real betrayal.
Author: George Orwell,  1984

Quote: Your "I CAN"is more important than your IQ.
Author: Robin S. Sharma,  The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari

Quote: No. Don't give up hope just yet. It's the last thing to go. When you have lost hope, you have lost everything. And when you think all is lost, when all is dire and bleak, there is always hope.
Author: Pittacus Lore,  I Am Number Four

Quote: The pure present is an ungraspable advance of the past devouring the future. In truth, all sensation is already memory.
Author: Henri Bergson,  Matter and Memory

Quote: The language of Friendship is not words, but meanings.
Author: Henry David Thoreau,  A Week on the Concord and Merrimack Rivers

Quote: Trust is the glue of life. It's the most essential ingredient in effective communication. It's the foundational principle that holds all relationships.
Author: Stephen R. Covey

Quote: Sometimes I think my head is so big because it is so full of dreams
Author: R.J. Palacio,  Wonder

Quote: Margaret Atwood, the Canadian novelist, once asked a group of women at a university why they felt threatened by men. The women said they were afraid of being beaten, raped, or killed by men. She then asked a group of men why they felt threatened by women. They said they were afraid women would laugh at them.
Author: Molly Ivins,  Molly Ivins Can't Say That, Can She?

Quote: From the beginning men used God to justify the unjustifiable.
Author: Salman Rushdie,  The Satanic Verses

Quote: It's only in drugs or death we'll see anything new, and death is just too controlling.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Survivor

Quote: O may I join the choir invisibleOf those immortal dead who live againIn minds made better by their presence; liveIn pulses stirred to generosity,In deeds of daring rectitude...
Author: George Eliot,  O May I Join the Choir Invisible! And Other Favourite Poems

Quote: Poetry is the rhythmical creation of beauty in words.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: When you part from your friend, you grieve not;For that which you love most in him may be clearer in his absence, asthe mountain to the climber is clearer from the plain.
Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet

Quote: Ideas come from everything
Author: Alfred Hitchcock

Quote: I believe in looking reality straight in the eye and denying it.
Author: Garrison Keillor

Quote: The beautiful is always bizarre.
Author: Charles Baudelaire

Quote: If you aren't the woman I think you are, then this isn't the world I thought it was.
Author: Arthur Golden,  Memoirs of a Geisha

Quote: Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.
Author: Vincent van Gogh

Quote: If you care about what you do and work hard at it, there isn't anything you can't do if you want to.
Author: Jim Henson,  It's Not Easy Being Green: And Other Things to Consider

Quote: People have only as much liberty as they have the intelligence to want and the courage to take.
Author: Emma Goldman

Quote: Humanity does not ask us to be happy. It merely asks us to be brilliant on its behalf.
Author: Orson Scott Card,  Ender's Game

Quote: What I actually want to call you is a hell of a lot more unprintable than your name
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

Quote: It's inspirational to see someone who is dying smile.
Author: Arlen Specter

Quote: The man who has really won the love of one good woman in this world, I do not care if he dies in the ditch a beggar - his life has been a success.
Author: Robert Green Ingersoll

Quote: Few tragedies can be more extensive than the stunting of life, few injustices deeper than the denial of an opportunity to strive or even to hope, by a limit imposed from without, but falsely identified as lying within.
Author: Stephen Jay Gould

Quote: It's the most exciting thing to watch God work when I've asked him about something, to listen to him and watch him work. It's like this friendship, and it just grows and grows and grows and grows.
Author: Charles R. Swindoll

Quote: Love feels no burden, thinks nothing of trouble, attempts what is above its strength, pleads no excuse of impossibility; for it thinks all things lawful for itself, and all things possible.
Author: Thomas a Kempis

Quote: I've always chosen my band members based on their sense of humor. It might sound stupid, but it means not only are they fun to live with on a tour bus for years, but humor implies intelligence.
Author: Kristin Hersh

Quote: Impressionism is the newspaper of the soul.
Author: Henri Matisse

Quote: I have known the joy and pain of friendship. I have served and been served. I have made some good enemies for which I am not a bit sorry. I have loved unselfishly, and I have fondled hatred with the red-hot tongs of Hell. That's living.
Author: Zora Neale Hurston

Quote: abyss, n.There are times when I doubt everything. When I regret everything you've taken from me, everything I've given you, and the waste of all the time I've spent on us.
Author: David Levithan,  The Lover's Dictionary

Quote: You are the most important thing to me now. The most important thing to me ever.
Author: Stephenie Meyer,  Twilight

Quote: I think that one of these days,"he said, "you're going to have to find out where you want to go. And then you've got to start going there. But immediately. You can't afford to lose a minute. Not you.
Author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye

Quote: Sex had been amazing, but it wasn't a magical cure for everything. Damn. Somewhere along the way, I'd picked up common sense.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Last Sacrifice

Quote: To achieve great things, two things are needed: a plan and not quite enough time.
Author: Leonard Bernstein

Quote: The first method for estimating the intelligence of a ruler is to look at the men he has around him.
Author: Niccolò Machiavelli,  The Prince

Quote: In order to rise from its own ashes, a Phoenix first must burn.
Author: Octavia E. Butler

Quote: Writing is a job, a talent, but it's also the place to go in your head. It is the imaginary friend you drink your tea with in the afternoon.
Author: Ann Patchett,  Truth and Beauty

Quote: A man says a lot of things in summer he doesn't mean in winter.
Author: Patricia Briggs,  Dragon Blood

Quote: People wait around too long for love. I'm happy with all of my lusts!
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: Would you rather live one perfect day over and over or live your life with no perfect days but just decent ones?
Author: Jenny Han,  The Summer I Turned Pretty

Quote: We're all golden sunflowers inside.
Author: Allen Ginsberg

Quote: I love like a leaf in the wind. Please, hold your applause until the end of the performance (the last day of fall).
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This is the best book I've ever written, and it still sucks

Quote: I'm not saying it's going to be easy. Nothing in life is easy. But that's no reason to give up. You'll be surprised what you can accomplish if you set your mind to it. After all, you only have one life, so you should try to make the most of it.
Author: Louis Sachar

Quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations

Quote: The inner fire is the most important thing mankind possesses.
Author: Edith Södergran

Quote: He'd changed since the last summer. Instead of Bermuda shorts and a T-shirt, he wore a button-down shirt, khaki pants, and leather loafers. His sandy hair, which used to be so unruly, was now clipped short. He look like an evil male model, showing off what the fashionable college-age villain was wearing to Harvard this year.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Sea of Monsters

Quote: You have to participate relentlessly in the manifestation of your own blessings.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: There are few reasons for telling the truth, but for lying the number is infinite.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind

Quote: When you handle books all day long, every new one is a friend and a temptation.
Author: Elizabeth Kostova,  The Historian

Quote: Literature adds to reality, it does not simply describe it. It enriches the necessary competencies that daily life requires and provides; and in this respect, it irrigates the deserts that our lives have already become.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: I have so much in me, and the feeling for her absorbs it all; I have so much, and without her it all comes to nothing.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe,  The Sorrows of Young Werther

Quote: Jace looked as if she had slapped him. "Why are you determined not to believe us?""Because she loves you,"said Valentine.Clary felt the blood drain out of her face.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

Quote: Life is a whim of several billion cells to be you for a while
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: But you can build a future out of anything. A scrap, a flicker. The desire to go forward, slowly, one foot at a time. You can build an airy city out of ruins.
Author: Lauren Oliver,  Pandemonium

Quote: May Light always surround you;Hope kindle and rebound you.May your Hurts turn to Healing;Your Heart embrace Feeling.May Wounds become Wisdom;Every Kindness a Prism.May Laughter infect you;Your Passion resurrect you.May Goodness inspire your Deepest Desires.Through all that you Reach For, May your arms Never Tire.
Author: D. Simone

Quote: One does no question miracles, or complain that they are no constructed perfectly to one's liking.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Princess

Quote: Is life not a thousand times too short for us to bore ourselves?
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: See how she leans her cheek upon her hand. O, that I were a glove upon that hand That I might touch that cheek!
Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet

Quote: Go and make interesting mistakes, make amazing mistakes, make glorious and fantastic mistakes. Break rules. Leave the world more interesting for your being here.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  Make Good Art

Quote: I did not marry the first girl that I fell in love with, because there was a tremendous religious conflict, at the time. She was an atheist, and I was an agnostic.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: Ask yourself these three questions, Tatiana Metanova, and you will know who you are. Ask: What do believe in? What do you hope for? What do you love?
Author: Paullina Simons,  The Bronze Horseman

Quote: Five syllables,"Apollo said, counting them on his fingers. "That would be real bad.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Last Olympian

Quote: Music is an outburst of the soul.
Author: Frederick Delius

Quote: Those whom we most love are often the most alien to us.
Author: Christopher Paolini,  Eldest

Quote: Somehow I can't believe that there are any heights that can't be scaled by a man who knows the secrets of making dreams come true. This special secret, it seems to me, can be summarized in four Cs. They are curiosity, confidence, courage, and constancy, and the greatest of all is confidence. When you believe in a thing, believe in it all the way, implicitly and unquestionable.
Author: Walt Disney Company

Quote: I see a light in the kitchen. Let us not deprive Molly any longer of the chance to deplore how thin you are.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: You like every one; that is to say, you are indifferent to every one.
Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray

Quote: Love is a snowmobile racing across the tundra and then suddenly it flips over, pinning you underneath. At night, the ice weasels come.
Author: Matt Groening,  The Big Book of Hell

Quote: My girlfriend is sad and quiet and keeps me up all night worrying about her.
Author: Rainbow Rowell,  Eleanor & Park

Quote: Love is a bicycle with two pancakes for wheels. You may see love as more of an exercise in hard work, but I see it as more of a breakfast on the go.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: In itself, homosexuality is as limiting as heterosexuality: the ideal should be to be capable of loving a woman or a man; either, a human being, without feeling fear, restraint, or obligation.
Author: Simone de Beauvoir

Quote: But beauty is about finding the right fit, the most natural fit, To be perfect, you have to feel perfect about yourself --- avoid trying to be something you're not. For a goddess, that's especially hard. We can change so easily.-Aphrodite
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Lost Hero

Quote: Love like rain, can nourish from above, drenching couples with a soaking joy. But sometimes under the angry heat of life, love dries on the surface and must nourish from below, tending to its roots keeping itself alive.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  By the River Piedra I Sat Down and Wept

Quote: I don't paint dreams or nightmares, I paint my own reality.
Author: Frida Kahlo

Quote: You have something on your neck. What Looks like a bite mark, what were you doing out all night, anyway? Nothing. I went walking in the park. Tried to clear my head. And ran into a vampire What? No! I fell. On your neck?
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: With writing, we have second chances.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Everything Is Illuminated

Quote: If someone says 'grunge' or 'punk,' you know what the sound is, but if you say 'No Wave,' it's kind of mysterious. That was the most interesting part and should have been the most inspirational thing about it... here's this collective sonic insanity, and none of it sounds anything alike.
Author: Lydia Lunch

Quote: I am fully aware that everybody has a right to succeed, and success should be with ethics.
Author: Sharad Pawar

Quote: I hope people understand that when you tax corporations that the concrete and the steel and the plastic don't pay. People pay. And so when you tax corporations, either the employees are going to pay or the shareholders are going to pay or the customers are going to pay. And so corporations are people.
Author: Mitt Romney

Quote: I have no idea what a British sensibility or a British sense of humor is. I have no concept of what that is. I have no concept of what American sensibility is. I was born in Great Britain, but I was only there for six months, and we moved to Belgium, where I grew up.
Author: Frank Oz

Quote: Every woman that finally figured out her worth, has picked up her suitcases of pride and boarded a flight to freedom, which landed in the valley of change.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: ...there ain't no journey what don't change you some.
Author: David Mitchell,  Cloud Atlas

Quote: Each suburban wife struggles with it alone. As she made the beds, shopped for groceries, matched slipcover material, ate peanut butter sandwiches with her children, chauffeured Cub Scouts and Brownies, lay beside her husband at night- she was afraid to ask even of herself the silent question-- 'Is this all?
Author: Betty Friedan,  The Feminine Mystique

Quote: The most perfidious way of harming a cause consists of defending it deliberately with faulty arguments.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Like all dreamers I confuse disenchantment with truth.
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: Scientists do not join hands every Sunday and sing "Yes gravity is real! I know gravity is real! I will have faith! I believe in my heart that what goes up, up, up must come down, down, down. Amen!"If they did, we would think they were pretty insecure about the concept.
Author: Dan Barker,  Godless: How an Evangelical Preacher Became One of America's Leading Atheists

Quote: 0 plus 100 equals 100. But so does 50 plus 50, only with more balance. Let this be a lesson in love.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: The first question which the priest and the Levite asked was: 'If I stop to help this man, what will happen to me?' But...the good Samaritan reversed the question: 'If I do not stop to help this man, what will happen to him?
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: Life is too short when you think of the length of death
Author: Sean Mangan

Quote: The reason many people in our society are miserable, sick, and highly stressed is because of an unhealthy attachment to things they have no control over.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

Quote: Happiness was but the occasional episode in a general drama of pain.
Author: Thomas Hardy,  The Mayor of Casterbridge

Quote: A man is like a novel: until the very last page you don't know how it will end. Otherwise it wouldn't be worth reading.
Author: Yevgeny Zamyatin,  We

Quote: There will never be no love at all.
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: I got my heart's desire, and there my troubles began.
Author: Lev Grossman,  The Magicians

Quote: The person who writes for fools is always sure of a large audience.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer,  Religion: A Dialogue and Other Essays

Quote: You can't outwit fate by standing on the sidelines placing little sidebets about the outcome of life. either you wade in and risk everything you have to play the game or you don't play at all. and if u don't play u can't win.
Author: Judith McNaught,  Paradise

Quote: Never, under any circumstances, take a sleeping pill and a laxative on the same night.
Author: Colleen Hoover,  Point of Retreat

Quote: Do you know the difference between education and experience? Education is when you read the fine print; experience is what you get when you don't.
Author: Pete Seeger

Quote: Time is precious, but truth is more precious than time.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: She has been to the compound before. She remembered this hallway. She knows about the initiation process. My mother was Dauntless.
Author: Veronica Roth,  Divergent

Quote: You shall love your crooked neighbour, with your crooked heart.
Author: W.H. Auden

Quote: The Buddhists say there are 149 ways to God. I'm not looking for God, only for myself, and that is far more complicated. God has had a great deal written about Him; nothing has been written about me. God is bigger, like my mother, easier to find, even in the dark. I could be anywhere, and since I can't describe myself I can't ask for help.
Author: Jeanette Winterson,  Sexing the Cherry

Quote: And the story of love is a long sad tale ending in graves.
Author: Jack Kerouac

Quote: Late FragmentAnd did you get whatyou wanted from this life, even so?I did.And what did you want?To call myself beloved, to feel myselfbeloved on the earth.
Author: Raymond Carver,  A New Path to the Waterfall

Quote: I think everything that happened in Idris-Valentine, Max, Hodge, even Sebastian-I kept shoving it all down, trying to forget, but it's catching up with me. I... I'll get help. I'll get better. I promise.""You promise.""I swear on the Angel."He ducked his head down, kissed her cheek."The hell with that. I swear on us.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Fallen Angels

Quote: I used to think the worst thing in life is to end up all alone. It's not. The worst thing in life is to end up with people who make you feel all alone.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Loki'd!
Author: Tom Hiddleston

Quote: Hugh and I have been together for so long that in order to arouse extraordinary passion, we need to engage in physical combat. Once, he hit me on the back of the head with a broken wineglass, and I fell to the floor pretending to be unconscious. That was romantic, or would have been had he rushed to my side rather than stepping over my body to fetch the dustpan.
Author: David Sedaris,  Dress Your Family in Corduroy and Denim

Quote: Self-knowledge is better than self-control any day,"Raquel said firmly. "And I know myself well enough to know how I act around cookies.
Author: Claudia Gray,  Evernight

Quote: How quick come the reasons for approving what we like.
Author: Jane Austen,  Persuasion

Quote: I was dead, then alive.Weeping, then laughing.The power of love came into me,and I became fierce like a lion,then tender like the evening star.
Author: Rumi

Quote: I do love nothing in the world so well as you- is not that strange?
Author: William Shakespeare,  Much Ado About Nothing

Quote: The best way to measure how much you've grown isn't by inches or the number of laps you can now run around the track, or even your grade point average-- though those things are important, to be sure. It's what you've done with your time, how you've chosen to spend your days, and whom you've touched this year. That, to me, is the greatest measure of success.
Author: R.J. Palacio,  Wonder

Quote: Truth is on the side of the oppressed.
Author: Malcolm X

Quote: Visualize this thing you want. See it, feel it, believe in it. Make your mental blueprint and begin.
Author: Robert Collier

Quote: I needed him like I'd never needed anyone.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,  Crescendo

Quote: I love you not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you
Author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

Quote: In all the world, there is no heart for me like yours.In all the world, there is no love for you like mine.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Love God and He will enable you to love others even when they disappoint you.
Author: Francine Rivers,  And the Shofar Blew

Quote: I couldn't stand here, hanging on, when the very thing I held disappeared more with each passing day.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,  Crescendo

Quote: Oh lovers! be careful in those dangerous first days! once you've brought breakfast in bed you'll have to bring it forever, unless you want to be accused of lovelessness and betrayal.
Author: Milan Kundera,  The Book of Laughter and Forgetting

Quote: Fair speech may hide a foul heart.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Two Towers

Quote: I hate to think that all my current experiences will someday become stories with no point.
Author: Bill Watterson,  It's a Magical World

Quote: Artemis felt like he was six again and caught hacking the school computers trying to make the test questions harder
Author: Eoin Colfer,  The Time Paradox

Quote: People tend to think that happiness is a stroke of luck, something that will descend like fine weather if you're fortunate. But happiness is the result of personal effort. You fight for it, strive for it, insist upon it, and sometimes even travel around the world looking for it. You have to participate relentlessly.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: You can't know, you can only believe - or not.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: I must create a system, or be enslaved by another man's. I will not reason and compare: my business is to create.
Author: William Blake,  Jerusalem

Quote: What have I always believed?That on the whole, and by and large, if a man lived properly, not according to what any priests said, but according to what seemed decent and honest inside, then it would, at the end, more or less, turn out all right.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Small Gods

Quote: The best form of flattery is to be admired, imitated or respected. I've always felt proud our fans look up to us or feel we are inspirational.
Author: Cheryl James

Quote: Israel was not created in order to disappear - Israel will endure and flourish. It is the child of hope and the home of the brave. It can neither be broken by adversity nor demoralized by success. It carries the shield of democracy and it honors the sword of freedom.
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.
Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

Quote: When I am dead, I hope it may be said: His sins were scarlet, but his books were read.
Author: Hilaire Belloc

Quote: Just when I think I have learned the way to live, life changes.
Author: Hugh Prather

Quote: Imagination is at the root of much that passes for love.
Author: Gilbert Parker

Quote: I like being a Baha'i who has an out-there sense of humor. God gives us talents and faculties, and making people laugh is one of mine.
Author: Rainn Wilson

Quote: I think that many things that go on in an art school have a tendency to undermine confidence, and that shouldn't be part of the ballgame, ever.
Author: Lewis Black

Quote: The choices you make now, the people you surround yourself with, they all have the potential to affect your life, even who you are, forever.
Author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever

Quote: Love.Not the kind you see in the movies or hear about on the radio.The real kind.The kind that gets beaten down and bloody, yet perseveres.The kind that hopes even when hope seems foolish.The kind that can forgives. The kind that believes in healing. The kind that can sit in silence and feel renewed.The real kind of love.It's rare and we have it..
Author: Chelsea Fine,  Sophie & Carter

Quote: Love is honesty. Love is a mutual respect for one another.
Author: Simone Elkeles,  Leaving Paradise

Quote: You will be required to do wrong no matter where you go. It is the basic condition of life, to be required to violate your own identity. At some time, every creature which lives must do so. It is the ultimate shadow, the defeat of creation; this is the curse at work, the curse that feeds on all life. Everywhere in the universe.
Author: Philip K. Dick,  Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?

Quote: Oh, you hate your job? Why didn't you say so?There's a support group for that. It's called EVERYBODY, and they meet at the bar.
Author: Drew Carey

Quote: That night when you kissed me, I left a poem in your mouth, and you can hear some of the lines every time you breathe out.
Author: Andrea Gibson

Quote: Don't forget to give Neville our love!' Ginny told James as she hugged him.'Mum! I can't give a professor love!''But you know Neville-'James rolled his eyes.'Outside, yeah, but at school he's Professor Longbottom, isn't he? I can't walk into Herbology and give him love....
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Quote: ...Nobody knows like a woman how to say things that are both sweet and profound. Sweetness and depth, this is all of woman; this is Heaven.
Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables

Quote: Always and never are two words you should always remember never to use.
Author: Wendell Johnson

Quote: Rule number one: Don't fuck with librarians.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: Maybe everyone is just waiting for someone else to save them.
Author: Margaret Peterson Haddix,  Among the Brave

Quote: You can get all A's and still flunk life.
Author: Walker Percy,  The Second Coming

Quote: You know all that sympathy that you feel for an abused child who suffers without a good mom or dad to love and care for them? Well, they don't stay children forever. No one magically becomes an adult the day they turn eighteen. Some people grow up sooner, many grow up later. Some never really do. But just remember that some people in this world are older versions of those same kids we cry for.
Author: Ashly Lorenzana

Quote: That's brain tissue. How can you-?"Claire shut her mouth, fast. "Never mind. I don't think I wanna know.""Truly, I think that's best. Please take it."He showed his teeth briefly in a very unsettling grin. "I'm giving you a piece of my mind.""I so wish you hadn't said that.
Author: Rachel Caine,  Feast of Fools

Quote: Don't give up the fight,Stand up for your rights.
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: There are these two young fish swimming along and they happen to meet an older fish swimming the other way, who nods at them and says "Morning, boys. How's the water?"And the two young fish swim on for a bit, and then eventually one of them looks over at the other and goes "What the hell is water?
Author: David Foster Wallace,  This Is Water: Some Thoughts, Delivered on a Significant Occasion, about Living a Compassionate Life

Quote: No one cares how much you know, until they know how much you care
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: There's nothing more inspiring than the complexity and beauty of the human heart.
Author: Cynthia Hand,  Hallowed

Quote: He asked, "What makes a man a writer?""Well,"I said, "it's simple. You either get it down on paper, or jump off a bridge.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: The day science begins to study non-physical phenomena, it will make more progress in one decade than in all the previous centuries of its existence.
Author: Nikola Tesla

Quote: ...love is the sum of our choices, the strength of our commitments, the ties that bind us together.
Author: Emily Giffin,  Love the One You're With

Quote: I need the thing that happens when your brain shuts off and your heart turns on.
Author: Elizabeth Wurtzel,  Prozac Nation
