Quote: Makakapili ka ng lugar na uupuan mo, pero hindi mo mapipili ang taong uupo sa puwang sa tabi mo... Ganyan ang senaryo sa bus. Ganyan din sa pag-ibig... Lalong 'di mo kontrolado kung kelan siya bababa.
Author: Bob Ong

Quote: I want someone who is fierce and will love me until death and knows that love is as strong as death, and be on my side forever and ever. I want someone who will destroy and be destroyed by me.
Author: Jeanette Winterson,  Oranges Are Not the Only Fruit

Quote: We lead our lives like water flowing down a hill, going more or less in one direction until we splash into something that forces us to find a new course.
Author: Arthur Golden,  Memoirs of a Geisha

Quote: Minds are like flowers, they only open when the time is right.
Author: Stephen Richards

Quote: I suggest that the only books that influence us are those for which we are ready, and which have gone a little further down our particular path than we have yet gone ourselves.
Author: E.M. Forster

Quote: I suppose sooner or later in the life of everyone comes a moment of trial. We all of us have our particular devil who rides us and torments us, and we must give battle in the end.
Author: Daphne du Maurier,  Rebecca

Quote: What is called a reason for living is also an excellent reason for dying.
Author: Albert Camus,  The Myth of Sisyphus and Other Essays

Quote: I half closed my eyes and imagined this was the spot where everything I'd ever lost since my childhood had washed up, and I was now standing here in front of it, and if I waited long enough, a tiny figure would appear on the horizon across the field and gradually get larger until I'd see it was Tommy, and he'd wave, and maybe even call.
Author: Kazuo Ishiguro,  Never Let Me Go

Quote: Faith is the bird that feels the light and sings when the dawn is still dark.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: I believe entertainment can aspire to be art, and can become art, but if you set out to make art you're an idiot.
Author: Steve Martin

Quote: Oh, look at that, he's heard of me. My fame grows.
Author: Julie Kagawa,  The Iron Queen

Quote: His lips tasted cool and sharp, peppermint, winter, but his hands, soft on the back of my neck, promised long days and summer and forever.
Author: Maggie Stiefvater,  Shiver

Quote: All these people talk so eloquently about getting back to good old-fashioned values. Well, as an old poop I can remember back to when we had those old-fashioned values, and I say let's get back to the good old-fashioned First Amendment of the good old-fashioned Constitution of the United States -- and to hell with the censors! Give me knowledge or give me death!
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: Where should I go?"-Alice. "That depends on where you want to end up."- The Cheshire Cat.
Author: Lewis Carroll,  Alice's Adventures in Wonderland & Through the Looking-Glass

Quote: As the light begins to intensify, so does my misery, and I wonder how it is possible to hurt so much when nothing is wrong.
Author: Tabitha Suzuma,  Forbidden

Quote: I had jumped off the edge, and then, at the very last moment, something reached out and caught me in midair. That something is what I define as love. It is the one thing that can stop a man from falling, powerful enough to negate the laws of gravity.
Author: Paul Auster,  Moon Palace

Quote: If nature has made you for a giver, your hands are born open, and so is your heart; and though there may be times when your hands are empty, your heart is always full, and you can give things out of that--warm things, kind things, sweet things--help and comfort and laughter--and sometimes gay, kind laughter is the best help of all.
Author: Frances Hodgson Burnett,  A Little Princess

Quote: Anything under God's control is never out of control.
Author: Charles R. Swindoll

Quote: Death, taxes and childbirth! There's never any convenient time for any of them.
Author: Margaret Mitchell,  Gone with the Wind

Quote: Each of us has his own rhythm of suffering.
Author: Roland Barthes

Quote: Almost every college playwright or sketch or improv comedian was sort of aware of Christopher Durang - even kids in high school. His short plays were so accessible to younger people and I think that was inspirational to me.
Author: Mindy Kaling

Quote: Tell me, why is the media here so negative? Why are we in India so embarrassed to recognise our own strengths, our achievements? We are such a great nation. We have so many amazing success stories but we refuse to acknowledge them. Why?
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: The friend in my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity.
Author: Ulysses S. Grant

Quote: Cosmetics makers have always sold 'hope in a jar' - creams and potions that promise youth, beauty, sex appeal, and even love for the women who use them.
Author: Virginia Postrel

Quote: Life was always a matter of waiting for the right moment to act.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Strangely enough, they have a mind to till the soil, and the love of possessions is a disease in them.
Author: Sitting Bull

Quote: I don't think that because you die and move on to somewhere else that you lose your sense of humor.
Author: Peter Jackson

Quote: Dance music is my love, is my passion, is my life. I live for my fans and take my art very seriously.
Author: Steve Aoki

Quote: Give a bowl of rice to a man and you will feed him for a day. Teach him how to grow his own rice and you will save his life.
Author: Confucius

Quote: I love you and it's getting worse.
Author: Joseph E. Morris

Quote: Love is a striking example of how little reality means to us.
Author: Marcel Proust,  In Search of Lost Time

Quote: The only difference between you and God is that you have forgotten you are divine.
Author: Dan Brown,  The Lost Symbol

Quote: The trick is in what one emphasizes. We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same.
Author: Carlos Castaneda

Quote: The pupil dilates in darkness and in the end finds light, just as the soul dilates in misfortune and in the end finds God.
Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables

Quote: You can get a thousand no's from people, and only one "yes"from God.
Author: Tyler Perry

Quote: I thought about all of the things that everyone ever says to each other, and how everyone is going to die, whether it's in a millisecond, or days, or months, or 76.5 years, if you were just born. Everything that's born has to die, which means our lives are like skyscrapers. The smoke rises at different speeds, but they're all on fire, and we're all trapped.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

Quote: Literature was not born the day when a boy crying "wolf, wolf"came running out of the Neanderthal valley with a big gray wolf at his heels; literature was born on the day when a boy came crying "wolf, wolf"and there was no wolf behind him.
Author: Vladimir Nabokov,  Lectures on Literature

Quote: No furniture is so charming as books.
Author: Sydney Smith,  A memoir of the Rev. Sydney Smith

Quote: To find out if she really loved me, I hooked her up to a lie detector. And just as I suspected, my machine was broken.
Author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo,  Love Quotes for the Ages. Specifically Ages 19-91.

Quote: My brain is divided into two butterflies, and both are in love with your rose-shaped heart. If you've got the garden, I've got my whole life.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: One of the greatest journeys in life is overcoming insecurity and learning to truly not give a shit.
Author: J.A. Konrath

Quote: I think the highest and lowest points are the important ones. Anything else is just...in between.
Author: Jim Morrison

Quote: It's like I'm thirteen again and he's my crush. All I'm aware of in this entire roomful of people is him. Where he is, what he's doing, who he's talking to.
Author: Sophie Kinsella,  Remember Me?

Quote: The Revolution introduced me to art, and in turn, art introduced me to the Revolution!
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: You're Valentine's son. I'm sure you're the one the Queen really wants to see. Besides, you're charming. Maybe not at the moment.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

Quote: Any game plan? Xypher asked Sin.Don't die.I like it. Simple, bold. Impossible. Works for me.Kat scoffed at his sarcasm. What are you bitching about, Xypher? You're already dead.He laughed. You know, for once, it's good to be me.
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,  Devil May Cry

Quote: There's some heinous fuckery goin' on mon.
Author: Christopher Moore,  Fluke: Or, I Know Why the Winged Whale Sings

Quote: One can be the master of what one does, but never of what one feels.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: Life will hit you hard in the face, wait for you to get back up just so it can kick you in the stomach. But getting the wind knocked out of you is the only way to remind your lungs how much they like the taste of air.
Author: Sarah Kay

Quote: I imagine a line, a white line, painted on the sand and on the ocean, from me to you.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Everything Is Illuminated

Quote: my mother, poor fish,wanting to be happy, beaten two or three times aweek, telling me to be happy: "Henry, smile!why don't you ever smile?"and then she would smile, to show me how, and it was thesaddest smile I ever saw
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: My shoulder will never be the same. I expect you to nurse me back to health.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

Quote: When the eagles are silent, the parrots begin to jabber.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: Do not dare not to dare.
Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Horse and His Boy

Quote: Many people could say things in a cutting way, Nanny knew. But Granny Weatherwax could listen in a cutting way. She could make something sound stupid just by hearing it.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: Right,"she said, "We're going to the Land of the Dead and I shouldn't think negative.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Lightning Thief

Quote: The evil that is in the world almost always comes from ignorance, and good intentions may do as much harm as malevolence if they lack understanding.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: I love the stars.Because they can't say anything.I love the stars.Because they do not judge anyone.
Author: Natsuki Takaya

Quote: Drop out of school before your mind rots from exposure to our mediocre educational system. Forget about the Senior Prom and go to the library and educate yourself if you've got any guts. Some of you like Pep rallies and plastic robots who tell you what to read.
Author: Frank Zappa

Quote: I'm afraid of time... I mean, I'm afraid of not having enough time. Not enough time to understand people, how they really are, or to be understood myself. I'm afraid of the quick judgements or mistakes everybody makes. You can't fix them without time. I'm afraid of seeing snapshots, not movies.
Author: Ann Brashares

Quote: Conventionality is not morality. Self-righteousness is not religion. To attack the first is not to assail the last.
Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre

Quote: Must I go bound while you go freeMust I love a manwho doesn't love meMust I be born with so little artAs to love a man who'll break my Heart
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Prince

Quote: We pass through this world but once. Few tragedies can be more extensive than the stunting of life, few injustices deeper than the denial of an opportunity to strive or even to hope, by a limit imposed from without, but falsely identified as lying within.
Author: Stephen Jay Gould,  The Mismeasure of Man

Quote: Always be yourself, there's no one better!
Author: Selena Gómez

Quote: When in doubt, look intelligent.
Author: Garrison Keillor

Quote: Who are you?"he asked.I am the future queen of this world, at the very least. You may refer to me as Mistress Koboi for the next five minutes. After that you may refer to me as Aaaaarrrrgh, hold your throat, die screaming, and so on.
Author: Eoin Colfer,  The Time Paradox

Quote: You know that look that women get when they want to have sex? Me neither.
Author: Steve Martin

Quote: I'm a pessimist because of intelligence, but an optimist because of will.
Author: Antonio Gramsci,  Gramsci's Prison Letters

Quote: Well, I like to eat, sleep, drink, and be in love.I like to work, read, learn, and understand life.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: Drink your tea slowly and reverently, as if it is the axis on which the world earth revolves - slowly, evenly, without rushing toward the future.
Author: Hanh Nhat Thich

Quote: We are not held back by the love we didn't receive in the past, but by the love we're not extending in the present.
Author: Marianne Williamson

Quote: Losing your life is not the worst thing that can happen. The worst thing is to lose your reason for living.
Author: Jo Nesbø

Quote: Intellectual growth should commence at birth and cease only at death.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The hardest thing of all is to find a black cat in a dark room, especially if there is no cat.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Reading was very important to me as a kid. It was very inspirational to me. I went to a school where that wasn't encouraged so much, but my parents encouraged that, and it has made me part of who I am.
Author: Sasha Grey

Quote: Success is a beast. And it actually puts the emphasis on the wrong thing. You get away with more instead of looking within.
Author: Brad Pitt

Quote: That friendship will not continue to the end which is begun for an end.
Author: Francis Quarles

Quote: All I can hope to do is instill great morality in my son and trust him along the way. The music he listens to or how he chooses to wear his hair doesn't define his moral compass, and if he wants to listen to country music and wear a cowboy hat too, that's fine.
Author: Mark Hoppus

Quote: For me life is continuously being hungry. The meaning of life is not simply to exist, to survive, but to move ahead, to go up, to achieve, to conquer.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: You have to love what you do to want to do it everyday.
Author: Aaliyah

Quote: I wore goofy hats to school and did musical theater. Most people thought I was a dork. But if you have a sense of humor about it, no one can bring you down.
Author: Zac Efron

Quote: The biggest problem with every art is by the use of appearance to create a loftier reality.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Love is the will to extend one's self for the purpose of nurturing one's own or another's spiritual growth... Love is as love does. Love is an act of will -- namely, both an intention and an action. Will also implies choice. We do not have to love. We choose to love.
Author: M. Scott Peck

Quote: What if love wasn't the act of finding what you were missing but the give-and-take that made you both match?
Author: Jodi Picoult,  The Tenth Circle

Quote: Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: Never doubt my weaseling abilities, Shadowhunter, for they are epic and memorable in their scope.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge: it is those who know little, not those who know much, who so positively assert that this or that problem will never be solved by science.
Author: Charles Darwin,  The Descent of Man

Quote: I give you this to take with you:Nothing remains as it was. If you know this, you canbegin again, with pure joy in the uprooting.
Author: Judith Minty,  Letters to My Daughters

Quote: True teachers are those who use themselves as bridges over which they invite their students to cross; then, having facilitated their crossing, joyfully collapse, encouraging them to create theirown.
Author: Nikos Kazantzakis

Quote: I wore your promise on my finger for one yearI'll wear your name on my heart til I dieBecause you were my boy, you were my only boy forever.
Author: Coco J. Ginger

Quote: Deep in her heart, she wasn't sure she deserved to be happy, nor did she believe that she was worthy of someone who seemed...normal.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Safe Haven

Quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
Author: Seneca

Quote: And I thought that all those little kids are going to grow up someday. And all of those little kids are going to do the things that we do. And they will all kiss someone someday. But for now, sledding is enough. I think it would be great if sledding were always enough, but it isn't.
Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: I wish I could've lived my life without making any wrong turns. But that's impossible. A path like that doesn't exist. We fail. We trip. We get lost. We make mistakes. And little by little, one step at a time, we push forward. It's all we can do. On our own two feet.
Author: Natsuki Takaya,  Fruits Basket, Vol. 21

Quote: Those unable to catalog the past are doomed to repeat it.
Author: Lemony Snicket,  The End

Quote: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power or our will.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.
Author: Confucius

Quote: I was with book, as a woman is with child.
Author: C.S. Lewis,  Till We Have Faces

Quote: I am suddenly comsumed by nostalgia for the little girl who was me, who loved the fields and believed in God, who spent winter days home sick from school reading Nancy Drew and sucking menthol cough drops, who could keep a secret.
Author: Audrey Niffenegger,  The Time Traveler's Wife

Quote: Love takes off the masks we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.
Author: James Baldwin

Quote: And in the end, we were all just humans.. drunk on the idea that love, only love, could heal our brokenness.
Author: Christopher Poindexter

Quote: Hate looks like everybody else until it smiles
Author: Tahereh Mafi

Quote: Money may not buy happiness, but I'd rather cry in a Jaguar than on a bus.
Author: Françoise Sagan

Quote: Well then,"Roen said briskly, "are you sleeping?""Yes.""Come now. A mother can tell when her son lies. Are you eating?""No,"Brigan said gravely. "I've not eaten in two months. It's a hunger strike to protest the spring flooding in the south.""Gracious,"Roen said, reaching for the fruit bowl. "Have an apple, dear.
Author: Kristin Cashore,  Fire

Quote: You backbiting, poisonous, treacherous, deceitful, wicked, clever girl. If this works I'll buy you a pony.
Author: Jim Butcher,  Summer Knight

Quote: Most things break, including hearts. The lessons of life amount not towisdom, but to scar tissue and callus.
Author: Wallace Stegner,  The Spectator Bird

Quote: But maybe happiness isn't in the choosing. Maybe it's in the fiction, in the pretending: that wherever we have ended up is where we intended to be all along.
Author: Lauren Oliver,  Requiem

Quote: When you are in troubled and worried and sick at heartAnd your plans are upset and your world falls apart,Remember God's ready and waiting to shareThe burden you find much to heavy to bear--So with faith, "Let Go and Let GOD"lead your wayInto a brighter and less troubled day
Author: Helen Steiner Rice

Quote: From my rotting body, flowers shall grow and I am in them, and that is eternity.
Author: Edvard Munch

Quote: Sometimes what we want isn't what we need.
Author: Gena Showalter,  The Darkest Night

Quote: Expectations make people miserable, so whatever yours are, lower them. You'll definitely be happier.
Author: Simone Elkeles,  How to Ruin Your Boyfriend's Reputation

Quote: Death is a stripping away of all that is not you. The secret of life is to "die before you die"--- and find that there is no death.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: When I compliment you, I compliment myself, because I am who I associate with.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: Cut the ending. Revise the script. The man of her dreams is a girl.
Author: Julie Anne Peters,  Keeping You a Secret

Quote: Mr. Franz, I think careers are a 20th century invention and I don't want one.
Author: Jon Krakauer,  Into the Wild

Quote: I called Vee."How are you doing?"I asked."Good. How are you?""Good."Silence."Okay,"Vee said in a rush, "I am still totally freaked out. You?""Totally.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,  Hush, Hush

Quote: I like libraries. It makes me feel comfortable and secure to have walls of words, beautiful and wise, all around me. I always feel better when I can see that there is something to hold back the shadows.
Author: Roger Zelazny,  Nine Princes in Amber

Quote: Well, I think that there's a very thin dividing line between success and failure. And I think if you start a business without financial backing, you're likely to go the wrong side of that dividing line.
Author: Richard Branson

Quote: I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better.
Author: Plutarch

Quote: I would like this to be a new day. I would hope now that we can focus on doing the people's business.
Author: Ernie Fletcher

Quote: I'm just thankful for everything, all the blessings in my life, trying to stay that way. I think that's the best way to start your day and finish your day. It keeps everything in perspective.
Author: Tim Tebow

Quote: For each of us, life is a journey. Heavenly Father designed it for us out of love. Each of us has unique experiences and characteristics, but our journey began in the same place before we were born into this world.
Author: Henry B. Eyring

Quote: I'm not for gratuitous nudity, but if there's humor, I don't have a problem.
Author: Rebecca Romijn

Quote: I think having land and not ruining it is the most beautiful art that anybody could ever want to own.
Author: Andy Warhol

Quote: We are not people who touch each other carelessly; every point of contact between us feels important, a rush of energy and relief.
Author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant

Quote: We should love, not fall in love, because everything that falls, gets broken.
Author: Taylor Swift,  Taylor Swift

Quote: Remember. The way you make love is the way God will be with you.
Author: Rumi

Quote: It's so much easier to convince yourself you're madly in love with someone when you know nothing about him.
Author: Megan McCafferty,  Second Helpings

Quote: All that happens means something; nothing you do is ever insignificant.
Author: Aldous Huxley,  Crome Yellow

Quote: We're all made of stories. When they finally put us underground, the stories are what will go on. Not forever, perhaps, but for a time. It's a kind of immortality, I suppose, bounded by limits, it's true, but then so's everything.
Author: Charles de Lint

Quote: Everywhere is walking distance if you have the time.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: It's just that in the Deep South, women learn at a young age that when the world is falling apart around you, it's time to take down the drapes and make a new dress.
Author: Karen Marie Moning,  Faefever

Quote: To be in your children's memories tomorrow,You have to be in their lives today.
Author: Barbara Johnson

Quote: The nuclear arms race is like two sworn enemies standing waist deep in gasoline, one with three matches, the other with five.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: I can't go on, I'll go on.
Author: Samuel Beckett,  I Can't Go On, I'll Go On: A Samuel Beckett Reader

Quote: If you think this Universe is bad, you should see some of the others.
Author: Philip K. Dick

Quote: Are you insinuatin' that my daughter is a liar?""Oh, no, not at all. I'm saying your daughter is a liar. Surely you can appreciate the difference.
Author: Kami Garcia,  Beautiful Creatures

Quote: Education is no substitute for intelligence.
Author: Frank Herbert

Quote: There are two ways to be happy: improve your reality, or lower your expectations.
Author: Jodi Picoult,  Nineteen Minutes

Quote: Where wisdom reigns, there is no conflict between thinking and feeling.
Author: C.G. Jung

Quote: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained
Author: Walt Disney Company

Quote: The most merciful thing in the world, I think, is the inability of the human mind to correlate all its contents... some day the piecing together of dissociated knowledge will open up such terrifying vistas of reality, and of our frightful position therein, that we shall either go mad from the revelation or flee from the light into the peace and safety of a new Dark Age.
Author: H.P. Lovecraft

Quote: You often meet your fate on the road you take to avoid it.
Author: Goldie Hawn

Quote: Sharing tales of those we've lost is how we keep from really losing them.
Author: Mitch Albom,  For One More Day

Quote: If I were to wish for anything, I should not wish for wealth and power, but for the passionate sense of the potential, for the eye which, ever young and ardent, sees the possible. Pleasure disappoints, possibility never. And what wine is so sparkling, what so fragrant, what so intoxicating, as possibility!
Author: Søren Kierkegaard,  Either/Or: A Fragment of Life

Quote: Part of me suspects that I'm a loser, and the other part of me thinks I'm God Almighty.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: It ought to make us feel ashamed when we talk like we know what we're talking about when we talk about love.
Author: Raymond Carver

Quote: You were a summer gift, one I'll always treasure. You were a dream I never wanted to wake up from. You opened my eyes to things I'll never really see. You're the best thing that will ever happen to me.
Author: Ellen Hopkins,  Crank

Quote: My brain? That's my second favorite organ.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: Ever since happiness heard your name, it has been running through the streets trying to find you.
Author: حافظ

Quote: I've been accused of vulgarity. I say that's bullshit.
Author: Mel Brooks

Quote: If you can't do great things, do small things in a great way.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: What if you slept?What if you slept And what if In your sleep You dreamed And what if In your dream You went to heaven And there plucked a strange and beautiful flower And what if When you awoke You had that flower in you hand Ah, what then?
Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge,  The Complete Poems

Quote: I am at the moment writing a lengthy indictment against our century. When my brain begins to reel from my literary labors, I make an occasional cheese dip.
Author: John Kennedy Toole,  A Confederacy of Dunces

Quote: Education is a system of imposed ignorance.
Author: Noam Chomsky,  Manufacturing Consent: The Political Economy of the Mass Media

Quote: I don't want to be somebody's crush. If somebody likes me, I want them to like the real me, not what they think I am.
Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: No one in the world gets what they want and that is beautiful.
Author: Ernest Cline,  Ready Player One

Quote: You leave me tied up like a dog? Then you had better remember that this bitch bites!
Author: Kresley Cole,  Kiss of a Demon King

Quote: Coffee is a way of stealing time that should by rights belong to your older self.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Thud!

Quote: This calls for a very special blend of psychology and extreme violence.
Author: Ben Elton,  Bachelor Boys: The Young Ones Book

Quote: Hate is... It's too easy. Love. Love takes courage.
Author: Hannah Harrington,  Speechless

Quote: The end may justify the means as long as there is something that justifies the end.
Author: Leon Trotsky,  Their Morals and Ours

Quote: Scars are just another kind of memory.
Author: M.L. Stedman,  The Light Between Oceans

Quote: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time, who never loses any. It is wonderful how much may be done, if we are always doing.
Author: Thomas Jefferson,  Letters of Thomas Jefferson

Quote: Just deleting vandalism on the Chuck Norris page,"Radar said. "For instance, while I do think that Chuck Norris specializes in the roundhouse kick, I don't think it's accurate to say, 'Chuck Norris's tears can cure cancer, but unfortunately he has never cried.
Author: John Green

Quote: Later she remembered all the hours of the afternoon as happy -- one of those uneventful times that seem at the moment only a link between past and future pleasure, but turn out to have been the pleasure itself.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  Tender is the Night

Quote: Hope itself is like a star- not to be seen in the sunshine of prosperity, and only to be discovered in the night of adversity.
Author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

Quote: We'd stared into the face of Death, and Death blinked first. You'd think that would make us feel brave and invincible. It didn't.
Author: Rick Yancey,  The 5th Wave

Quote: How inappropriate to call this planet "Earth,"when it is clearly "Ocean.
Author: Arthur C. Clarke

Quote: Truth without love is brutality, and love without truth is hypocrisy.
Author: Warren W. Wiersbe

Quote: The only queer people are those who don't love anybody.
Author: Rita Mae Brown

Quote: Everyone always wants to know how you can tell when it's true love, and the answer is this: when the pain doesn't fade and the scars don't heal, and it's too damned late.
Author: Jonathan Tropper,  The Book of Joe

Quote: I want to write a poem about "Truth,""Honor,""Dignity,"and whether the toilet paper should roll over or under when you pull on it.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want

Quote: Did you ever wonder if the person in the puddle is real, and you're just a reflection of him?
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: His eyes are as green as a fresh pickled toad,His hair is as dark as a blackboard.I wish he was mine, he's really divine,The hero who conquered the Dark Lord.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Quote: When we come face-to-face with one down a dark alley, we're going to be having a shufti to see if it's solid, aren't we, we're not going to be asking, 'Excuse me, are you the imprint of a departed soul?
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: Everyone thinks you've been kidnapped,"he said. "We've been scouring the ship. When Coach Hedge finds out- oh, gods, you've been here all night?""Frank!"Annabeth's ears were as red as strawberries. "We just came down here to talk. We fell asleep. Accidentally. That's it.""Kissed a couple of times,"Percy said.Annabeth glared at him. "Not helping!
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Mark of Athena

Quote: Humor is what happens when we're told the truth quicker and more directly than we're used to.
Author: George Saunders,  The Braindead Megaphone

Quote: For you will certainly carry out God's purpose, however you act, but it makes a difference to you whether you serve like Judas or like John.
Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Problem of Pain

Quote: I have outlasted all desire,My dreams and I have grown apart;My grief alone is left entire,The gleamings of an empty heart.The storms of ruthless dispensationHave struck my flowery garland numb,I live in lonely desolationAnd wonder when my end will come.Thus on a naked tree-limb, blastedBy tardy winter's whistling chill,A single leaf which has outlastedIts season will be trembling still.
Author: Alexander Pushkin

Quote: Put down everything that comes into your head and then you're a writer. But an author is one who can judge his own stuff's worth, without pity, and destroy most of it."(Casual Chance, 1964)
Author: Colette

Quote: There will always be competition, especially in showbiz. There's always someone younger and hungrier standing behind you; there's always someone with more contacts; there's always someone whose grandfather or father is a filmmaker. I think your job is just to be there 100% - you work hard, and there are no shortcuts to success.
Author: Preity Zinta

Quote: The sincere friends of this world are as ship lights in the stormiest of nights.
Author: Giotto di Bondone

Quote: At the end of the day, customer choice is essential. And we don't make products that compete with Apple, nor make products that compete with Google. Our customers come in both iOS and Android flavors, and I hope our customers can still buy the products they want to purchase wherever they want to purchase them.
Author: Tony Fadell

Quote: Sometimes life hits you in the head with a brick. Don't lose faith.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: I love the spirit of Halloween and the energy that comes with it.
Author: Katharine McPhee

Quote: I'm still trying to figure out how to write about cancer and my family's experience with it. If I had been able to write 'The Pura Principle' back in those days, I'm positive it would have had no humor in it. Which means the story would have been false.
Author: Junot Diaz

Quote: Controversy is part of the nature of art and creativity.
Author: Yoko Ono

Quote: She has a sly smile, and eyes that seem to see my essence as they explore my soul and implore my spirit to enter her. I look at her and I see love.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: There's always another storm. It's the way the world works. Snowstorms, rainstorms, windstorms, sandstorms, and firestorms. Some are fierce and others are small. You have to deal with each one separately, but you need to keep an eye on whats brewing for tomorrow.
Author: Maria V. Snyder,  Fire Study

Quote: My soul sees its equal in you.
Author: Renee Ahdieh,  The Wrath and the Dawn

Quote: It is truth that liberates, not your effort to be free.
Author: Jiddu Krishnamurti,  The First and Last Freedom

Quote: no matter how ugly the world gets or how stupid it shows me it is, I always have faith
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: I was never aware of any other option but to question everything.
Author: Noam Chomsky

Quote: For thousands of nights I dreamed of making love to you. No man on earth has ever hated sunrise as I do.
Author: Lisa Kleypas,  Again the Magic

Quote: If a story is in you, it has to come out.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: Thank God for books and music and things I can think about.
Author: Daniel Keyes,  Flowers for Algernon

Quote: [I] read books because I love them, not because I think I should read them.
Author: Simon Van Booy

Quote: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself and you are the easiest person to fool.
Author: Richard Feynman

Quote: Winners are not afraid of losing. But losers are. Failure is part of the process of success. People who avoid failure also avoid success.
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki,  Rich Dad, Poor Dad

Quote: Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized.
Author: Osho,  The Buddha Said...: Meeting the Challenge of Life's Difficulties

Quote: We know from daily life that we exist for other people first of all, for whose smiles and well-being our own happiness depends.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Life is not like water. Things in life don't necessarily flow over the shortest possible route.
Author: Haruki Murakami,  1Q84

Quote: The knowledge of all things is possible
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: Have you ever noticed how parents can go from the most wonderful people in the world to totally embarrassing in three seconds?
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Red Pyramid

Quote: What can be explained is not poetry.
Author: W.B. Yeats

Quote: Kenapa harus takut gelap kalau ada banyak hal indah yang hanya bisa dilihat sewaktu gelap?-Nishimura Kazuto
Author: Ilana Tan,  Winter in Tokyo

Quote: America...just a nation of two hundred million used car salesmen with all the money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the world who tries to make us uncomfortable
Author: Hunter S. Thompson

Quote: Sometimes good things fall apart, so better things can fall together.
Author: Jessica Howell

Quote: Love and friendship. They are what make us who we are, and what can change us, if we let them.
Author: Emily Giffin,  Something Blue

Quote: I don't understand the point of being together if you're not the happiest.
Author: Gillian Flynn,  Gone Girl

Quote: When a man learns to love, he must bear the risk of hatred.
Author: Masashi Kishimoto

Quote: I've come to believe that in everyone's life, there's one undeniable moment of change, a set of circumstances that suddenly alters everything.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Safe Haven

Quote: The right thing to do and the hard thing to do are usually the same.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

Quote: I think I am, therefore, I am... I think.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: If you can't you must, and if you must you can.
Author: Anthony Robbins

Quote: I think she just asked if she could touch my mango.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Fallen Angels

Quote: Pooh,"said Rabbit kindly, "you haven't any brain.""I know,"said Pooh humbly.
Author: A.A. Milne,  Winnie-the-Pooh

Quote: We're going to knock those demons out and slay them with the power of Jesus. Hallelujah, can I get an amen?- Timmie
Author: Jeaniene Frost,  Halfway to the Grave

Quote: My soul is a hidden orchestra; I know not what instruments, what fiddlestrings and harps, drums and tamboura I sound and clash inside myself. All I hear is the symphony.
Author: Fernando Pessoa,  The Book of Disquiet

Quote: And life  definitely  doesn't want me To just let it  tell  me that the  girl  I met,The  beautiful, amazing, strong, resilient girl That I fell so  hard  forShould only come in  third Life  knows. Life is trying to  tell  neThat the  girl  I  love The girl I fellSo  hard  for?There's room for her in  first. I'm putting  her  first.
Author: Colleen Hoover,  Slammed

Quote: One swallow does not make a summer,neither does one fine day; similarly one day or brief time of happiness does not make a person entirely happy.
Author: Aristotle,  The Nicomachean Ethics

Quote: When you compare the sorrows of real life to the pleasures of the imaginary one, you will never want to live again, only to dream forever.
Author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo

Quote: Don't find fault, find a remedy; anybody can complain
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the master calls a butterfly.
Author: Richard Bach,  Illusions: The Adventures of a Reluctant Messiah

Quote: I don't like lollipops.
Author: Eoin Colfer,  Artemis Fowl

Quote: We lay there and looked up at the night sky and she told me about stars called blue squares and red swirls and I told her I'd never heard of them. Of course not, she said, the really important stuff they never tell you. You have to imagine it on your own.
Author: Brian Andreas

Quote: If I must fall, may it be from a high place.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  By the River Piedra I Sat Down and Wept

Quote: Only the gentle are ever really strong.
Author: James Dean

Quote: Anybody who says they are a good liar obviously is not, because any legitimately savvy liar would always insist they're honest about everything.
Author: Chuck Klosterman

Quote: A girl has to have a beautiful smile, Beautiful eyes and she should have a good sense of humor. She should be honest, loving and trustworthy.
Author: Justin Bieber

Quote: He was now in that state of fire that she loved. She wanted to be burnt.
Author: Anaïs Nin,  Delta of Venus

Quote: How could I have ever been ashamed of loving Dante Quintana?
Author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz,  Aristotle and Dante Discover the Secrets of the Universe

Quote: I've crossed some kind of invisible line. I feel as if I've come to a place I never thought I'd have to come to. And I don't know how I got here. It's a strange place. It's a place where a little harmless dreaming and then some sleepy, early-morning talk has led me into considerations of death and annihilation.
Author: Raymond Carver,  Where I'm Calling From: New and Selected Stories

Quote: Dexter, I love you so much. So, so much, and I probably always will. I just don't like you anymore. I'm sorry.
Author: David Nicholls,  One Day

Quote: The key to your happiness is to own your slippers, own who you are, own how you look, own your family, own the talents you have, and own the ones you don't. If you keep saying your slippers aren't yours, then you'll die searching, you'll die bitter, always feeling you were promised more. Not only our actions, but also our omissions, become our destiny.
Author: Abraham Verghese,  Cutting for Stone

Quote: I am always doing what I cannot do yet, in order to learn how to do it.
Author: Vincent van Gogh

Quote: Down with tyranny!' Bramble cried. 'Aristocracy! Autocracy! Monocracy! Other ocracy things! You are outnumbered, sir! Surrender!
Author: Heather Dixon,  Entwined

Quote: The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found.
Author: Calvin Trillin

Quote: The road of excess leads to the palace of wisdom.
Author: William Blake,  The Marriage of Heaven and Hell

Quote: With every mistake, we must surely be learning.
Author: George Harrison

Quote: Sometimes, we are so attached to our way of life that we turn down wonderful opportunities simply because don't know what to do with it.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  Like the Flowing River

Quote: Poems are never finished - just abandoned
Author: Paul Valéry

Quote: Men must live and create. Live to the point of tears.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Your success and happiness lies in you. Resolve to keep happy, and your joy and you shall form an invincible host against difficulties.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: Sweet is the memory of distant friends! Like the mellow rays of the departing sun, it falls tenderly, yet sadly, on the heart.
Author: Washington Irving

Quote: Japan's beautiful seas and its territory are under threat, and young people are having trouble finding hope in the future amid economic slump. I promise to protect Japan's land and sea, and the lives of the Japanese people no matter what.
Author: Shinzo Abe

Quote: Life is too short to worry about anything. You had better enjoy it because the next day promises nothing.
Author: Eric Davis

Quote: It's interesting. People go to an animal shelter and pick a dog that's been kicked, beaten, and has lost a leg and an eye, and they'll take that dog home and give it love and support, but they don't do that with people.
Author: Nikki Sixx

Quote: I realized women and humor were linked very closely.
Author: Craig Ferguson

Quote: Of all the seasons, winter is the most conducive to the great art of dormancy. This art requires an appreciation of semi-consciousness: the beautiful and necessary prelude to sleep - a special pleasure in itself that is all too often neglected, under-valued or looked down upon.
Author: Michael Leunig

Quote: What's a fuck when what I want is love?
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: If one wanted to depict the whole thing graphically, every episode, with its climax, would require a three-dimensional, or, rather, no model: every experience is unrepeatable. What makes lovemaking and reading resemble each other most is that within both of them times and spaces open, different from measurable time and space.
Author: Italo Calvino,  If on a Winter's Night a Traveler

Quote: I love you because no two snowflakes are alike, and it is possible, if you stand tippy-toe, to walk between the raindrops.
Author: Nikki Giovanni

Quote: Not like this. He wanted it to be real.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  Catching Fire

Quote: Love's gift cannot be given, it waits to be accepted.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: No one believes a liar. Even when she's telling the truth.
Author: Sara Shepard,  Heartless

Quote: What I'm looking for is not out there, it is in me.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: You are essentially who you create yourself to be and all that occurs in your life is the result of your own making.
Author: Stephen Richards,  Think Your way to Success: Let Your Dreams Run Free

Quote: Don't marry a rich man. Marry a good man. He will spend his life trying to keep you happy. No rich man can buy that!
Author: Staness Jonekos

Quote: Heart, we will forget him,You and I, tonight!You must forget the warmth he gave,I will forget the light.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: Because...because...she came here with me.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  The Hunger Games

Quote: The world is so empty if one thinks only of mountains, rivers & cities; but to know someone who thinks & feels with us, & who, though distant, is close to us in spirit, this makes the earth for us an inhabited garden.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: A boo is a lot louder than a cheer.
Author: Lance Armstrong

Quote: In prayer it is better to have a heart without words than words without a heart.
Author: John Bunyan

Quote: There is no limit to the amount of good you can do if you don't care who gets the credit.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: Thinking is hard work, which is why you don't see many people doing it.
Author: Sue Grafton

Quote: Happiness doesn't result from what we get, but from what we give.
Author: Ben Carson

Quote: Is anyone anywhere happy?
Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

Quote: There's no such thing as perfect writing, just like there's no such thing as perfect despair.
Author: Haruki Murakami,  Hear the Wind Sing

Quote: If I do not write to empty my mind, I go mad.
Author: George Gordon Byron

Quote: The only important thing in a book is the meaning that it has for you.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: And what is the use of a book,"thought Alice, "without pictures or conversation?
Author: Lewis Carroll,  Alice's Adventures in Wonderland

Quote: I'm sorry. I know you loved her. It was hard not to.
Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

Quote: People are strange: They are constantly angered by trivial things, but on a major matter like totally wasting their lives, they hardly seem to notice.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: I don't let nobody see me wishin' he was mine
Author: Taylor Swift

Quote: The doubters said, "Man can not fly,"The doers said, "Maybe, but we'll try,"And finally soared In the morning glow While non-believers Watched from below.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: I'm not absolutely certain of the facts, but I rather fancy it's Shakespeare who says that it's always just when a fellow is feeling particularly braced with things in general that Fate sneaks up behind him with the bit of lead piping.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse,  Carry on, Jeeves

Quote: I choose gentleness... Nothing is won by force. I choose to be gentle. If I raise my voice may it be only in praise. If I clench my fist, may it be only in prayer. If I make a demand, may it be only of myself.
Author: Max Lucado

Quote: You look too pretty to be useful.""Truer words were never spoken.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Bloodlines

Quote: Am I about to discover where you, Ron, and Hermione disappeared to while you were supposed to be in the back room of Fred and George's shop?''How did you...?''Harry, please. You're talking to the man who raised Fred and George.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: Are you any good at it?""Pulling idiots out of the snow? I'm the best.
Author: Cynthia Hand,  Unearthly

Quote: Doubt isn't the opposite of faith; it is an element of faith.
Author: Paul Tillich

Quote: Tantalus made a wild grab, but the marshmallow committed suicide, diving into the flames.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Sea of Monsters

Quote: We are a way for the cosmos to know itself.
Author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos

Quote: Some things you hear with your ears. Others, you hear with your heart.
Author: Sarah J. Maas,  Crown of Midnight

Quote: Let all of life be an unfettered howl.
Author: Vladimir Nabokov

Quote: You can't hurt me the way you think you can. But even if you could? I would rather die with the taste of you on my tongue than live and never touch you again. I'm in love with you, Mara. I love you. No matter what you do.
Author: Michelle Hodkin,  The Evolution of Mara Dyer

Quote: How could I be sleeping with this particular man.... Surely only true love could justify my lack of taste.
Author: Margaret Atwood,  Lady Oracle

Quote: Life is but a day:A fragile dewdrop on its perilious wayFrom a tree's summit
Author: John Keats

Quote: Perhaps people like us cannot love. Ordinary people can - that is their secret.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: After all my erstwhile dear, my no longer cherished; Need we say it was not love, just because it perished?
Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

Quote: I was married by a judge. I should have asked for a jury.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: If your kid needs a role model and you ain't it, you're both fucked.
Author: George Carlin,  Brain Droppings

Quote: The more I learn about the universe, the less convinced I am that there's any sort of benevolent force that has anything to do with it, at all.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: A kiss on the beach when there is a full moon is the closest thing to heaven.
Author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

Quote: Carve your name on hearts, not tombstones. A legacy is etched into the minds of others and the stories they share about you.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: It's funny how, in this journey of life, even though we may begin at different times and places, our paths cross with others so that we may share our love, compassion, observations, and hope. This is a design of God that I appreciate and cherish.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

Quote: We all know interspecies romance is weird.
Author: Tim Burton

Quote: The butterfly counts not months but moments, and has time enough.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Learn from yesterday, live for today, look to tomorrow, rest this afternoon.
Author: Charles M. Schulz,  Charlie Brown's Little Book of Wisdom

Quote: Happiness is not achieved by the conscious pursuit of happiness; it is generally the by-product of other activities.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: I am eternally grateful for my knack of finding in great books, some of them very funny books, reason enough to feel honored to be alive, no matter what else might be going on.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Timequake

Quote: I want to make this world perfect.
Author: Malala Yousafzai

Quote: My success was not based so much on any great intelligence but on great common sense.
Author: Helen Gurley Brown

Quote: True friends stab you in the front.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I hope that any expansion of London will learn from the planning examples of some of its most desirable areas such as Chelsea, Notting Hill, Belgravia and Mayfair. All are characterised by high density and a generosity of green spaces.
Author: Norman Foster

Quote: I feel like life is really short, and it's important to enjoy yourself and embrace whatever comes your way, whether it's a challenging day or a great day, just welcome it with open arms. No matter who you are, you can't escape challenges; they are part of life.
Author: Miranda Kerr

Quote: For me, I really love 'Tim and Eric' and 'Dr. Steve Brule' and a lot of the Adult Swim shows, so I like strange, weird, sometimes slightly upsetting humor.
Author: Gillian Jacobs

Quote: Censorship is to art as lynching is to justice.
Author: Henry Louis Gates

Quote: There used to be days that I thought I was okay, or at least that I was going to be. We'd be hanging out somewhere and everything would just fit right and I would think 'it will be okay if it can just be like this forever' but of course nothing can ever stay just how it is forever.
Author: Nina LaCour,  Hold Still

Quote: I have been loving you a little more every minute since this morning.
Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables

Quote: Huh,"Leo said. "Well, if you ever get off this island and want a job, let me know. You're not a total klutz."She smirked. "A job, eh?"Making things in your forge?""Nah, we could start our own shop,"Leo said, surprising himself. Starting a machine shop had always been one of his dreams, but he'd never told anyone about it. "Leo and Calypso's Garage: Auto Repair and Mechanical Monsters.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The House of Hades

Quote: the [coat] rack above his head like a javelin.On the other side of the door was Jace. He blinked. "Is that a coatrack?"Jordan slammed the coatrack down on the ground and sighed. "If you'd been a vampire, this would have been a lot more useful.""Yes,"said Jace. "Or, you know, just someone with a lot of coats.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Fallen Angels

Quote: Chaos is more freedom; in fact, total freedom. But no meaning. I want to be free to act, and I also want my actions to mean something.
Author: Audrey Niffenegger,  The Time Traveler's Wife

Quote: Where there is no hope, it is incumbent on us to invent it.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Here's a haiku/palindrome I wrote called, "Obsession."Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob,Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob,Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob, Bob
Author: Jarod Kintz,  A Letter to Andre Breton, Originally Composed on a Leaf of Lettuce With an Ink-dipped Carrot

Quote: I love the smell of book ink in the morning.
Author: Umberto Eco

Quote: When faced with two equally tough choices, most people choose the third choice: to not choose.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Title is Invisible

Quote: I crave your mouth, your voice, your hair.Silent and starving, I prowl through the streets. Bread does not nourish me, dawn disrupts me, all day I hunt for the liquid measure of your steps.
Author: Pablo Neruda,  100 Love Sonnets

Quote: When people fall in love, they burst into flames.
Author: Jandy Nelson,  I'll Give You the Sun

Quote: Even on the most solemn occasions I got away without wearing socks and hid that lack of civilization in high boots
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I don't think you should be an Auror, Harry,"said Luna unexpectedly. Everybody looked at her. "The Aurors are part of the Rotfang Conspiracy, I thought everyone knew that. They're working to bring down the Ministry of Magic from within using a mixture of dark magic and gum disease.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: Whoa. Fangs. She had fangs.She leaned in, prodded them a little. Eating with those puppies was going to take some getting used to, she thought.On impulse, she brought up her hands, turned her fingers into claws. Hissed.Cool.
Author: J.R. Ward,  Dark Lover

Quote: Kronos would be 10 times more powerful. His very presence would incinerate you. And once he achieves this he will empower the other Titans. They are weak, compared to what they soon will become, unless you can stop them, the world will fall, the gods will die, and I will never achieve a perfect score on this stupid machine.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Last Olympian

Quote: Believe me, I'm no romantic, and while I've heard all about love at first sight, I've never believed in it, and I still don't. But even so, there was something there, something recognizably real, and I couldn't look away.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Dear John

Quote: Youth offers the promise of happiness, but life offers the realities of grief.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Rescue

Quote: I try to avoid looking forward or backward, and try to keep looking upward.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: You must accept the reality of other people. You think that reality is up for negotiation, that we think it's whatever you say it is. You must accept that we are as real as you are; you must accept that you are not God.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  The Casual Vacancy

Quote: Free at last, Free at last, Thank God almighty we are free at last.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.,  I Have a Dream: Writings and Speeches That Changed the World

Quote: Spending time with God is the key to our strength and success in all areas of life. Be sure that you never try to work God into your schedule, but always work your schedule around Him.
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: Nobody ever gets what they want when it comes to love.
Author: Scott Turow

Quote: Herondales."Zachariah's voice was a breath, half laughter, half pain. "I had almost forgotten. No other family does so much for love, or feels so much guilt for it. Don't carry the weight of the world on you, Jace. It's too heavy for even a Herondale to bear.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Heavenly Fire

Quote: I love you, in my mind where my thoughts reside, in my heart where my emotions live, and in my soul where my dreams are born. I love you.
Author: Dee Henderson,  The Healer

Quote: One of the best times for figuring out who you are & what you really want out of life? Right after a break-up.
Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass

Quote: It's good to do uncomfortable things. It's weight training for life.
Author: Anne Lamott,  Plan B: Further Thoughts on Faith

Quote: I'm the warlock who's here to cure you. Didn't they tell you I was coming?""I know who you are, but..."Maia looked dazed. "You look so...so...shiny.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Indeed, learning to write may be part of learning to read. For all I know, writing comes out of a superior devotion to reading.
Author: Eudora Welty,  On Writing

Quote: Sticking feathers up your butt does not make you a chicken!
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Fight Club

Quote: A fire broke out backstage in a theatre. The clown came out to warn the public; they thought it was a joke and applauded. He repeated it; the acclaim was even greater. I think that's just how the world will come to an end: to general applause from wits who believe it's a joke.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard,  Either/Or, Part I

Quote: You are not a victim. No matter what you have been through, you're still here. You may have been challenged, hurt, betrayed, beaten, and discouraged, but nothing has defeated you. You are still here! You have been delayed but not denied. You are not a victim, you are a victor. You have a history of victory.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

Quote: When I was a boy the Dead Sea was only sick.
Author: George Burns

Quote: Many religions now come before us with ingratiating smirks and outspread hands, like an unctuous merchant in a bazaar. They offer consolation and solidarity and uplift, competing as they do in a marketplace. But we have a right to remember how barbarically they behaved when they were strong and were making an offer that people could not refuse.
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: Only priests and fools are fearless and I've never been on the best of terms with God.
Author: Patrick Rothfuss,  The Name of the Wind

Quote: Every day People straighten up the hair, why not the heart?
Author: Ernesto Che Guevara

Quote: It's hard to love a woman and do anything.
Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Anna Karenina

Quote: Are you a female dog?""What?"Massie asked. "Why?""Because you are acting like a real bitch!
Author: Lisi Harrison,  The Clique

Quote: When trouble arises and things look bad, there is always one individual who perceives a solution and is willing to take command. Very often, that individual is crazy.
Author: Dave Barry,  Dave Barry Turns Fifty

Quote: I have never voted in my life... I have always known and understood that the idiots are in a majority so it's certain they will win.
Author: Louis-Ferdinand Céline

Quote: You're still here. No beer. I'm not corrupting a minor.""But you're a minor,"she pointed out. "At least for beer.""Yeah, and by the way, how much does it suck that I'm an adult if I kill somebody, and I'm not if I want a beer?
Author: Rachel Caine,  Glass Houses

Quote: I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse,  The Code of the Woosters

Quote: Women may fall when there's no strength in men.Act II
Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet

Quote: Death leaves a heartache no one can heal, love leaves a memory no one can steal.From an Irish headstone
Author: Richard Puz,  The Carolinian

Quote: Night poured over the desert. It came suddenly, in purple. In the clear air, the stars drilled down out of the sky, reminding any thoughtful watcher that it is in the deserts and high places that religions are generated. When men see nothing but bottomless infinity over their heads they have always had a driving and desperate urge to find someone to put in the way.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Jingo

Quote: In old days books were written by men of letters and read by the public. Nowadays books are written by the public and read by nobody.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: God loves to help him who strives to help himself.
Author: Aeschylus

Quote: There is nothing more difficult to take in hand, more perilous to conduct, or more uncertain in its success, than to take the lead in the introduction of a new order of things.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quote: A friendship can weather most things and thrive in thin soil; but it needs a little mulch of letters and phone calls and small, silly presents every so often - just to save it from drying out completely.
Author: Pam Brown

Quote: I think that hope, that ability to envision, to imagine a better way, and then to apply yourself to it, is the way to climb out of a hole, is the way to build a better life, is the way to build a better community and a better country.
Author: Deval Patrick

Quote: Few people seem to realize that the resurrection of Jesus is the cornerstone to a worldview that provides the perspective to all of life.
Author: Josh McDowell

Quote: I had parents who instilled in me the importance of love, morals and hard work. I give God all the glory because he has brought me through so much.
Author: Junior Seau

Quote: There's always a source for humor.
Author: Calvin Trillin

Quote: Works of art make rules; rules do not make works of art.
Author: Claude Debussy

Quote: I had rather be shut up in a very modest cottage with my books, my family and a few old friends, dining on simple bacon, and letting the world roll on as it liked, than to occupy the most splendid post, which any human power can give.
Author: Thomas Jefferson,  Letters of Thomas Jefferson

Quote: Oh, it's always the same,' she sighed, 'if you want men to behave well to you, you must be beastly to them; if you treat them decently they make you suffer for it.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham,  Of Human Bondage

Quote: Love is not patronizing and charity isn't about pity, it is about love. Charity and love are the same -- with charity you give love, so don't just give money but reach out your hand instead.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: To pay attention, this is our endless and proper work.
Author: Mary Oliver

Quote: To teach how to live without certainty, and yet without being paralyzed by hesitation, is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy, in our age, can still do for those who study it.
Author: Bertrand Russell,  A History of Western Philosophy

Quote: I want to get the words "Courage"and "Bravery"tattooed across my back, so people could associate me with those things as they read them while they chase me.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want

Quote: Death should take me while I am in the mood.
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne,  The Blithedale Romance

Quote: We're taught that in life, we should try to look on the bright side. Not in this case. In this case, assume rejection first. Assume you're the rule, not the exception. It's liberating. But we also know it's not an easy concept. -He's not just into you
Author: Greg Behrendt

Quote: Making love to me is amazing. Wait, I meant: making love, to me, is amazing. The absence of two little commas nearly transformed me into a sex god.
Author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo,  Love Quotes for the Ages. Specifically Ages 19-91.

Quote: They laugh at me because I'm different; I laugh at them because they're all the same.
Author: Kurt Cobain

Quote: We dance round in a ring and suppose,But the Secret sits in the middle and knows.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: We can't choose our fate, but we can choose others. Be careful in knowing that.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Quote: I didn't know a van could go up on two wheels like that, for so long."-Nudge
Author: James Patterson,  The Angel Experiment

Quote: Lies are neither bad nor good. Like a fire they can either keep you warm or burn you to death, depending on how they're used.
Author: Max Brooks,  World War Z: An Oral History of the Zombie War

Quote: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and all science. He to whom this emotion is a stranger, who can no longer pause to wonder and stand rapt in awe, is as good as dead: his eyes are closed.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Thought I couldn't live without youIt's gonna hurt when it heals tooEven though I really love youI'm gonna smile cause I deserve toQuickly I'm learning to love againAll I know is I'mma be ok
Author: Leona Lewis

Quote: Dance. Smile. Giggle. Marvel. TRUST. HOPE. LOVE. WISH. BELIEVE. Most of all, enjoy every moment of the journey, and appreciate where you are at this moment instead of always focusing on how far you have to go.
Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass

Quote: I am who I am; no more, no less.
Author: Terry Goodkind,  Wizard's First Rule

Quote: Men are more interesting in books than they are in real life.
Author: Mary Ann Shaffer,  The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society

Quote: The Lord works from the inside out. The world works from the outside in. The world would take people out of the slums. Christ would take the slums out of people, and then they would take themselves out of the slums.The world would mold men by changing their environment. Christ changes men, who then change their environment. The world would shape human behavior, but Christ can change human nature.
Author: Ezra Taft Benson

Quote: To elevate the soul, poetry is necessary.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: All this timeI drank you like the cure when maybeyou were the poison.
Author: Clementine von Radics

Quote: This time I wouldn't forget him, because I couldn't ever forgive him - for breaking my heart twice.
Author: James Patterson,  Sundays at Tiffany's

Quote: Anything is possible. Anything can be.
Author: Shel Silverstein

Quote: The man who smiles when things go wrong has thought of someone to blame it on.
Author: Robert Bloch

Quote: Out of doubt, out of dark to the day's risingI came singing into the sun, sword unsheathing.To hope's end I rode and to heart's breaking:Now for wrath, now for ruin and a red nightfall!
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Return of the King

Quote: Like a sculptor, if necessary,carve a friend out of stone.Realize that your inner sight is blindand try to see a treasure in everyone.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Live or die, but don't poison everything.
Author: Anne Sexton

Quote: Clocks slay time... time is dead as long as it is being clicked off by little wheels; only when the clock stops does time come to life.
Author: William Faulkner,  The Sound and the Fury

Quote: Our love went from fly to flower to butterfly, and it was meant to beautifully flutter, not sit still on a shelf like a trophy to be collected.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: It hurts to breathe. It hurts to live. I hate her, yet I do not think I can exist without her.
Author: Charlotte Featherstone,  Addicted

Quote: Kat laughed. 'Who wants to live forever?'Kish put his hand up. 'For the record, I do.'Sin scowled at him. 'Then why do you irritate me so often?'Suicidal tendencies are inherent in my species?
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,  Devil May Cry

Quote: Self-respect is the root of discipline: The sense of dignity growswith the ability to say no to oneself.
Author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

Quote: The further you go, the more you have to be proud of. At the same time, in order to come a long way, you have to be behind to begin with. IN the end, though maybe it's not how you reach a place that matters. Just that you get there at all.
Author: Sarah Dessen,  Lock and Key

Quote: The ideals which have always shone before me and filled me with joy are goodness, beauty, and truth.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Courage, my friends; 'tis not too late to build a better world.
Author: Tommy Douglas

Quote: Management is efficiency in climbing the ladder of success; leadership determines whether the ladder is leaning against the right wall.
Author: Stephen Covey

Quote: Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.
Author: Herodotus

Quote: Putting on my legs is like putting on my shoes. I understand that's how some people might think differently, but I hope that in London, their perceptions open up.
Author: Oscar Pistorius

Quote: We cannot always control everything that happens to us in this life, but we can control how we respond. Many struggles come as problems and pressures that sometimes cause pain. Others come as temptations, trials, and tribulations.
Author: L. Lionel Kendrick

Quote: I didn't have a fireworks moment for my salvation. I had a falling in love with Jesus in Sunday school when I was a very young child.
Author: Beth Moore

Quote: A lot of stars don't have a sense of humor.
Author: Kathy Griffin

Quote: As in nature, as in art, so in grace; it is rough treatment that gives souls, as well as stones, their luster.
Author: Thomas Guthrie

Quote: Pierre was right when he said that one must believe in the possibility of happiness in order to be happy, and I now believe in it. Let the dead bury the dead, but while I'm alive, I must live and be happy.
Author: Leo Tolstoy,  War and Peace

Quote: Kiss a lover, Dance a measure, Find your name And buried treasure. Face your life, It's pain, It's pleasure, Leave no path untaken.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Graveyard Book

Quote: Just for the record, she still loves you. She wouldn't bother to torture you if she didn't.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Diary

Quote: ...the opposite of love is not hate -- it's apathy. It's not giving a damn. If somebody hates me, they must "feel"something ... or they couldn't possibly hate. Therefore, there's some way in which I can get to them.
Author: Leo Buscaglia

Quote: But I miss screamin' and fightin' and kissin' in the rain and it's 2 a.m. and I'm cursin' your name. You're so in love the you act insane, and that's the way I loved you.
Author: Taylor Swift

Quote: Hollowness: that I understand. I'm starting to believe that there isn't anything you can do to fix it. That's what I've taken from the therapy sessions: the holes in your life are permanent. You have to grow around them, like tree roots around concrete; you mold yourself through the gaps
Author: Paula Hawkins,  The Girl on the Train

Quote: She had become accustomed to being lonely. She was used to walking alone and to being considered 'different.' She did not suffer too much.
Author: Betty Smith,  A Tree Grows in Brooklyn

Quote: I am Dead, but it's not so bad. I've learned to live with it.
Author: Isaac Marion,  Warm Bodies

Quote: Leo frowned at the giant's spire. "Can't we blow it up or something?""Without me, you do not have the power,"Hera said. "You might as well try to destroy a mountain.""Done that once today,"Jason said.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Lost Hero

Quote: Maybe this is why we read, and why in moments of darkness we return to books: to find words for what we already know.
Author: Alberto Manguel,  A Reading Diary: A Passionate Reader's Reflections on a Year of Books

Quote: Every person must choose how much truth he can stand.
Author: Irvin D. Yalom,  When Nietzsche Wept

Quote: [E]xceptional claims demand exceptional evidence.
Author: Christopher Hitchens,  God Is Not Great: How Religion Poisons Everything

Quote: Our bodies have five senses: touch, smell, taste, sight, hearing. But not to be overlooked are the senses of our souls: intuition, peace, foresight, trust, empathy. The differences between people lie in their use of these senses; most people don't know anything about the inner senses while a few people rely on them just as they rely on their physical senses, and in fact probably even more.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: For a day, just for one day,Talk about that which disturbs no oneAnd bring some peace into yourBeautiful eyes.
Author: حافظ,  The Subject Tonight Is Love: 60 Wild and Sweet Poems of Hafiz

Quote: Isn't it funny.I'm enjoying my hatred so much more than i ever enjoyed love. Love is temperamental. Tiring. It makes demands. Love uses you, changes its mind. But hatred, now, that's something you can use. Sculpt. Wield. It's hard, or soft, however you need it. Love humiliates you, but Hatred cradles you.
Author: Janet Fitch,  White Oleander

Quote: We made eyes at each other, and then we made love. We also made other things too, like meatloaf.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: What greater thing is there for two human souls, than to feel that they are joined for life--to strengthen each other in all labor, to rest on each other in all sorrow, to minister to each other in all pain, to be one with each other in silent unspeakable memories at the moment of the last parting?
Author: George Eliot,  Adam Bede

Quote: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: Our ability to adapt is amazing. Our ability to change isn't quite as spectacular.
Author: Lisa Lutz,  The Spellmans Strike Again

Quote: If I've learned one lesson from all that's happened to me, it's that there is no such thing as the biggest mistake of your existence. There's no such thing as ruining your life. Life's a pretty resilient thing, it turns out.
Author: Sophie Kinsella,  The Undomestic Goddess

Quote: The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends towards justice.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: I'd like to add some beauty to life,"said Anne dreamily. "I don't exactly want to make people KNOW more... though I know that IS the noblest ambition... but I'd love to make them have a pleasanter time because of me... to have some little joy or happy thought that would never have existed if I hadn't been born.
Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne's House of Dreams

Quote: Lies run sprints, but the truth runs marathons.
Author: Michael Jackson

Quote: My soul is in the sky.
Author: William Shakespeare,  A Midsummer Night's Dream

Quote: The tyrant dies and his rule is over, the martyr dies and his rule begins.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard,  The Journals of Kierkegaard

Quote: A professional writer is an amateur who didn't quit.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: Reach high, for stars lie hidden in you. Dream deep, for every dream precedes the goal.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: The greatest discovery of any generation is that a human can alter his life by altering his attitude.
Author: William James

Quote: I took a speed-reading course and read War and Peace in twenty minutes. It involves Russia.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: There are some things one remembers even though they may never have happened.
Author: Harold Pinter,  Old Times

Quote: If they killed him tonight, at least he would die alive.
Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

Quote: If I cannot do great things, I can do small things in a great way
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: There are too many books in the world to read in a single lifetime; you have to draw the line somewhere.
Author: Diane Setterfield,  The Thirteenth Tale

Quote: When she is happy, she can't stop talking, when she is sad she doesn't say a word.
Author: Ann Brashares,  Girls In Pants: The Third Summer of the Sisterhood

Quote: I love you more than songs can say, but I can't keep running after yesterday...
Author: John Mayer,  John Mayer - Battle Studies

Quote: It's important in life if you don't give a shit. It can help you a lot.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: The right thing at the wrong tme is the wrong thing.
Author: Joshua Harris,  I Kissed Dating Goodbye: A New Attitude Toward Relationships and Romance

Quote: The truth was...he was in love with her. Totally over-the-line, no-going-back, not-even-dead-would-he-part kind of shit.
Author: J.R. Ward,  Lover Mine

Quote: What does the brain matter compared with the heart?
Author: Virginia Woolf,  Mrs. Dalloway

Quote: All the most powerful emotions come from chaos -fear,anger,love- especially love. Love is chaos itself. Think about it! Love makes no sense. It shakes you up and spins you around. And then, eventually , it falls apart.
Author: Kirsten Miller,  The Eternal Ones

Quote: When you know my love, my love will warm you.
Author: Ruby Dee

Quote: Enjoy life. There's plenty of time to be dead.
Author: Hans Christian Andersen

Quote: Jamie: You know what I figured out today?Landon: What?Jamie: Maybe God has a bigger plan for me than I had for myself. Like this journey never ends. Like you were sent to me because I'm sick. To help me through all this. You're my angel.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  A Walk to Remember

Quote: Sometimes, as we're stumbling along in the dark, we hit something good.
Author: Susan Ee,  Angelfall

Quote: Contentment is natural wealth, luxury is artificial poverty.
Author: Socrates,  Essential Thinkers - Socrates

Quote: A man who does not think for himself does not think at all.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: In the name of the Pizza Lord. Charge!
Author: Jim Butcher,  Summer Knight

Quote: Is this one of those keep-your-friends-close-and-your-enemies-closer things?""I though it was keep your friends close so you have someone to drive the car when you sneak over to your enemy's house at night and throw up in his mailbox.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Fallen Angels

Quote: Studies have shown that an ant can carry one hundred times its own weight, but there is no known limit to the lifting power of the average tiny eighty-year-old Spanish peasant grandmother.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Reaper Man

Quote: I always tell the truth. Even when I lie.
Author: Al Pacino

Quote: It's not your job to like me - it's mine
Author: Byron Katie

Quote: Life is the tragedy,' she said bitterly. 'You know how they categorize Shakespeare's plays, right? If it ends with a wedding, it's a comedy. And if it ends with a funeral, it's a tragedy. So we're all living tragedies, because we all end the same way, and it isn't with a goddamn wedding.
Author: Robyn Schneider,  The Beginning of Everything

Quote: And when I saw him[my father] lying dead in a pool of his own blood, I knew then that I hadn't stopped believing in God. I'd just stopped believing God cared. There might be a God, Clary, and there might be not. Either way, we're on our own.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

Quote: I believe in love the verb, not the noun.
Author: Greg Behrendt,  He's Just Not That Into You: The No-Excuses Truth to Understanding Guys

Quote: Dogs have given us their absolute all. We are the center of their universe. We are the focus of their love and faith and trust. They serve us in return for scraps. It is without a doubt the best deal man has ever made.
Author: Roger A. Caras

Quote: The thing with your heart's desire is that your heart doesn't even know what it desires until it turns up.
Author: Daniel Handler,  Why We Broke Up

Quote: It is not a daily increase, but a daily decrease. Hack away at the inessentials.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: Freddie experienced the sort of abysmal soul-sadness which afflicts one of Tolstoy's Russian peasants when, after putting in a heavy day's work strangling his father, beating his wife, and dropping the baby into the city's reservoir, he turns to the cupboards, only to find the vodka bottle empty.
