Author: P.G. Wodehouse,  The Best of Wodehouse: An Anthology

Quote: The truth is messy. It's raw and uncomfortable. You can't blame people for preferring lies.
Author: Holly Black,  Red Glove

Quote: So wise so young, they say, do never live long.
Author: William Shakespeare,  Richard III

Quote: Green was the silence, wet was the light,the month of June trembled like a butterfly.
Author: Pablo Neruda,  100 Love Sonnets

Quote: Hindus, in their capacity for love, are indeed hairless Christians, just as Muslims, in the way they see God in everything, are bearded Hindus, and Christians, in their devotion to God, are hat wearing Muslims.
Author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi

Quote: Those who cannot work with their hearts achieve but a hollow, half-hearted success that breeds bitterness all around.
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.
Author: Charles Caleb Colton

Quote: When you have put all your faith in man and continue to be disappointed, don't you hope there is something out of there that is not of human element?
Author: Natalie Cole

Quote: What I love about my husband is that he really allows me to be the best person I can.
Author: Georgina Chapman

Quote: I used to watch 'The Waltons' and sob because my family was nothing like that. We had a cruel sense of humor in my family.
Author: Paula Poundstone

Quote: Venice is the perfect place for a phase of art to die. No other city on earth embraces entropy quite like this magical floating mall.
Author: Jerry Saltz

Quote: Changing is what people do when they have no options left.
Author: Holly Black,  Red Glove

Quote: You have my whole heart. You always did.
Author: Cormac McCarthy,  The Road

Quote: I'm not married,"he said softly, "because I can't stomach the idea of marrying a woman inferior to me in mind and spirit. It would mean the death of my soul.
Author: Sarah J. Maas,  Throne of Glass

Quote: This thing about you that you think is your flaw - it's the reason I'm falling in love with you.
Author: Colleen Hoover,  Slammed

Quote: It was brave,"countered Issa. "It was rare. It was love, and it was beautiful.
Author: Laini Taylor,  Days of Blood & Starlight

Quote: When you make a choice, you change the future.
Author: Deepak Chopra

Quote: Why did I write? Because I found life unsatisfactory.
Author: Tennessee Williams

Quote: Have you ever seen the stars in the night? See them closely, they will tell you, how to be open, how to love and how to shine and twinkle without any differences and jealousy of other stars.
Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday

Quote: When you take risks you learn that there will be times when you succeed and there will be times when you fail, and both are equally important.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres,  Seriously... I'm Kidding

Quote: There is nothing more beautiful than seeing a person being themselves. Imagine going through your day being unapologetically you.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

Quote: If at first you don't succeed, destroy all evidence that you tried.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: Ends are not bad things, they just mean that something else is about to begin. And there are many things that don't really end, anyway, they just begin again in a new way. Ends are not bad and many ends aren't really an ending; some things are never-ending.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: I couldn't stop staring at his mouth when he spoke. I bet he knew how to kiss. Perfect kisses too, ones that weren't wet and gross, but the kind that curled toes.I needed to stop looking at him in general.
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,  Obsidian

Quote: Love is a rebellious bird that nobody can tame.
Author: Veronica Rossi,  Through the Ever Night

Quote: Half the night I waste in sighs,Half in dreams I sorrow afterThe delight of early skies;In a wakeful dose I sorrowFor the hand, the lips, the eyes,For the meeting of the morrow,The delight of happy laughter,The delight of low replies.
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson,  Maud, and other poems

Quote: What ho!"I said."What ho!"said Motty."What ho! What ho!""What ho! What ho! What ho!"After that it seemed rather difficult to go on with the conversation.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse,  My Man Jeeves

Quote: Neither were you [born yesterday], unless of course I am wrong, in which case welcome to the world, little baby, and congratulations on learning to read so early in life.
Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Penultimate Peril

Quote: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: It may be that you are not yourself luminous, but that you are a conductor of light. Some people without possessing genius have a remarkable power of stimulating it.
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle

Quote: Some books are undeservedly forgotten; none are undeservedly remembered.
Author: W.H. Auden,  The Dyer's Hand

Quote: Tell me, tutor,' I said. 'Is revenge a science, or an art?
Author: Mark Lawrence,  Prince of Thorns

Quote: The boundaries which divide Life from Death are at best shadowy and vague. Who shall say where the one ends, and where the other begins?
Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  The Premature Burial

Quote: It has shown me that everything is illuminated in the light of the past. It is always along the side of us...on the inside, looking out.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: Selling my soul would be a lot easier if I could just find it.
Author: Nikki Sixx,  The Heroin Diaries: A Year In The Life Of A Shattered Rock Star

Quote: Their fingers seemed to fit together in just the right way- effortlessly clasped,like perfect complements.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!
Author: John Lennon

Quote: Helloooo? I just made some changes in my life, and if I don't get back to you as soon as possible, then guess what? You were one of those changes.
Author: Rumiko Takahashi

Quote: If equal affection cannot be,Let the more loving one be me.
Author: W.H. Auden

Quote: Childhood should be carefree, playing in the sun; not living a nightmare in the darkness of the soul.
Author: Dave Pelzer,  A Child Called "It"

Quote: She was fascinated with words. To her, words were things of beauty, each like a magical powder or potion that could be combined with other words to create powerful spells.
Author: Dean Koontz,  Lightning

Quote: Most of what makes a book 'good' is that we are reading it at the right moment for us.
Author: Alain de Botton

Quote: Life is 10 percent what you make itand 90 percent how you take it.
Author: Irving Berlin

Quote: People tell me I look like my father. I've never seen my dad, so does that mean I look invisible?
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: Had I been in love, I could not have been more wretchedly blind. But vanity, not love, has been my folly.
Author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice

Quote: Well, spit on my empty grave--if it ain't the attack of the Disney princesses!
Author: Amy Plum,  Die for Me

Quote: They say that 'Guns don't kill people, people kill people.' Well I think the gun helps. If you just stood there and yelled BANG, I don't think you'd kill too many people.
Author: Eddie Izzard

Quote: But this room looked like it had been decorated by the unholy lovechild of Barbie and Strawberry Shortcake.
Author: Rachel Hawkins,  Hex Hall

Quote: Colin decided then and there that the female mind was a strange and incomprehensible organ - one which no man should even attempt to understand. There wasn't a woman alive who could go from point A to B without stopping at C, D, X, and 12 along the way.
Author: Julia Quinn,  Romancing Mister Bridgerton

Quote: I have good idea, for if you meet some person from different religion and he want to make argument about God. My idea is, you listen to everything this man say about God. Never argue about God with him. Best thing to say is, 'I agree with you.' Then you go home, pray what you want. This is my idea for people to have peace about religion.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love

Quote: The Uses Of Sorrow(In my sleep I dreamed this poem)Someone I loved once gave mea box full of darkness.It took me years to understandthat this, too, was a gift.
Author: Mary Oliver,  Thirst

Quote: The heart is an arrow. It demands aim to land true.
Author: Leigh Bardugo,  Six of Crows

Quote: I went to school in drag, in art school and my day was completely different because everybody thought I was a chick. You should see me as a chick. So I went as a girl, as like an experiment and it worked really well and everyone was really nice to me but I couldn't talk obviously...you know train conductors were really cool to me on my commute...HA! I looked hot as a chick!
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: Do not allow me to forget you
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez,  Of Love and Other Demons

Quote: We judge others instantly by their clothes, their cars, their appearance, their race, their education, their social status. The list is endless. What gets me is that most people decide who another person is before they have even spoken to them. What's even worse is that these same people decide who someone else is, and don't even know who they are themselves.
Author: Ashly Lorenzana

Quote: I love sleepwalking, because when else would I get to combine exercise and rest?
Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Merits of Marthaism, and How Being Named Susan Can Benefit You

Quote: Scars are not injuries, Tanner Sack. A scar is a healing. After injury, a scar is what makes you whole.
Author: China Miéville,  The Scar

Quote: You're so easy to read but the book is boring me.
Author: Emilie Autumn

Quote: People leave strange little memories of themselves behind when they die.
Author: Haruki Murakami,  Norwegian Wood

Quote: If there's only one nation in the sky, shouldn't all passports be valid for it?
Author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi

Quote: I knew who I was this morning, but I've changed a few times since then.
Author: Lewis Carroll,  Alice's Adventures in Wonderland & Through the Looking-Glass

Quote: Every moment and every event of every man's life on earth plants something in his soul.
Author: Thomas Merton

Quote: We need to accept that we won't always make the right decisions, that we'll screw up royally sometimes - understanding that failure is not the opposite of success, it's part of success.
Author: Arianna Huffington

Quote: A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth.
Author: Charles Darwin

Quote: The expectation in the Obama Administration, or at least the hope, is that a nuclear deal with the West could ultimately moderate Iranian behavior by helping to integrate the country more thoroughly into the international system. Will this happen? It's impossible to predict, of course. We will only know if we get there.
Author: Dexter Filkins

Quote: Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, it's a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope, and that enables you to laugh at life's realities.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: I love to deer hunt and fish and drive down the back roads in my truck. All those things basically equal freedom to me - and not having to return that message or call from my record company or management. At some point, I need to recharge.
Author: Blake Shelton

Quote: I'm sure there are people who survive tragedy without humor, but I've never met any of them. Nor would I be particularly interested in writing about them if I did meet them.
Author: Ayelet Waldman

Quote: Art is not for the cultivated taste. It is to cultivate taste.
Author: Nikki Giovanni

Quote: I cannot understand anti-abortion arguments that centre on the sanctity of life. As a species we've fairly comprehensively demonstrated that we don't believe in the sanctity of life. The shrugging acceptance of war, famine, epidemic, pain and life-long poverty shows us that, whatever we tell ourselves, we've made only the most feeble of efforts to really treat human life as sacred.
Author: Caitlin Moran,  How to Be a Woman

Quote: Do your best and let God do the rest.
Author: Ben Carson

Quote: I believe in God, only I spell it Nature.
Author: Frank Lloyd Wright,  Truth Against the World: Frank Lloyd Wright Speaks for an Organic Architecture

Quote: The best things are never arrived at in haste. God is in no hurry; His plans are never rushed.
Author: Michael R. Phillips

Quote: So long as you write what you wish to write, that is all that matters; and whether it matters for ages or only for hours, nobody can say.
Author: Virginia Woolf,  A Room of One's Own

Quote: A story has no beginning or end: arbitrarily one chooses that moment of experience from which to look back or from which to look ahead.
Author: Graham Greene,  The End of the Affair

Quote: Our lives can't be measured by our final years, of this I am sure.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook

Quote: Life is but a dream for the dead.
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: When red fights with white, pink is always the winner. Let that be a lesson in love.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  My love can only occupy one person at a time

Quote: The moment our lips met, I knew with pure and piercing certainty that I would have waited for him forever.
Author: Leigh Bardugo,  Shadow and Bone

Quote: And I'll dance with you in Vienna,I'll be wearing a river's disguise.The hyacinth wild on my shouldermy mouth on the dew of your thighs.And I'll bury my soul in a scrapbook,with the photographs there and the moss.And I'll yield to the flood of your beauty,my cheap violin and my cross.
Author: Leonard Cohen,  Stranger Music: Selected Poems and Songs

Quote: There's no advantage to hurrying through life."-Shikamaru Nara
Author: Masashi Kishimoto

Quote: Let me tell ya. You gotta pay attention to signs. When life reaches out with a moment like this it's a sin if you don't reach back... I'm telling you.
Author: Matthew Quick,  The Silver Linings Playbook

Quote: I hate you."I love you."You're a freak, you know that? Everyone says so. They always have."I'm trying not to be.
Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

Quote: My dad used to say that life's a journey, but somebody screwed up and lost the map.
Author: Rachel Caine,  Kiss of Death

Quote: I believe in the fundamental truth of all great religions of the world.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: When writing a novel a writer should create living people; people not characters. A character is a caricature.
Author: Ernest Hemingway,  Death in the Afternoon

Quote: Stories make us more alive, more human, more courageous, more loving.
Author: Madeleine L'Engle

Quote: My love is expansive. Your love is expensive.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Whenever You're Gone, I'm Here For You

Quote: Laughter is carbonated holiness.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: Education is teaching our children to desire the right things.
Author: Plato

Quote: Poetry = Anger x Imagination
Author: Sherman Alexie,  One Stick Song

Quote: Few people know how to take a walk. The qualifications are endurance, plain clothes, old shoes, an eye for nature, good humor, vast curiosity, good speech, good silence and nothing too much.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Love me like you'll never see me again.
Author: Alicia Keys

Quote: All any of us wanted, really, was to know that we counted. That someone else's life would not have been as rich without us here.
Author: Jodi Picoult,  Handle with Care

Quote: You must be shapeless, formless, like water. When you pour water in a cup, it becomes the cup. When you pour water in a bottle, it becomes the bottle. When you pour water in a teapot, it becomes the teapot. Water can drip and it can crash. Become like water my friend.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: The truth is, every son raised by a single mom is pretty much born married. I don't know, but until your mom dies it seems like all the other women in your life can never be more than just your mistress.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Do I look stupid?"snarled Uncle Vernon, a bit of fried egg dangling from his bushy mustache.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Quote: Most of what I say is complete truth. My edit button is broken.
Author: Myra McEntire,  Hourglass

Quote: I'm telling you a lie in a vicious effort that you will repeat my lie over and over until it becomes true
Author: Lady Gaga

Quote: The word 'God' is for me nothing more than the expression and product of human weaknesses, the Bible a collection of honorable, but still primitive legends which are nevertheless pretty childish. No interpretation, no matter how subtle, can (for me) change this.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Beauty is no quality in things themselves: It exists merely in the mind which contemplates them; and each mind perceives a different beauty.
Author: David Hume,  Of the Standard of Taste and Other Essays

Quote: Christmas, children, is not a date. It is a state of mind.
Author: Mary Ellen Chase

Quote: Define yourself radically as one beloved by God. This is the true self. Every other identity is illusion.
Author: Brennan Manning,  Abba's Child: The Cry of the Heart for Intimate Belonging

Quote: All the problem of women, starts with men. All the problem of men, ends with women.
Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday

Quote: When you were in love, you were capable of learning everything and of knowing things you had never dared even to think, because love was the key to understanding all of the mysteries.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  Brida

Quote: Grace is the face that love wears when it meets imperfection.
Author: Joseph R. Cooke

Quote: I wouldn't marry Giddon to save my life,"Katsa said. "Not even to save yours.""Well."Raffin's eyes were full of laughter. "I'd leave that part out.
Author: Kristin Cashore,  Graceling

Quote: To summarize the summary of the summary: people are a problem.
Author: Douglas Adams,  The Restaurant at the End of the Universe

Quote: My God, a moment of bliss. Why, isn't that enough for a whole lifetime?
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  White Nights

Quote: Sometimes you weren't supposed to share pain. Sometimes it was best just to deal with it alone.
Author: Sarah Addison Allen,  The Sugar Queen

Quote: Sleep would be so welcome. A warm blanket of black to erase everything else. Sleep without dreams. I've heard people talk about the sleep of the dead. Is that what death would feel like? The nicest, warmest, heaviest never-ending nap? If that's what it's like, I wouldn't mind. If that's what dying is like, I wouldn't mind that at all.
Author: Gayle Forman,  If I Stay

Quote: I want to write because I have the urge to excel in one medium of translation and expression of life. I can't be satisfied with the colossal job of merely living. Oh, no, I must order life in sonnets and sestinas and provide a verbal reflector for my 60-watt lighted head.
Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

Quote: I thought: pity the poor in spirit who know neither the enchantment nor the beauty of language.
Author: Muriel Barbery,  The Elegance of the Hedgehog

Quote: Keep your feet on the ground, but let your heart soar as high as it will. Refuse to be average or to surrender to the chill of your spiritual environment.
Author: Arthur Helps

Quote: No experience is a cause of success or failure. We do not suffer from the shock of our experiences, so-called trauma - but we make out of them just what suits our purposes.
Author: Alfred Adler

Quote: If achieving the Hong Kong dream becomes a vanishing hope, then our society will suffer. What would the Hong Kong dream be? It's no different from the American dream, whereby an everyday man on the street who works hard would be able to make good savings and use those savings as equity for their future small business.
Author: Richard Li

Quote: Communication is a skill that you can learn. It's like riding a bicycle or typing. If you're willing to work at it, you can rapidly improve the quality of evry part of your life.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: I'm satisfied with making true choices and finding the woman I love, Angie, and building a family that I love so much.
Author: Brad Pitt

Quote: There's humor in everything. There's gotta be humor in everything.
Author: Amy Sedaris

Quote: I have discovered the art of deceiving diplomats. I tell them the truth and they never believe me.
Author: Camillo di Cavour

Quote: In the Book of Life, The answers aren't in the back.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: When someone sees the same people every day, as had happened with him at the seminary, they wind up becoming a part of that person's life. And then they want the person to change. If someone isn't what others want them to be, the others become angry. Everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, but none about his or her own.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

Quote: I had fun last night,"I told Patch, flicking off my chin strap and handing over my helmet. "I'm officially on love with your sheets.""That the only thing you're in love with?""Nope. Your mattress, too."Some smile crept into Patch's eyes. "My bed's an open invitation.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,  Silence

Quote: The truth was, he now belonged only to my past, and it was time I begin to accept it, as much as it hurt to do so.
Author: Tammara Webber,  Easy

Quote: L'amor che move il sole e l'altre stelle.
Author: Dante Alighieri,  The Divine Comedy

Quote: Well my gun fires seven different shades of shit, so what's your favorite color, punk?
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: You can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards. So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: Graffiti is one of the few tools you have if you have almost nothing. And even if you don't come up with a picture to cure world poverty you can make someone smile while they're having a piss.
Author: Banksy,  Banging Your Head Against a Brick Wall

Quote: God is subtle but he is not malicious.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Henry turned as if to dart out of the room, then swung around and stared at them, a look of confusion passing over his freckled face, as if he had only now had cause to wonder why Will, Tessa, and Jem might be crouching together in a mostly disused storage room. "What are you three doing in here, anyway?"Will tilted his head to the side and smiled at Henry. "Charades,"he said. "Massive game.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel

Quote: What you want most you push away from you.You want more than you care to admit.
Author: Tarjei Vesaas,  The Bridges

Quote: But I couldn't help myself, couldn't help the way I felt as I recalled the bliss and rush of a vampire's bite.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Vampire Academy

Quote: Semua perjalanan hidup adalah sinema. Bahkan lebih mengerikan. Darah adalah darah, dan tangis adalah tangis. Tak ada pemeran pengganti yang akan menanggung sakitmu.
Author: Dee Lestari,  Supernova: Ksatria, Puteri, dan Bintang Jatuh

Quote: Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you, knowing that every step forward is a step toward achieving something bigger and better than your current situation.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Art is the reason I get up in the morning, but the definition ends there. It doesn't seem fair that I'm living for something I can't even define.
Author: Ani DiFranco

Quote: And if you couldn't be loved, the next best thing was to be let alone.
Author: L.M. Montgomery

Quote: Five minutes are enough to dream a whole life, that is how relative time is.
Author: Mario Benedetti

Quote: Tucker: Why would you tell me now if it's against the rules?Clara: Because I love you.
Author: Cynthia Hand,  Unearthly

Quote: You should never assume. You know what happens when you assume. You make an ass out of you and me because that's how it's spelled.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quote: One mistake does not have to rule a person's entire life.
Author: Joyce Meyer,  Any Minute

Quote: You know what i can't understand? You have all these people telling you all the time how great you are, smart and funny and talented and all that, i mean endlessly, i've been telling you for years. So why don't you believe it? why do you think people say that stuff, Em? Do you think it's a conspiracy, people secretly ganging up to be nice about you?
Author: David Nicholls,  One Day

Quote: When you're the only sane person, you look like the only insane person.
Author: Criss Jami,  Diotima, Battery, Electric Personality

Quote: The small wisdom is like water in a glass:clear, transparent, pure.The great wisdom is like the water in the sea:dark, mysterious, impenetrable.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Is there a difference between happiness and inner peace? Yes. Happiness depends on conditions being perceived as positive; inner peace does not.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: End? No, the journey doesn't end here. Death is just another path, one that we all must take. The grey rain-curtain of this world rolls back, and all turns to silver glass, and then you see it.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Quote: Looks like what drives me crazyDon't have no effect on you--But I'm gonna keep on at itTill it drives you crazy, too.
Author: Langston Hughes,  Selected Poems

Quote: some people fall in love over and over again while some people can only do it once.
Author: Ann Brashares,  Forever in Blue: The Fourth Summer of the Sisterhood

Quote: Where you go, I shall go; where you die, I shall die, and there will I be buried.
Author: Rosamund Hodge,  Cruel Beauty

Quote: Someone once wrote that a novel should deliver a series of small astonishments. I get the same thing spending an hour with you.
Author: E. Lockhart,  We Were Liars

Quote: Your sacred space is where you can find yourself over and over again.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: Sometimes I lie awake at night and I ask, "Why me?", then a voice answers "Nothing personal, your name just happened to come up.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: Life is wasted on the living.
Author: Douglas Adams,  The Restaurant at the End of the Universe

Quote: We're being lead by an idiot with a crayon.
Author: Eoin Colfer,  The Eternity Code

Quote: My heart might be bruised, but it will recover and become capable of seeing beauty of life once more. It's happened before, it will happen again, I'm sure. When someone leaves, it's because someone else is about to arrive--I'll find love again.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Zahir

Quote: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes, but in liking what one does.
Author: J.M. Barrie

Quote: The funny thing about writing is that whether you're doing well or doing it poorly, it looks the exact same. That's actually one of the main ways that writing is different from ballet dancing.
Author: John Green

Quote: One should use common words to say uncommon things
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: The mind can calculate, but the spirit yearns, and the heart knows what the heart knows
Author: Stephen King

Quote: I am terrified by this dark thing that sleeps in me.
Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Collected Poems

Quote: I am nothing more than the consequence of catastrophe.
Author: Tahereh Mafi,  Unravel Me

Quote: Your truest friends are the ones who will stand by you in your darkest moments--because they're willing to brave the shadows with you--and in your greatest moments--because they're not afraid to let you shine.
Author: Nicole Yatsonsky

Quote: twice I have lived forever in a smile
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: A woman should soften but not weaken a man.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: I threw myself into that fire, threw myself into it, into him, and let myself burn.
Author: Sarah J. Maas,  A Court of Thorns and Roses

Quote: You can love a person dear to you with a human love, but an enemy can only be loved with divine love.
Author: Leo Tolstoy,  War and Peace

Quote: To write well, express yourself like the common people, but think like a wise man.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Love of music, of sunsets and sea; a liking for the same kind of people; political opinions that are not radically divergent; a similar stance as we look at the stars and think of the marvelous strangeness of the universe - these are what build a marriage. And it is never to be taken for granted.
Author: Madeleine L'Engle,  Two-Part Invention: The Story of a Marriage

Quote: You cannot hope to sweep someone else away by the force of your writing until it has been done to you.
Author: Stephen King,  On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft

Quote: All that is important is this one moment in movement. Make the moment important, vital, and worth living. Do not let it slip away unnoticed and unused.
Author: Martha Graham

Quote: If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning: just as, if there were no light in the universe and therefore no creatures with eyes, we should never know it was dark. Dark would be without meaning.
Author: C.S. Lewis,  Mere Christianity

Quote: I both made the knife-fighting team, and I got cut. If only love were so easy to understand.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: When he died, all things soft and beautiful and bright would be buried with him.
Author: Madeline Miller,  The Song of Achilles

Quote: Who is John Galt?
Author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged

Quote: The truth may be puzzling. It may take some work to grapple with. It may be counterintuitive. It may contradict deeply held prejudices. It may not be consonant with what we desperately want to be true. But our preferences do not determine what's true.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: It's just the most amazing thing to love a dog, isn't it? It makes our relationships with people seem as boring as a bowl of oatmeal.
Author: John Grogan,  Marley and Me: Life and Love With the World's Worst Dog

Quote: Writing simply means no dependent clauses, no dangling things, no flashbacks, and keeping the subject near the predicate. We throw in as many fresh words we can get away with. Simple, short sentences don't always work. You have to do tricks with pacing, alternate long sentences with short, to keep it vital and alive.... Virtually every page is a cliffhanger--you've got to force them to turn it."~
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Instruction does much, but encouragement everything."(Letter to A.F. Oeser, Nov. 9, 1768)
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe,  Early and Miscellaneous Letters of J. W. Goethe: Including Letters to His Mother. With Notes and a Short Biography

Quote: Man never made any material as resilient as the human spirit.
Author: Bernard Williams

Quote: I believe any success in life is made by going into an area with a blind, furious optimism.
Author: Sylvester Stallone

Quote: My friends are my estate.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: If you die you're completely happy and your soul somewhere lives on. I'm not afraid of dying. Total peace after death, becoming someone else is the best hope I've got.
Author: Kurt Cobain

Quote: People should be allowed to marry, and gay marriage should be out there. If a man or a woman has a good partner and they love each other with their heart and soul, let them marry. I am very much for gay marriage.
Author: Pierce Brosnan

Quote: Women respond to comfort and a sense of humor. I was always able to make them laugh, so that helps a lot.
Author: Peter Dinklage

Quote: Most painting in the European tradition was painting the mask. Modern art rejected all that. Our subject matter was the person behind the mask.
Author: Robert Motherwell

Quote: I have learned, that the person I have to ask for forgiveness from the most is: myself. You must love yourself. You have to forgive yourself, everyday, whenever you remember a shortcoming, a flaw, you have to tell yourself "That's just fine". You have to forgive yourself so much, until you don't even see those things anymore. Because that's what love is like.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: I love the Lord, for he heard my voice; he heard my cry for mercy. Because he turned his ear to me, I will call on him as long as I live. (Psalms 116:1-2 NIV)
Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: New International Version

Quote: Believe in yourself and there will come a day when others will have no choice but to believe with you.
Author: Cynthia Kersey

Quote: We all pay for life with death, so everything in between should be free.
Author: Bill Hicks

Quote: I love being a writer. What I can't stand is the paperwork.
Author: Peter De Vries

Quote: I want to be happy and sad at the same time. Yeah, I know it sounds sappy.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want Two apply for a job at our country's largest funeral home, and then wear a suit and noose to the job interview.

Quote: Our biggest regrets are not for the things we have done but for the things we haven't done
Author: Chad Michael Murray

Quote: Life is problems. Living is solving problems.
Author: Raymond E. Feist,  Silverthorn

Quote: My expectations were reduced to zero when I was 21. Everything since then has been a bonus."[The Science of Second-Guessing (New York Times Magazine Interview, December 12, 2004)]
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: Yes, I understand why things had to happen this way. I understand his reason for causing me pain. But mere understanding does not chase away the hurt. It does not call upon the sun when dark clouds have loomed over me. Let the rain come then if it must come! And let it wash away the dust that hurt my eyes!
Author: Jocelyn Soriano,  Mend My Broken Heart

Quote: Love in action is a harsh and dreadful thing compared to love in dreams.
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  The Brothers Karamazov

Quote: My point is, life is about balance. The good and the bad. The highs and the lows. The pina and the colada.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres,  Seriously... I'm Kidding

Quote: God knows I had not wanted to fall in love with her. I had not wanted to fall in love with any one. But God knows I had and I lay on the bed in the room of the hospital in Milan and all sorts of things went through my head but I felt wonderful...
Author: Ernest Hemingway,  A Farewell to Arms

Quote: When another blames you or hates you, or people voice similar criticisms, go to their souls, penetrate inside and see what sort of people they are. You will realize that there is no need to be racked with anxiety that they should hold any particular opinion about you.
Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations

Quote: An individual has not started living until he can rise above the narrow confines of his individualistic concerns to the broader concerns of all humanity.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: A well-read woman is a dangerous creature.
Author: Lisa Kleypas,  A Wallflower Christmas

Quote: Now I understand that one of the important reasons for going to college and getting an education is to learn that the things you've believed in all your life aren't true, and that nothing is what it appears to be.
Author: Daniel Keyes,  Flowers for Algernon

Quote: To know that you do not know is the best.To think you know when you do not is a disease.Recognizing this disease as a disease is to be free of it.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: PHOSPHORESCENCE. Now there's a word to lift your hat to... to find that phosphorescence, that light within, that's the genius behind poetry.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: I used to spend so much time reacting and responding to everyone else that my life had no direction. Other people's lives, problems, and wants set the course for my life. Once I realized it was okay for me to think about and identify what I wanted, remarkable things began to take place in my life.
Author: Melody Beattie,  The Language of Letting Go: Daily Meditations on Codependency

Quote: Let us embrace each other like we have the arms of two chairs. Let us dance like our legs are those of a table. We should do dinner sometime.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: She called it a slap, but I called it a high-five to my face. Love is so encouraging!
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: Some people try to change the world one life at a time. Others try to change the world one death at a time. And I try to change the world one bucket full of dirt at a time.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: In the first place God made idiots. This was for practice. Then he made school boards.
Author: Mark Twain,  Following the Equator: A Journey Around the World

Quote: molesting the vampire while he's too weak to fight back, iz? jace asked. i'm pretty sure that violates at least one of the accords.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Glass

Quote: Nothing is yet in its true form.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: It is always fatal to have music or poetry interrupted.
Author: George Eliot,  Middlemarch

Quote: You have lost your reason and taken the wrong path. You have taken lies for truth, and hideousness for beauty. You would marvel if, owing to strange events of some sorts, frogs and lizards suddenly grew on apple and orange trees instead of fruit, or if roses began to smell like a sweating horse; so I marvel at you who exchange heaven for earth. I don't want to understand you.
Author: Anton Chekhov

Quote: Life is not complex. We are complex. Life is simple, and the simple thing is the right thing.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: What is love? two souls and one flesh; friendship? two bodies and one soul.
Author: Joseph Roux

Quote: We never know which lives we influence, or when, or why.
Author: Stephen King,  11/22/63

Quote: But why think about that when all the golden lands ahead of you and all kinds of unforseen events wait lurking to surprise you and make you glad you're alive to see?
Author: Jack Kerouac,  On the Road

Quote: You have to love dancing to stick to it. It gives you nothing back, no manuscripts to store away, no paintings to show on walls and maybe hang in museums, no poems to be printed and sold, nothing but that single fleeting moment when you feel alive.
Author: Merce Cunningham

Quote: You ask, what is our aim? I can answer in one word. It is victory, victory at all costs, victory in spite of all terror, victory, however long and hard the road may be; for without victory, there is no survival.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: Sometimes I think I must have a Guardian Idiot. A little invisible spirit just behind my shoulder, looking out for me...only he's an imbecile.
Author: Spider Robinson,  Off the Wall at Callahan's

Quote: Because introverts are typically good listeners and, at least, have the appearance of calmness, we are attractive to emotionally needy people. Introverts, gratified that other people are initiating with them, can easily get caught in these exhausting and unsatisfying relationships.
Author: Adam S. McHugh

Quote: Literature is strewn with the wreckage of those who have minded beyond reason the opinion of others.
Author: Virginia Woolf,  A Room of One's Own

Quote: Normal is an illusion. What is normal for the spider is chaos for the fly.
Author: Charles Addams

Quote: I didn't know love could leave the lights on all the time.
Author: Rainbow Rowell,  Attachments

Quote: You are protected, in short, by your ability to love!
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: I realize all guys have thorns. But I am a rose, and she chose a cactus over me. I wish her luck with her dry, desert-like existence with him.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: Do you remember all of your audiences?"Marco asks. "Not all of them,"Celia says. "But I remember the people who look at me the way you do.""What way might that be?""As though they cannot decide if they are afraid of me or they want to kiss me.""I am not afraid of you,"Marco says.
Author: Erin Morgenstern,  The Night Circus

Quote: Can't you just like a girl who likes you back?''None of them likes me back. I may as well like the one I really want.
Author: Rainbow Rowell,  Eleanor & Park

Quote: Love is the most powerful force in the world. That love can do anything.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Fallen Angels

Quote: Love now, not later. Also, love later.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: I welcome questions. I hate assumptions.
Author: Red Haircrow

Quote: Well you seemed too busy to call him a prat and I thought someone should.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Quote: Whatever you think, be sure it is what you think; whatever you want, be sure that is what you want; whatever you feel, be sure that is what you feel.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: Hello Dad! It is now three in the morning. Do you know where I am?
Author: Bill Watterson,  The Essential Calvin And Hobbes

Quote: The reason we all like to think so well of others is that we are all afraid for ourselves. The basis of optimism is sheer terror.
Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray

Quote: A primary object should be the education of our youth in the science of government. In a republic, what species of knowledge can be equally important? And what duty more pressing than communicating it to those who are to be the future guardians of the liberties of the country?
Author: George Washington

Quote: I even love the smell of books.
Author: Adriana Trigiani

Quote: We're all strangers connected by what we reveal, what we share, what we take away--our stories. I guess that's what I love about books--they are thin strands of humanity that tether us to one another for a small bit of time, that make us feel less alone or even more comfortable with our aloneness, if need be.
Author: Libba Bray

Quote: I love those who yearn for the impossible.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: You really have to work hard and apply yourself and by applying yourself and working hard and being diligent, you can achieve success.
Author: Julie Benz

Quote: A friend is, as it were, a second self.
Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

Quote: Hope fills the holes of my frustration in my heart.
Author: Emanuel Cleaver

Quote: As I get older, my sense of humor is my biggest asset.
Author: David Alan Grier

Quote: One must do the same subject over again ten times, a hundred times. In art nothing must resemble an accident, not even movement.
Author: Edgar Degas

Quote: All sacrifice and suffering is redemptive. It is used to either teach the individual or to help others. Nothing is by chance.
Author: A.J. Russell

Quote: This is what I know. Don't settle for 40, 50, or even 80 percent. A relationship-it shouldn't be too small or too tight or even a little scratchy. It shouldn't take up space in your closet out of guilty conscience or convenience or a moment of desire. Do you hear me? It shold be perfect for you. It should be lasting. Wait. wait for 100 percent.
Author: Deb Caletti,  The Secret Life of Prince Charming

Quote: Hearts Live By Being Wounded
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: If you listen to the wind very carefully, you'll be able to hear me whisper my love for you.
Author: Andrew Davidson

Quote: Why, darling, I don't live at all when I'm not with you.
Author: Ernest Hemingway,  A Farewell to Arms

Quote: Stay hungry, stay young, stay foolish, stay curious, and above all, stay humble because just when you think you got all the answers, is the moment when some bitter twist of fate in the universe will remind you that you very much don't.
Author: Tom Hiddleston

Quote: a wind has blown the rain away & the sky away & all the leaves away, & the trees stand. i think i, too, have known autumn too long.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: I like to spoon after I fork.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want

Quote: The essence of independence has been to think and act according to standards from within, not without: to follow one's own path, not that of the crowd.
Author: Nicholas Tharcher,  Rebels and Devils: The Psychology of Liberation

Quote: Over time, any deception destroys intimacy, and without intimacy couples cannot have true and lasting love.
Author: Bonnie Eaker Weil,  Financial Infidelity: Seven Steps to Conquering the #1 Relationship Wrecker

Quote: At that moment I had no mind to change, or not change, or throw against the nearest wall.
Author: James Patterson

Quote: There is nothing more beautiful than someone who goes out of their way to make life beautiful for others.
Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass

Quote: Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.
Author: Roberto Bolaño,  2666

Quote: Science flies you to the moon. Religion flies you into buildings.
Author: Victor J. Stenger

Quote: As long as I am breathing, in my eyes, I am just beginning.
Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

Quote: Love is hard to find, hard to keep, and hard to forget.
Author: Alysha Speer

Quote: If love is blind, then maybe a blind person that loves has a greater understanding of it.
Author: Criss Jami,  Salomé: In Every Inch In Every Mile

Quote: If something doesn't work exactly right, or maybe needs some special treatment, you don't just throw it away. Everything can't be fully operational all the time. Sometimes, we need to have the patience to give something the little nudge it needs.
Author: Sarah Dessen,  Keeping the Moon

Quote: I consider it an extremely dangerous doctrine, because the more likely we are to assume that the solution comes from the outside, the less likely we are to solve our problems ourselves.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Before we go, I gotta know: If mind-reading abilities are real, there's something else I wondered if fiction got right about vampires-""Ask me if I sparkle and I'll kill you where you stand,"Bones cut him off with utmost seriousness.
Author: Jeaniene Frost,  This Side of the Grave

Quote: It takes a huge effort to free yourself from memory
Author: Paulo Coelho,  Aleph

Quote: They heard the click of the mail slot and flop of letters on the doormat. "Get the mail, Dudley,"said Uncle Vernon from behind his paper. "Make Harry get it.""Get the mail, Harry.""Make Dudley get it.""Poke him with your Smelting stick, Dudley.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

Quote: It's partly true, too, but it isn't all true. People always think something's all true.
Author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye

Quote: There will always be someone willing to hurt you, put you down, gossip about you, belittle your accomplishments and judge your soul. It is a fact that we all must face. However, if you realize that God is a best friend that stands beside you when others cast stones you will never be afraid, never feel worthless and never feel alone.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: Life is both sad and solemn. We are led into a wonderful world, we meet one another here, greet each other - and wander together for a brief moment. Then we lose each other and disappear as suddenly and unreasonably as we arrived.
Author: Jostein Gaarder,  Sophie's World

Quote: It is the tale, not he who tells it.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: I hate quotations. Tell me what you know.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Gods prefer simple, vicious games, where you Do Not Achieve Transcendence but Go Straight To Oblivion; a key to the understanding of all religion is that a god's idea of amusement is Snakes and Ladders with greased rungs.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Wyrd Sisters

Quote: A young man who wishes to remain a sound atheist cannot be too careful of his reading.
Author: C.S. Lewis,  Surprised by Joy: The Shape of My Early Life

Quote: We can only be said to be alive in those moments when our hearts are conscious of our treasures.
Author: Thornton Wilder

Quote: Always forgive, but never forget, else you will be a prisoner of your own hatred, and doomed to repeat your mistakes forever.
Author: Wil Zeus,  Sun Beyond the Clouds

Quote: One time I saw a tiny Joshua tree sapling growing not too far from the old tree. I wanted to dig it up and replant it near our house. I told Mom that I would protect it from the wind and water it every day so that it could grow nice and tall and straight. Mom frowned at me. "You'd be destroying what makes it special,"she said. "It's the Joshua tree's struggle that gives it its beauty.
Author: Jeannette Walls,  The Glass Castle

Quote: Love is not blind; that is the last thing that it is. Love is bound; and the more it is bound the less it is blind.
Author: G.K. Chesterton,  Orthodoxy

Quote: Sometimes you know you've got a chance with a girl because she wants to fight with you. If the world wasn't so messed up, it wouldn't be like that. If the world was normal, a girl being nice to you would be a good sign, but in the real world, it isn't.
Author: Nick Hornby

Quote: You might be looking for reasons but there are no reasons.
Author: Nina LaCour,  Hold Still

Quote: Our individuality is all, all, that we have. There are those who barter it for security, those who repress it for what they believe is the betterment of the whole society, but blessed in the twinkle of the morning star is the one who nurtures it and rides it in, in grace and love and wit, from peculiar station to peculiar station along life's bittersweet route.
Author: Tom Robbins,  Jitterbug Perfume

Quote: Going back to something is harder than you think.
Author: Mitch Albom,  For One More Day

Quote: If you reveal your secrets to the wind,you should not blame the wind forrevealing them to the trees.
Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Wanderer

Quote: I am the captain of my soul.
Author: Nelson Mandela

Quote: Harry and Hermione are very platonic friends. But I won't answer for anyone else, nudge-nudge wink-wink!
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Pietrisycamollaviadelrechiotemexity.
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: Until an hour before the Devil fell, God thought him beautiful in Heaven.
Author: Arthur Miller,  The Crucible

Quote: Lonely people tend, rather, to be lonely because they decline to bear the psychic costs of being around other humans. They are allergic to people. People affect them too strongly.
Author: David Foster Wallace,  A Supposedly Fun Thing I'll Never Do Again: Essays and Arguments

Quote: I suppose that one reason I have always detested religion is its sly tendency to insinuate the idea that the universe is designed with 'you' in mind or, even worse, that there is a divine plan into which one fits whether one knows it or not. This kind of modesty is too arrogant for me.
Author: Christopher Hitchens,  Hitch-22: A Memoir

Quote: You are what you write.
Author: Helvy Tiana Rosa,  Risalah Cinta

Quote: The person who deserves most pity is a lonesome one on a rainy day who doesn't know how to read.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: She did not believe he could have really gone, because for her, to leave the person you loved was impossible.
Author: Jodi Lynn Anderson,  Tiger Lily

Quote: Physical love is unthinkable without violence.
Author: Milan Kundera,  The Unbearable Lightness of Being

Quote: In love, one and one are one.
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: Everyone has his own reality in which, if one is not too cautious, timid or frightened, one swims. This is the only reality there is.
Author: Henry Miller,  Stand Still Like the Hummingbird

Quote: The train is roaring toward you and the villain is twirling his moustache and you're fussing that he's tied you to the tracks with the wrong kind of rope.
Author: Robin McKinley,  Sunshine

Quote: With your head full of brains and your shoes full of feet, you're too smart to go down any not-so-good street.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: If they tell you that she died of sleeping pills you must know that she died of a wasting grief, of a slow bleeding at the soul.
Author: Clifford Odets

Quote: Deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Why does one begin to write? Because she feels misunderstood, I guess. Because it never comes out clearly enough when she tries to speak. Because she wants to rephrase the world, to take it in and give it back again differently, so that everything is used and nothing is lost. Because it's something to do to pass the time until she is old enough to experience the things she writes about.
Author: Nicole Krauss

Quote: Learning how to be still, to really be still and let life happen - that stillness becomes a radiance.
Author: Morgan Freeman

Quote: There is simply no substitute for hard work when it comes to achieving success.
Author: Heather Bresch

Quote: A friend in power is a friend lost.
Author: Henry Adams

Quote: My friends, love is better than anger. Hope is better than fear. Optimism is better than despair. So let us be loving, hopeful and optimistic. And we'll change the world.
Author: Jack Layton

Quote: Slow down and enjoy life. It's not only the scenery you miss by going to fast - you also miss the sense of where you are going and why.
Author: Eddie Cantor

Quote: The essence of Hinduism is the same essence of all true religions: Bhakti or pure love for God and genuine compassion for all beings.
Author: Radhanath Swami

Quote: The humor section is the last place an author wants to be. They put your stuff next to collections of Cathy cartoons.
Author: David Sedaris

Quote: I used language because I wanted to offer content that people - not necessarily art people - could understand.
Author: Jenny Holzer

Quote: Progress just means bad things happen faster.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Witches Abroad

Quote: Without music, life would be a blank to me.
Author: Jane Austen,  Emma

Quote: We met less than a week ago and in that time I've done nothing but lie and cheat and betray you. I know. But if you give me a chance...all I want is to protect you. To be near you. For as long as I'm able.
Author: Marissa Meyer,  Scarlet

Quote: Nice dress. Take it off.
Author: Janet Evanovich

Quote: it is impossible to build one's own happiness on the unhappiness of others. This perspective is at the heart of Buddhist teachings.
Author: Daisaku Ikeda

Quote: Your stepfather? I'd like to meet him."Oh no... why?"I'm not sure that's a good idea."Christian unlocks the door, his mouth in a grim line."Are you ashamed of me?""No!"It's my turn to sound exasperated. "Introduce you to my dad as what? 'This is the man who deflowered me and wants to start a BDSM relationship'. You're not wearing running shoes.
Author: E.L. James,  Fifty Shades of Grey

Quote: The meeting was like a war council with donuts. Then again, back at Camp Half-Blood they used to have their most serious discussions around the Ping-Pong table in the rec room with crackers and Cheez Whiz, so Percy felt right at home.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Mark of Athena

Quote: God creates out of nothing. Wonderful you say. Yes, to be sure, but he does what is still more wonderful: he makes saints out of sinners.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard,  The Journals of Kierkegaard

Quote: If the stars should appear one night in a thousand years, how would men believe and adore; and preserve for many generations the remembrance of the city of God which had been shown! But every night come out these envoys of beauty, and light the universe with their admonishing smile.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Nature and Selected Essays

Quote: Coaching 101: First you build the team, and then you build the torture chamber for underperformers.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Has No Title

Quote: Don't let yourself die without knowing the wonder of fucking with love.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

Quote: If I had a camera,' I said, 'I'd take a picture of you every day. That way I'd remember how you looked every single day of your life.
Author: Nicole Krauss

Quote: I love you. It hurts more than anything ever has, but I do. So don't you dare tell me I don't. Don't you ever say it again!
Author: Jenny Downham,  Before I Die

Quote: Life is like a beautiful melody, only the lyrics are messed up.
Author: Hans Christian Andersen

Quote: Nelly, I am Heathcliff - he's always, always in my mind - not as a pleasure, any more then I am always a pleasure to myself - but, as my own being.
Author: Emily Brontë,  Wuthering Heights

Quote: I love you. I love you. I send this message through my fingers and into his, up his arm and into his heart. Hear me. I love you. And I'm sorry to leave you.
Author: Jenny Downham,  Before I Die

Quote: My destination is no longer a place, rather a new way of seeing.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quote: I never found beauty in longing for the impossible and never found the possible to be beyond my reach.
Author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged

Quote: Sometimes when it looks like I'm deep in thought I'm just trying not to have a conversation with people.
Author: Pete Wentz

Quote: You're thinking I'm one of those wise-ass California vegetarians who is going to tell you that eating a few strips of bacon is bad for your health. I'm not. I say its a free country and you should be able to kill yourself at any rate you choose, as long as your cold dead body is not blocking my driveway.
Author: Scott Adams

Quote: Isabelle snorted, "All the boys are gay. In this truck, anyway. Well, not you, Simon.""You noticed,"said Simon. "I think of myself as a freewheeling bisexual,"added Magnus. "Please never say those words in front of my parents,"said Alec.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Lost Souls

Quote: The quickest way to rectify that mistake (choosing the wrong person) is by learning from that, moving on, and choosing much more wisely in the future.
Author: Greg Behrendt,  He's Just Not That Into You: The No-Excuses Truth to Understanding Guys

Quote: There is no rule on how to write. Sometimes it comes easily and perfectly; sometimes it's like drilling rock and then blasting it out with charges.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: I never exactly made a book. It's rather like taking dictation. I was given things to say.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Of all things, I liked books best.
Author: Nikola Tesla

Quote: A book is more than a verbal structure or series of verbal structures; it is the dialogue it establishes with its reader and the intonation it imposes upon his voice and the changing and durable images it leaves in his memory. A book is not an isolated being: it is a relationship, an axis of innumerable relationships.
Author: Jorge Luis Borges

Quote: Live fast. Die young. Be wild. Have fun.
Author: Lana Del Rey

Quote: There comes a time in your life when you have to choose to turn the page, write another book or simply close it.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: Let's be reasonable and add an eighth day to the week that is devoted exclusively to reading.
Author: Lena Dunham

Quote: Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die.
Author: Mel Brooks

Quote: I'm a godmother, that's a great thing to be, a godmother. She calls me god for short, that's cute, I taught her that.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quote: I wondered how many people there were in the world who suffered, and continued to suffer, because they could not break out from their own web of shyness and reserve, and in their blindness and folly built up a great distorted wall in front of them that hid the truth.
Author: Daphne du Maurier,  Rebecca

Quote: A man without words is a man without thought.
Author: John Steinbeck,  East of Eden

Quote: It takes a great man to be a good listener.
Author: Calvin Coolidge

Quote: [I]t's not just the books under fire now that worry me. It is the books that will never be written. The books that will never be read. And all due to the fear of censorship. As always, young readers will be the real losers.
Author: Judy Blume

Quote: I am your moon and your moonlight tooI am your flower garden and your water tooI have come all this way, eager for youWithout shoes or shawlI want you to laughTo kill all your worriesTo love youTo nourish you.
Author: Rumi

Quote: There are only two reasons why you leave someone you're still in love with - either it's the right thing to do, or it's the only thing to do.
Author: Tiffany Reisz,  The Siren

Quote: So,"he called to her back, "Just out of curiosity, you know, purely conversation and all, at what age will you be entertaining offers of marriage?""You think it'll be so easy?"she called back over her shoulder. "No way. There will be tasks. Like in a fairy tale.""Sounds dangerous.""Very, so think twice.""No need,"he said. "You're worth it.
Author: Laini Taylor,  Days of Blood & Starlight

Quote: I have loved to the point of madness; that which is called madness, that which to me, is the only sensible way to love.
Author: Francois Sagon

Quote: Happiness, you see, its just an illusion of Fate, a heavenly sleight of hand designed to make you believe in fairy tales. But there's no happily ever after. You'll only find happy endings in books. Some books.
Author: Ellen Hopkins

Quote: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
Author: Sam Levenson

Quote: I give myself a good cry if I need it. But then I concentrate on the good things still in my life. I don't allow myself any more self-pity than that. A little each every morning, a few tears, and that's all.
Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie

Quote: Just wait until he figures out I shut him out of his slut hut.
Author: Ilona Andrews,  Magic Bleeds

Quote: Even the finest sword plunged into salt water will eventually rust.
Author: Sun Tzu

Quote: Don't ever call me mad, Mycroft. I'm not mad. I'm just ... well, differently moraled, that's all.
Author: Jasper Fforde,  The Eyre Affair

Quote: We are all wonderful, beautiful wrecks. That's what connects us--that we're all broken, all beautifully imperfect.
Author: Emilio Estevez

Quote: Vampires. They wrote the book on possessive.
Author: Charlaine Harris,  Dead to the World

Quote: All right,"Clara said. "We have our swordsman, so let's get moving. Brigan, could you attempt, at least, to make yourself presentable? I know this is a war, but the rest of us are trying to pretend it's a party.
Author: Kristin Cashore,  Fire

Quote: When you're screwing up and nobody says anything to you anymore, that means they've given up on you.
Author: Randy Pausch

Quote: Whoever said the pen is mightier than the sword obviously never encountered automatic weapons.
Author: Douglas MacArthur

Quote: The true measure of success is how many times you can bounce back from failure.
Author: Stephen Richards

Quote: I didn't want it to be one good memory that led to a lot of bad ones. I wanted it to stay what it was, one amazing moment, something that was strong and sweet enough to stand on its own. Something I could remember without any pain. - Kate
Author: Elizabeth Scott,  Perfect You

Quote: Read a thousand books, and your words will flow like a river.
Author: Lisa See,  Snow Flower and the Secret Fan

Quote: The story is always better than your ability to write it.
Author: Robin McKinley

Quote: If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music which he hears, however measured or far away.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: You cannot allow your desire to be a winner to be diminished by achieving success before and I believe there is room for improvement in every sportsman.
Author: Lionel Messi

Quote: How delightful to find a friend in everyone.
Author: Joseph Brodsky

Quote: Don't give up. Don't lose hope. Don't sell out.
Author: Christopher Reeve

Quote: The terrorists thought they would change my aims and stop my ambitions, but nothing changed in my life except this: weakness, fear and hopelessness died. Strength, power and courage were born.
Author: Malala Yousafzai

Quote: If I have the power to post 'Happy Birthday' on someone's Facebook page and make them feel really good, it feels really good to make other people feel really good. I love it. I'm a huge Facebook and Twitter person. And I love talking to my fans. It's fun.
Author: Rebecca Mader

Quote: I think a lot of humor is about distracting yourself. Pretend you're not trying to make it funny. Because for some reason the effort to be funny smells like sulphur in our culture.
Author: Sloane Crosley

Quote: Copy, art, and typography should be seen as a living entity; each element integrally related, in harmony with the whole, and essential to the execution of an idea.
Author: Paul Rand

Quote: Absence is to love what wind is to fire; it extinguishes the small, it inflames the great.
Author: Roger de Bussy-Rabutin

Quote: Kung matatakot kang harapin ang totoo at sabihin ang talagang nararamdaman mo dahil baka masaktan ka, isa lang ibig sabihin noon: ipinagkait mo na sa sarili mo ang pagiging masaya at kinarir mo ang magpakatanga.
Author: Bob Ong

Quote: I thought it sounded a bit like Percy singing... maybe you've got to attack him while he's in the shower, Harry.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Quote: I would never want to be a member of a group whose symbol was a man nailed to two pieces of wood.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Some people come into our lives and leave footprints on our hearts and we are never ever the same.
Author: Flavia Weedn

Quote: What has he found who has lost God?And what has he lost who has found God?
Author: Ibn 'Ata' Allah Al-Iskandari

Quote: Me: On time. Love: Late. Death: Early. Seriously, why are you late?
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: I like being the girl nobody can have.
Author: Miley Cyrus

Quote: Ever since time began, people have recognized their true Love by the light in their eyes.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: and when all the wars are over, a butterfly will still be beautiful.
Author: Ruskin Bond,  Scenes from a Writer's Life

Quote: The first rule is to keep an untroubled spirit. The second is to look things in the face and know them for what they are.
Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations

Quote: Hey, our hair's the same color,"I said, eying us side by side in the mirror."Sure is, girlfriend."Eric grinned at me.
Author: Charlaine Harris,  Living Dead in Dallas

Quote: Sweater, n. Garment worn by child when its mother is feeling chilly.
Author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

Quote: To be stupid, and selfish, and to have good health are the three requirements for happiness - though if stupidity is lacking, the others are useless.
Author: Julian Barnes,  Flaubert's Parrot

Quote: I can calculate the motion of heavenly bodies but not the madness of people.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quote: If a man can possess a woman sexually -really possess- he won't need to control her ideas, her opinions, her clothes, her friends, even her other lovers.
Author: Toni Bentley

Quote: She was the third beer. Not the first one, which the throat receives with almost tearful gratitude; nor the second, that confirms and extends the pleasure of the first. But the third, the one you drink because it's there, because it can't hurt, and because what difference does it make?
Author: Toni Morrison,  Song of Solomon

Quote: Writing is not necessarily something to be ashamed of, but do it in private and wash your hands afterwards.
Author: Robert A. Heinlein

Quote: Every politician has a promising career. Unfortunately, most of them do not keep those promises.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: Never lend books, for no one ever returns them; the only books I have in my library are books that other folks have lent me.
Author: Anatole France

Quote: Do you know what your problem is? You can't live with the idea that someone might leave.
Author: John Green,  An Abundance of Katherines

Quote: Love demands everything, they say, but my love demands only this: that no matter what happens or how long it takes, you`ll keep faith in me, you`ll remember who we are, and you`ll never feel despair.
Author: Ann Brashares,  My Name Is Memory

Quote: To be loved but not known is comforting but superficial. To be known and not loved is our greatest fear. But to be fully known and truly loved is, well, a lot like being loved by God. It is what we need more than anything. It liberates us from pretense, humbles us out of our self-righteousness, and fortifies us for any difficulty life can throw at us.
Author: Timothy Keller,  The Meaning of Marriage: Facing the Complexities of Commitment with the Wisdom of God

Quote: I think joy and sweetness and affection are a spiritual path. We're here to know God, to love and serve God, and to be blown away by the beauty and miracle of nature. You just have to get rid of so much baggage to be light enough to dance, to sing, to play. You don't have time to carry grudges; you don't have time to cling to the need to be right.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: I always appear smarter when I dress up in my giant nipple costume. I know this because I'll overhear people say things like, 'At least he's not a complete boob.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  It Occurred to Me

Quote: You won't even take your bow? Are you planning to throttle a moose with your bare hands, then?""I've a knife in my boot,"she said, and then wondered, for a moment, if she could throttle a moose with her bare hands.
Author: Kristin Cashore,  Graceling

Quote: [In the Universe it may be that] Primitive life is very common and intelligent life is fairly rare. Some would say it has yet to occur on Earth.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: No one is actually dead until the ripples they cause in the world die away...
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Reaper Man

Quote: Knowledge will bring you the opportunity to make a difference.
Author: Claire Fagin

Quote: The more you are motivated by Love, The more Fearless & Free your action will be.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: Being in love with someone who doesn't even know you exist isn't the worst thing in the world. In fact, it's quite the oppostie. Almost like passing in a term paper that you know sucked, but having that period of time where you haven't gotten your grade back yet -- that kind of exhale where you haven't been rejected, although you pretty much know how it's going to turn out.
Author: Tonya Hurley,  Ghostgirl

Quote: He was too perfect, despite being one of the most imperfect people I knew.
Author: Richelle Mead,  The Indigo Spell

Quote: God turns you from one feeling to another and teaches by means of opposites so that you will have two wings to fly, not one
Author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi

Quote: First you jump off the cliff and build your wings on the way down.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: I've noticed that when people are joking they're usually dead serious, and when they're serious, they're usually pretty funny.
Author: Jim Morrison

Quote: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
Author: Seneca

Quote: A dysfunctional family is any family with more than one person in it.
Author: Mary Karr,  The Liars' Club

Quote: Mary-Lynnette: "You have not read 'Pride and Prejudice'."Ash: "Why not?"Mary-Lynnette: "Because Jane Austen was a human."Ash: "How do you know?"Mary-Lynnette: "Well Jane Austen was a woman, and you're a chauvinist pig."Ash: "Yes, well, that I can't argue.
Author: L.J. Smith

Quote: Either you repeat the same conventional doctrines everybody is saying, or else you say something true, and it will sound like it's from Neptune.
Author: Noam Chomsky

Quote: If you believe what you like in the Gospel, and reject what you don't like, it is not the Gospel you believe, but yourself.
Author: Augustine of Hippo

Quote: [God] will not be used as a convenience. Men or nations who think they can revive the Faith in order to make a good society might just as well think they can use the stairs of heaven as a shortcut to the nearest chemist's shop.
Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Screwtape Letters

Quote: I wonder if rooms in an insane asylum have Do Not Disturb signs for the doors. I should hope not, because knock or no knock, every occupant in those rooms is already disturbed.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Days of Yay are Here! Wake Me Up When They're Over.

Quote: Poetry is a life-cherishing force. For poems are not words, after all, but fires for the cold, ropes let down to the lost, something as necessary as bread in the pockets of the hungry.
Author: Mary Oliver,  A Poetry Handbook

Quote: Always read stuff that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it.
Author: P.J. O'Rourke

Quote: A joke is a very serious thing.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: To be invisible, paint yourself with the direct shade of zero. Leave nothing to chance, by taking nothing with you wherever you go.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: The first stab of love is like a sunset, a blaze of color -- oranges, pearly pinks, vibrant purples...
Author: Anna Godbersen,  The Luxe

Quote: The whole world is divided for me into two parts: one is she, and there is all happiness, hope, light; the other is where she is not, and there is dejection and darkness...
Author: Leo Tolstoy,  War and Peace

Quote: Creo que todos tenemos un poco de esa bella locura que nos mantiene andando cuando todo alrededor es tan insanamente cuerdo.
Author: Julio Cortázar

Quote: The cosmos is within us. We are made of star-stuff. We are a way for the universe to know itself.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: No one ever does live happily ever after, but we leave the children to find that out for themselves.
Author: Stephen King,  Wolves of the Calla

Quote: Are those the only options? Nothing or forever?
Author: Sarah Dessen,  This Lullaby

Quote: What would you do if you weren't afraid?
Author: Sheryl Sandberg,  Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead

Quote: Out of the corner of his eye, he saw Tyson pounding the Earthborn into the ground like a game of whack-a-mole. Ella was fluttering above him, dodging missiles and calling out advice: "The groin. The Earthborn's groin is sensitive."SMASH!"Good. Yes. Tyson found its groin.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Son of Neptune

Quote: A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices.
Author: William James

Quote: Yes, boys are a little like shoes. Why? Well...They can be useful. But mainly...They are nice to look at. Getting the right one can be a lovely accessory to an outfit. There are times when you couldn't do without them. And there are times when you'd rather do without them. Get the wrong ones and they can hurt. There are many types and often the ones that look the nicest are completely unpractical.
Author: Rachel Hill,  A Girl's Guide to Guys: Meeting Them, Managing Them and All That Love Stuff

Quote: I think you ought to know I'm feeling very depressed.
Author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

Quote: In darkness God's truth shines most clear.
Author: Corrie ten Boom,  The Hiding Place

Quote: I call him religious who understands the suffering of others.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: If you had started doing anything two weeks ago, by today you would have been two weeks better at it.
Author: John Mayer

Quote: Love and desire are the spirit's wings to great deeds.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: No one who achieves success does so without acknowledging the help of others. The wise and confident acknowledge this help with gratitude.
Author: Alfred North Whitehead

Quote: He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I'm a romantic; a sentimental person thinks things will last, a romantic person hopes against hope that they won't.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: I am happy to say that everyone that I have met in my life, I have gained something from them; be it negative or positive, it has enforced and reinforced my life in some aspect.
Author: Walter Payton

Quote: I have no doubt concerning that Supreme Goodness, who is so eager to share His blessings, or of that everlasting love which makes Him more eager to bestow perfection on us than we are to receive it.
Author: Saint Ignatius

Quote: My humor is a lot like Kristen Wiig's from 'Saturday Night Live' or 'Bridesmaids.' Quirky, off the beaten path.
Author: Nicole Ari Parker

Quote: I would love to spend all my time writing to you; I'd love to share with you all that goes through my mind, all that weighs on my heart, all that gives air to my soul; phantoms of art, dreams that would be so beautiful if they could come true.
Author: Luigi Pirandello

Quote: If you're not comfortable enough with yourself or with your own truth when entering a relationship, then you're not ready for that relationship.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

Quote: String several words together in a sentence and you have a language necklace. My I love you would look great with your favorite red dress.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: She was bored. She loved, had capacity to love, for love, to give and accept love. Only she tried twice and failed twice to find somebody not just strong enough to deserve it, earn it, match it, but even brave enough to accept it.
Author: William Faulkner,  The Town

Quote: What's your heart telling you to do?I don't know.'Maybe, you're trying too hard to hear it.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  A Walk to Remember

Quote: I'd like to get away from earth awhileAnd then come back to it and begin over.May no fate wilfully misunderstand meAnd half grant what I wish and snatch me awayNot to return. Earth's the right place for love:I don't know where it's likely to go better.
Author: Robert Frost,  Birches

Quote: I'm sure you think that I don't understand what you're going through, but I do. It's just that sometimes, our future is dictated by what we are, opposed to what we want.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: In times of stress, the best thing we can do for each other is to listen with our ears and our hearts and to be assured that our questions are just as important as our answers.
Author: Fred Rogers,  The World According to Mister Rogers: Important Things to Remember

Quote: We are all of us born with a letter inside us, and that only if we are true to ourselves, may we be allowed to read it before we die.
Author: Douglas Coupland

Quote: Because teachers, no matter how kind, no matter how friendly, are sadistic and evil to the core.
Author: Heather Brewer,  Eighth Grade Bites

Quote: ...even a tiny bit of deceit is dishonorable when it's used for selfish or cowardly reasons.- Mr. Penderwick
Author: Jeanne Birdsall,  The Penderwicks on Gardam Street

Quote: As with most of life's problems, this one can be solved by a box of pure radiation.
Author: Andy Weir,  The Martian

Quote: Hope may be the thing that pulls you forward, may be the thing that keeps you going, but that it's dangerous, that it's painful and risky, that it's making a dare in the world and when has the world ever let us win a dare?
Author: Patrick Ness,  The Knife of Never Letting Go

Quote: I know, too, that death is the only god who comes when you call.
Author: Roger Zelazny,  Frost & Fire

Quote: There is no school equal to a decent home and no teacher equal to a virtuous parent.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: It is only through mystery and madness that the soul is revealed
Author: Thomas Moore

Quote: Reading is that fruitful miracle of a communication in the midst of solitude.
Author: Marcel Proust
