Quote: The goal of life is to make your heartbeat match the beat of the universe, to match your nature with Nature.
Author: Joseph Campbell,  A Joseph Campbell Companion: Reflections on the Art of Living

Quote: You have to, take a deep breath. and allow the music to flow through you. Revel in it, allow yourself to awe. When you play allow the music to break your heart with its beauty.
Author: Kelly White

Quote: He is ugly and sad... but he is all love.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez,  Love in the Time of Cholera

Quote: Learn to deal with the fact that you are not a perfect person but you are a person that deserves respect and honesty.
Author: Pandora Poikilos,  Excuse Me, My Brains Have Stepped Out

Quote: No, this trick won't work... How on earth are you ever going to explain in terms of chemistry and physics so important a biological phenomenon as first love?
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I may not look like much, but I'm an expert at pretending to be a ninja.
Author: Darynda Jones,  First Grave on the Right

Quote: If it's a penny for your thoughts and you put in your two cents worth, then someone, somewhere is making a penny.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: Every time you do a good deed you shine the light a little farther into the dark. And the thing is, when you're gone that light is going to keep shining on, pushing the shadows back.
Author: Charles de Lint

Quote: What saves a man is to take a step. Then another step.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: To keep your marriage brimming, with love in the wedding cup, whenever you're wrong, admit it; whenever you're right, shut up.
Author: Ogden Nash

Quote: I do not know everything; still many things I understand.
Author: Madeleine L'Engle,  A Wrinkle in Time

Quote: Water is the softest thing, yet it can penetrate mountains and earth. This shows clearly the principle ofsoftness overcoming hardness.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: I know of no society in human history that ever suffered because its people became too desirous of evidence in support of their core beliefs.
Author: Sam Harris,  Letter to a Christian Nation

Quote: You will hear thunder and remember me, And think: she wanted storms. The rim Of the sky will be the colour of hard crimson, And your heart, as it was then, will be on fire.
Author: Anna Akhmatova,  The Complete Poems of Anna Akhmatova

Quote: And I mean to hear ye groan like that again. And to moan and sob, even though you dinna wish to, for ye canna help it. I mean to make you sigh as though your heart would break, and scream with the wanting, and at last to cry out in my arms, and I shall know that I've served ye well.
Author: Diana Gabaldon,  Outlander

Quote: Mr. Bradford,"she said. "I'm not going to propose to you."The twinkle in Mr. Bradford's eyes faded. So did his smile. He managed to keep it on his face. It looked painful."Oh,"he said."Mr. Bradford?""Yes?""Would you mind it so very much if...you know...you proposed to me?"The light in Mr. Bradford's eyes jumped to life. He beamed so largely it almost wasn't crooked."If you want.
Author: Heather Dixon,  Entwined

Quote: Obstacles are things a person sees when he takes his eyes off his goal.
Author: E. Joseph Cossman

Quote: When I open them, most of the books have the smell of an earlier time leaking out between the pages - a special odor of the knowledge and emotions that for ages have been calmly resting between the covers. Breathing it in, I glance through a few pages before returning each book to its shelf.
Author: Haruki Murakami,  Kafka on the Shore

Quote: We owe it to each other to tell stories.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: My life is a reading list.
Author: John Irving,  A Prayer for Owen Meany

Quote: I've come to believe that all my past failure and frustration were actually laying the foundation for the understandings that have created the new level of living I now enjoy.
Author: Anthony Robbins

Quote: I'll be your family now,"he says. "I love you,"I say. (....)He stares at me. I wait with my hands clutching his arms for stability as he considers his response. He frowns at me. "Say it again.""Tobias,"I say, "I love you.
Author: Veronica Roth,  Insurgent

Quote: Most scars are invisible. Damn transparent knives. Does anything cut deeper than love? I need to get some new body armor.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: And I'm dying to know, is it killing you like it's killing me? And the story of us looks a lot like a tragedy now.
Author: Taylor Swift

Quote: But, my God, it's so beautiful when the boy smiles
Author: Anna Nalick

Quote: May I share with you a formula that in my judgment will help you and help me to journey well through mortality... First, fill your mind with truth; second, fill your life with service; and third, fill your heart with love.
Author: Thomas S. Monson

Quote: Death, therefore, the most awful of evils, is nothing to us, seeing that, when we are, death is not come, and, when death is come, we are not.
Author: Epicurus

Quote: Happiness is always there. You just have to choose to see it. There's no point dwelling in the dark and ignoring the light of the stars.
Author: Carrie Hope Fletcher

Quote: I used to think the world was broken down by tribes,' I said. 'By Black and White. By Indian and White. But I know this isn't true. The world is only broken into two tribes: the people who are assholes and the people who are not.
Author: Sherman Alexie,  The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian

Quote: Don't limit a child to your own learning, for she was born in another time.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: When life gives you lemons, make lemonade, and then throw it in the face of the person who gave you the lemons until they give you the oranges you originally asked for.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: If you need help bark like a dog."- Gendry. "That's stupid. If I need help I'll shout help."- Arya
Author: George R.R. Martin,  A Clash of Kings

Quote: Just about everything in this world is easier said than done, with the exception of "systematically assisting Sisyphus's stealthy, cyst-susceptible sister,"which is easier done than said.
Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Hostile Hospital

Quote: Only in our dreams are we free. The rest of the time we need wages.
Author: Terry Pratchett,  Wyrd Sisters

Quote: Magnus raised his hands above his head and clapped once. The room flooded with light. "You see? You think that would be possible without magic? "Actually,"replied Simon, "It is. If you watched infomercials you'd know that.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: She can't help it,' he said. 'She's got the soul of a poet and the emotional makeup of a junkyard dog.
Author: Stephen King,  Under the Dome

Quote: An ability to look into the confusing mess of life and see things for what they are.
Author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay

Quote: For there is no friend like a sisterIn calm or stormy weather; To cheer one on the tedious way, To fetch one if one goes astray,To lift one if one totters down, To strengthen whilst one stands
Author: Christina Rossetti,  Goblin Market and Other Poems

Quote: Hide things everywhere. Forget about them. Find them randomly and feel surprised like a pirate finding buried treasure. Avoid scurvy. Love more.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: The whole image is that eternal suffering awaits anyone who questions God's infinite love. That's the message we're brought up with, isn't it? Believe or die! Thank you, forgiving Lord, for all those options.
Author: Bill Hicks

Quote: Never forget that justice is what love looks like in public.
Author: Cornel West

Quote: Not that she didn't love almost every boy she'd ever met, and not that every boy in the world didn't totally love her. It was impossible not to. But she wanted someone to love her and shower her with attention the way only a boy who was completely in love with her could. The rare sort of love. True love. The kind of love she'd never had.
Author: Cecily von Ziegesar,  I Like It Like That

Quote: The nice part about being a pessimist is that you are constantly being either proven right or pleasantly surprised.
Author: George F. Will

Quote: I still don't belong to anyone - I am mine.
Author: Morrissey

Quote: Being single doesn't mean you're weak, it means that you're strong enough to wait for the right person.
Author: Niall Horan

Quote: I didn't want to spoil the mood. This was probably the longest Daemon and I had ever spoken without some statement earning him the finger.
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,  Obsidian

Quote: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: I do not think that there is any other quality so essential to success of any kind as the quality of perseverance. It overcomes almost everything, even nature.
Author: John D. Rockefeller

Quote: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.
Author: George Santayana

Quote: Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow.
Author: Anne Wilson Schaef

Quote: You take away all the other luxuries in life, and if you can make someone smile and laugh, you have given the most special gift: happiness.
Author: Brad Garrett

Quote: What you have to understand is that my thing is not glamour. I love stretch marks and C-section scars and all of that. I'm a grown man. You don't gotta put on no makeup with me.
Author: Tracy Morgan

Quote: I try to bring it across on my record, in my dress, in what I do and what I say because to me humor is important. You should have a dose of that and I guess giving it is what I'm here for.
Author: Bootsy Collins

Quote: Homer has taught all other poets the art of telling lies skillfully.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: He's around the twist,' said Azalea. 'Breaking all the windows? He's mad.''Ah, no,' said the King. 'It's only madness if you actually do it. If you want to break all the windows in the house and drown yourself in a bucket but don't actually do it, well, that's love.
Author: Heather Dixon,  Entwined

Quote: There is emotion in the hug, and there is respect and a form of love. Emotion that comes from honesty, respect that comes from challenge, and the form of love that exists between people whose minds have touched, whose hearts have touched, whose souls have touched. Our minds touched. Our hearts touched. Our souls touched.We separate.
Author: James Frey,  A Million Little Pieces

Quote: I make love with a focus and intensity that most people reserve for sleep.
Author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo,  Love Quotes for the Ages. Specifically Ages 19-91.

Quote: I...will never...regret you.
Author: Colleen Hoover,  Maybe Someday

Quote: My I love you was a measured response, like one gallon of coffee in one cup of sugar. It was just overflowing with an awakening of my soul.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: The best way to keep children at home is to make the home atmosphere pleasant, and let the air out of the tires.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: Even a soul submerged in sleep is hard at work and helps make something of the world.
Author: Heraclitus,  Fragments

Quote: He's not safe, but he's good (referring to Aslan, the Lion, in The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe)
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Civilization will not attain to its perfection until the last stone from the last church falls on the last priest.
Author: Émile Zola

Quote: This is the key to life: To expect everything to be given to you from above, yet to be genuinely surprised and forever grateful, when they are. Expecting all good things to be yours, while not knowing how to take anything for granted. If there may be a key in life, this is the key.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: We fell in love like two medium pizzas in one large stomach. I wish dad would have saved a few slices for us.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: When you fish for love, bait with your heart, not your brain.
Author: Mark Twain,  Notebook

Quote: The curve of her smile, the curve of the small of her back, the curve of her laugh, everything about her makes me want to be more well-rounded.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: I had to touch you with my hands, I had to taste you with my tongue; one can't love and do nothing.
Author: Graham Greene,  The End of the Affair

Quote: I would lay down everything I possess, even my soul, for you. If that isn't love, it's the best I have.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,  Silence

Quote: If it weren't for music, I would think that love is mortal.
Author: Mark Helprin,  A Soldier of the Great War

Quote: In the end, the world always wins. That's just the way of things.
Author: Khaled Hosseini,  The Kite Runner

Quote: Words do not express thoughts very well; every thing immediately becomes a little different, a little distorted, a little foolish. And yet it also pleases me and seems right that what is of value and wisdom of one man seems nonsense to another.
Author: Gautama Buddha

Quote: If you're trapped in the dream of the Other, you're fucked.
Author: Gilles Deleuze

Quote: Why are you limping like that?' Nicholas demanded.'I'm swaggering,' I informed him.'You look like you're wearing a diaper.'Charming. And I had a crush on this guy.Wait. I had a crush on this guy?'Now what?' he asked. 'You're making weird faces.''Nothing,' I said quickly. 'Never mind.
Author: Alyxandra Harvey,  My Love Lies Bleeding

Quote: why can't you see i'm a kid', said the kid.Why try to make me like you?Why are you hurt when I don't cuddle?Why do you sigh when I splash through a puddle?Why do you scream when I do what I did?Im a kid.
Author: Shel Silverstein,  Falling Up

Quote: There are always some lunatics about. It would be a dull world without them.
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle,  The Red Headed League

Quote: What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. These are but trifles, to be sure; but scattered along life's pathway, the good they do is inconceivable.
Author: Joseph Addison

Quote: When God is going to do something wonderful, He or She always starts with a hardship; when God is going to do something amazing, He or She starts with an impossibility.
Author: Anne Lamott,  Plan B: Further Thoughts on Faith

Quote: They lay silently. She was staring at something across the room. She was making him feel uncomfortable. 'It wouldn't work. It's the attraction of opposites,' he said.We're not opposites.'I don't mean just you and me. Women fall in love when they get to know you. Men are just the opposite. When they finally know you they're ready to leave.
Author: James Salter

Quote: Why are desire scales 1-10? They should be 1-12, like a clock, because I want her 1-12, I mean like all the time.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: The greatest personal limitation is to be found not in the things you want to do and can't, but in the things you've never considered doing.
Author: Richard Bandler

Quote: I love how babies look like old people. I saw a baby the other day that looked exactly like my grandpa, only taller.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: I scream for everything that has gone wrong. I scream for everything broken in our lives.
Author: Marie Lu,  Champion

Quote: ...when pain is over, the remembrance of it often becomes a pleasure.
Author: Jane Austen,  Persuasion

Quote: sometimes no matter how many eyelashes or dandelion seeds you blow, no matter how much of your heart you tear out and slap on your sleeve, it just ain't gonna happen.
Author: Melissa Jensen,  The Fine Art of Truth or Dare

Quote: Nothing carries meaning. People carry meaning. We are the porters of importance.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: Life is a bowl of cherries. Some cherries are rotten while others are good; its your job to throw out the rotten ones and forget about them while you enjoy eating the ones that are good! There are two kinds of people: those who choose to throw out the good cherries and wallow in all the rotten ones, and those who choose to throw out all the rotten ones and savor all the good ones.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: Two things you will never have to chase: True friends & true love.
Author: Mandy Hale

Quote: There comes a time when we realize that our parents cannot save themselves or save us, that everyone who wades through time eventually gets dragged out to sea by the undertow- that, in short, we are all going.
Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

Quote: Doing nothing for others is the undoing of ourselves.
Author: Horace Mann

Quote: There are random moments - tossing a salad, coming up the driveway to the house, ironing the seams flat on a quilt square, standing at the kitchen window and looking out at the delphiniums, hearing a burst of laughter from one of my children's rooms - when I feel a wavelike rush of joy. This is my true religion: arbitrary moments of of nearly painful happiness for a life I feel privileged to lead.
Author: Elizabeth Berg,  The Art of Mending

Quote: Death, so called, is a thing which makes men weep, And yet a third of life is passed in sleep.
Author: George Gordon Byron

Quote: I hope we'll be friends forever, together we'll always be. I don't think you understand just how much you mean to me. And one day when we part our ways, we'll think back to the past and think about how happy we are 'cause our friendship will always last.
Author: Bridget Davis

Quote: You're better than this. Better than whatever it is you're going to do now.
Author: Richelle Mead,  Last Sacrifice

Quote: You have every right to a beautiful life.
Author: Selena Gómez

Quote: Love those you hate you.
Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Anna Karenina

Quote: A weed is but an unloved flower.
Author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

Quote: There is love in holding and there is love in letting go.
Author: Elizabeth Berg,  The Year of Pleasures

Quote: A dead thing goes with the stream, but only a living thing can go against it.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: Drinking is fun! It makes me feel horrible and sexy!
Author: Warren Ellis

Quote: It is a damn poor mind that can think of only one way to spell a word.
Author: Andrew Jackson

Quote: Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings so that you shall come easily by what others have labored hard for.
Author: Socrates

Quote: If you really want to do something, you'll find a way. If you don't, you'll find an excuse.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: It is much easier to be brave if you do not know everything.
Author: Lois Lowry

Quote: How ghastly for her, people actually thinking, with their brains, and right next door. Oh, the travesty of it all.
Author: Gail Carriger,  Soulless

Quote: Happiness only real when shared.
Author: Christopher McCandless

Quote: That's all we have, finally, the words, and they had better be the right ones.
Author: Raymond Carver

Quote: Hopes are like hair ornaments. Girls want to wear too many of them. When they become old women they look silly wearing even one.
Author: Arthur Golden,  Memoirs of a Geisha

Quote: It shattered something inside me that hadn't been broken before.
Author: E. Lockhart,  The Boyfriend List: 15 Guys, 11 Shrink Appointments, 4 Ceramic Frogs and Me, Ruby Oliver

Quote: The baby batScreamed out in fright,'Turn on the dark,I'm afraid of the light.
Author: Shel Silverstein

Quote: Fate,"Blue replied, glowering at her mother, "is a very weighty word to throw around before breakfast.
Author: Maggie Stiefvater,  The Raven Boys

Quote: From now on, I'm not doing anything I don't want to do! The world owes me happiness, fulfillment and success.... I'm just here to cash in.
Author: Bill Watterson,  Homicidal Psycho Jungle Cat

Quote: Every immigrant who comes here should be required within five years to learn English or leave the country.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: This is my living faith, an active faith, a faith of verbs: to question, explore, experiment, experience, walk, run, dance, play, eat, love, learn, dare, taste, touch, smell, listen, speak, write, read, draw, provoke, emote, scream, sin, repent, cry, kneel, pray, bow, rise, stand, look, laugh, cajole, create, confront, confound, walk back, walk forward, circle, hide, and seek.
Author: Terry Tempest Williams,  Leap

Quote: My heart has joined the Thousand, for my friend stopped running today.
Author: Richard Adams,  Watership Down

Quote: When you walk to the edge of all the light you have and take that first step into the darkness of the unknown, you must believe that one of two things will happen. There will be something solid for you to stand upon or you will be taught to fly.
Author: Patrick Overton,  The leaning tree: [poems]

Quote: As a man, I instantly became aware of the gold in her hair, her height measured against mine, and how easily she'd fit in my arms. ~Ren
Author: Colleen Houck,  Tiger's Curse

Quote: All thoughts, secret or spoken, belong in a coffee table book written in Braille, so you can really feel the emotions.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: I have a problem with people who take the Constitution loosely and the Bible literally.
Author: Bill Maher

Quote: Neither novels or their readers benefit from any attempts to divine whether any facts hide inside a story. Such efforts attack the very idea that made-up stories can matter, which is sort of the foundational assumption of our species.
Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

Quote: You change your life by changing your heart.
Author: Max Lucado

Quote: If we get our self-esteem from superficial places, from our popularity, appearance, business success, financial situation, health, any of these, we will be disappointed, because no one can guarantee that we'll have them tomorrow.
Author: Kathy Ireland

Quote: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
Author: George Washington

Quote: I've tried to reduce profanity but I reduced so much profanity when writing the book that I'm afraid not much could come out. Perhaps we will have to consider it simply as a profane book and hope that the next book will be less profane or perhaps more sacred.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: Once something has outlived its usefulness in one area of life, its purpose for being in existence is no longer the same. The leaf that captures a stream of sunlight, and then transfers its energy to the tree, serves one purpose in the spring and summer, and another completely different one through the fall and winter.
Author: Guy Finley

Quote: Sometimes when I try to make jokes or have a sense of humor in interviews, it doesn't go over very well. But Twitter made my life easier in this way that I didn't expect. It would have taken probably 10 times as long for people to accept my voice and my sense of humor if I didn't have Twitter.
Author: Anna Kendrick

Quote: I don't understand dating.. and the other things that people do.. all I know is that you ought to find the one you recognize. The one who gives you four arms, four legs, four eyes, and has the other half of your heart. There's only one of those, so what are all the other things for? Like dating?
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: I believe when life gives you lemons, you should make lemonade...and try to find someone whose life has given them vodka, and have a party.
Author: Ron White

Quote: Your absence has not taught me to be alone, it merely has shown that when together we cast a single shadow on the wall.
Author: Doug Fetherling

Quote: I always had this idea that you should never give up a happy middle in the hopes of a happy ending, because there is no such thing as a happy ending. Do you know what I mean? There is so much to lose.
Author: John Green,  Let It Snow

Quote: The glory of Christianity is to conquer by forgiveness.
Author: William Blake

Quote: Words save our lives, sometimes.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Ocean at the End of the Lane

Quote: It's not that I want you to go, it's just that I don't want you to stay."- China Sorrows -
Author: Derek Landy,  Mortal Coil

Quote: Butch tightened his grip on his cell and wished there were an app that let you reach through a phone and bitch slap someone.
Author: J.R. Ward,  Lover Unleashed

Quote: You're a monster.Thanks. Does this mean I get a raise?No, just a medal. The budget isn't inexhaustable.
Author: Orson Scott Card,  Ender's Game

Quote: So that's it?"Kenji says. "You just like him for his personality, huh?""What?""All of this,"Kenji says, waving a hand in the air, "has nothing to do with him being all sexy and shit and him being able to touch you all the time?""You think Warner is sexy?""That is not what I said.
Author: Tahereh Mafi,  Ignite Me

Quote: I love you so much that nothing can matter to me - not even you...Only my love- not your answer. Not even your indifference
Author: Ayn Rand,  The Fountainhead

Quote: The highest activity a human being can attain is learning for understanding, because to understand is to be free.
Author: Baruch Spinoza

Quote: Let us live so that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Did he just rip out the engine?"I asked."Yes", Saiman said. "And now he is demolishing the Maserati with it."Ten seconds later Curran hurled the twisted wreck of black and orange that used to be the Maserati into the wall.The first melodic notes of an old song came from the computer. I glanced at Saiman.He shrugged. "It begged for a soundtrack.
Author: Ilona Andrews,  Magic Slays

Quote: You've got no sense of humor.""I'm going to laugh really hard after I kick your ass.
Author: J.D. Robb,  Imitation in Death

Quote: And you're blind?"Uh-huh,"Iggy said, trying to sound bored.Were you born that way?"No."How did you become blind, uh, Jeff, is it?"Yeah, Jeff. Well, I looked directly at the sun, you know, the way they always tell you not to. If only I had listened.
Author: James Patterson,  School's Out—Forever

Quote: I found power in accepting the truth of who I am. It may not be a truth that others can accept, but I cannot live any other way. How would it be to live a lie every minute of your life.
Author: Alison Goodman,  Eon: Dragoneye Reborn

Quote: Wisdom.... comes not from age, but from education and learning.
Author: Anton Chekhov

Quote: Words are like eggs dropped from great heights; you can no more call them back than ignore the mess they leave when they fall.
Author: Jodi Picoult,  Salem Falls

Quote: What we do comes out of who we believe we are.
Author: Rob Bell,  Sex God: Exploring the Endless Connections Between Sexuality and Spirituality

Quote: Your battles inspired me - not the obvious material battles but those that were fought and won behind your forehead.
Author: James Joyce

Quote: There are few sights sadder than a ruined book.
Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Wide Window

Quote: Your time is way too valuable to be wasting on people that can't accept who you are.
Author: Turcois Ominek

Quote: A flowing flurry of flowers fell to the floor when I fell in love, as if my heart were a garden that gushed forth and flooded her being with the fragrance of romance.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: What if I were smiling and running into your arms? Would you see then what I see now?
Author: Jon Krakauer,  Into the Wild

Quote: Let me wake up next to you, have coffee in the morning and wander through the city with your hand in mine, and I'll be happy for the rest of my fucked up little life.
Author: Charlotte Eriksson,  Empty Roads & Broken Bottles; in search for The Great Perhaps

Quote: I want someone whose heart is big enough to hold me.
Author: Rainbow Rowell,  Attachments

Quote: I only want to write. And there's no college for that except life.
Author: Dodie Smith,  I Capture the Castle

Quote: Pulvis et umbra sumus. (We are but dust and shadow.)
Author: Horace,  The Odes of Horace: Bilingual Edition

Quote: You look as scary as a buttered muffin.
Author: Tamora Pierce

Quote: The most important thing in life is to stop saying 'I wish' and start saying 'I will.' Consider nothing impossible, then treat possiblities as probabilities.
Author: David Copperfield

Quote: The only thing that makes life possible is permanent, intolerable uncertainty: not knowing what comes next.
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Left Hand of Darkness

Quote: I have gone temporarily deaf and haven't any idea what you said, Harry.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Quote: Getting married is like trading in the adoration of many for the sarcasm of one.
Author: Mae West

Quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: There is no God but Allah and Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah.
Author: Anonymous,  The Quran / القرآن الكريم

Quote: I don't want to believe. I want to know.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: For every moment of triumph, for every instance of beauty, many souls must be trampled.
Author: Hunter S. Thompson

Quote: If you're texting Magnus to say 'I think u r kewl' I'm going to kill you
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

Quote: I lay on the bed and lost myself in stories. I liked that. Books were safer than other people anyway.
Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Ocean at the End of the Lane

Quote: Look for the good in every person and every situation. You'll almost always find it.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: The greatest step towards a life of simplicity is to learn to let go.
Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

Quote: I really think I write about everyday life. I don't think I'm quite as odd as others say I am. Life is intrinsically, well, boring and dangerous at the same time. At any given moment the floor may open up. Of course, it almost never does; that's what makes it so boring.
Author: Edward Gorey

Quote: Perhaps all the questions we ask of love, to measure, test, probe, and save it, have the additional effect of cutting it short. Perhaps the reason we are unable to love is that we yearn to be loved, that is, we demand something (love) from our partner instead of delivering ourselves up to him demand-free and asking for nothing but his company.
Author: Milan Kundera,  The Unbearable Lightness of Being

Quote: Sometimes you have to learn to love what's good for you.
Author: Stephenie Meyer,  New Moon

Quote: She was bendable light: she shone around every corner of my day.
Author: Jerry Spinelli,  Stargirl

Quote: My cabinet was made by hand. My applause is also made by hand, and I stood there clapping the whole time the carpenter was making my cabinet.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: I might appear confident and chatty, but I spend most of my time laughing at jokes I don't find funny, saying things I don't really mean - because at the end of the day that's what we're all trying to do: fit in, one way or another, desperately trying to pretend we're all the same.
Author: Tabitha Suzuma,  Forbidden

Quote: How can He be perfect? Everything He ever makes...dies.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I died. I died and someone made a clerical error and I am in Heaven.
Author: Jim Butcher,  Summer Knight

Quote: Someday we'll look back on this and it will all seem funny.
Author: Bruce Springsteen

Quote: In the long second before everyone absorbs what just happened, I see the angel rolling his eyes heavenward, like a teenager in the presence of overwhelming lameness. Some people just have no sense of gratitude.
Author: Susan Ee,  Angelfall

Quote: The wisest are the most annoyed at the loss of time.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quote: Faith does not eliminate questions. But faith knows where to take them.
Author: Elisabeth Elliot,  A Chance to Die: The Life and Legacy of Amy Carmichael

Quote: I'm guilty of giving people more chances than they deserve but when I'm done, I'm done.
Author: Turcois Ominek

Quote: Life is much more successfully looked at from a single window.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  The Great Gatsby

Quote: I believe that there is an equality to all humanity. We all suck.
Author: Bill Hicks

Quote: When I hear music, I fear no danger. I am invulnerable. I see no foe. I am related to the earliest times, and to the latest.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: I make furniture that can be used as weapons. The most dangerous piece of furniture is the Loveseat.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent.
Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein,  Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus

Quote: The impossible often has a kind of integrity to it which the merely improbable lacks.
Author: Douglas Adams,  The Long Dark Tea-Time of the Soul

Quote: What are you talking about?"Narcissus demanded. "I am amazing. Everyone knows this.""Amazing at pure suck,"Leo said. "If I was as suck as you, I'd drown myself. Oh wait, you already did that.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Mark of Athena

Quote: Then you must teach my daughter this same lesson. How to lose your innocence but not your hope. How to laugh forever.
Author: Amy Tan,  The Joy Luck Club

Quote: I couldn't escape him, now or ever. He'd always be there, consuming my every thought, my heart locked in his hands. I was drawn to him by forces I couldn't control, let alone escape.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,  Silence

Quote: Talent is a wonderful thing, but it won't carry a quitter.
Author: Stephen King,  Duma Key

Quote: If two heads are better than one, then what about double chins? On that note, I will help myself to seconds.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: We relish news of our heroes, forgetting that we are extraordinary to somebody too.
Author: Helen Hayes

Quote: Success in any endeavor depends on the degree to which it is an expression of your true self.
Author: Ralph Marston

Quote: If it's very painful for you to criticize your friends - you're safe in doing it. But if you take the slightest pleasure in it, that's the time to hold your tongue.
Author: Alice Miller

Quote: I hope people think of me as a bit older. I do have a beard. That makes me look very old.
Author: Jack Whitehall

Quote: I desire many things concerning myself; but I desire nothing so much, as to have a heart filled with love to the Lord. I long for a warm personal attachment to Him.
Author: George Muller

Quote: If you stop and think about it, nearly all great humor is at the expense of someone or something.
Author: Alan King

Quote: Politeness is the art of choosing among your thoughts.
Author: Madame de Stael

Quote: By the way, when Oprah Winfrey is suggesting you may have overextended yourself, you need to examine your fucking life.
Author: Tina Fey,  Bossypants

Quote: For the things we have to learn before we can do them, we learn by doing them.
Author: Aristotle,  The Nicomachean Ethics

Quote: Don't be reckless with other people's hearts. Don't put up with people who are reckless with yours.
Author: Jimi Hendrix

Quote: I don't know why people are afraid of lust. Then I can imagine that they are very afraid of me, for I have a great lust for everything. A lust for life, a lust for how the summer-heated street feels beneath my feet, a lust for the touch of another's skin on my skin...a lust for everything. I even lust after cake. Yes, I am very lusty and very scary.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: Life is short. If you doubt me, ask a butterfly. Their average life span is a mere five to fourteen days.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres,  The Funny Thing Is...

Quote: I thought about how mothers feed their babies with tiny little spoons and forks so I wondered, what do Chinese mothers use? Toothpicks?
Author: George Carlin

Quote: In matters of grave importance, style, not sincerity, is the vital thing.
Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Importance of Being Earnest

Quote: There's a hell of a distance between wise-cracking and wit. Wit has truth in it; wise-cracking is simply calisthenics with words."[Interview, The Paris Review, Summer 1956]
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: When you choose one way out of many, all the ways you don't take are snuffed out like candles, as if they'd never existed.
Author: Philip Pullman,  The Amber Spyglass

Quote: I am the coffee, and God is The Barista. Through me, he may awaken your soul. But the coffee knows not what flows through the mind of The Barista.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: If you want me again look for me under your boot soles.
Author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass

Quote: The whales do not sing because they have an answer, they sing because they have a song.
Author: Gregory Colbert

Quote: A good story is always more dazzling than a broken piece of truth.
Author: Diane Setterfield,  The Thirteenth Tale

Quote: Some editors are failed writers, but so are most writers.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: Who saidI can't wear my ConverseWith my dress, well babyThat's just me!
Author: Demi Lovato

Quote: None of us can choose where we shall love...
Author: Susan Kay,  Phantom

Quote: Never stop just because you feel defeated. The journey to the other side is attainable only after great suffering.
Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday

Quote: He had a bleeding cut on his leg and he smelled like shit.Her nose wrinkled. "Step in something?"she asked innocently."That I did not mind."He took a menacing step toward her. "What I did mind was being hit by a cab, then landing on the lap of a naked man. With an erection, Anya. He had an erection.
Author: Gena Showalter,  The Darkest Kiss

Quote: It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.
Author: Andy Warhol

Quote: Curiously enough, the only thing that went through the mind of the bowl of petunias as it fell was Oh no, not again. Many people have speculated that if we knew exactly why the bowl of petunias had thought that we would know a lot more about the nature of the Universe than we do now.
Author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

Quote: Berhenti bercita-cita adalah tragedi terbesar dalam hidup manusia
Author: Andrea Hirata,  Sang Pemimpi

Quote: If you live in a past dream, you don't enjoy what is happening right now because you will always wish it to be different than it is. There is no time to miss anyone or anything because you are alive. Not enjoying what is happening right now is living in the past and being only half alive. This leads to self pity, suffering and tears.
Author: Miguel Ruiz,  The Four Agreements: A Practical Guide to Personal Freedom

Quote: As an author, I like self-help, because clapping can be done by myself, for myself. I should buy gloves.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: Next time I see you, remind me not to talk to you.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: He said he came in second place, so I assumed there were only two competitors. But you never know with love, there may have been a third party involved.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: I crossed a thousand leagues to come to you, and lost the best part of me along the way. Don't tell me to leave.
Author: George R.R. Martin,  A Storm of Swords

Quote: I regret..."Tobias tilts his head, and sighs. "I regret my choice.""What Choice?""Dauntless,"he says. "I was born Abnegation. I was planning on leaving Dauntless, and becoming factionless. But I met her, and... I felt like maybe I could make something more of my decision."Her.
Author: Veronica Roth,  Insurgent

Quote: She didn't need to understand the meaning of life; it was enough to find someone who did, and then fall asleep in his arms and sleep as a child sleeps, knowing that someone stronger than you is protecting you from all evil and all danger
Author: Paulo Coelho,  Brida

Quote: The waves were choppy, like Chuck Norris' karate hands. The ocean would have been still, if I weren't making love in it.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: Loving's pretty easy. It's letting someone love you that's hard.
Author: Rita Mae Brown,  Riding Shotgun

Quote: Love makes us such fools.
Author: Leslye Walton,  The Strange and Beautiful Sorrows of Ava Lavender

Quote: True friends are those who came into your life, saw the most negative part of you, but are not ready to leave you, no matter how contagious you are to them.
Author: Michael Bassey Johnson,  The Infinity Sign

Quote: We are born in one day. We die in one day. We can change in one day. And we can fall in love in one day. Anything can happen in just one day.
Author: Gayle Forman,  Just One Day

Quote: Don't just say you have read books. Show that through them you have learned to think better, to be a more discriminating and reflective person. Books are the training weights of the mind. They are very helpful, but it would be a bad mistake to suppose that one has made progress simply by having internalized their contents."Translation by Sharon Lebell
Author: Epictetus,  The Art of Living: The Classical Manual on Virtue, Happiness and Effectiveness

Quote: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him will believeth in anything. - Hitchens 3:16
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: What's most important in a friendship? Tolerance and loyalty.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: I remember the time I was kidnapped and they sent a piece of my finger to my father. He said he wanted more proof.
Author: Rodney Dangerfield

Quote: Claire, did I invite you to my barbeque?"Massie asked, her neck tilting to the right and her arms tightly crossed."Huh? No. I mean, I don't know,"Claire said."Then why are you all up in my grill?"Massie said through her teeth.
Author: Lisi Harrison,  The Clique

Quote: The only time I really think is when I smoke, and I quit smoking years ago.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  There are Two Typos of People in This World: Those Who Can Edit and Those Who Can't

Quote: The world isn't fair, Calvin.""I know Dad, but why isn't it ever unfair in my favor?
Author: Bill Watterson,  The Essential Calvin and Hobbes: A Calvin and Hobbes Treasury

Quote: ...crackers..."a voice breathed out nehind us, "yesss..."Both of us turned, watching as Chubs twisted around in his seat and settled back down, still fast asleep. I pressed a hand over my mouth to keep from laughing. Liam rolled his eyes, smiling. "He dreams about food,"he said. "A lot.
Author: Alexandra Bracken,  The Darkest Minds

Quote: Our belief is not a belief. Our principles are not a faith. We do not rely soley upon science and reason, because these are necessary rather than sufficient factors, but we distrust anything that contradicts science or outrages reason. We may differ on many things, but what we respect is free inquiry, openmindedness, and the pursuit of ideas for their own sake.
Author: Christopher Hitchens,  God Is Not Great: How Religion Poisons Everything

Quote: The trouble about jumping was that if you didn't pick the right number of storeys, you might still be alive when you hit bottom.
Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Bell Jar

Quote: One child, one teacher, one book, one pen can change the world.
Author: Malala Yousafzai

Quote: And now you are and I am and we're a mystery which will never happen again.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: The Moving Finger writes; and, having writ,Moves on: nor all thy Piety nor WitShall lure it back to cancel half a Line,Nor all thy Tears wash out a Word of it.
Author: Omar Khayyám

Quote: The person who tries to live alone will not succeed as a human being. His heart withers if it does not answer another heart. His mind shrinks away if he hears only the echoes of his own thoughts and finds no other inspiration.
Author: Pearl S. Buck

Quote: It's a rare book that wins the battle against drooping eyelids.
Author: Tracy Chevalier

Quote: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.
Author: Thomas A. Edison

Quote: So I learned two things that night, and the next day, from him: the perfection of a moment, and the fleeting nature of it.
Author: Margaret George,  Memoirs of Cleopatra

Quote: I want YOU to be the one wanting me first. Pushing me first. Kissing me first. Don't be careful with me,"he said. "Because I won't be careful with you.
Author: Michelle Hodkin,  The Evolution of Mara Dyer

Quote: That's the thing about life. A lot of the time, it isn't easy at all. We just have to try to make the best of it.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Safe Haven

Quote: I love you with everything I am, everything I've been, and everything I hope to be. I love you with my past, and I love you for my future. I love you for the children we'll have and for the years we'll have together. I love you for every one of my smiles and even more, for every one of your smiles.
Author: Julia Quinn,  Romancing Mister Bridgerton

Quote: Nothing's a better cure for writer's block than to eat ice cream right out of the carton.
Author: Don Roff

Quote: What is Man? Man is a noisome bacillus whom Our Heavenly Father created because he was disappointed in the monkey.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: You're an investigator - can't nobody find stuff out like a woman. Y'all put the police to shame, make the little investigative tricks they show on CSI and Law & Order: SVU look like counting lessons on Sesame Street.
Author: Steve Harvey,  Act Like a Lady, Think Like a Man: What Men Really Think About Love, Relationships, Intimacy, and Commitment

Quote: Now what state do you live in?''Denial.
Author: Bill Watterson,  The Essential Calvin and Hobbes: A Calvin and Hobbes Treasury

Quote: We're playing Scrabble. It's a nightmare.""Scrabble?"He sounds surprised. "Scrabble's great.""Not when you're playing with a family of geniuses, it's not. They all put words like 'iridiums'. And I put 'pig'.
Author: Sophie Kinsella,  I've Got Your Number

Quote: I hugged him without any kind of fear or self-consciousness, fiercely, with a rush of emotion that almost brought tears to my eyes."I could kiss you!"Chubs cried."Please don't!"I gasp out, feeling his arms tighten around my ribs to the point of cracking them.
Author: Alexandra Bracken,  The Darkest Minds

Quote: You take people, you put them on a journey, you give them peril, you find out who they really are.
Author: Joss Whedon

Quote: Information is not knowledge.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: ... there is no shame in not knowing. The problem arises when irrational thought and attendant behavior fill the vacuum left by ignorance.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson,  The Sky Is Not the Limit: Adventures of an Urban Astrophysicist

Quote: God creates dinosaurs, God kills dinosaurs, God creates man, man kills God, man brings back dinosaurs.
Author: Michael Crichton,  Jurassic Park

Quote: In a gentle way, you can shake the world.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Success in life is founded upon attention to the small things rather than to the large things; to the every day things nearest to us rather than to the things that are remote and uncommon.
Author: Booker T. Washington

Quote: The best time to make friends is before you need them.
Author: Ethel Barrymore

Quote: Hope can be the most wonderful thing in the world or it can crush your heart like an eggshell.
Author: Harlan Coben

Quote: Life doesn't require that we be the best, only that we try our best.
Author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

Quote: I am a Mormon because I love the Lord Jesus Christ. And as I exercise faith in Him, I am blessed with the Holy Spirit in my life.
Author: Jane Clayson

Quote: The people in New York - their humor is on a level that goes, uh, very deep, you know?
Author: Elaine Stritch

Quote: You say a new era in art is preparing; you sensed it coming; continue your studies without weakening. God will do the rest.
Author: Paul Cezanne

Quote: It is life, I think, to watch the water. A man can learn so many things.
Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook

Quote: Another world is not only possible, she is on her way. On a quiet day, I can hear her breathing.
Author: Arundhati Roy

Quote: Never lose faith in yourself, and never lose hope; remember, even when this world throws its worst and then turns its back, there is still always hope.
Author: Pittacus Lore,  The Power of Six

Quote: To become one who believes two become one, you need love in your life.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: That's not a bad word...hate and war are bad words, but fuck isn't.
Author: Judy Blume,  Forever

Quote: And I pray one prayer--I repeat it till my tongue stiffens--Catherine Earnshaw, may you not rest as long as I am living! You said I killed you--haunt me, then!...Be with me always--take any form--drive me mad! only do not leave me in this abyss, where I cannot find you!
Author: Emily Brontë,  Wuthering Heights

Quote: ... And these childrenthat you spit onas they try to change their worldsare immune to your consultations.They're quite awareof what they're going through...
Author: David Bowie

Quote: Who would have guessed that four minutes could change everything?
Author: Jennifer E. Smith,  The Statistical Probability of Love at First Sight

Quote: Poor fellow! I think he is in love with you.'I am not aware of it. And to me it is one of the most odious things in a girl's life, that there must always be some supposition of falling in love coming between her and any man who is kind to her... I have no ground for the nonsensical vanity of fancying everybody who comes near me is in love with me.
Author: George Eliot

Quote: For our first date we went Dutch. We would have gone another nationality, but they are the tallest.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: Living well is an art that can be developed: a love of life and ability to take great pleasure from small offerings and assurance that the world owes you nothing and that every gift is exactly that, a gift.
Author: Maya Angelou,  Wouldn't Take Nothing for My Journey Now

Quote: That which we persist in doing becomes easier to do, not that the nature of the thing has changed but that our power to do has increased.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I think, therefore I'll think.
Author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged: 35th Anniversary Edition

Quote: Popularity's a weird thing. You can't really define it, and it's not cool to talk about, but you know it when you see it. Like a lazy eye, or porn.
Author: Lauren Oliver,  Before I Fall

Quote: Mainstream news wants to keep you as a useful idiot. Instead, try being a non-useful idiot.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: Watch out for each other. Love everyone and forgive everyone, including yourself. Forgive your anger. Forgive your guilt. Your shame. Your sadness. Embrace and open up your love, your joy, your truth, and most especially your heart.
Author: Jim Henson

Quote: Life is such a glorious trauma, is it not?
Author: J.R. Ward,  Lover Avenged

Quote: Everyone's a little crazy. Some people just hide it better than others.
Author: Michelle Hodkin,  The Retribution of Mara Dyer

Quote: Right now we are here, and nothing can mar our perfection, or steal the joy of this perfect moment.
Author: Audrey Niffenegger,  The Time Traveler's Wife

Quote: Deciding whether or not to trust a person is like deciding whether or not to climb a tree because you might get a wonderful view from the highest branch or you might simply get covered in sap and for this reason many people choose to spend their time alone and indoors where it is harder to get a splinter.
Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Penultimate Peril

Quote: I am a believer in free will. If my dog chooses to hate the whole human race except myself, it must be free to do so.
Author: Diana Wynne Jones,  Castle in the Air

Quote: Time is not the great teacher. Experience is. A man may live a whole life, but if he never leaves his home to experience that life, he dies knowing nothing. A mere child who has suffered and lived can be the wiser of the two.
Author: Lynsay Sands,  Love Bites

Quote: Because you believed I was capable of behaving decently, I did.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Devil and Miss Prym

Quote: Writing a book is an adventure. To begin with it is a toy and an amusement. Then it becomes a mistress, then it becomes a master, then it becomes a tyrant. The last phase is that just as you are about to be reconciled to your servitude, you kill the monster and fling him to the public.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: Thank goodness I was never sent to school; it would have rubbed off some of the originality.
Author: Beatrix Potter

Quote: All I have learned, I learned from books.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Our sweetest songs are those of saddest thought.
Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley,  The Complete Poems

Quote: Whoever loves becomes humble. Those who love have , so to speak , pawned a part of their narcissism.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: Hatred would have been easier. With hatred, I would have known what to do. Hatred is clear, metallic, one-handed, unwavering; unlike love.
Author: Margaret Atwood,  Cat's Eye

Quote: And Max, the king of all wild things, was lonely and wanted to be where someone loved him best of all.
Author: Maurice Sendak,  Where the Wild Things Are

Quote: Those who have never known the deep intimacy and the intense companionship of happy mutual love have missed the best thing that life has to give.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: He was free, free in every way, free to behave like a fool or a machine, free to accept, free to refuse, free to equivocate; to marry, to give up the game, to drag this death weight about with him for years to come. He could do what he liked, no one had the right to advise him, there would be for him no Good or Evil unless he thought them into being.
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: So. You get handed a holy sword by an archangel, told to go fight the forces of evil, and you somehow remain an atheist. Is that what you're saying?
Author: Jim Butcher,  Death Masks

Quote: There's no trouble in this world so serious that it can't be cured with a hot bath, a glass of whiskey, and the Book of Common Prayer.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love

Quote: Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have.
Author: Doris Mortman

Quote: True regret is knowing you missed your only opportunity to be simply a good friend to someone that was exactly like you.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: Sometimes when you lose your way, you find YOURSELF.
Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass

Quote: I think people believe in heaven because they don't like the idea of dying, because they want to carry on living and they don't like the idea that other people will move into their house and put their things into the rubbish.
Author: Mark Haddon,  The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time

Quote: . . . owning a dog always ended with this sadness because dogs just don't live as long as people do.
Author: John Grogan,  Marley and Me: Life and Love With the World's Worst Dog

Quote: Do you really mean to tell me the only reason you try to be good is to gain God's approval and reward, or to avoid his disapproval and punishment? That's not morality, that's just sucking up, apple-polishing, looking over your shoulder at the great surveillance camera in the sky, or the still small wiretap inside your head, monitoring your every move, even your every base though.
Author: Richard Dawkins,  The God Delusion

Quote: Remember my friend, that knowledge is stronger than memory, and we should not trust the weaker
Author: Bram Stoker,  DRACULA

Quote: Whining is not only graceless, but can be dangerous. It can alert a brute that a victim is in the neighborhood.
Author: Maya Angelou,  Wouldn't Take Nothing for My Journey Now

Quote: No man who worships education has got the best out of education... Without a gentle contempt for education no man's education is complete.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: Perfect love is the most beautiful of all frustrations because it is more than one can express.
Author: Charlie Chaplin

Quote: Making benches is no walk in the park. It takes one a lot of love to make a bench, and then it takes two to make love on that bench.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Quote: The Lord prefers common-looking people. That is why he made so many of them.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Her heart had grown so familiar to the pain of life without him, that to respond now seemed too large a pleasure she could not endure. If pain was love, then she loved fiercely. Yet knew she could not be near that boy again.
Author: Coco J. Ginger

Quote: Love cannot live where there is no trust.
Author: Edith Hamilton,  Mythology: Timeless Tales of Gods and Heroes

Quote: The past can't hurt you anymore. Not unless you let it. They made you into a victim, Evey. They made you into a statistic. But, that's not the real you. That's not who you are inside.
Author: Alan Moore,  V for Vendetta

Quote: Caring about someone isn't complicated. It isn't easy. But it isn't complicated, either. Kinda like lifting the engine block out of a car.
Author: Jim Butcher,  Small Favor

Quote: A melancholy-looking man, he had the appearance of one who has searched for the leak in life's gas-pipe with a lighted candle.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse,  The Man Upstairs and Other Stories

Quote: My hobbies include rubbing my nipples across a cheese grater, meeting cat ladies on Tinder, and voting for either Democrat or Republican every four years. You could say I am a torture enthusiast.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: You can't save everybody. In fact, there are days when I think you can't save anyone. Each person has to save himself first, then you can move in and help. I have found this philosophy does not work during a gun battle, or a knife fight either. Outside of that it works just fine.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  Guilty Pleasures

Quote: I belong, and my penis, it be long.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: It has been said, 'the truth will make men free.' The truth alone has never made anyone free. It is only doubt which will bring mental emancipation.
Author: Anton Szandor LaVey

Quote: If there was a God. I would spit in his face for subjecting me to this. If there was a Devil, I would sell my sould to make it end. If there was something Higher that controlled out f***ing fates, I would tell it to take my fate and shove it up its fucking ass. Shove it hard and far, you motherf***er. Please end. Please end. Please end.
Author: James Frey,  A Million Little Pieces

Quote: The battle you are going through is not fueled by the words or actions of others; it is fueled by the mind that gives it importance.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: I knew from the moment I heard you, the moment I saw the gun and realized that this lovely, petit woman was the executioner, that you would never die waiting for me to save you - that you would save yourself.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  Narcissus in Chains

Quote: We must never stop dreaming. Dreams provide nourishment for the soul, just as a meal does for the body.
Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Pilgrimage

Quote: Governments and fashions come and go but Jane Eyre is for all time.
Author: Jasper Fforde,  The Eyre Affair

Quote: Reading well is one of the great pleasures that solitude can afford you.
Author: Harold Bloom

Quote: My heart only grows more powerful the more my flowing love goes unabsorbed, unobserved, and unappreciated.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: A warrior does not give up what he loves, he finds the love in what he does
Author: Dan Millman,  Way of the Peaceful Warrior: A Book That Changes Lives

Quote: When we're connected to others, we become better people.
Author: Randy Pausch,  The Last Lecture

Quote: But hurry, let's entwine ourselves as one, our mouth broken, our soul bitten by love, so time discovers us safely destroyed.
Author: Federico García Lorca

Quote: And maybe that was love. Being so vulnerable and allowing someone else in so far they could hurt you, but they also give you everything.
Author: Christine Feehan,  Water Bound

Quote: I assess the power of a will by how much resistance, pain, torture it endures and knows how to turn to its advantage
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: In eternity there is no time, only an instant long enough for a joke.
Author: Hermann Hesse,  Steppenwolf

Quote: A dishonest man you can always trust to be dishonest.
Author: Johnny Depp

Quote: The truth is always an insult or a joke, lies are generally tastier. We love them. The nature of lies is to please. Truth has no concern for anyone's comfort
Author: Katherine Dunn,  Geek Love

Quote: Anger exceeding limits causes fear and excessive kindness eliminates respect.
Author: Euripides

Quote: the writing of somemenis like a vast bridgethat carries youoverthe many thingsthat claw and tear.The Wine of Forever
Author: Charles Bukowski,  Love is a Dog from Hell

Quote: A compliment is something like a kiss through a veil.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.
Author: James Allen

Quote: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.
Author: Laurence J. Peter

Quote: The ninety and nine are with dreams, content but the hope of the world made new, is the hundredth man who is grimly bent on making those dreams come true.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: People need to spread love towards strangers. We all bleed the same blood and we are all part of a global community now.
Author: Aloe Blacc

Quote: In Australia, even the darkest subject matter has a little pinch of humor. A little sweet to make the sour go down.
Author: Ben Mendelsohn

Quote: Why must art be static? You look at an abstraction, sculptured or painted, an entirely exciting arrangement of planes, spheres, nuclei, entirely without meaning. It would be perfect, but it is always still. The next step in sculpture is motion.
Author: Alexander Calder

Quote: [F]or just one second, look at your life and see how perfect it is. Stop looking for the next secret door that is going to lead you to your real life. Stop waiting. This is it: there's nothing else. It's here, and you'd better decide to enjoy it or you're going to be miserable wherever you go, for the rest of your life, forever.
Author: Lev Grossman,  The Magicians

Quote: Well, you can think what you want, so long as you remember - no matter how ordinary things seem between us - I'm still here, still in love with you, and care about you more than any other guy, evil or otherwise, ever will.
Author: Richelle Mead,  The Indigo Spell

Quote: When I walk, I walk with you. Where I go, you're with me always.
Author: Alice Hoffman,  The Story Sisters

Quote: Looking at beauty in the world, is the first step of purifying the mind.
Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations

Quote: My heart, which is so full to overflowing, has often been solaced and refreshed by music when sick and weary.
Author: Martin Luther

Quote: When two people are cuddled close, they can really warm up one burrito. It may take all night, but I like my cheese melted. #CuddleChampion
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: Haven't you ever heard of the saying, "If you want to shoot the general, first shoot the horse!"?' --LinIf you wanna shoot the general, then you should just SHOOT THE GENERAL!' --Ed
Author: Hiromu Arakawa,  Fullmetal Alchemist, Vol. 14

Quote: It was a cold night, so I got a fire going. I lit a scented candle.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it. (21)
Author: Hanh Nhat Thich,  Peace Is Every Step: The Path of Mindfulness in Everyday Life

Quote: For darkness restores what light cannot repair.
Author: Joseph Brodsky

Quote: To live by grace means to acknowledge my whole life story, the light side and the dark. In admitting my shadow side I learn who I am and what God's grace means.
Author: Brennan Manning

Quote: Because horror on Earth is real and it is every day. It is like a flower or like the sun; it cannot be contained.
Author: Alice Sebold,  The Lovely Bones

Quote: The language of love letters is the same as suicide notes.
Author: Courtney Love,  Dirty Blonde: The Diaries of Courtney Love

Quote: That's the nature of being a parent, Sabine has discovered. You'll love your children far more than you ever loved your parents, and -- in the recognition that your own children cannot fathom the depth of your love -- you come to understand the tragic, unrequited love of your own parents.
Author: Ursula Hegi

Quote: He brought out the worst in me, and was the best thing that ever happened to me.
Author: Coco J. Ginger

Quote: I close my eyes, thinking that there is nothing like an embrace after an absence, nothing like fitting my face into the curve of his shoulder and filling my lungs with the scent of him.
Author: Jodi Picoult,  Keeping Faith

Quote: You can go your whole life collecting days, and none will outweigh the one you wish you had back.
Author: Mitch Albom,  For One More Day

Quote: I come here with no expectations, only to profess, now that I am at liberty to do so, that my heart is and always will be yours.
Author: Jane Austen,  Sense and Sensibility

Quote: My heart is spinning. Love is a tornado. Will you be my Kansas?
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: If the only prayer you say throughout your life is "Thank You,"then that will be enough.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Quote: Remind thyself, in the darkest moments, that every failure is only a step toward success, every detection of what is false directs you toward what is true, every trial exhausts some tempting form of error, and every adversity will only hide, for a time, your path to peace and fulfillment.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: It is easier to be wise for others than for ourselves.
Author: François de La Rochefoucauld

Quote: You know what they say about boys next door...
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,  Obsidian

Quote: Aim at Heaven and you will get Earth 'thrown in': aim at Earth and you will get neither.
Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Joyful Christian

Quote: Literature is my Utopia
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: It might be possible that the world itself is without meaning.
Author: Virginia Woolf,  Mrs. Dalloway

Quote: She held up her calloused, grimy fingers. Leo couldn't help thinking there was nothing hotter than a girl who didn't mind getting her hands dirty. But of course, that was just a general comment. Didn't apply to Calypso. Obviously.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The House of Hades

Quote: Beauty is a whore, I like money better.
Author: Michael Cunningham,  The Hours

Quote: He felt now that he was not simply close to her, but that he did not know where he ended and she began.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Besides, the world isn't split into good people and Death Eaters. We've all got both light and dark inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are.
Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

Quote: No, our science is no illusion. But an illusion it would be to suppose that what science cannot give us we can get elsewhere.
Author: Sigmund Freud,  The Future of an Illusion

Quote: Last night I dreamt that somebody loved me.No hope, no harm; just another false alarm
Author: Morrissey

Quote: Re-examine all you have been told. Dismiss what insults your soul.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: When you realize there is something you don't understand, then you're generally on the right path to understanding all kinds of things.
Author: Jostein Gaarder,  The Solitaire Mystery

Quote: I feel like dancing. If I bring an extra wheelchair for you, would you like to join me?
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: To be great, be whole;Exclude nothing, exaggerate nothing that is not you.Be whole in everything. Put all you areInto the smallest thing you do.So, in each lake, the moon shines with splendorBecause it blooms up above.
Author: Fernando Pessoa,  Poems of Fernando Pessoa

Quote: Better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie.
Author: Khaled Hosseini,  The Kite Runner

Quote: If curiosity killed the cat, it was satisfaction that brought it back.
Author: Holly Black,  Tithe

Quote: The Bible may, indeed does, contain a warrant for trafficking in humans, for ethnic cleansing, for slavery, for bride-price, and for indiscriminate massacre, but we are not bound by any of it because it was put together by crude, uncultured human mammals.
Author: Christopher Hitchens,  God Is Not Great: How Religion Poisons Everything

Quote: Do not follow me! Let's just be fabulously where we are and who we are. You be you and I'll be me, today and today and today, and let's trust the future to tommorrow. Let the stars keep track of us. Let us ride our own orbits and trust that they will meet. May our reunion be not a finding but a sweet collision of destinies!
Author: Jerry Spinelli,  Love, Stargirl

Quote: A story was a form of telepathy. By means of inking symbols onto a page, she was able to send thoughts and feelings from her mind to her reader's. It was a magical process, so commonplace that no one stopped to wonder at it.
Author: Ian McEwan,  Atonement

Quote: The discontent and frustration that you feel is entirely your own creation.
Author: Stephen Richards,  Think Your way to Success: Let Your Dreams Run Free
